original: aom badzra p'a ne na bindha bindha thu badzre dri badzra hum h'um phat ces ba chu la'o //
analyzed: aom badzra p'a ne na bindha bindha thu badzre dri badzra hum h'um phat ces ba chu la'o //
translated: Om vajra-pani bindha bindha thuna vajre dri vajra hum hum phat is for the water.

original: aom badzra ka'i la kee: k'i la ya k'i la ya tli badzre dhi badzra hum h'um phat ces pa sa'i dkyil 'khor la dbugs kyi bzlas pa'o //
analyzed: aom badzra ka'i la kee: k'i la ya k'i la ya tli badzre dhi badzra hum h'um phat ces pa sa'i dkyil 'khor la dbugs kyi bzlas pa'o //
translated: Om vajra-kala keya kilaya kilaya tli vajre dhi vajra hum hum phat is for the wind mandala.

original: de nas sdig pa'i dus sbyor la aom badzra mungha re n'a ko ta y'a ko ta ya sl'i badzre shi badzra hum h'um phat ces pa sa'i dkyil 'khor la dbugs kyi bzlas pa'o //
analyzed: de nas sdig pa'i dus sbyor la aom badzra mungha re n'a ko ta y'a ko ta ya sl'i badzre shi badzra hum h'um phat ces pa sa'i dkyil 'khor la dbugs kyi bzlas pa'o //
translated: Then, for the evil conjunctions, Om vajra-mungahari nakotaya nakotaya sali vajre shi vajra hum hum phat is for the wind mandala.

original: aom badzra tsakrena tstshe da ya tstshe da ya w'u badzre shri badzra hum h'um phat ces pa chu la'o //🔽aom badzra kun te na bhin bha bhin dha shri badzre wu badzra hum h'um phat ces pa me la'o //
analyzed: aom badzra tsakrena tstshe da ya tstshe da ya w'u badzre shri badzra hum h'um phat ces pa chu la'o // aom badzra kun te na bhin bha bhin dha shri badzre wu badzra hum h'um phat ces pa me la'o //
translated: Om vajra-chakra chhedaya chhedaya vau vajre shri vajra hum hum phat is for the water.🔽Om vajra-kunte na bhin bhin dhin shri vajre vum vajra hum hum phat is for the fire.

original: aom badzra danden t'a da ya t'a da ya sh'i badzre sli badzra hum h'um phat ces pa rlung la'o //
analyzed: aom badzra danden t'a da ya t'a da ya sh'i badzre sli badzra hum h'um phat ces pa rlung la'o //
translated: Om vajra-dandenta daya daya shi vajre sli vajra hum hum phat is for the wind.

original: aom badzra par shu n'a tstshinda tstshinda thk'a badzre hum h'um phat ces pa nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor la dur khrod du dbugs kyi bzlas pa'o //
analyzed: aom badzra par shu n'a tstshinda tstshinda thk'a badzre hum h'um phat ces pa nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor la dur khrod du dbugs kyi bzlas pa'o //
translated: Oṃ vajra-arrow, cut, cut, pierce the vajra, hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ is the recitation of breath in the cemetery in the middle of the sky mandala.

original: de nas gzhu'i dus sbyor la aom s'ar dha tri ko ti kha nd'a ni kri tv'a sham sh'a na bh'u my'am sarba bh'u te byor ba lim ku ru ku ru thaka badzre hum h'um phat ces pa nam mkha'i dkyil lhor la dur khrod du dbugs kyi bzlas pa'o🔽// aom badzra da ma ru ke na badzra d'a ki n'i r'a b'a ha y'a b'a ha ya shi @202b badzre sl'i badzra hum h'um phat ces pa rlung la'o //
analyzed: de nas gzhu'i dus sbyor la aom s'ar dha tri ko ti kha nd'a ni kri tv'a sham sh'a na bh'u my'am sarba bh'u te byor ba lim ku ru ku ru thaka badzre hum h'um phat ces pa nam mkha'i dkyil lhor la dur khrod du dbugs kyi bzlas pa'o // aom badzra da ma ru ke na badzra d'a ki n'i r'a b'a ha y'a b'a ha ya shi @202b badzre sl'i badzra hum h'um phat ces pa rlung la'o //
translated: Then, in the Sagittarius ayana, Oṃ vajra-bow, with a hundred thousand arrows, make all the bhūtas tremble, make them tremble, pierce the vajra, hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ is the recitation of breath in the cemetery in the south of the sky mandala.🔽Oṃ vajra-drum, the vajra-dakini's roar, come, come, pierce the vajra, hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ is for the wind.

original: aom badzra d'a ko ni bhyo m'a ra ki ya k'a n'am ru dhi ram ni be da ya ni be da yashri badzre w'u badzra hum h'um phat ces pa me la'o //
analyzed: aom badzra d'a ko ni bhyo m'a ra ki ya k'a n'am ru dhi ram ni be da ya ni be da yashri badzre w'u badzra hum h'um phat ces pa me la'o //
translated: Oṃ vajra-dakini, bhyoḥ, make the mārā-kāṇas tremble, make the rudhiras tremble, pierce, pierce, pierce the vajra, hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ is for the fire.

original: aom panyts'a mri ta h'a ri n'i bhya:panyts'a mri tam ni be da ya ni be da ya w'u badzra shira badzre hum h'um phat ces pa chu la'o //
analyzed: aom panyts'a mri ta h'a ri n'i bhya:panyts'a mri tam ni be da ya ni be da ya w'u badzra shira badzre hum h'um phat ces pa chu la'o //
translated: Oṃ pañcāmṛta hāriṇi bhyaḥ, pañcāmṛtaṃ niveśaya niveśaya vauṣaṭ vajre huṃ phaṭ.

original: aom sarba badzra d'a ki n'i sa hi ta:sarba satva nam sh'antim kam pooshati kam raksh'a ba ra na gu bhim ku ru ku ru sli badzre sh'i badzra hum h'um phat ces pa sa'i dkyil 'khor la dbugs kyi bzlas pa'o //
analyzed: aom sarba badzra d'a ki n'i sa hi ta:sarba satva nam sh'antim kam pooshati kam raksh'a ba ra na gu bhim ku ru ku ru sli badzre sh'i badzra hum h'um phat ces pa sa'i dkyil 'khor la dbugs kyi bzlas pa'o //
translated: Oṃ sarva-vajra-ḍākinī-sahitaṃ sarva-sattvānāṃ śāntikaṃ pauṣṭikaṃ rakṣāvaraṇaṃ guhyaṃ kuru kuru śīghraṃ vajre śīghraṃ vajre huṃ phaṭ.

original: de ltar phreng ba'i sngags nyin zhag so sor dbugs kyi 'khor lo'i grangs bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar phreng ba'i sngags nyin zhag so sor dbugs kyi 'khor lo'i grangs bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the mantra of the rosary should be recited in the count of the breath-wheel for each day.

original: 'dir bgrang phreng med cing sngags brjod pa med de dbugs 'jug pa dang 'byung ba dag dang lhan cig sngags kyi yi ge rnams rab tu 'jug pa dang 'byung ba me tog gi phreng ba bzhin du zla ba dang nyi ma'i rang bzhin lugs dang mthun pa dang
analyzed: 'dir bgrang phreng med cing sngags brjod pa med de dbugs 'jug pa dang 'byung ba dag dang lhan cig sngags kyi yi ge rnams rab tu 'jug pa dang 'byung ba me tog gi phreng ba bzhin du zla ba dang nyi ma'i rang bzhin lugs dang mthun pa dang
translated: Here, there is no rosary and no recitation of the mantra. The mantra syllables enter and exit together with the inhalation and exhalation of breath, like a garland of flowers, in the forward and reverse sequence of the nature of the moon and sun.

original: lugs dang mi mthun pas blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: lugs dang mi mthun pas blta bar bya'o //
translated: One should look at it in a way that is not in accordance with the system.

original: de ltar nang du nyin zhag lngas stong phrag brgyad lhag pa'i 'bum phrag gi bzlas pa rnal 'byor pas bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar nang du nyin zhag lngas stong phrag brgyad lhag pa'i 'bum phrag gi bzlas pa rnal 'byor pas bya'o //
translated: Thus, the yogī should do the repetition of 100,000 with 8,000 in excess for five days internally.

original: nyin zhag lnga brgya rnams kyis dbugs 'bum phrag brgyad lhag pa'i bye ba bzlas pa'o //
analyzed: nyin zhag lnga brgya rnams kyis dbugs 'bum phrag brgyad lhag pa'i bye ba bzlas pa'o //
translated: With 500 days, there is the repetition of 10,000,000 with 800,000 in excess.

original: de nas lus dag pa ste de bzhin du ngag dag pa dang de bzhin du sems rnams par dag pa'o //
analyzed: de nas lus dag pa ste de bzhin du ngag dag pa dang de bzhin du sems rnams par dag pa'o //
translated: Then, the body is purified, and likewise, the speech is purified, and likewise, the mind is purified.

original: de ltar nyin zhag brgya phrag bco lnga rnams kyis dbugs g-yo ba med par 'gyur te srog gi bum pa can gyi gnas skabs thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar nyin zhag brgya phrag bco lnga rnams kyis dbugs g-yo ba med par 'gyur te srog gi bum pa can gyi gnas skabs thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, with 1,500 days, the breath becomes motionless, and one attains the state of the vase of life.

original: de nas rnal 'byor pa rnams la mngon par shes pa lnga skye bar 'gyur te g-yon dang g-yas dang dbu ma'i srog yang dag par rgyu bas rdo rje'i bzlas pa'i rim pa dang ma ning gi bzlas pa'i rim pa'o zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa'o
analyzed: de nas rnal 'byor pa rnams la mngon par shes pa lnga skye bar 'gyur te g-yon dang g-yas dang dbu ma'i srog yang dag par rgyu bas rdo rje'i bzlas pa'i rim pa dang ma ning gi bzlas pa'i rim pa'o zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa'o
translated: Then, the five superknowledges arise for the yogīs, by the correct movement of the left, right, and middle life-force. This is the stage of vajra repetition and the stage of neuter repetition. This is the Bhagavān’s definitive statement.

original: // da ni aa ba dh'u ti'i dbugs rnams dang sku dang gsung dang thugs dang ye shes dang 'khor lo lnga po rnams kyis sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sdom pa gsungs pa dbugs rnams gang dag ces pa la sogs pa ste 'dir byis pa skye ba'i dus su dbu
analyzed: // da ni aa ba dh'u ti'i dbugs rnams dang sku dang gsung dang thugs dang ye shes dang 'khor lo lnga po rnams kyis sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sdom pa gsungs pa dbugs rnams gang dag ces pa la sogs pa ste 'dir byis pa skye ba'i dus su dbu
translated: Now, the vows of all the buddhas are stated by the winds of the avadhūti, and the five bodies, speech, mind, gnosis, and wheels.🔽The winds🔽Here, at the time of the birth of a child, the winds in the madhyamā are the thirty-six with the eight legs, which are the eight with the legs, the dead, and the red.

original: ma la ni dbugs rnams gang dag rkang pa dang bcas pa'i lnga bcu rtsa drug ste rkang pa dang bcas ro dang dmar gyur pa de brgyad rnams kyis 'khor lor 'gyur te 'og dang mkha' yi dbang gis sgo yi dbus gnas lha mo rnams zhes pa ni dbugs
analyzed: ma la ni dbugs rnams gang dag rkang pa dang bcas pa'i lnga bcu rtsa drug ste rkang pa dang bcas ro dang dmar gyur pa de brgyad rnams kyis 'khor lor 'gyur te 'og dang mkha' yi dbang gis sgo yi dbus gnas lha mo rnams zhes pa ni dbugs
translated: Those are the wheels.🔽The goddesses in the middle of the doors are by the power of the space below.

original: 'di rnams kyi nang nas sku dang gsung dang thugs dang ye shes kyi chos can gyi @203a * //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi nang nas sku dang gsung dang thugs dang ye shes kyi chos can gyi @203a * //
translated: Among these, the eight winds that are the phenomena of body, speech, mind, and gnosis

original: dbugs brgyad de shes rab dang thabs kyi dbye ba las so //
analyzed: dbugs brgyad de shes rab dang thabs kyi dbye ba las so //
translated: are by the division of method and wisdom.

original: de rnams ni snying po'i padma'i 'dab ma la lha mo brgyad do //
analyzed: de rnams ni snying po'i padma'i 'dab ma la lha mo brgyad do //
translated: Those are the eight goddesses on the petals of the heart lotus.

original: 'dir thod pa rnams su ni mi 'gyur te dpa' bo rnams kyang ngo //
analyzed: 'dir thod pa rnams su ni mi 'gyur te dpa' bo rnams kyang ngo //
translated: Here, the skull-bowls are not so, nor are the heroes.

original: brgyad ni gzugs rnams par dag pas sa'i 'khor lo la'o //
analyzed: brgyad ni gzugs rnams par dag pas sa'i 'khor lo la'o //
translated: Eight are on the earth-wheel, by the purification of the forms.

original: brgyad ni 'du shes rnam par dag pas chu'i 'khor lo la'o //🔽brgyad ni tshor ba rnam par dag pas me'i 'khor lo la'o //
analyzed: brgyad ni 'du shes rnam par dag pas chu'i 'khor lo la'o // brgyad ni tshor ba rnam par dag pas me'i 'khor lo la'o //
translated: Eight are on the water-wheel, by the purification of the perceptions.🔽Eight are on the fire-wheel, by the purification of the feelings.

original: brgyad ni 'du byed rnam par dag pas rlung gi 'khor lo la'o //
analyzed: brgyad ni 'du byed rnam par dag pas rlung gi 'khor lo la'o //
translated: Eight are on the wind-wheel, by the purification of the impulses.

original: brgyad ni rnam par shes pa rnam par dag pas nam mkha'i 'khor lo la'o //
analyzed: brgyad ni rnam par shes pa rnam par dag pas nam mkha'i 'khor lo la'o //
translated: Eight are on the space-wheel, by the purification of consciousness.

original: brgyad ni ye shes rnam par dag pas dur khrod brgyad po rnams la'o //
analyzed: brgyad ni ye shes rnam par dag pas dur khrod brgyad po rnams la'o //
translated: Eight are on the eight charnel grounds, by the purification of intuition.

original: de ltar gsang ba dang lte ba dang snying kha dang mgrin pa dang dpral ba dang gtsug tor gyi 'khor lo drug po rnams la bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad do //
analyzed: de ltar gsang ba dang lte ba dang snying kha dang mgrin pa dang dpral ba dang gtsug tor gyi 'khor lo drug po rnams la bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad do //
translated: Thus, there are forty-eight on the six wheels of the secret place, the navel, the heart, the throat, the brow, and the crown.

original: de bzhin du sna'i bug pa dag la gnyis dang mig gi bug pa dag la gnyis dang rna ba'i bug pa dag la gnyis dang lce'i sgo dang gtsug tor gyi bug pa dag la gnyis so zhes pa ni lha mo'i tshogs te de ltar lnga bcu rtsa drug
analyzed: de bzhin du sna'i bug pa dag la gnyis dang mig gi bug pa dag la gnyis dang rna ba'i bug pa dag la gnyis dang lce'i sgo dang gtsug tor gyi bug pa dag la gnyis so zhes pa ni lha mo'i tshogs te de ltar lnga bcu rtsa drug
translated: Likewise, there are two in the nostrils, two in the eyes, two in the ears, and two in the mouth and the crown of the head.

original: go // lhag ma rkang pa gcig gis bskyed pa srid pa gsum gyi yum sna tshogs yum ste phyag na gri gug dang thod pa can no //
analyzed: go // lhag ma rkang pa gcig gis bskyed pa srid pa gsum gyi yum sna tshogs yum ste phyag na gri gug dang thod pa can no //
translated: The remaining one, which is generated by the one foot, is the mother of the three existences, Viśvamātā, who holds a flaying knife and a skull.

original: g-yon brkyang bdud rtsi'i cha de yis 'khyud pa nyi ma zla ba'i steng du ste /
analyzed: g-yon brkyang bdud rtsi'i cha de yis 'khyud pa nyi ma zla ba'i steng du ste /
translated: She embraces him with her left leg extended, on a sun and moon seat.

original: bdud dang nyon mongs pa'i steng du g-yas brkyang gis gnas pa bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i bde ba'o //
analyzed: bdud dang nyon mongs pa'i steng du g-yas brkyang gis gnas pa bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i bde ba'o //
translated: The Bhagavān Kālacakra, the supreme unchanging bliss, stands with his right leg extended on the top of Māra and the afflictions.

original: dbugs 'di rnams kyi sa bon rnams ni 'chad par 'gyur ba las li sogs dbyangs brgyad gang dag ces pa la sogs pas brjod par bya ste des na 'dir ma bris so //
analyzed: dbugs 'di rnams kyi sa bon rnams ni 'chad par 'gyur ba las li sogs dbyangs brgyad gang dag ces pa la sogs pas brjod par bya ste des na 'dir ma bris so //
translated: The seed syllables of these breaths will be explained later in the verse that begins, “The eight vowels such as ḷi and so on.”

original: 'dir nges pa'i don ni dus thams cad du brtan par gyur pa dang bum pa can gyi gnas skabs su gyur pa ji srid par dus thams cad du rnal 'byor pas 'jug pa dang 'byung ba nyid kyis srog dbu mar bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir nges pa'i don ni dus thams cad du brtan par gyur pa dang bum pa can gyi gnas skabs su gyur pa ji srid par dus thams cad du rnal 'byor pas 'jug pa dang 'byung ba nyid kyis srog dbu mar bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Here, the definitive meaning is that the yogi/nī should meditate on the life-force in the central channel by means of the entry and emergence of the life-force, which is stable at all times and in the state of the vase-shaped holding.

original: de nas rnal 'byor pas mngon par shes pa lnga thob par 'gyur te srog gi bzlas pa las so zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: de nas rnal 'byor pas mngon par shes pa lnga thob par 'gyur te srog gi bzlas pa las so zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa'o //
translated: Then, the yogi/nī will attain the five superknowledges from the life-force repetition. This is the definitive statement of the Bhagavān.

original: de ltar mi phyed pa'i yan lag srog dang ldan pa'i yid kyis sngags bzlas par bya'o zhes pa ni @203b rgyud thams cad las rdo rje'i tshig ste sngar brjod zin to //
analyzed: de ltar mi phyed pa'i yan lag srog dang ldan pa'i yid kyis sngags bzlas par bya'o zhes pa ni @203b rgyud thams cad las rdo rje'i tshig ste sngar brjod zin to //
translated: Thus, one should recite the mantra with the mind possessing the life-force, which is the branch of indivisibility. This vajra statement in all the tantras has been stated previously.

original: gang yang srog gi bzlas pa sngags brjod pa dang bgrang phreng dang bral ba de lta na yang bzlas pa zhes brjod par bya ste srog 'byung ba dang 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang yang srog gi bzlas pa sngags brjod pa dang bgrang phreng dang bral ba de lta na yang bzlas pa zhes brjod par bya ste srog 'byung ba dang 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Also, although the life-force repetition is free from the recitation of the mantra and the rosary, it should still be called “repetition” because of the emergence and entry of the life-force.

original: da ni phyi dang nang du lha'i gdan gyi dag pa gsungs pa lnga zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir dpa' bo gcig pa'i gdan ni zla ba khu ba'am nyi ma rdul lo //
analyzed: da ni phyi dang nang du lha'i gdan gyi dag pa gsungs pa lnga zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir dpa' bo gcig pa'i gdan ni zla ba khu ba'am nyi ma rdul lo //
translated: Now, the purity of the seats of the deities within and without is taught, beginning with “five,” and so on. Here, the seat of the sole hero is the moon, the semen, or the sun, the ovum.

original: khams lnga po rnams shes rab kyi chos can nyid kyi phyir zla ba'i yon tan yul lnga po de rnams ni 'dir spyan ma la sogs pa rnams kyi zla ba'i gang na rnams te nam mkha'i khams kyi mthar thug par ro //
analyzed: khams lnga po rnams shes rab kyi chos can nyid kyi phyir zla ba'i yon tan yul lnga po de rnams ni 'dir spyan ma la sogs pa rnams kyi zla ba'i gang na rnams te nam mkha'i khams kyi mthar thug par ro //
translated: Because the five elements are the subjects of wisdom, those five objects, which are the qualities of the moon, are here the moons of Locanā and so on, extending to the element of space.

original: yon tan gsum gyi dbang gis rin chen 'byung ldan dang snang ba mtha' yas dang don yod grub pa rnams kyi nyi ma'i gdan gsum mo //
analyzed: yon tan gsum gyi dbang gis rin chen 'byung ldan dang snang ba mtha' yas dang don yod grub pa rnams kyi nyi ma'i gdan gsum mo //
translated: By the power of the three qualities, there are three suns of Ratnasaṃbhava, Amitābha, and Amoghasiddhi.

original: 'byung ba bzhi'i bdag nyin ni gzugs chen po zhes pa khams gsum bzhi'i chos can nyid kyi phyir rnam par snang mdzad kyi zla ba'i gdan no //
analyzed: 'byung ba bzhi'i bdag nyin ni gzugs chen po zhes pa khams gsum bzhi'i chos can nyid kyi phyir rnam par snang mdzad kyi zla ba'i gdan no //
translated: The lord of the four elements is Mahā­rūpa, the subject of the three realms and four elements, and so is the moon seat of Vairocana.

original: ye shes kyi 'od zer gyi chos can nyid kyi phyir nyi ma'i gdan ni tshor ba la sogs pa lhag ma rnams kyi ste gzugs can min pa zhes pa'i gsung las so //
analyzed: ye shes kyi 'od zer gyi chos can nyid kyi phyir nyi ma'i gdan ni tshor ba la sogs pa lhag ma rnams kyi ste gzugs can min pa zhes pa'i gsung las so //
translated: The sun seat is for the remaining ones, feeling, etc., because of the nature of the light rays of intuition.

original: de ltar zla ba'i dkyil 'khor lnga dang snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa dang mnyam pa nyid kyi dbye bas nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor bzhi'o //
analyzed: de ltar zla ba'i dkyil 'khor lnga dang snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa dang mnyam pa nyid kyi dbye bas nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor bzhi'o //
translated: Thus, there are five moon maṇḍalas and four sun maṇḍalas by the divisions of sattva, rajas, tamas, and sama.

original: de ltar phung po dang khams rnams kyi yon tan dang yul gyi rten la dgu'i bdag nyid kyi 'dus pa ste mngal du skyes pa'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rnams kyi ji lta ba de bzhin du lha la yang ngo //
analyzed: de ltar phung po dang khams rnams kyi yon tan dang yul gyi rten la dgu'i bdag nyid kyi 'dus pa ste mngal du skyes pa'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rnams kyi ji lta ba de bzhin du lha la yang ngo //
translated: Thus, the collection of nine is the support of the qualities and objects of the aggregates and constituents. As it is for the consciousness, etc., of one born from a womb, so it is for the gods.

original: slar yang gzhan khro bo'i gdan bzhi ste chu gter rkang pa zhes pa nyi ma'i rkang pa'i nor dang bu lon 'phel ba dang 'grib pa'i dbang gis khro bo rnams kyi nyi ma'i gdan rnams so //
analyzed: slar yang gzhan khro bo'i gdan bzhi ste chu gter rkang pa zhes pa nyi ma'i rkang pa'i nor dang bu lon 'phel ba dang 'grib pa'i dbang gis khro bo rnams kyi nyi ma'i gdan rnams so //
translated: Again, there are four other wrathful seats, the feet of the ocean, which are the sun seats of the wrathful ones by the power of the increase and decrease of the sun’s debt and credit.

original: de ltar khro bo rnams kyi rkang pa zhes pa ste bcu gsum gyi bdag nyid kyi 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar khro bo rnams kyi rkang pa zhes pa ste bcu gsum gyi bdag nyid kyi 'dus pa'o //
translated: Thus, the assembly is of the nature of thirteen, with the feet of the wrathful ones.

original: de bzhin du gza' bdun po nyi ma'i gdan rnams dang rdzogs pa bcu gnyis zla ba'i dkyil 'khor rnams te gsum pa bcu dgu'i bdag nyid kyi 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gza' bdun po nyi ma'i gdan rnams dang rdzogs pa bcu gnyis zla ba'i dkyil 'khor rnams te gsum pa bcu dgu'i bdag nyid kyi 'dus pa'o //
translated: Similarly, the seven planets are the seats of the sun, and the twelve complete [moons] are the moon-disks, so the assembly is of the nature of nineteen, with the third.

original: lo so sor nag po'i rdzogs pa gnam stong bcu gnyis dang dkar po'i rdzogs pa nya bcu gnyis te de ltar nyi shu rtsa bzhi nyi ma dang zla ba'i gdan rnams dang gtso @204a * //
analyzed: lo so sor nag po'i rdzogs pa gnam stong bcu gnyis dang dkar po'i rdzogs pa nya bcu gnyis te de ltar nyi shu rtsa bzhi nyi ma dang zla ba'i gdan rnams dang gtso @204a * //
translated: Each year, there are twelve complete [moons] of the dark [fortnight] on the thirtieth, and twelve complete [moons] of the bright [fortnight] on the full moon, so there are twenty-four. The seats of the sun and moon,

original: bo'i rigs kyi dbang gis zla ba'am nyi ma'i gdan te de ltar lha rnams kyi rten gyi dbye ba las nyi shu rtsa lnga'i bdag nyid kyi 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: bo'i rigs kyi dbang gis zla ba'am nyi ma'i gdan te de ltar lha rnams kyi rten gyi dbye ba las nyi shu rtsa lnga'i bdag nyid kyi 'dus pa'o //
translated: and the moon or sun seats by the power of the principal's family, so the assembly is of the nature of twenty-five by the division of the bases of the deities.

original: slar yang de rnams kyi nang du gzhan gza' bdun gyi gdan rnams bsreg pa ni phung po lnga dang khams bzhi dang skye mched bcu gnyis dang khro bo bcu gcig rnams kyi gdan sum cu rtsa gnyis su 'gyur te sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi bdag nyid kyi 'dus
analyzed: slar yang de rnams kyi nang du gzhan gza' bdun gyi gdan rnams bsreg pa ni phung po lnga dang khams bzhi dang skye mched bcu gnyis dang khro bo bcu gcig rnams kyi gdan sum cu rtsa gnyis su 'gyur te sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi bdag nyid kyi 'dus
translated: Again, the burning of the seats of the other seven planets within those [channels] is the thirty-two seats of the five aggregates, the four elements, the twelve sense bases, and the eleven wrathful ones.

original: pa'o // slar yang mnyam dang mi mnyam gnas la srog 'gro ba nyi ma'i gdan dang 'ong ba zla ba'i gdan te des na sum cu rtsa bzhi'i bdag nyid kyi 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: pa'o // slar yang mnyam dang mi mnyam gnas la srog 'gro ba nyi ma'i gdan dang 'ong ba zla ba'i gdan te des na sum cu rtsa bzhi'i bdag nyid kyi 'dus pa'o //
translated: Thus, there is a gathering of thirty-two. Again, the life force moving on the equal and unequal [levels] is the seat of the sun, and the return is the seat of the moon. Thus, there is a gathering of thirty-four.

original: de ltar rnam pa drug ste mngal du byis pa'i khams kyi rten dang brten pa 'dus pa ji lta bde bzhin du lha rnams kyi 'dus pa'o zhes pa'i rigs pas 'dus pa drug go //
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa drug ste mngal du byis pa'i khams kyi rten dang brten pa 'dus pa ji lta bde bzhin du lha rnams kyi 'dus pa'o zhes pa'i rigs pas 'dus pa drug go //
translated: Thus, there are six aspects. Just as the womb is the gathering of the elements of the child, the support and the supported, in the same way, the gathering of the deities is the gathering of the six.

original: da ni zla ba zhes pa la sogs pas 'khor lo gsum gyi sdom pa la gdan gyi dag pa gsungs te 'dir 'khor lo gsum la rtsibs nyi shu rtsa bzhi'o //
analyzed: da ni zla ba zhes pa la sogs pas 'khor lo gsum gyi sdom pa la gdan gyi dag pa gsungs te 'dir 'khor lo gsum la rtsibs nyi shu rtsa bzhi'o //
translated: Now, beginning from the line the moon, he explains the purity of the seats in the three wheels. Here, the three wheels have twenty-four spokes.

original: de rnams kyang 'byung dang 'byung ba mda' dang rig byed yon tan lag pa ri bong can zhes pa sngar gsungs pa'i zla ba'i rkang pa nyi shu rtsa lnga ste de rnams las nyi shu rtsa bzhi ni 'khor lo gsum gyi rtsibs su 'gyur zhing nyi shu rtsa
analyzed: de rnams kyang 'byung dang 'byung ba mda' dang rig byed yon tan lag pa ri bong can zhes pa sngar gsungs pa'i zla ba'i rkang pa nyi shu rtsa lnga ste de rnams las nyi shu rtsa bzhi ni 'khor lo gsum gyi rtsibs su 'gyur zhing nyi shu rtsa
translated: Those are the twenty-five lunar digits previously mentioned, called “elements, elements, arrow, science, quality, hand, and rabbit.”

original: lnga pa gcig pu ni padma'i 'dab ma'i lha mo'i ro'i gdan no //
analyzed: lnga pa gcig pu ni padma'i 'dab ma'i lha mo'i ro'i gdan no //
translated: Of those, twenty-four become the spokes of the three wheels, and the twenty-fifth is the seat of the goddess of the lotus petal.🔽The eleven solar digits are called “corpse, time, and rabbit.”

original: nyi ma'i rkang pa ni ro dang dus dang ri bong can zhes pa bcu gcig ste de rnams las gsum ni snying po'i padma'i 'dab ma gsum la'o //
analyzed: nyi ma'i rkang pa ni ro dang dus dang ri bong can zhes pa bcu gcig ste de rnams las gsum ni snying po'i padma'i 'dab ma gsum la'o //
translated: Of those, three are on the three lotus petals of the heart.

original: lhag ma brgyad ni dur khrod brgyad la ro'i gzugs kyis gnas pa rnams te rtsibs zhes pa ni rten no //
analyzed: lhag ma brgyad ni dur khrod brgyad la ro'i gzugs kyis gnas pa rnams te rtsibs zhes pa ni rten no //
translated: The remaining eight are the eight charnel grounds, abiding in the form of corpses.🔽“Spokes” means the support.

original: ro zhes pa ni lha mo rnams kyi bzhon pa'i ro rnams so //
analyzed: ro zhes pa ni lha mo rnams kyi bzhon pa'i ro rnams so //
translated: “Corpses” means the corpses that are the mounts of the goddesses.

original: de ltar 'khor lo gsum gyi sngom pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'khor lo gsum gyi sngom pa'o //
translated: Thus, there are three wheels.

original: slar yang lnga ma dang phyi ma'i dbye bas rkang pa nyis 'gyur ni sdom pa chen po la lha mo rnams kyi gdan bdun cu rtsa gnyis su 'gyur te de ltar 'khor lo drug go sngom pa'o //
analyzed: slar yang lnga ma dang phyi ma'i dbye bas rkang pa nyis 'gyur ni sdom pa chen po la lha mo rnams kyi gdan bdun cu rtsa gnyis su 'gyur te de ltar 'khor lo drug go sngom pa'o //
translated: Again, by the division into five and six, the double of the verses is the Great Binding, with seventy-two seats of the goddesses. Thus there are six wheels.

original: sgyu 'phrul dra ba la rdzogs pa nyi shu rtsa bzhi ste dkar po dang nag po rnams zla ba dang nyi ma'i gdan rnams so //
analyzed: sgyu 'phrul dra ba la rdzogs pa nyi shu rtsa bzhi ste dkar po dang nag po rnams zla ba dang nyi ma'i gdan rnams so //
translated: In the Magical Net there are twenty-four perfections, with the white and black seats of the moon and sun.

original: de bzhin du gza' bdun te nyi ma'i gdan bdun no //
analyzed: de bzhin du gza' bdun te nyi ma'i gdan bdun no //
translated: Similarly, there are seven planets, with seven seats of the sun.

original: nyi ma'i rkang pa rnams ni nyi ma'i gdan bcu gcig go //
analyzed: nyi ma'i rkang pa rnams ni nyi ma'i gdan bcu gcig go //
translated: The verses of the sun are the eleven seats of the sun.

original: yang na bsam pa'i dbye bas zla ba'i gdan rnams te de ltar gdan bzhi bcu rtsa gsum ni gcig la'o //
analyzed: yang na bsam pa'i dbye bas zla ba'i gdan rnams te de ltar gdan bzhi bcu rtsa gsum ni gcig la'o //
translated: Or, by the division of the imagination, there are seats of the moon. Thus there are forty-three seats in the first.

original: mnyam dang mi mnyam rkang bas sngar bzhin du zla ba dang nyi ma'i gdan te gdan bzhi @204b bcu rtsa lnga ni gnyis ba la'o //
analyzed: mnyam dang mi mnyam rkang bas sngar bzhin du zla ba dang nyi ma'i gdan te gdan bzhi @204b bcu rtsa lnga ni gnyis ba la'o //
translated: By the equal and unequal verses, as before, there are seats of the moon and sun. Thus there are forty-five seats in the second.

original: chu gter rkang pa zhes pa nyi ma'i rkang pa'i dbye bas nyi ma'i gdan nam zla ba'i gdan bzhir 'gyur te lus dang bsam pa'i dbye bas so //
analyzed: chu gter rkang pa zhes pa nyi ma'i rkang pa'i dbye bas nyi ma'i gdan nam zla ba'i gdan bzhir 'gyur te lus dang bsam pa'i dbye bas so //
translated: The “feet of the ocean” are the divisions of the feet of the sun, which are the seats of the sun or the moon, four in number, by the divisions of the body and the mind.

original: de ltar lha rnams kyi gdan bzhi bcu rtsa dgu ni sgyu 'phrul dra ba gsum pa la ste mngal du byis pa'i srog gi rten du gyur pa'i khams rnams ji lta ba de bzhin du phyi rol dang gzhan la yang la grub bo /
analyzed: de ltar lha rnams kyi gdan bzhi bcu rtsa dgu ni sgyu 'phrul dra ba gsum pa la ste mngal du byis pa'i srog gi rten du gyur pa'i khams rnams ji lta ba de bzhin du phyi rol dang gzhan la yang la grub bo /
translated: Thus, the forty-nine seats of the deities are in the three-part Magical Net, just as the elements that are the support of the life of the child in the womb are in the external and other.

original: de ltar 'dus pa dang sgyu 'phrul dra ba dang 'khor lo gsum dang 'khor lo drug gi sdom pa yongs su dag pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'dus pa dang sgyu 'phrul dra ba dang 'khor lo gsum dang 'khor lo drug gi sdom pa yongs su dag pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: Thus, there is the certainty of the complete purity of the vows of the three and six wheels of the Magical Net and the Gathering.

original: rgyud de rnams la gtso bo ni gzugs med pa'i phung po'i chos can nyid kyi phyir nyi ma'am gzugs kyi chos can nyid kyi phyir shes rab kyi chos las zla ba la 'gyur zhing rnam par snang mdzad ni snying rje'i chos kyis zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la 'gyur
analyzed: rgyud de rnams la gtso bo ni gzugs med pa'i phung po'i chos can nyid kyi phyir nyi ma'am gzugs kyi chos can nyid kyi phyir shes rab kyi chos las zla ba la 'gyur zhing rnam par snang mdzad ni snying rje'i chos kyis zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la 'gyur
translated: In those tantras, the principal one is the sun because of being the dharma of the form aggregate, and the moon is the dharma of wisdom because of being the dharma of form. Vairocana is the moon maṇḍala because of being the dharma of compassion.

original: te rigs kyi dbang gis zhes pa shes rab dang snying rje'i dbang gis so //
analyzed: te rigs kyi dbang gis zhes pa shes rab dang snying rje'i dbang gis so //
translated: By the power of the family means by the power of wisdom and compassion.

original: gtso bo'i yang na kha sbyor la zhes pa ni dus kyi 'khor lo la shes rab dang snying rje gnyis la'o zhes pa ste dang po'i sangs rgyas ris med pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes grub bo //
analyzed: gtso bo'i yang na kha sbyor la zhes pa ni dus kyi 'khor lo la shes rab dang snying rje gnyis la'o zhes pa ste dang po'i sangs rgyas ris med pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes grub bo //
translated: Or, in the embrace of the principal means in the embrace of the Wheel of Time, who is wisdom and compassion. Thus it is established that the first Buddha is nondual.🔽Now he states the purity of the faces of the gods such as Vayu.

original: da ni rlung la sogs pa'i lha rnams kyi zhal gyi dag pa gsungs pa rlung zhes pa las sogs pa ste 'dir rlung la sogs pa'i lha rnams kyi zhal ni rnam pa gnyis te gcig ni yul dag pas so //
analyzed: da ni rlung la sogs pa'i lha rnams kyi zhal gyi dag pa gsungs pa rlung zhes pa las sogs pa ste 'dir rlung la sogs pa'i lha rnams kyi zhal ni rnam pa gnyis te gcig ni yul dag pas so //
translated: Here the faces of the gods such as Vayu are twofold: one by the purity of the object,

original: gnyis pa ni yon tan gsum dag pas so //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni yon tan gsum dag pas so //
translated: and the second by the purity of the three qualities.

original: de la rlung gi khams la reg bya'i yon tan gyi bdag nyid zhal gcig tu 'gyur zhing gnyis pa ni sgra'i yon tan gyi bdag nyid rgyas gdab pa ste des na 'du byed kyi phung po la rnam par shes pa'i phung pos rgyas gdab bo //
analyzed: de la rlung gi khams la reg bya'i yon tan gyi bdag nyid zhal gcig tu 'gyur zhing gnyis pa ni sgra'i yon tan gyi bdag nyid rgyas gdab pa ste des na 'du byed kyi phung po la rnam par shes pa'i phung pos rgyas gdab bo //
translated: Therein, the wind element becomes one face, which is of the nature of the quality of touch, and the second is the quality of sound, which is the seal. Thus the aggregate of mental formations is sealed by the aggregate of consciousness.

original: de ltar rlung la reg bya'i zhal gcig dang ni yon tan gzhan gyi dbang gis rgyas gdab zhal ni gnyis pa zhes pa spyi bor te zhal gyi gnas su ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar rlung la reg bya'i zhal gcig dang ni yon tan gzhan gyi dbang gis rgyas gdab zhal ni gnyis pa zhes pa spyi bor te zhal gyi gnas su ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, wind has one face of touch and a second face of sealing by the power of other qualities, but not at the site of the face at the crown.

original: de bzhin du me la ro dang reg bya'i yul gyi chos kyis zhal gnyis dang yon tan gyis rgyas gdab pa'i zhal ni gsum pa ste des na tshor pa la yang rnam par shes pas rgyas gdab bo //
analyzed: de bzhin du me la ro dang reg bya'i yul gyi chos kyis zhal gnyis dang yon tan gyis rgyas gdab pa'i zhal ni gsum pa ste des na tshor pa la yang rnam par shes pas rgyas gdab bo //
translated: Similarly, fire has two faces of taste and touch and a third face of sealing by the power of qualities. Thus, feeling is also sealed by consciousness.

original: de bzhin du chu la gzugs dang ro dang reg bya yi ni zhal te zhal gsum dang rgyas gdab zhal ni bzhi pa nam mkha'i mtshan nyid sgra'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du chu la gzugs dang ro dang reg bya yi ni zhal te zhal gsum dang rgyas gdab zhal ni bzhi pa nam mkha'i mtshan nyid sgra'o //
translated: Similarly, water has three faces of form, taste and touch and a fourth face of sealing by the characteristic of space, sound.

original: des na 'du shes la rnam par shes pas rgyas gdab bo //
analyzed: des na 'du shes la rnam par shes pas rgyas gdab bo //
translated: Thus, discernment is also sealed by consciousness.

original: sa la dri la sogs pa zhes pa @205a * //
analyzed: sa la dri la sogs pa zhes pa @205a * //
translated: Earth has the smell and so on.

original: la sogs pa dri dang gzugs dang ro dang reg bya'i yul gyi chos kyis zhal bzhir 'gyur te des na gzugs kyi phung po la yang rnam par shes pa'i phung pos rgyas gdab bo zhes grub bo //
analyzed: la sogs pa dri dang gzugs dang ro dang reg bya'i yul gyi chos kyis zhal bzhir 'gyur te des na gzugs kyi phung po la yang rnam par shes pa'i phung pos rgyas gdab bo zhes grub bo //
translated: And so on refers to the four faces of smell, form, taste, and touch. Therefore, the aggregate of consciousness seals the aggregate of form.

original: nam mkha'i khams dang rnam par shes pa'i phung po la ni stong pa chen po'i 'gyur med lnga zhes gsungs pa'i phyir stong pa rnam pa lnga zhal lnga ste rgya yis gdab pa'i zhal ni drug pa ye shes kyi phung po'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams dang rnam par shes pa'i phung po la ni stong pa chen po'i 'gyur med lnga zhes gsungs pa'i phyir stong pa rnam pa lnga zhal lnga ste rgya yis gdab pa'i zhal ni drug pa ye shes kyi phung po'o //
translated: Since the element of space and the aggregate of consciousness are said to be the five immutable great emptinesses, the five aspects of emptiness are the five faces. The face of the seal is the aggregate of timeless awareness, which is the sixth.🔽Similarly, the element of timeless awareness is the six faces of the qualities of the six elements. The six faces of emptiness are the six faces of the qualities of the elements and the sense objects.

original: de bzhin du ni ye shes khams la 'gyur te yon tan dbang las zhes pa zhal drug pa la stong pa drug gi zhal te de la yang rnam par shes pa'i khams kyis rgyas gdab bo zhes pa phyag rgya'i nges pa ste khams dang yul gyi yon tan
analyzed: de bzhin du ni ye shes khams la 'gyur te yon tan dbang las zhes pa zhal drug pa la stong pa drug gi zhal te de la yang rnam par shes pa'i khams kyis rgyas gdab bo zhes pa phyag rgya'i nges pa ste khams dang yul gyi yon tan
translated: The aggregate of consciousness seals that.

original: gyi dbang gis dag pa'o //
analyzed: gyi dbang gis dag pa'o //
translated: That is the ascertainment of the seals.🔽The purity is by the power of the qualities of the elements and the sense objects.

original: de nas gcig ni bzhi la bsres pa bde mnyam 'bras bu ster ba dag ste gnyis dang gsum ni bsres pa lnga zhes pa ni 'dir gang gi tshe rlung gi khams reg bya gcig pu'i yon tan gyi bdag nyid nam mkha'i khams kyis rgyas btab pa ni sa'i
analyzed: de nas gcig ni bzhi la bsres pa bde mnyam 'bras bu ster ba dag ste gnyis dang gsum ni bsres pa lnga zhes pa ni 'dir gang gi tshe rlung gi khams reg bya gcig pu'i yon tan gyi bdag nyid nam mkha'i khams kyis rgyas btab pa ni sa'i
translated: The two and three mixed are the five.🔽When the wind element, the nature of the single quality of touch, is sealed by the space element, it is mixed with the earth element, the nature of the four qualities of smell and so on, sealed by the space element.

original: khams dri la sogs pa yon tan bzhi'i bdag nyid nam mkha'i khams kyis rgyas btab pa la bsres par gyur pa de'i tshe bde mnyam 'bras bu ster bshes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyi sbyor bar 'gyur ro /
analyzed: khams dri la sogs pa yon tan bzhi'i bdag nyid nam mkha'i khams kyis rgyas btab pa la bsres par gyur pa de'i tshe bde mnyam 'bras bu ster bshes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyi sbyor bar 'gyur ro /
translated: At that time, the union of the nature of wisdom and method bestows the result of the bliss of union.

original: de bzhin du me reg bya dang ro'i yon tan gnyis kyi bdag nyid nam mkha'i yon tan gyis rgyas btab pa dang chu'i khams yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid nam mkha'i yon tan gyis rgyas btab pa phan tshun 'dus pa ni lngar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du me reg bya dang ro'i yon tan gnyis kyi bdag nyid nam mkha'i yon tan gyis rgyas btab pa dang chu'i khams yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid nam mkha'i yon tan gyis rgyas btab pa phan tshun 'dus pa ni lngar 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, the fire element, the nature of the two qualities of touch and taste, sealed by the quality of space, and the water element, the nature of the three qualities, sealed by the quality of space, are mixed with each other, making five.

original: de bzhin dus dang rlung dag la lnga'o //
analyzed: de bzhin dus dang rlung dag la lnga'o //
translated: Similarly, there are five for the earth and wind elements.

original: de bzhin du shar dang nub dang byang dang lho phan tshun 'dus pa ni shes rab dang thabs zhal bcu ste 'di'i spros pa ni nang gi le'u las shes rab thabs ni rus pa sha dang chu dang bcas pa'i khrag dang smin byed dang ni gci ba nyid
analyzed: de bzhin du shar dang nub dang byang dang lho phan tshun 'dus pa ni shes rab dang thabs zhal bcu ste 'di'i spros pa ni nang gi le'u las shes rab thabs ni rus pa sha dang chu dang bcas pa'i khrag dang smin byed dang ni gci ba nyid
translated: “Wisdom and method are the bones, flesh, water, blood, and the ripening of feces and urine.”

original: ces pa la sogs pas gsungs so zhes pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: ces pa la sogs pas gsungs so zhes pa nges pa'o //
translated: This is the ascertainment.

original: gzhan yang yon tan rnam pa gsum zhes pa la sogs pas yon tan gsum gyi dbye ba gsungs te 'dir khams thams cad la snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa'i yon tan rnams yod de de rnams kyi khams thams cad zhal gsum pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang yon tan rnam pa gsum zhes pa la sogs pas yon tan gsum gyi dbye ba gsungs te 'dir khams thams cad la snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa'i yon tan rnams yod de de rnams kyi khams thams cad zhal gsum pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the statement “the three qualities” and so on explains the division of the three qualities. Here all the elements have the qualities of sattva, rajas, and tamas. All those elements have three faces.

original: khams rnams la dri la sogs pa bas chos kyi khams kyi mthar thug pa yul drug ste de rnams kyi phyag drug pa'o //
analyzed: khams rnams la dri la sogs pa bas chos kyi khams kyi mthar thug pa yul drug ste de rnams kyi phyag drug pa'o //
translated: The elements have six objects, from smell up to the ultimate element of phenomena. They have six arms.

original: de ltar yon tan rnams pa gsum @205b gyi dbang gis bzhi la zhal ni bcu gnyis te shar dang nub dang byang dang lho dang 'og dang steng gi shes rab dang thabs so zhes pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar yon tan rnams pa gsum @205b gyi dbang gis bzhi la zhal ni bcu gnyis te shar dang nub dang byang dang lho dang 'og dang steng gi shes rab dang thabs so zhes pa nges pa'o //
translated: Thus, by the power of the three kinds of qualities, the faces are twelve, in the east, west, north, south, below, and above, with wisdom and means.

original: 'dus pa las thams cad kyi mtshan ma ni khu ba dang rtsa dang rus pa rnams par dag pa rdo rje dang padma dang 'khor lo ste mi bskyod pa'i g-yas na'o //
analyzed: 'dus pa las thams cad kyi mtshan ma ni khu ba dang rtsa dang rus pa rnams par dag pa rdo rje dang padma dang 'khor lo ste mi bskyod pa'i g-yas na'o //
translated: In the assembly, the signs of all are the purified semen, nerves, and bones, the vajra, lotus, and wheel, on the right of Akshobhya.

original: rdul dang khrag dang sha ni rdo rje dril bu dang nor bu dang ral gri ste g-yon na'o //
analyzed: rdul dang khrag dang sha ni rdo rje dril bu dang nor bu dang ral gri ste g-yon na'o //
translated: The dust, blood, and flesh are the vajra, bell, jewel, and sword, on the left.

original: 'dir lha gang gi g-yas kyi phyag dang po'i mthil du rang gi mtshan ma song ba de'i gnas su rdo rje'i mtshan ma 'gro ba de ltar 'dus pa'i nges pa ste 'dus pa la sangs rgyas gang dbus su bzhugs pa de'i gnas su mi bskyod pa 'gro ba
analyzed: 'dir lha gang gi g-yas kyi phyag dang po'i mthil du rang gi mtshan ma song ba de'i gnas su rdo rje'i mtshan ma 'gro ba de ltar 'dus pa'i nges pa ste 'dus pa la sangs rgyas gang dbus su bzhugs pa de'i gnas su mi bskyod pa 'gro ba
translated: Here, the sign of whatever deity goes into the palm of the first right hand, and in its place the vajra sign goes. Thus, the certainty of the assembly is that in the assembly, the place of whatever buddha is in the center, Akshobhya goes there.

original: ji lta ba de bzhin du mtshan ma la yang nges pa'o //
analyzed: ji lta ba de bzhin du mtshan ma la yang nges pa'o //
translated: Just as it is, it is also the certainty of the signs.

original: de bzhin du zhal lnga pa dang zhal drug pa dag la zhal bcu gnyis pa ste rnam par shes pa dang ye shes kyi khams rnams zhal lnga pa dang zhal drug pa stong pa chen po 'gyur med lnga dang thig le stong pa 'gyur med drug dag la'o
analyzed: de bzhin du zhal lnga pa dang zhal drug pa dag la zhal bcu gnyis pa ste rnam par shes pa dang ye shes kyi khams rnams zhal lnga pa dang zhal drug pa stong pa chen po 'gyur med lnga dang thig le stong pa 'gyur med drug dag la'o
translated: Likewise, the twelve-faced one is for the five-faced and six-faced ones, that is, for the five unchanging great emptinesses and the six unchanging empty essences of the elements of consciousness and gnosis.

original: // slar yang de dag phan tshun ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid kyis 'dus pa ni zhal nyi shu rtsa gnyis pa'o zhes pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: // slar yang de dag phan tshun ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid kyis 'dus pa ni zhal nyi shu rtsa gnyis pa'o zhes pa nges pa'o //
translated: Again, the twenty-two-faced one is for the mutual dependence of those, that is, the definite.

original: da ni dus kyi dbye bas zhal la sogs pa'i dag pa gsungs pa thun mtshams zhes pa ste 'dir /
analyzed: da ni dus kyi dbye bas zhal la sogs pa'i dag pa gsungs pa thun mtshams zhes pa ste 'dir /
translated: Now, the purity of the faces and so on is stated in terms of the divisions of time:

original: nyin mo bcom ldan rdo rje can /
analyzed: nyin mo bcom ldan rdo rje can /
translated: The day is the Bhagavān Vajrī,🔽and the night is renowned as Prajñā.

original: mtshan mo shes rab rab tu grags zhes pa'i nges pa las nam phyed nas nyi ma phyed kyi bar la thun mtshams dbye bas thun tshod kyi dbye bas phyag brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan mo shes rab rab tu grags zhes pa'i nges pa las nam phyed nas nyi ma phyed kyi bar la thun mtshams dbye bas thun tshod kyi dbye bas phyag brgyad pa'o //
translated: From this rule, the eight-faced one is from the division of the periods, that is, from the division of the periods from midnight to noon.

original: de bzhin du nyi ma phyed nas nam phyed kyi bar la shes rab kyang zhal bzhi phyag brgyad ma'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du nyi ma phyed nas nam phyed kyi bar la shes rab kyang zhal bzhi phyag brgyad ma'o //
translated: Likewise, from noon to midnight, Wisdom is also four-faced and eight-armed.

original: mnyam pa 'khrud pa ni nyin mo dang mtshan mo dag gi gung gi cha shas la'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa 'khrud pa ni nyin mo dang mtshan mo dag gi gung gi cha shas la'o //
translated: The equalizing bath is in the middle part of the day and night.

original: mi mnyam pa ni snga dro'i thun mtshams dang phyi de'i thun mtshams dag la'o //
analyzed: mi mnyam pa ni snga dro'i thun mtshams dang phyi de'i thun mtshams dag la'o //
translated: The unequalizing is in the morning and evening.

original: de la nyin mo dang mtshams mo dag dman pa dang lhag pa'i dbang gis 'ga' zhig tu ni nyin mo 'phel ba las bcom ldan 'das zhal lnga phyag bcu pa dang bcom ldan 'das ma zhal gsum phyag drug ma'o //
analyzed: de la nyin mo dang mtshams mo dag dman pa dang lhag pa'i dbang gis 'ga' zhig tu ni nyin mo 'phel ba las bcom ldan 'das zhal lnga phyag bcu pa dang bcom ldan 'das ma zhal gsum phyag drug ma'o //
translated: There, by the power of the lesser and greater [parts of the day and night], in some cases, the day increases, and the Lord is five-faced and ten-armed, and the Goddess is three-faced and six-armed.

original: mtshan mo 'phel ba las bcom ldan 'das ma zhal lnga dang bcom ldan 'das zhal gsum pa'o zhes pa la sogs pa grub bo zhes pa ni dus kyi 'khor lo'i rnam par dag pa gcig go //
analyzed: mtshan mo 'phel ba las bcom ldan 'das ma zhal lnga dang bcom ldan 'das zhal gsum pa'o zhes pa la sogs pa grub bo zhes pa ni dus kyi 'khor lo'i rnam par dag pa gcig go //
translated: The night increases, and the Goddess is five-faced and the Lord is three-faced. This and so forth is established. This is one purification of the Wheel of Time.

original: de bzhin du gnyis pa gsungs pa rnams pa gsum zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir @206a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du gnyis pa gsungs pa rnams pa gsum zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir @206a * //
translated: Likewise, the second is stated: The three parts, etc.🔽Here, the three parts are the three faces of the Lord and the Goddess.

original: chu srin la sogs pa khyim bcu gnyis po de rnams kyi nad nas chu srin dang bum pa dang nya'i khyim rnams ni thugs rdo rje'i zhal rnams te mun pa dang rdul dang snying stobs kyi dbye bas nag po dang dmar po dang dkar po ste dus sbyor
analyzed: chu srin la sogs pa khyim bcu gnyis po de rnams kyi nad nas chu srin dang bum pa dang nya'i khyim rnams ni thugs rdo rje'i zhal rnams te mun pa dang rdul dang snying stobs kyi dbye bas nag po dang dmar po dang dkar po ste dus sbyor
translated: The twelve houses of the crocodile and so forth are the faces of the three vajras. The houses of the crocodile, pot and fish are the faces of Akshobhya, and are black, red and white, respectively, by way of the divisions of darkness, passion and purity.

original: dbye bas kha dog gsum zhes so //🔽de bzhin du lug dang glang dang 'khrig pa rnams ni gsung rdo rje'i zhal rnams te rdul dang snying stobs dang mun pa'i dbye bas dmar po dang dkar po dang nag po'i kha dog rnams so //
analyzed: dbye bas kha dog gsum zhes so // de bzhin du lug dang glang dang 'khrig pa rnams ni gsung rdo rje'i zhal rnams te rdul dang snying stobs dang mun pa'i dbye bas dmar po dang dkar po dang nag po'i kha dog rnams so //
translated: The colors are three by way of the divisions of the lunar mansions.🔽Similarly, the houses of the ram, bull and twins are the faces of Amitabha, and are red, white and black, respectively, by way of the divisions of passion, purity and darkness.

original: karka ta dang seng ge dang bu mo rnams ni sku rdo rje'i zhal te snying stobs dang mun pa dang rdul gyi dbye bas dkar po dang nag po dang dmar po rnams so //
analyzed: karka ta dang seng ge dang bu mo rnams ni sku rdo rje'i zhal te snying stobs dang mun pa dang rdul gyi dbye bas dkar po dang nag po dang dmar po rnams so //
translated: The houses of the crab, lion and virgin are the faces of Vairochana, and are white, black and red, respectively, by way of the divisions of purity, darkness and passion.

original: srad dang sdig pa dang gzhu'i dus sbyor rnams ni ye shes rdo rje'i zhal te mun pa dang rdul dang snying stobs kyi dbye bas ser po dang dmar po dang dkar po'i kha dog rnams so //
analyzed: srad dang sdig pa dang gzhu'i dus sbyor rnams ni ye shes rdo rje'i zhal te mun pa dang rdul dang snying stobs kyi dbye bas ser po dang dmar po dang dkar po'i kha dog rnams so //
translated: The asterisms Aśvinī, Bharaṇī, and Dhanisthā are the faces of Jñānavajra, yellow, red, and white, respectively, by the division of darkness, passion, and purity.

original: dus sbyor phyed kyis phyag gi dbye bar 'gyur te drug po rnams kyi gnyis gnyis la rtsa ba'i zhal la sogs pas grangs bzhin du g-yon dang g-yas pa dag la kha dog gsum mo //
analyzed: dus sbyor phyed kyis phyag gi dbye bar 'gyur te drug po rnams kyi gnyis gnyis la rtsa ba'i zhal la sogs pas grangs bzhin du g-yon dang g-yas pa dag la kha dog gsum mo //
translated: The division of the hands is by half asterisms. In each of the six faces, the left and right hands are the three colors, respectively, by the root face, etc.

original: de ltar zhal bcu gnyis dang phyag nyi shu rtsa bzhi pa ni bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo gcig go //
analyzed: de ltar zhal bcu gnyis dang phyag nyi shu rtsa bzhi pa ni bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo gcig go //
translated: Thus, with twelve faces and twenty-four arms, there is one Bhagavān Kālacakra.

original: 'dir sngar gsungs pa'i lha zhal gcig pa dang zhal bzhi pa la sogs pa rnams kyi mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa 'khyud pa gang yin pa de ni thun mtshams cha shas snga phyi la ste snga dro'i thun mtshams dang phyi dro'i thun mtshams la 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir sngar gsungs pa'i lha zhal gcig pa dang zhal bzhi pa la sogs pa rnams kyi mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa 'khyud pa gang yin pa de ni thun mtshams cha shas snga phyi la ste snga dro'i thun mtshams dang phyi dro'i thun mtshams la 'dus pa'o //
translated: Here, the embrace of the unequaled and the equal of the one-faced, four-faced, and so on, previously mentioned deities is in the earlier and later parts of the junction, that is, in the junction of the morning and the junction of the afternoon.

original: zhal gsum phyag drug pa rnams kyi phan tshun 'khyud pa gang yin pa de ni gung gi cha shas la ste nyi ma gung gi thun mtshams dang mtshan mo phyed kyi thun mtshams la'o //
analyzed: zhal gsum phyag drug pa rnams kyi phan tshun 'khyud pa gang yin pa de ni gung gi cha shas la ste nyi ma gung gi thun mtshams dang mtshan mo phyed kyi thun mtshams la'o //
translated: The embrace of those with three faces and six arms is in the middle part, that is, at noon and midnight.

original: de ltar lus dang sems la zhes pa ni lnga pa'i don la bdun pa ste lus dang bsam pa'i dbye ba las zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar lus dang sems la zhes pa ni lnga pa'i don la bdun pa ste lus dang bsam pa'i dbye ba las zhes pa'o //
translated: Thus, in body and mind, the fifth case is the seventh, that is, in the division of body and mind.

original: de bzhin du snga dro dang phyi dro'i thun mtshams ni rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud kyi 'khyud pa ste zhal gcig dang zhal bzhi pa dag gam zhal gcig pa la sogs pa dang zhal brgyad pa la sogs pa dag gi mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa snyoms par zhugs🔽pa las so //
analyzed: de bzhin du snga dro dang phyi dro'i thun mtshams ni rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud kyi 'khyud pa ste zhal gcig dang zhal bzhi pa dag gam zhal gcig pa la sogs pa dang zhal brgyad pa la sogs pa dag gi mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa snyoms par zhugs pa las so //
translated: Similarly, the embrace in the Yoginī Tantras is at the juncture of morning and afternoon, that is, in the unequal and equal union of those with one face and four faces, or those with one face and so on, and those with eight faces and so on.

original: rnal 'byor gyi rgyud la zhal dang phyag mnyam pa dag gis 'khyud pa ni nyin mo dang mtshan mo mnyam pa'i dus la'o zhes pa dus kyi khyad par gyis nges pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor gyi rgyud la zhal dang phyag mnyam pa dag gis 'khyud pa ni nyin mo dang mtshan mo mnyam pa'i dus la'o zhes pa dus kyi khyad par gyis nges pa'o //
translated: The embrace of those with equal faces and arms is at the time of the equal day and night. This is the determination by the difference of time.

original: de skad du bzang @206b ngan shes shing dus shes la //
analyzed: de skad du bzang @206b ngan shes shing dus shes la //
translated: Thus, knowing good and bad, knowing the time,

original: khyab bdag dam shes dam tshig ldan //
analyzed: khyab bdag dam shes dam tshig ldan //
translated: knowing the sacred, possessing sacred pledge,

original: dus shes sems can dbang po shes //
analyzed: dus shes sems can dbang po shes //
translated: knowing the time, knowing the faculties of sentient beings,🔽skilled in the three liberations.

original: rnam grol gsum la mkhas pa po zhes pa mtshan yang dag par brjod pa las te bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: rnam grol gsum la mkhas pa po zhes pa mtshan yang dag par brjod pa las te bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa'o //
translated: This is the definition from the Praise in Hundred and Fifty Verses.

original: da ni bya ba'i rgyud rnams gsungs pa shes rab ces pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: da ni bya ba'i rgyud rnams gsungs pa shes rab ces pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Now, the Action Tantras are taught, beginning with “wisdom” and so forth.

original: 'dir rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud la shes rab sbyor ba dang rnal 'byor gyi rgyud la snyoms par zhugs pa ste snga dro dang phyi dro'i thun mtshams kyi sbyor ba dang nyi ma gung nas mtshan dro'i thun mtshams kyi sbyor ba dang nyi ma gung nas mtshan gnyis la
analyzed: 'dir rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud la shes rab sbyor ba dang rnal 'byor gyi rgyud la snyoms par zhugs pa ste snga dro dang phyi dro'i thun mtshams kyi sbyor ba dang nyi ma gung nas mtshan dro'i thun mtshams kyi sbyor ba dang nyi ma gung nas mtshan gnyis la
translated: Here, in the Yoginī Tantras, the union of wisdom and means is the union of the morning and evening periods, the union of the period from noon to the evening period, and the union from noon to the two nights.

original: grub po // rgod pa la sogs rnams ni thun gyi mngon mtshams la'o zhes pa ni 'dir thun dang po'i mngon mtshams la rgod pa'i rgyud dang thun gsum pa'i mngon mtshams la lta ba'i rgyud dang thun lnga pa'i mngon mtshams la nu ma la reg pa'i rgyud dang thun bdun pa'i
analyzed: grub po // rgod pa la sogs rnams ni thun gyi mngon mtshams la'o zhes pa ni 'dir thun dang po'i mngon mtshams la rgod pa'i rgyud dang thun gsum pa'i mngon mtshams la lta ba'i rgyud dang thun lnga pa'i mngon mtshams la nu ma la reg pa'i rgyud dang thun bdun pa'i
translated: It is accomplished.🔽The four continuums of agitation and so on are at the beginning of the sessions.🔽Here, the continuum of agitation is at the beginning of the first session, the continuum of the view is at the beginning of the third session, the continuum of touching the breasts is at the beginning of the fifth session, and the continuum of holding hands is at the beginning of the seventh session.

original: mngon mtshams la lag pa 'dzin pa'i rgyud de de ltar rgyud rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: mngon mtshams la lag pa 'dzin pa'i rgyud de de ltar rgyud rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: Thus there are four continuums.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na 'dir rlung gi zad par rnams ni shes rab la rgod pa tsam gyis 'dzag pa'i bde bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na 'dir rlung gi zad par rnams ni shes rab la rgod pa tsam gyis 'dzag pa'i bde bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Why is that? Here, the dissolutions of the vāyu element are the bliss of the mere agitation of the wisdom.

original: me'i zad pa rnams ni bltas pas bde bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: me'i zad pa rnams ni bltas pas bde bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The dissolutions of the fire element are the bliss of looking.

original: chu'i zad par rnams ni nu ma la reg pas bde bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chu'i zad par rnams ni nu ma la reg pas bde bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The dissolutions of the water element are the bliss of touching the breasts.🔽The dissolutions of the earth element are the bliss of holding hands.

original: sa'i zad par rnams ni lag pa 'dzin pas bde bar 'gyur ro de ltar 'og min la sogs pa nas tshangs ris kyi mthar thug pa gzugs na spyod pa bcu drug ste 'di rnams kyi rgyas pa ni 'chad par 'gyur pa mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i ye shes
analyzed: sa'i zad par rnams ni lag pa 'dzin pas bde bar 'gyur ro de ltar 'og min la sogs pa nas tshangs ris kyi mthar thug pa gzugs na spyod pa bcu drug ste 'di rnams kyi rgyas pa ni 'chad par 'gyur pa mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i ye shes
translated: Thus, from Akaniṣṭha and so on up to the Brahmakāyika realm, there are sixteen [heavens] in the form realm. The expansion of these will be explained in the [chapter on] the supreme, unchanging gnosis.

original: grub pa las brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: grub pa las brjod par bya'o //
translated: [This] will be discussed in the [chapter on] the accomplishment.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams kyi snyoms par zhugs pa ni gnyis gnyis sbyor ba'o zhes pa grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams kyi snyoms par zhugs pa ni gnyis gnyis sbyor ba'o zhes pa grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: The assertion is that the meditative equipoise of those in the desire realm is the union of the two.

original: thams cad du gzugs med pa la ni 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams gnas so //
analyzed: thams cad du gzugs med pa la ni 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams gnas so //
translated: In all the formless [realms], those free from attachment abide.

original: da ni lus la bsam pa rab tu 'jug pa gsungs pa shes rag ces pa la sogs pa ste 'dir shes rab kyi yan lag dmar po me'i khams dang ser po sa'i khams la nges par dus kyi 'khor lo'i bsam pa rab tu 'jug go //
analyzed: da ni lus la bsam pa rab tu 'jug pa gsungs pa shes rag ces pa la sogs pa ste 'dir shes rab kyi yan lag dmar po me'i khams dang ser po sa'i khams la nges par dus kyi 'khor lo'i bsam pa rab tu 'jug go //
translated: Now, the statement of the contemplation of the body is the wisdom and so on. Here, the contemplation of Kālacakra definitely enters the red fire element of the wisdom branch and the yellow earth element.

original: shes rab dang thabs kyi gzung bar bya ba ste gang gi phyir snyoms par zhugs pa la shes rab gang yin pa de ni thabs kyi bsam pa 'dzin pa mo dang thabs gang yin pa de yang shes rab kyi bsam pa 'dzin pa po ste bsam pa 'dzin
analyzed: shes rab dang thabs kyi gzung bar bya ba ste gang gi phyir snyoms par zhugs pa la shes rab gang yin pa de ni thabs kyi bsam pa 'dzin pa mo dang thabs gang yin pa de yang shes rab kyi bsam pa 'dzin pa po ste bsam pa 'dzin
translated: The wisdom and method are to be held, because when one enters into union, whatever is the wisdom is the female who holds the intention of method, and whatever is the method is the male who holds the intention of wisdom.

original: pa des na bde ba skye'o //
analyzed: pa des na bde ba skye'o //
translated: By holding the intention in that way, bliss arises.

original: des na dus kyi 'khor @207a * //
analyzed: des na dus kyi 'khor @207a * //
translated: Therefore, the white water element of the Kālacakra

original: lo'i chu'i khams dkar po ni dmar po'i yan lag me'i yan lag la rab tu 'jug cing ro mnyam par 'gyur te de bzhin du rlung nag po ni ser po'i yan lag sa la ro mnyam par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lo'i chu'i khams dkar po ni dmar po'i yan lag me'i yan lag la rab tu 'jug cing ro mnyam par 'gyur te de bzhin du rlung nag po ni ser po'i yan lag sa la ro mnyam par 'gyur ro //
translated: enters into the branch of the red fire element and becomes of the same taste. Likewise, the black wind becomes of the same taste as the yellow earth element.

original: de ltar na lho dang nub tu lha rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: de ltar na lho dang nub tu lha rnams kyi'o //
translated: Thus, the gods are in the south and west.

original: de bzhin du rdo rje can dang lha rnams kyi g-yon gyi yan lag ste chu'i khams dkar po'i yan lag la shes rab bsam pa zhes pa dmar po'i bsam pa rab tu 'jug go //
analyzed: de bzhin du rdo rje can dang lha rnams kyi g-yon gyi yan lag ste chu'i khams dkar po'i yan lag la shes rab bsam pa zhes pa dmar po'i bsam pa rab tu 'jug go //
translated: Similarly, the white branch of the water element, the branch of the vajra-holder and the gods, enters into the red branch of the intention of wisdom, the intention of the red.

original: mdun du kha dog nag po rlung gi khams la ser po sa'i bsam pa 'jug go //
analyzed: mdun du kha dog nag po rlung gi khams la ser po sa'i bsam pa 'jug go //
translated: In front, the black color is the wind element, and the yellow is the earth element.

original: de bzhin du steng dang 'og tu ljang khu dang sngon po dag phan tshun du yang dag par sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du steng dang 'og tu ljang khu dang sngon po dag phan tshun du yang dag par sbyor ba'o //
translated: Similarly, above and below, the green and blue are mutually combined.

original: de ltar sems can thams cad kyi yang mchog gi lus la shes rab bsam pas phye ba g-yon dang mdun ni zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar sems can thams cad kyi yang mchog gi lus la shes rab bsam pas phye ba g-yon dang mdun ni zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, in the supreme body of all sentient beings, the left and front are pacifying, differentiated by the intention of wisdom.

original: drag po g-yas dang rgyab kyi yan lag mchog gi rgyal ba'i bdag po'i bsam pas phye ba de bzhin nyid ces pa ste steng zhi ba dang 'og drag por grub bo //
analyzed: drag po g-yas dang rgyab kyi yan lag mchog gi rgyal ba'i bdag po'i bsam pas phye ba de bzhin nyid ces pa ste steng zhi ba dang 'og drag por grub bo //
translated: The right and rear limbs are wrathful, differentiated by the intention of the supreme victor, just as it is. Above is pacifying, and below is wrathful.

original: de ltar shes rab kyis phye rgyal ba dag gi rab mchog tshogs kyi rigs te khu ba'i khams las byung ba lus kyi dbye ba chu dang rlung dang nam mkha'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de nyid bas pa'i dbye bas rdul gyi khams rnams kyis phye ba sa
analyzed: de ltar shes rab kyis phye rgyal ba dag gi rab mchog tshogs kyi rigs te khu ba'i khams las byung ba lus kyi dbye ba chu dang rlung dang nam mkha'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de nyid bas pa'i dbye bas rdul gyi khams rnams kyis phye ba sa
translated: Thus, differentiated by wisdom, the supreme of victors is the family of the assembly, arisen from the semen element. The divisions of the body, which have the characteristics of water, wind, and space, are differentiated by the divisions of the womb, by the elements of the particles.

original: dang me dang ye shes kyi rang bzhin du 'gyur ba'i phyir rab mchog tshogs kyi rigs ni gnyis kyi rang bzhin zhes pa byang dang / lhor lha'i tshogs dmar po dang dkar por 'gyur zhing shar dang nub tu ser po dang nag por 'gyur la steng dang 'og tu sngon po dang ljang khur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dang me dang ye shes kyi rang bzhin du 'gyur ba'i phyir rab mchog tshogs kyi rigs ni gnyis kyi rang bzhin zhes pa byang dang / lhor lha'i tshogs dmar po dang dkar por 'gyur zhing shar dang nub tu ser po dang nag por 'gyur la steng dang 'og tu sngon po dang ljang khur 'gyur ro //
translated: The assembly of deities in the south becomes red and white, and in the east and west it becomes yellow and black, and above and below it becomes blue and green.

original: de bzhin du shes rab kyi ni tshogs kyi rigs gtso bo'i bsam pas phye bas nges par phyogs bral du yang gnyis kyi rang bzhin nyid du 'gyur te bden bral dang dbang ldan du dkar po dang dmar por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab kyi ni tshogs kyi rigs gtso bo'i bsam pas phye bas nges par phyogs bral du yang gnyis kyi rang bzhin nyid du 'gyur te bden bral dang dbang ldan du dkar po dang dmar por 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, the family of the assembly of wisdom, divided by the intention of the principal, certainly becomes of the nature of two in the intermediate directions, and in the southwest and northwest it becomes white and red.

original: rlung dang me dang ser por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rlung dang me dang ser por 'gyur ro //
translated: In the northeast and southeast it becomes yellow and black, and in the nadir and zenith it becomes blue and green.

original: gnyis kyi rang bzhin zhes pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis kyi rang bzhin zhes pa nges pa'o //
translated: The nature of two is certain.

original: de ltar thabs kyi tshogs ni phyogs su gnas pa ste rnal 'byor ma'i tshogs zhes pa shes rab kyi tshogs spyan ma la sogs pa dang sgrol ma la sogs pa ni phyogs bral du gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar thabs kyi tshogs ni phyogs su gnas pa ste rnal 'byor ma'i tshogs zhes pa shes rab kyi tshogs spyan ma la sogs pa dang sgrol ma la sogs pa ni phyogs bral du gnas pa'o //
translated: Thus, the assembly of means is located in the directions, and the assembly of yoginis, namely, Locana and so on and Tara and so on, is located in the intermediate directions.

original: de ltar g-yas dang g-yas min nyi ma ri bong can gyi sku dag zung ste shar dang nub nyid kyang //
analyzed: de ltar g-yas dang g-yas min nyi ma ri bong can gyi sku dag zung ste shar dang nub nyid kyang //
translated: Thus, the bodies of the sun and moon, right and left, are paired, and the east and west are also so.

original: nag po ser po @207b dag ste sngon po ljang khu dag kyang de bzhin mkha' dang sa 'og yang dag gnas pa lha'i tshogs zhes pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: nag po ser po @207b dag ste sngon po ljang khu dag kyang de bzhin mkha' dang sa 'og yang dag gnas pa lha'i tshogs zhes pa nges pa'o //
translated: The black and yellow, and the blue and green, are also so, and the sky and the underworld are also so. This is the rule for the assembly of deities.

original: gzhan gyi rigs las 'khyud pa de'i phyir thabs dkar po rnams kyi shes rab dmar mo rnams su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rigs las 'khyud pa de'i phyir thabs dkar po rnams kyi shes rab dmar mo rnams su 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the embrace is from the other family, the white means become the red wisdoms.

original: thabs dmar po rnams kyi shes rab ri bong 'dzin pa ltar dkar mo rnams dang de bzhin nyid du thabs ser po rnams kyi shes rab kha dog nag mo rnams dang thabs dkar min zhes pa nag po'i rigs rnams kyi shes rab mchog gi gser dang mtshungs pa
analyzed: thabs dmar po rnams kyi shes rab ri bong 'dzin pa ltar dkar mo rnams dang de bzhin nyid du thabs ser po rnams kyi shes rab kha dog nag mo rnams dang thabs dkar min zhes pa nag po'i rigs rnams kyi shes rab mchog gi gser dang mtshungs pa
translated: The wisdoms of the red means are white like the moon, and likewise the wisdoms of the yellow means are black, and the wisdoms of the means that are not white, that is, of the black type, are supreme gold.

original: ser mo rnams dang sngon po rnams kyi shes rab kha dog sna tshogs zhes pa ldan khu rnams so //
analyzed: ser mo rnams dang sngon po rnams kyi shes rab kha dog sna tshogs zhes pa ldan khu rnams so //
translated: The wisdoms of the blue and the green are of various colors.

original: slar yang thabs ljang khu rnams kyi shes rab sngon mo rnams so //
analyzed: slar yang thabs ljang khu rnams kyi shes rab sngon mo rnams so //
translated: Again, the wisdoms of the green means are blue.

original: de bzhin gsungs zhes pa ni rig pa ste gzhan gyi rigs la 'khyud pa las bya ba 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gsungs zhes pa ni rig pa ste gzhan gyi rigs la 'khyud pa las bya ba 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: “Likewise” means that the knowledge of embracing another type will accomplish the activity.

original: rang gi rigs la 'khyud pas ni bya ba grub pa med de rang gi bdag nyid la bya ba 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi rigs la 'khyud pas ni bya ba grub pa med de rang gi bdag nyid la bya ba 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Embracing one’s own type does not accomplish the activity because activity with respect to oneself is contradictory.

original: bha ga'i sems kyis bha ga'i rigs kyi khams can rnams kyi bde ba skye ba dang de bzhin du rtags kyi sems kyis skyes pa'i rtags kyi rigs can rnams kyi bde ba skye ba ni med do //
analyzed: bha ga'i sems kyis bha ga'i rigs kyi khams can rnams kyi bde ba skye ba dang de bzhin du rtags kyi sems kyis skyes pa'i rtags kyi rigs can rnams kyi bde ba skye ba ni med do //
translated: The mind of the bhaga does not give rise to the bliss of those who have the bhaga-type element, and likewise the mind of the sign does not give rise to the bliss of those who have the sign-type element.

original: de'i phyir dus kyi 'khor lo la rang 'od kyi shes rab rnams su mi 'gyur te rang gi bdag nyid la bya ba 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir dus kyi 'khor lo la rang 'od kyi shes rab rnams su mi 'gyur te rang gi bdag nyid la bya ba 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, in the Kālacakra, the self-luminous wisdoms do not become the self-nature, because it is contradictory for an action to be done to itself.

original: ci ste me long gi gzugs brnyan gyi chos kyis sems kyis sems kyi dngos po 'dzin par byed do zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste me long gi gzugs brnyan gyi chos kyis sems kyis sems kyi dngos po 'dzin par byed do zhe na /
translated: If it is said that the mind apprehends the nature of the mind through the phenomenon of a mirror image,

original: de nyid rnam par dpyad par bya ste 'dir me long la skyes bu'i gzugs brnyan ni nu ma dang skra dang ldan pa dang mtshungs pa ma yin zhing bud med kyi gzugs kyang nu ma dang skye gnas dang bral ba ma yin te des na re zhig pa
analyzed: de nyid rnam par dpyad par bya ste 'dir me long la skyes bu'i gzugs brnyan ni nu ma dang skra dang ldan pa dang mtshungs pa ma yin zhing bud med kyi gzugs kyang nu ma dang skye gnas dang bral ba ma yin te des na re zhig pa
translated: that should be analyzed. Here, the reflection of a person in a mirror is not similar to having breasts and hair, and the reflection of a woman is not devoid of breasts and genitals. Therefore,

original: 'od ni med do //
analyzed: 'od ni med do //
translated: light does not exist.

original: de bzhin du 'gal ba gzhan yang 'dir gzugs kyi g-yon pa'i lag pa rnams na mtshan ma gang yod pa de dag ni me long gi gzugs brnyan gyi lag pa g-yas pa rnams na gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'gal ba gzhan yang 'dir gzugs kyi g-yon pa'i lag pa rnams na mtshan ma gang yod pa de dag ni me long gi gzugs brnyan gyi lag pa g-yas pa rnams na gnas pa'o //
translated: Likewise, other contradictions are here: whatever signs are on the left hands of the forms, they are on the right hands of the mirror images.

original: de bzhin du g-yon gyi gdong gang yin pa de ni g-yas kyi ste de'i kha dog nyid kyang rang 'od zer mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du g-yon gyi gdong gang yin pa de ni g-yas kyi ste de'i kha dog nyid kyang rang 'od zer mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Likewise, whatever is the left face is the right one, and its color is not changed by its own light rays.

original: des na gzhan yi rigs la 'khyud pas dkyil 'khor gyi sgom pa ste dus kyi 'khor lo'i rigs pa las so //
analyzed: des na gzhan yi rigs la 'khyud pas dkyil 'khor gyi sgom pa ste dus kyi 'khor lo'i rigs pa las so //
translated: Therefore, the meditation on the mandala is by embracing the other clans, from the reasoning of the Kālacakra clan.

original: rgyud gzhan dang gzhan las ni /
analyzed: rgyud gzhan dang gzhan las ni /
translated: In other tantras,

original: dngos po gang dang gang gi ni //
analyzed: dngos po gang dang gang gi ni //
translated: whatever thing

original: mi rnams yid la yang dag sbyor //
analyzed: mi rnams yid la yang dag sbyor //
translated: is applied to the mind of men,

original: des de'i @208a * //
analyzed: des de'i @208a * //
translated: by that

original: rang bzhin nyid 'gyur te //
analyzed: rang bzhin nyid 'gyur te //
translated: its nature is changed,

original: sna tshogs gzugs kyis nor bu bzhin //🔽des na 'khrags 'khrugs byed pa yi //
analyzed: sna tshogs gzugs kyis nor bu bzhin // des na 'khrags 'khrugs byed pa yi //
translated: like a gem by various forms.🔽Therefore, the words of the one who is agitated

original: tshig ni rnam par dpyad mi bzod ces so //
analyzed: tshig ni rnam par dpyad mi bzod ces so //
translated: are not to be analyzed.

original: don dam par ni stong pa nyid kyi gzugs sgom pa la gzugs dang sku'i rtog pa med de des na rang 'od dang rang 'od ma yin pa zhes pa med do //
analyzed: don dam par ni stong pa nyid kyi gzugs sgom pa la gzugs dang sku'i rtog pa med de des na rang 'od dang rang 'od ma yin pa zhes pa med do //
translated: In the ultimate sense, in the meditation on the form of emptiness, there is no concept of form or body, and therefore there is no such thing as “self-illumination” or “non-self-illumination.”

original: rnam pa thams cad pa dang kha dog thams cad pa'i phyir shes pa dang shes bya rdul phra rab kyi rdzas dang rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba dag la rang bzhin med do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad pa dang kha dog thams cad pa'i phyir shes pa dang shes bya rdul phra rab kyi rdzas dang rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba dag la rang bzhin med do //
translated: Because of being all-aspect and all-color, consciousness and the object of consciousness, free from the substance and concept of atoms, are without intrinsic nature.

original: de'i phyir rang bzhin med pa'i srid pa sgom pa ni bum pa dang snam bu dang shing rta dang dpung la sogs pa rnams kyi bya ba nyi tshe pa ma yin pa 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad mtha' dag dang bral ba'o zhes pa dbu ma pa yi grub
analyzed: de'i phyir rang bzhin med pa'i srid pa sgom pa ni bum pa dang snam bu dang shing rta dang dpung la sogs pa rnams kyi bya ba nyi tshe pa ma yin pa 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad mtha' dag dang bral ba'o zhes pa dbu ma pa yi grub
translated: Therefore, the meditation on existence without intrinsic nature is not the mere function of pots, cloth, chariots, armies, and so on, but is free from all worldly conventions. This is the established conclusion of the Mādhyamikas.

original: pa'i mtha' ste sngags kyi tshul la de kho na nyid kyi skabs su rigs pa las so //
analyzed: pa'i mtha' ste sngags kyi tshul la de kho na nyid kyi skabs su rigs pa las so //
translated: In the context of reality in the way of mantra, this is from reasoning.

original: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad pa nas brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa drug cu rtsa gsum pa'i bar tshigs su bcad pa bcu drug ni go sla'o //🔽da ni lus la rnam pa bcu'i dag pa gsungs pa spu zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir ba spu dang skra ni nam mkha'i khams dang pags pa dang sha ni rlung gi khams dang khrag rnam pa gnyis ni me'i khams dang rdul dang gci ba ni chu'i
analyzed: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad pa nas brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa drug cu rtsa gsum pa'i bar tshigs su bcad pa bcu drug ni go sla'o // da ni lus la rnam pa bcu'i dag pa gsungs pa spu zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir ba spu dang skra ni nam mkha'i khams dang pags pa dang sha ni rlung gi khams dang khrag rnam pa gnyis ni me'i khams dang rdul dang gci ba ni chu'i
translated: Here, the sixteen verses beginning with the forty-eighth up to the sixty-third are easy to understand.

original: khams dang rus pa dang rkang ni sa'i khams dang rtsa dang srog la sogs pa ni ye shes kyi khams so //
analyzed: khams dang rus pa dang rkang ni sa'i khams dang rtsa dang srog la sogs pa ni ye shes kyi khams so //
translated: Now, the purity of the body in ten aspects is stated: hair and so on. Here, the hair and the nails are the space element, the skin and the flesh are the wind element, the two kinds of blood are the fire element, the feces and the urine are the water element, the bones and the marrow are the earth element, and the channels, the life-force, and so on are the wisdom element.

original: sgra gcan gyi mjug ma ni ye shes rdo rje dang nyi ma ni gsung rdo rje dang zla ba ni sku rdo rje ste bzhi po 'di rnams kyi dbus su kun nas srog rgyud pa'o //
analyzed: sgra gcan gyi mjug ma ni ye shes rdo rje dang nyi ma ni gsung rdo rje dang zla ba ni sku rdo rje ste bzhi po 'di rnams kyi dbus su kun nas srog rgyud pa'o //
translated: Rahu's tail is the wisdom vajra, the sun is the speech vajra, and the moon is the body vajra. The life-force circulates completely in the middle of these four.

original: zla ba'i dbus su ste khu ba'i dbus su dri med nor bu bzhin du zhes pa nye bar gzhag pa dang 'brel pa'i shel bzhin du dngos po kun gyis 'khyud pa'i rnam par shes pa ste de ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag gnyis su med
analyzed: zla ba'i dbus su ste khu ba'i dbus su dri med nor bu bzhin du zhes pa nye bar gzhag pa dang 'brel pa'i shel bzhin du dngos po kun gyis 'khyud pa'i rnam par shes pa ste de ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag gnyis su med
translated: In the middle of the moon, that is, in the middle of semen, the consciousness, like a stainless jewel, that is, like a crystal, embraced by all things, is the state of the nectar of unchanging supreme bliss, the pervasion that cannot be destroyed, which is the nonduality of things and nonthings, like a myrobalan fruit, the mere form of emptiness.

original: pa nyid skyu ma lta bu stong pa nyid kyi gzugs tsam 'gyur pa med pa'i bde ba mchog gi bdud rtsi'i go 'phang khyab byed gzhom du med pa'o zhes pa nges pa ste lus la rnam pa bcu dag pa'o //
analyzed: pa nyid skyu ma lta bu stong pa nyid kyi gzugs tsam 'gyur pa med pa'i bde ba mchog gi bdud rtsi'i go 'phang khyab byed gzhom du med pa'o zhes pa nges pa ste lus la rnam pa bcu dag pa'o //
translated: This is the ascertainment, the purity of the ten aspects in the body.

original: da ni sa bcu rnams kyis khams de rnams dag pa gsungs pa spu la sogs pa zhes pa ste 'dir ba spu dang skra ni rab tu dga' ba'o //
analyzed: da ni sa bcu rnams kyis khams de rnams dag pa gsungs pa spu la sogs pa zhes pa ste 'dir ba spu dang skra ni rab tu dga' ba'o //
translated: Now, the purities of those elements by means of the ten stages are stated: The hairs and so on are the Joyful.
