original: pags pa dang sha ni dri ma med pa dang khrag rnam @208b pa gnyis ni 'od byed pa dang ro dang chu ni 'od 'phro ba dang rus pa dang rkang ni spyad dka' ba dang rtsa ba dang srog ni mngon du gyur pa dang dus kyi me dang
analyzed: pags pa dang sha ni dri ma med pa dang khrag rnam @208b pa gnyis ni 'od byed pa dang ro dang chu ni 'od 'phro ba dang rus pa dang rkang ni spyad dka' ba dang rtsa ba dang srog ni mngon du gyur pa dang dus kyi me dang
translated: Skin and flesh are the stainless, and the two kinds of blood are the shining. Taste and water are the radiant, and bone and marrow are the difficult to conquer. The root and life force are the manifest, and the fire of time is the gone afar.

original: chags pa'i khams ni ring du song ba dang sgra gcan ni mi g-yo ba dang nyi ma ni legs pa'i blo gros dang zla ba ni chos kyi sprin te chags pa dang mun pa dang rdul dang snying stobs kyi chos kyis kun rdzob la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: chags pa'i khams ni ring du song ba dang sgra gcan ni mi g-yo ba dang nyi ma ni legs pa'i blo gros dang zla ba ni chos kyi sprin te chags pa dang mun pa dang rdul dang snying stobs kyi chos kyis kun rdzob la 'jug pa'o //
translated: The element of passion is the immovable, and Rahu is the excellent wisdom. The sun is the cloud of Dharma, and the moon is the cloud of Dharma. The qualities of passion, darkness, and purity enter into the conventional.

original: de ltar spu la sogs pa zla ba'i mtha' ni mtha' dag lus la gnas pa de rnams kyi sgrib pa med pa las sa bcu po de rnams so //
analyzed: de ltar spu la sogs pa zla ba'i mtha' ni mtha' dag lus la gnas pa de rnams kyi sgrib pa med pa las sa bcu po de rnams so //
translated: Thus, the ten stages are from the stainless up to the cloud of Dharma, which are the ten stages of the body, from hair to the end of the moon.

original: gang zhig sa bcur gsungs pa de rnams kyang sde pa drug dang la sogs gzhan dbyangs dang ldan pa rnams su gsungs so //
analyzed: gang zhig sa bcur gsungs pa de rnams kyang sde pa drug dang la sogs gzhan dbyangs dang ldan pa rnams su gsungs so //
translated: Those ten stages that are taught are also taught in the six schools and others beginning with the Gandharvas.

original: de la ka'i sde pa ni rab tu dga' pa ste de bzhin du grangs ji lta bar tsa ta pa ta sa zhes pa de pa drug po rnams dang / la wa ra ya ha aal ao yar ae aa /
analyzed: de la ka'i sde pa ni rab tu dga' pa ste de bzhin du grangs ji lta bar tsa ta pa ta sa zhes pa de pa drug po rnams dang / la wa ra ya ha aal ao yar ae aa /
translated: La, Va, Ra, Ya, Ha, and A are the six classes of the long vowels.

original: li au ri ai aa /
analyzed: li au ri ai aa /
translated: Li, Ui, Ri, Ai, and O are the five classes of the short vowels.

original: ha: aam zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ha: aam zhes pa'o //
translated: Ha and A are the two classes of the diphthongs.

original: de bzhin du lugs las bzlog pas kyang ring po la sogs pa'i sde pa rnams shes rab kyis rnams so //
analyzed: de bzhin du lugs las bzlog pas kyang ring po la sogs pa'i sde pa rnams shes rab kyis rnams so //
translated: In the same way, by the reverse order, the classes of the long vowels, etc., are known by wisdom.

original: 'di dag dus kun rnal 'byor rnams la bde mnyam 'bras bu ster //
analyzed: 'di dag dus kun rnal 'byor rnams la bde mnyam 'bras bu ster //
translated: These always bestow the fruit of the bliss of equality on the yogis.

original: de phyir bla ma'i zhabs la gnas pa zhes pa aa ba dh'u t'i'i zhabs la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis ni thar pa'i slad du btsal bar bya zhes pa bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: de phyir bla ma'i zhabs la gnas pa zhes pa aa ba dh'u t'i'i zhabs la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis ni thar pa'i slad du btsal bar bya zhes pa bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the yogis who abide at the feet of the guru, that is, at the feet of the avadhûti, should seek it for the sake of liberation. This is the rule of the Bhagavat.

original: lus las ma gtogs gang zhig khyab byed thar pa ster ba'i sangs rgyas gzhan ni 'ga' yang yod pa min te 'dir lus kyi khams sgrib pa med pa rnams sangs rgyas nyid ster bar byed pa dang thar pa ster pa'o //
analyzed: lus las ma gtogs gang zhig khyab byed thar pa ster ba'i sangs rgyas gzhan ni 'ga' yang yod pa min te 'dir lus kyi khams sgrib pa med pa rnams sangs rgyas nyid ster bar byed pa dang thar pa ster pa'o //
translated: There is no other Buddha who bestows liberation, except for the body. Here, the unobstructed elements of the body bestow Buddhahood and bestow liberation.

original: tshigs su bcad pa drug cu rtsa lnga pa 'di nas bdun cu rtsa bzhi pa'i mthar thug pa gzhan tshigs su bcad pa dgu ni go sla'o //

original: de yi rtse mo ni 'od zer yin zhing rtse mo des spyi bo ste dpral bar zla ba zhu bar byed ces pa ni byang chub kyi sems skye ba'i gnas so //
analyzed: de yi rtse mo ni 'od zer yin zhing rtse mo des spyi bo ste dpral bar zla ba zhu bar byed ces pa ni byang chub kyi sems skye ba'i gnas so //
translated: Its peak is the light ray, and that peak melts the moon at the forehead, that is, at the brow, which is the place where the thought of awakening arises.

original: @209a * // byang chub sems kyi thig le gang gang dpral ba 'di nas mgrin pa dang snying ga dang lte ba dang gsang ba rnams la son pa ni srog rtsol gyi stobs kyis 'gog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: @209a * // byang chub sems kyi thig le gang gang dpral ba 'di nas mgrin pa dang snying ga dang lte ba dang gsang ba rnams la son pa ni srog rtsol gyi stobs kyis 'gog par 'gyur te /
translated: The drop of the thought of awakening, wherever it may be, from this brow to the throat, heart, navel, and genitals, is stopped by the power of breath control.

original: gsang bar sku'i thig le 'gog cing de bzhin du gsung dang thugs dang ye shes kyi thig le ni lte ba dang snying ga dang mgrin pa la 'gog go //
analyzed: gsang bar sku'i thig le 'gog cing de bzhin du gsung dang thugs dang ye shes kyi thig le ni lte ba dang snying ga dang mgrin pa la 'gog go //
translated: The drop of the body is stopped at the genitals, and similarly the drops of speech, mind, and gnosis are stopped at the navel, heart, and throat.

original: thig le 'di las g-yo ba'i khu ba gang zhes pa ni 'dir gsang ba la gnas pa sku'i thig le bska ba'i rang bzhin las gzhan sla ba'i khu ba gang yin pa de ni g-yo ba'i khu bar gsungs shing de ni rdo rje nor bu la gnas rgyal
analyzed: thig le 'di las g-yo ba'i khu ba gang zhes pa ni 'dir gsang ba la gnas pa sku'i thig le bska ba'i rang bzhin las gzhan sla ba'i khu ba gang yin pa de ni g-yo ba'i khu bar gsungs shing de ni rdo rje nor bu la gnas rgyal
translated: The fluid that moves from this drop is the fluid that is other than the drop of the body, which is located here at the genitals and is of the nature of astringent. That is said to be the moving fluid, and it is located at the vajra jewel.

original: mtshan rtse la ste rtags kyi sgo la yang dag par 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan rtse la ste rtags kyi sgo la yang dag par 'gog pa'o //
translated: It is stopped, that is, blocked, at the tip of the organ, the door of the sign.

original: g-yo ba de ni shes rab ye shes skad cig gal te thig le'i phreng ba 'pho ba med pa'i rgyus bde ba ster na'o //
analyzed: g-yo ba de ni shes rab ye shes skad cig gal te thig le'i phreng ba 'pho ba med pa'i rgyus bde ba ster na'o //
translated: That movement is the instant of the wisdom intuition, if it gives pleasure by the cause of the non-emission of the rosary of drops.

original: de'i tshe las kyi phyag rgya'i ye shes ma yin te shes rab ye shes so zhes grub bo //
analyzed: de'i tshe las kyi phyag rgya'i ye shes ma yin te shes rab ye shes so zhes grub bo //
translated: At that time, it is not the intuition of the action seal, but the intuition of the wisdom seal.

original: mi 'pho ba'i rgyu de'i phyir g-yo med bde ba'i skad cig gang yin pa 'dir ni chos kyi dbyings te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin mas ster bar byed do //
analyzed: mi 'pho ba'i rgyu de'i phyir g-yo med bde ba'i skad cig gang yin pa 'dir ni chos kyi dbyings te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin mas ster bar byed do //
translated: The cause of non-emission is the instant of unmoving bliss, which is given by the perfection of wisdom, the realm of phenomena.

original: des na phyag rgya chen po'i bde ba ni mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: des na phyag rgya chen po'i bde ba ni mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the bliss of the great seal is the supreme, unchanging bliss.

original: las dang ye shes kyi phyag rgya'i bde ba ni bde ba 'dzag pa dang g-yo ba'i thabs te byis pa dang lang tsho'o //
analyzed: las dang ye shes kyi phyag rgya'i bde ba ni bde ba 'dzag pa dang g-yo ba'i thabs te byis pa dang lang tsho'o //
translated: The bliss of the action seal and the wisdom seal is the method of emission and movement of bliss, which are the childish and the youthful.

original: ji ltar dngul chu byis pa dang lang tsho dang rgan po dang bcings pa de bzhin du khu ba yang byis pa dang lang tsho dang rgan po dang 'gog pa ste sgrib pa thams cad zad pa las so //
analyzed: ji ltar dngul chu byis pa dang lang tsho dang rgan po dang bcings pa de bzhin du khu ba yang byis pa dang lang tsho dang rgan po dang 'gog pa ste sgrib pa thams cad zad pa las so //
translated: Just as mercury is a child, a youth, and an old man, so is the semen a child, a youth, and an old man, from the exhaustion of all obscurations, that is, from the cessation, the bondage.

original: sgrib pa ni dri ma'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa ni dri ma'o //
translated: An obscuration is a stain.

original: byang chub kyi sems de nyid gang gi tshe dpral bar steng du 'gro ba de'i tshe sems de ji ltar byon pa de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems de nyid gang gi tshe dpral bar steng du 'gro ba de'i tshe sems de ji ltar byon pa de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur ro //
translated: When that very bodhicitta moves upward to the forehead, then that mind becomes a Tathāgata, just as it came.

original: ro yi 'gro ba rnams la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: ro yi 'gro ba rnams la gnas pa ste /
translated: It abides in the migrations of the taste,

original: sa la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor drug po rnams la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor drug po rnams la gnas pa'o //
translated: that is, in the six maṇḍalas of earth and so forth.

original: srog rnams thams cad bkug cing zhes pa ni nyi khri chig stong drug brgya po'o //
analyzed: srog rnams thams cad bkug cing zhes pa ni nyi khri chig stong drug brgya po'o //
translated: Having drawn in all the life-breaths, that is, the twenty-one thousand six hundred.

original: de ltar nyon mongs bdud rnams bcom byas nas rdzu 'phrul dang kun mkhyen gyi sa bcu gnyis 'chang bar 'gyur pa rnams dang srid gsum bla ma nyid ces pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang lam mkhyen pa nyid dang lam
analyzed: de ltar nyon mongs bdud rnams bcom byas nas rdzu 'phrul dang kun mkhyen gyi sa bcu gnyis 'chang bar 'gyur pa rnams dang srid gsum bla ma nyid ces pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang lam mkhyen pa nyid dang lam
translated: Thus, having conquered the afflictions and the demons, the yogis who will hold the twelve levels of magical powers and omniscience and the state of being the guru of the three worlds, that is, omniscience, knowledge of all aspects, knowledge of the path, knowledge of the aspects of the path, and so on,

original: gyi rnam pa mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa'i 'phyogs pa ni rnal 'byor pa ni brtson 'grus dang ldan pa rnams kyi skye ba 'di la ster bar byed do //
analyzed: gyi rnam pa mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa'i 'phyogs pa ni rnal 'byor pa ni brtson 'grus dang ldan pa rnams kyi skye ba 'di la ster bar byed do //
translated: are granted by the yogic practitioner endowed with diligence in this life.🔽But if, when they have set out on the path, they die without attaining yoga, then by the power of their latent propensities, they will again obtain everything in another human birth and will

original: ci ste gang gi tshe @209b lam du rab tu zhugs par gyur pa rnal 'byor ma thob par shi bar gyur na de'i tshe de yi 'dzin pa ste bag chags kyi stobs kyis slar yang mi'i skye ba gzhan la thams cad thob par 'gyur te brtson 'grus dang
analyzed: ci ste gang gi tshe @209b lam du rab tu zhugs par gyur pa rnal 'byor ma thob par shi bar gyur na de'i tshe de yi 'dzin pa ste bag chags kyi stobs kyis slar yang mi'i skye ba gzhan la thams cad thob par 'gyur te brtson 'grus dang
translated: attain the state of a yogi.

original: mi ldan par gyur cing ye shes ma bsgoms kyang skye ba bdun gyi mthar thug pas so zhes pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: mi ldan par gyur cing ye shes ma bsgoms kyang skye ba bdun gyi mthar thug pas so zhes pa nges pa'o //
translated: Even though one does not cultivate wisdom, one is born in the end of seven existences.

original: da ni byang chub sems dpa'i byin gyis brlabs pa skye ba gsungs pa gang zhig yon tan med ces pa la sogs pa ste 'dir gzhon nu ma gang yig yon tan med pa na mi 'dzag pa'i phyir chos kyi khams kyi yon tan dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: da ni byang chub sems dpa'i byin gyis brlabs pa skye ba gsungs pa gang zhig yon tan med ces pa la sogs pa ste 'dir gzhon nu ma gang yig yon tan med pa na mi 'dzag pa'i phyir chos kyi khams kyi yon tan dang bral ba'o //
translated: Now, the birth of the consecration of the Bodhisattva is stated: “One who is without good qualities, etc.” Here, a girl who is without good qualities is devoid of the good qualities of the element of phenomena because she does not drip.

original: de ni dngos po chung ba lus kyi khams ma rdzogs shing so ma brjes pa ste lo brgyad kyi bar du gcig go //
analyzed: de ni dngos po chung ba lus kyi khams ma rdzogs shing so ma brjes pa ste lo brgyad kyi bar du gcig go //
translated: She is of little substance, with an incomplete body element, and has not yet had her teeth replaced, and is one year up to eight years old.

original: de nas gnyis pa ni so brjes nas lo bcu'i bar ro //
analyzed: de nas gnyis pa ni so brjes nas lo bcu'i bar ro //
translated: Then, the second is from the time of having had her teeth replaced up to ten years old.

original: de ltar sku'i phyag rgya ni skye gnas ma nyams pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar sku'i phyag rgya ni skye gnas ma nyams pa'o //
translated: Thus, the seal of the body is the undamaged birthplace.

original: de'i mtshams nas lo bcu gcig nas brtsams nas lo bcva lnga'i bar du gcig ste chags pa rjes chags so //
analyzed: de'i mtshams nas lo bcu gcig nas brtsams nas lo bcva lnga'i bar du gcig ste chags pa rjes chags so //
translated: From that time, beginning with eleven years old up to fifteen years old is one, and is the subsequent passion of passion.

original: yon tan gter gzhan ni lo lnga'i bar du ste gsung gi phyag rgya rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yon tan gter gzhan ni lo lnga'i bar du ste gsung gi phyag rgya rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur ro //
translated: The other treasure of qualities is for five years, and so there are two types of seal of speech.

original: de ltar lo brgyad dang lo gnyis dang de bzhin du lo lnga dang lnga'o //
analyzed: de ltar lo brgyad dang lo gnyis dang de bzhin du lo lnga dang lnga'o //
translated: Thus, there are eight years, two years, and likewise five years each.

original: de nas lo nyi shu'i rjes la gzhan pa mkha' dus zhes pa lo bzhi bcu ni de bzhin du thugs kyi phyag rgya gcig ste nag po'i dngos po la rjes su chags pa'o //
analyzed: de nas lo nyi shu'i rjes la gzhan pa mkha' dus zhes pa lo bzhi bcu ni de bzhin du thugs kyi phyag rgya gcig ste nag po'i dngos po la rjes su chags pa'o //
translated: Then, after twenty years, the other one called “space time” is forty years, and likewise there is one seal of mind, which is attachment to the entity of darkness.

original: de ltar lo drug cu ma'i bud med do //
analyzed: de ltar lo drug cu ma'i bud med do //
translated: Thus, there are sixty years of a woman.

original: slar yang gzhan ma stong pa rig byed ces pa lo bzhi bcu'i bar du dkar po'i dngos po la rjes su chags pa ste rgan mo rgas pa skra dkar dang ldan pa lo brgya'i mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: slar yang gzhan ma stong pa rig byed ces pa lo bzhi bcu'i bar du dkar po'i dngos po la rjes su chags pa ste rgan mo rgas pa skra dkar dang ldan pa lo brgya'i mthar thug pa'o //
translated: Again, the other one called “empty vidyā” is forty years of attachment to the entity of light, an old woman who is old and has white hair, ending at one hundred years.

original: de ltar thugs kyi phyag rgya yang rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: de ltar thugs kyi phyag rgya yang rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: Thus, there are two types of seal of mind.

original: gsum po 'di rnams kyi nang nas sku'i phyag rgya ni shin tu bu mo'o //
analyzed: gsum po 'di rnams kyi nang nas sku'i phyag rgya ni shin tu bu mo'o //
translated: Among these three, the seal of body is a very young girl.

original: thugs kyi phyag rgya ni shin tu lang tsho dang rgan mo ste gsum po 'di rnams spangs nas lo bcu gcig ma mtshan nyid thams cad yang dag par rdzogs pa rnams ni rgyal po'i bla ma'am rgyal po dbang bskur ba'am dbang phyug dbang bskur ba gzhan rnams kyis🔽bsrungs bar bya'o ;
analyzed: thugs kyi phyag rgya ni shin tu lang tsho dang rgan mo ste gsum po 'di rnams spangs nas lo bcu gcig ma mtshan nyid thams cad yang dag par rdzogs pa rnams ni rgyal po'i bla ma'am rgyal po dbang bskur ba'am dbang phyug dbang bskur ba gzhan rnams kyis bsrungs bar bya'o ;
translated: Having abandoned these three, the eleven-year-old girl who is completely endowed with all characteristics should be protected by the king’s guru, the king, or another powerful lord.

original: / rin chen dbang po mi 'byung bar du ste mi 'byung zhes pa rdul mi 'byung gi bar du bsrung bar bya'o //
analyzed: / rin chen dbang po mi 'byung bar du ste mi 'byung zhes pa rdul mi 'byung gi bar du bsrung bar bya'o //
translated: Until the jewel lord arises, that is, until the jewel lord does not arise, that is, until the dust does not arise, she should be protected.

original: rin chen dbang po rab tu 'byung ba'i dus su mtha' dag yon tan gter gyi dkyil 'khor dus kyi 'khor lo bzhengs nas dang por legs par bslab par byas shing der de la dbang bskur @210a * //
analyzed: rin chen dbang po rab tu 'byung ba'i dus su mtha' dag yon tan gter gyi dkyil 'khor dus kyi 'khor lo bzhengs nas dang por legs par bslab par byas shing der de la dbang bskur @210a * //
translated: When the jewel lord arises, having arisen as the mandala of the treasure of all good qualities, the wheel of time, first train well and confer empowerment on her there.

original: nas sangs rgyas byin brlabs sngas rnams kyis zhes pa rdo rje drug po rnams dang 'jam dpal gyi ting nge 'dzin gyis shes rab kyis shes rab de yang rdzogs par byas te g-yas kyi rtsa la rab tu 'bab pa'i dus su de'i gsang ba'i padmar bde mnyam byang🔽chub kyi sems sngags dang bcas pa zhes pa sku dang gsung dang thugs dang ye shes kyi sngags dang bcas pa spro bar bya'o //
analyzed: nas sangs rgyas byin brlabs sngas rnams kyis zhes pa rdo rje drug po rnams dang 'jam dpal gyi ting nge 'dzin gyis shes rab kyis shes rab de yang rdzogs par byas te g-yas kyi rtsa la rab tu 'bab pa'i dus su de'i gsang ba'i padmar bde mnyam byang chub kyi sems sngags dang bcas pa zhes pa sku dang gsung dang thugs dang ye shes kyi sngags dang bcas pa spro bar bya'o //
translated: Having perfected that wisdom, when it descends into the right channel, one should emit the bodhicitta, which is the secret lotus of that, together with the mantra of equal bliss and enlightenment.

original: de nas gsang ba de la yan lag drug gis bsrung ba rab tu bya ste de nas rang gi rdo rje nor bu la gnas byang chub sems ni myang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas gsang ba de la yan lag drug gis bsrung ba rab tu bya ste de nas rang gi rdo rje nor bu la gnas byang chub sems ni myang bar bya'o //
translated: Then, one should protect that secret with the six-branched yoga. Then, one should taste the bodhicitta that abides in one's vajra jewel.

original: de nas rnal 'byor pas de la yang sbyin no //
analyzed: de nas rnal 'byor pas de la yang sbyin no //
translated: Then, the yogi/ni should also give that to the consort.

original: de'i padma'i phyir rol gyi gang yin pa de ni ming med dang mthe bo dag gis blangs nas myang bar bya ste thams cad bsrung ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: de'i padma'i phyir rol gyi gang yin pa de ni ming med dang mthe bo dag gis blangs nas myang bar bya ste thams cad bsrung ba'i don du'o //
translated: What is outside of her lotus, having taken it with the ring finger and thumb, one should taste it for the sake of protecting everything.

original: cho ga 'dis mngal bzung ba de la gang zhig bu ru gyur pa de ni 'jam dpal nyid do //
analyzed: cho ga 'dis mngal bzung ba de la gang zhig bu ru gyur pa de ni 'jam dpal nyid do //
translated: The one who becomes a son to the one who has conceived through this rite is Mañjuśrī himself.

original: shes rab lhag pa las zhes pa ni rdul lhag pa las gal te bu mor gyur na de'i tshe sna tshogs yum gyis byin gyis brlabs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes rab lhag pa las zhes pa ni rdul lhag pa las gal te bu mor gyur na de'i tshe sna tshogs yum gyis byin gyis brlabs par 'gyur ro //
translated: “From the excess of wisdom” means that if a girl is born from the excess of semen, then she will be blessed by the mother of the universe.

original: des na nges par sangs rgyas yum du 'gyur zhes pa ste 'jam dpal dang sna tshogs yum gyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: des na nges par sangs rgyas yum du 'gyur zhes pa ste 'jam dpal dang sna tshogs yum gyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i cho ga'o //
translated: Therefore, she will certainly become the mother of the buddhas. This is the rite of being blessed by Mañjuśrī and the mother of the universe.

original: de nas gzhan ma me tog gsum gyis zhes pa ni 'dir gal te rdul dang po la mngal ma skyes na de'i tshe yang dang yang du rdul mthong ba so so la dkyil 'khor bzhengs nas ting nge 'dzin gzhan rnams kyis byang chub kyi sems spro bar bya'o
analyzed: de nas gzhan ma me tog gsum gyis zhes pa ni 'dir gal te rdul dang po la mngal ma skyes na de'i tshe yang dang yang du rdul mthong ba so so la dkyil 'khor bzhengs nas ting nge 'dzin gzhan rnams kyis byang chub kyi sems spro bar bya'o
translated: “Then, with the other three flowers” means that if the first drop of semen is not conceived in the womb, then one should repeatedly visualize the drop, create the maṇḍala, and emit the bodhicitta through the other samādhis.

original: // de ltar gnyis pa la padma dkar 'dzin pa 'jig rten dbang phyug gi sprul par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: // de ltar gnyis pa la padma dkar 'dzin pa 'jig rten dbang phyug gi sprul par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that way, the second drop will become the emanation of Avalokiteśvara, the holder of the white lotus.

original: gsum pa la dza mbha la'i sprul pa dang bzhi pa la phyag na rdo rje ste bu'i yul la'o //
analyzed: gsum pa la dza mbha la'i sprul pa dang bzhi pa la phyag na rdo rje ste bu'i yul la'o //
translated: On the third, Jambhala's emanation; on the fourth, Vajrapāṇi.

original: bu mo'i yul la gos dkar mo dang nor rgyun ma dang sgra rdo rje mas byin gyis brlabs par 'gyur ro //🔽de nas me tog brgyad kyis gzhan phyogs dang phyogs bral du gnas rdzu 'phrul che ldan khro bo'i rgyal po rnams zhes pa ni 'dir sngar dzambha las byin gyis brlabs pa las gtsug tor gyi ting nge 'dzin gyis gtsug tor ram shin tu sngon mos byin gyis brlabs
analyzed: bu mo'i yul la gos dkar mo dang nor rgyun ma dang sgra rdo rje mas byin gyis brlabs par 'gyur ro // de nas me tog brgyad kyis gzhan phyogs dang phyogs bral du gnas rdzu 'phrul che ldan khro bo'i rgyal po rnams zhes pa ni 'dir sngar dzambha las byin gyis brlabs pa las gtsug tor gyi ting nge 'dzin gyis gtsug tor ram shin tu sngon mos byin gyis brlabs
translated: On the country of the daughters, Pāṇḍaravāsinī, Vasudhārā, and Śabdavajrā will bless.🔽Then, in the other directions and intermediate directions, with eight flowers, the great powerful kings of wrathful ones.

original: par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: par 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, through the concentration of the uṣṇīṣa, blessed by Jambhala, the uṣṇīṣa or very prior one will be blessed.

original: phyag na rdo rje'i gnas su gnod mdzes rgyal po 'am drag spyan mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje'i gnas su gnod mdzes rgyal po 'am drag spyan mar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the place of Vajrapāṇi, Ucchuṣma will be the king or fierce-eyed.

original: de nas rdul lnga pa la bgegs mthar byed dang brtson 'grus mtha' yas ma'o //
analyzed: de nas rdul lnga pa la bgegs mthar byed dang brtson 'grus mtha' yas ma'o //
translated: Then, on the fifth dust, Vighuṣṭa and Anantamati.

original: drug pa la shes rab mthar byed dang rmugs byed ma'o //
analyzed: drug pa la shes rab mthar byed dang rmugs byed ma'o //
translated: On the sixth, Prajñā and Mohinī.

original: bdun pa la padma mthar byed dang nga rgyal ma'o //
analyzed: bdun pa la padma mthar byed dang nga rgyal ma'o //
translated: On the seventh, Padmanarteśvara and Māna.

original: brgyad pa la gshin rje mthar phyed dang rengs byed @210b ma'o //
analyzed: brgyad pa la gshin rje mthar phyed dang rengs byed @210b ma'o //
translated: On the eighth, Yamāntaka and Stambhini.

original: de nas dgu pa la stobs po che dang 'od zer spyan ma'o //
analyzed: de nas dgu pa la stobs po che dang 'od zer spyan ma'o //
translated: Then, on the ninth, Mahābala and Māmakī.

original: bcu pa la mi g-yo ba dang tsun d'a'o //🔽bcu gcig pa la 'dod pa dang khro gnyer can no //
analyzed: bcu pa la mi g-yo ba dang tsun d'a'o // bcu gcig pa la 'dod pa dang khro gnyer can no //
translated: On the tenth, Acala and Cundā.🔽On the eleventh, Trailokyavijaya and Ghasmarī.

original: bcu gnyis pa la dbyug pa sngon po dang rdo rje lcags sgrog ma'o zhes pa ste phyogs bral rnams su'o //
analyzed: bcu gnyis pa la dbyug pa sngon po dang rdo rje lcags sgrog ma'o zhes pa ste phyogs bral rnams su'o //
translated: On the twelfth, Nīladaṇḍa and Vajrāṅkuśī.

original: de ltar khro bo'i ting nge 'dzin gyis mngal ni khro bos byin gyis brlabs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar khro bo'i ting nge 'dzin gyis mngal ni khro bos byin gyis brlabs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the womb is blessed by the wrathful ones through the concentration of wrath.

original: de nas zla mtshan bcu gsum pa ni slar yang dang po ste ma rig pa la sogs pa'i yan lag ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: de nas zla mtshan bcu gsum pa ni slar yang dang po ste ma rig pa la sogs pa'i yan lag ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: Then, the thirteenth menstrual period is the first, like the members beginning with ignorance.

original: des na zla ba de la rdul gang rab tu byung ba'i rdul de ni slar yang 'jam dbyangs rab tu skyed pa ste /
analyzed: des na zla ba de la rdul gang rab tu byung ba'i rdul de ni slar yang 'jam dbyangs rab tu skyed pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the drop that arises in that month is again the drop that generates Mañjuśrī.

original: de bzhin du de'i rjes la rnal 'byor pa ting nge 'dzin gyi dmigs pa byas nas byang chub kyi sems rnam par spro bar bya ste mngal ni des byin gyis brlabs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du de'i rjes la rnal 'byor pa ting nge 'dzin gyi dmigs pa byas nas byang chub kyi sems rnam par spro bar bya ste mngal ni des byin gyis brlabs par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, after that, the yogi, having made the object of concentration, should radiate the thought of enlightenment, and the womb will be blessed by that.

original: yum gyi lo nyi shu dag gi bar du so so'i rdul la gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' gcig gam gnyis la sogs par 'gyur pa ni snying stobs chen po can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yum gyi lo nyi shu dag gi bar du so so'i rdul la gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' gcig gam gnyis la sogs par 'gyur pa ni snying stobs chen po can du 'gyur ro //
translated: Up to the age of twenty of the mother, the particles of each one, when the Bodhisattva becomes one or two, etc., he becomes of great courage.

original: yum gyi lo bzhi bcu'i bar du cung zad snying stobs cha shad sman par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yum gyi lo bzhi bcu'i bar du cung zad snying stobs cha shad sman par 'gyur ro //
translated: Up to the age of forty of the mother, the particles of each one, the part of courage is a little diminished.

original: slar yang lo ni shu'i bar du de bas yang ni snying stobs chung zhing brtson 'grus chung ba'o //
analyzed: slar yang lo ni shu'i bar du de bas yang ni snying stobs chung zhing brtson 'grus chung ba'o //
translated: Again, up to the age of sixty, even more, courage is diminished, and effort is diminished.

original: de ltar yum gyi lo brgyad cu ste snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa'i dbye bas mngal byin gyis brlab pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar yum gyi lo brgyad cu ste snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa'i dbye bas mngal byin gyis brlab pa'o //
translated: Thus, up to the age of eighty of the mother, the womb is blessed by the division of courage, passion, and darkness.

original: de nas skye gnas la ni rdul med cing mngal gyi yul ni rab bcom ste /
analyzed: de nas skye gnas la ni rdul med cing mngal gyi yul ni rab bcom ste /
translated: Then, in the place of birth, there is no passion, and the place of the womb is destroyed.

original: de nyams pa las shes rab la dbang bskur ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyams pa las shes rab la dbang bskur ma yin no //
translated: It is not the consecration of wisdom from the degeneration of that.

original: thabs la yang sa bon med na ste /
analyzed: thabs la yang sa bon med na ste /
translated: Also, in the case of method, if there is no seed,

original: sa bon zhes pa ni gang rab tu skye ba'o //
analyzed: sa bon zhes pa ni gang rab tu skye ba'o //
translated: the seed is that which arises.

original: 'on kyang sa bon nyams pa'i rgan po la ni /
analyzed: 'on kyang sa bon nyams pa'i rgan po la ni /
translated: However, for an old man whose seed has degenerated,

original: shes rab dbang bskur rgyal ba'i bdag po'i gsung gi sbyin par bya ste /
analyzed: shes rab dbang bskur rgyal ba'i bdag po'i gsung gi sbyin par bya ste /
translated: the consecration of wisdom is the gift of the speech of the lord of victors.

original: dge slong la ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dge slong la ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: It is like the case of a fully ordained monk.

original: de bzhin du shes rab la yang dge slong ma la ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab la yang dge slong ma la ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: Likewise, in the case of wisdom, it is like the case of a fully ordained nun.

original: de ltar lo nyi shu ma rnams dbang gi don dang / byin gyis brlab pa'i don du bzang ngo //
analyzed: de ltar lo nyi shu ma rnams dbang gi don dang / byin gyis brlab pa'i don du bzang ngo //
translated: Thus, those who are twenty years old are good for the purpose of consecration and for the purpose of consecration.

original: lo nyi shu rnams kyis sa'i khams dang / de bzhin nyid du chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / nam mkha'i yon tan rnams lo brgya'i bar du ste /
analyzed: lo nyi shu rnams kyis sa'i khams dang / de bzhin nyid du chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / nam mkha'i yon tan rnams lo brgya'i bar du ste /
translated: The qualities of the earth element and likewise the water, fire, wind, and space elements of those who are twenty years old are for one hundred years.

original: rgyal ba'i yan lag don du brtsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i yan lag don du brtsal bar bya'o //
translated: The limbs of the victors should be sought for the purpose of the meaning.

original: byang chub sems kyi bsnyen pa 'di ni sems can don gyi byed pa mo ste 'bras bu mang por 'gyur zhes pa @211a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems kyi bsnyen pa 'di ni sems can don gyi byed pa mo ste 'bras bu mang por 'gyur zhes pa @211a * //
translated: This service of the Thought of Enlightenment is the female agent of the aim of sentient beings, and it becomes the many fruits.

original: byang chub sems dpa' skyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' skyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it generates the Bodhisattva.

original: da ni bdud rtsi btung ba gsungs pa gang zhig khrag ni zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir phyi rol du drang ba'i don gyis gang zhig khrag 'thung bar byed pa ni sha sbrang ngo //
analyzed: da ni bdud rtsi btung ba gsungs pa gang zhig khrag ni zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir phyi rol du drang ba'i don gyis gang zhig khrag 'thung bar byed pa ni sha sbrang ngo //
translated: Now he declares the drinking of nectar, which is, “He who drinks blood, etc. ” Here, in the sense of an external interpretation, “he who drinks blood” is a gadfly.

original: nges pa'i don gyis ni gang zhig aa ba dh'u t'ir 'pho ba'i dus su rdul gyi khams 'thung ba rab mchog lha mi rnams kyi sha sbrang de ni bdud rtsi gcig pu ste aa ba dh'u t'ir 'gog pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: nges pa'i don gyis ni gang zhig aa ba dh'u t'ir 'pho ba'i dus su rdul gyi khams 'thung ba rab mchog lha mi rnams kyi sha sbrang de ni bdud rtsi gcig pu ste aa ba dh'u t'ir 'gog pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: In the sense of the definitive meaning, “he who drinks the element of blood at the time of the transference into the avadhūtī, the supreme of all gadflies of gods and men, is the sole nectar, the cessation in the avadhūtī. ”

original: phyi rol du skyugs pa za ba gang yin pa de ni nges pa'i don gyis byang chub kyi sems gsang ba la sogs pa'i kha nas rdo rje nor bur song ba ni skyugs pa yin gyi shes rab kyi nang du rab tu zhugs pa ni ma yin no
analyzed: phyi rol du skyugs pa za ba gang yin pa de ni nges pa'i don gyis byang chub kyi sems gsang ba la sogs pa'i kha nas rdo rje nor bur song ba ni skyugs pa yin gyi shes rab kyi nang du rab tu zhugs pa ni ma yin no
translated: That which is vomitted externally is the vomitted bodhicitta of definitive meaning, which goes from the mouth to the vajra jewel, but not that which enters into the wisdom.

original: // de bzhin du 'pho ba med pa'i bshang ba dang gci ba dang khrag dang sha ni mchog tu ro mnyam ste mi zag pa'o //
analyzed: // de bzhin du 'pho ba med pa'i bshang ba dang gci ba dang khrag dang sha ni mchog tu ro mnyam ste mi zag pa'o //
translated: Likewise, the excrement, urine, blood, and flesh, which are without emission, are of supreme taste, and are not impure.

original: skyugs pa nang du rab tu zhugs pa zhes pa 'gags pa ste sgrib pa med par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: skyugs pa nang du rab tu zhugs pa zhes pa 'gags pa ste sgrib pa med par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The vomitted [bodhicitta] that enters within is stopped, and becomes free of obscuration.

original: 'di dag rnams ni ye shes bdud rtsir 'gyur zhing 'pho ba med pa'i bdud rtsi lnga ni srid pa gsum gyi bla ma yis kyang rgyud rnams kun du bstan te phyi rol gyi bshang pa la sogs pa dngos grub kyi slad du bstan pa ni ma yin no
analyzed: 'di dag rnams ni ye shes bdud rtsir 'gyur zhing 'pho ba med pa'i bdud rtsi lnga ni srid pa gsum gyi bla ma yis kyang rgyud rnams kun du bstan te phyi rol gyi bshang pa la sogs pa dngos grub kyi slad du bstan pa ni ma yin no
translated: These are the amṛtas of wisdom. The five amṛtas that are without emission are taught in all the tantras by the gurus of the three existences, but external excrement and so on are not taught for the sake of spiritual powers.

original: zhes pa bdud rtsi'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa bdud rtsi'i nges pa'o //
translated: This is the definition of amṛta.

original: da ni phyi rol du dam tshig bsrung ba dang bza' ba gsungs pa shes rab ces pa la sogs pa ste 'dir snyoms par zhugs pa la sgom par byed pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i byang chub kyi sems ma bsdams pa gal te shes rab kyi chos 'byung du lhung
analyzed: da ni phyi rol du dam tshig bsrung ba dang bza' ba gsungs pa shes rab ces pa la sogs pa ste 'dir snyoms par zhugs pa la sgom par byed pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i byang chub kyi sems ma bsdams pa gal te shes rab kyi chos 'byung du lhung
translated: Here, if the bodhicitta of the yogi who is engaged in meditation falls into the lotus of the wisdom consort,

original: na de'i tshe shes rab chos 'byung la ni gang zhig ltung ba'i bde ba dag kyang rab tu 'bad pas bsrung bar bya'o //
analyzed: na de'i tshe shes rab chos 'byung la ni gang zhig ltung ba'i bde ba dag kyang rab tu 'bad pas bsrung bar bya'o //
translated: then at that time the bliss of falling into the lotus of the wisdom consort should be guarded with effort.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ting nge 'dzin gyis spros pa'i byang chub kyi sems de yis gang su zhig byung ba de ni rgyal ba'i rigs la byang chub sems dpa' nyid de /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyis spros pa'i byang chub kyi sems de yis gang su zhig byung ba de ni rgyal ba'i rigs la byang chub sems dpa' nyid de /
translated: Whoever arises by that bodhicitta that is emanated by samādhi is a bodhisattva of the family of the victors.

original: gang gi phyir bde bar gshegs pa'i rigs rab tu 'phel bar byed pa de'i phyir bde bar gshegs pa pa mnyam par ma bzhag pa rnams kyi byang chub kyi sems bsrung ba dang bral ba de ni nyin zhag so so'i dus su bdud kyi pho nya dang srin
analyzed: gang gi phyir bde bar gshegs pa'i rigs rab tu 'phel bar byed pa de'i phyir bde bar gshegs pa pa mnyam par ma bzhag pa rnams kyi byang chub kyi sems bsrung ba dang bral ba de ni nyin zhag so so'i dus su bdud kyi pho nya dang srin
translated: Because it causes the lineage of the Sugatas to increase, therefore, the Sugata has taught that the bodhicitta of those who are not in equipoise, which is devoid of protection, is, at the time of each day, stolen by the messengers of Māra, the rākṣasas, and the semen-stealers.

original: po khu ba 'phrog par byed pa rnams dang mi rnams kyis kyang rnal 'byor pa'i cha byad kyis za ru 'jug par byed cing shes rab me tog dang ldan zos pa zhi ba bde ba'i 'bras bu ster bar ston @211b du 'jug par byed de byis pa'i skye
analyzed: po khu ba 'phrog par byed pa rnams dang mi rnams kyis kyang rnal 'byor pa'i cha byad kyis za ru 'jug par byed cing shes rab me tog dang ldan zos pa zhi ba bde ba'i 'bras bu ster bar ston @211b du 'jug par byed de byis pa'i skye
translated: Humans also, in the guise of yogis, cause the yogi to eat, and they cause him to show the result of the peace and bliss of eating the flower of wisdom.

original: bo gzhan rnams dmyal bar gtang ba'i slad du'o //
analyzed: bo gzhan rnams dmyal bar gtang ba'i slad du'o //
translated: This is in order to send other foolish people to hell.

original: de'i phyir sangs rgyas pa'i sngags pas rdo rje 'khums par ma gyur gyi bar du chu skyes las ni dbyung bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir sangs rgyas pa'i sngags pas rdo rje 'khums par ma gyur gyi bar du chu skyes las ni dbyung bar mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the Buddhist mantrin should not emerge from the lotus until the vajra is retracted.

original: gang tshe 'dod pa grub pa de'i tshe na 'di ni sangs rgyas byin gyis brlabs par rab tu 'gyur la rdo rje'i lam nas thabs kyi snying khar gzhug par bya zhing padma'i lam nas shes rab kyi snying khar gzhug par bya ste rang rang rdo rje'i snying khar
analyzed: gang tshe 'dod pa grub pa de'i tshe na 'di ni sangs rgyas byin gyis brlabs par rab tu 'gyur la rdo rje'i lam nas thabs kyi snying khar gzhug par bya zhing padma'i lam nas shes rab kyi snying khar gzhug par bya ste rang rang rdo rje'i snying khar
translated: When the desired goal is accomplished, then this is the consecration of the Buddha, and one should insert the vajra into the heart of the method through the vajra path, and one should insert the lotus into the heart of the wisdom through the lotus path.

original: lha yi 'khor lo rab tu bcug pa 'di yi 'od zer rnams kyis gnyi ga'i lus ni gang bar byas nas 'khor lo'i rnam par byed do //
analyzed: lha yi 'khor lo rab tu bcug pa 'di yi 'od zer rnams kyis gnyi ga'i lus ni gang bar byas nas 'khor lo'i rnam par byed do //
translated: The deity wheel is inserted into the heart of each one. The light rays from this fill the bodies of both, and it acts as a wheel.

original: gal te 'di ni grub phar ma gyur na de'i tshe rdo rje nor bu la ni yang dag gnas pa'i byang chub kyi sems ming med dang mthe bo dag gis blangs nas bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te 'di ni grub phar ma gyur na de'i tshe rdo rje nor bu la ni yang dag gnas pa'i byang chub kyi sems ming med dang mthe bo dag gis blangs nas bza' bar bya'o //
translated: If this is not accomplished, then at that time one should take the bodhicitta that is situated in the vajra jewel with the nameless and the thumb, and eat it.

original: de bzhin du shes rab kyi padma'i phyi rol du 'ongs pa de nyid kyang gnyis po dag gis bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab kyi padma'i phyi rol du 'ongs pa de nyid kyang gnyis po dag gis bza' bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, that which comes out of the lotus of the wisdom should also be eaten with both.

original: shes rab kyi ni chos 'byung na gnas pa la mtha' dag rgyal ba'i rigs ni bsrung ba'i don du dgod par bya ste dpral ba la sogs pa rnams su rdo rje drug po rnams dang snying kha la sogs pa rnams su yan lag drug go //
analyzed: shes rab kyi ni chos 'byung na gnas pa la mtha' dag rgyal ba'i rigs ni bsrung ba'i don du dgod par bya ste dpral ba la sogs pa rnams su rdo rje drug po rnams dang snying kha la sogs pa rnams su yan lag drug go //
translated: When the wisdom-born element arises, one should place the six vajras on the forehead and so forth, and the six limbs on the heart and so forth, in order to protect the entire Victor’s family.

original: shes rab ldan pa la'o zhes pa ni rdul dang ldan pa la'o //
analyzed: shes rab ldan pa la'o zhes pa ni rdul dang ldan pa la'o //
translated: “To the one endowed with wisdom” means to the one endowed with the dust.

original: de nas byang chub kyi sems gcig pu bsrungs pa la bsod nams chen por 'gyur te slar yang gsung ni rab tu gsungs pa byang chub kyi sems 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi sku'o //
analyzed: de nas byang chub kyi sems gcig pu bsrungs pa la bsod nams chen por 'gyur te slar yang gsung ni rab tu gsungs pa byang chub kyi sems 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi sku'o //
translated: Then, the protection of the bodhicitta alone is of great merit. Again, the speech is spoken: “This bodhicitta is the body of the Buddha.

original: bdud kyi rigs gang su zhig 'di ni nyams la mngon par dga' byed g-yon can de ni rdo rje can te he ru kas gsod par byed do ;
analyzed: bdud kyi rigs gang su zhig 'di ni nyams la mngon par dga' byed g-yon can de ni rdo rje can te he ru kas gsod par byed do ;
translated: Any demon family who delights in its destruction, that deceiver is killed by the one with the vajra, that is, by Heruka.”

original: / byang chub sems kyi dam tshig bsrung ba dang bza' ba'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: / byang chub sems kyi dam tshig bsrung ba dang bza' ba'i nges pa'o //
translated: This is the protection and eating of the commitment of bodhicitta.

original: 'dir sngags kyi tshul las srid pa gsum gyi bdag pos drag po'i las kyi rang bzhin du ma'i sngags rnams rab tu gsungs pa gang /
analyzed: 'dir sngags kyi tshul las srid pa gsum gyi bdag pos drag po'i las kyi rang bzhin du ma'i sngags rnams rab tu gsungs pa gang /
translated: Here, in the Mantra system, the Lord of the Three Existences has taught the mantras of the nature of violent action.

original: de rnams thams cad bdud kyi phyogs nyams 'jigs pa skyed byed srog chags rnams la nam yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de rnams thams cad bdud kyi phyogs nyams 'jigs pa skyed byed srog chags rnams la nam yang ma yin no //
translated: Those mantras are never for the destruction of living beings, for the production of fear in the faction of demons.

original: 'dir bdud rnams ni gang zhig dran pa rnams dang byed po g-yul gyi yul la dga' zhing gsod byed gzhan yang mu stegs pa de rnams la ni mchog gi rgyal sras rnams kyis srog chags bsrung ba'i don du de rnams sbyar bar bya /
analyzed: 'dir bdud rnams ni gang zhig dran pa rnams dang byed po g-yul gyi yul la dga' zhing gsod byed gzhan yang mu stegs pa de rnams la ni mchog gi rgyal sras rnams kyis srog chags bsrung ba'i don du de rnams sbyar bar bya /
translated: Here, the demons are those who delight in the objects of battle, the killers, and the tīrthikas. Those are applied by the supreme sons of the victors for the sake of protecting living beings.

original: @212a * // de rnams kyi phyogs zhes pa ni rig byed kyi chos la sogs pa ste chos de chos nyams pa dang 'jigs pa'i slad du yin gyi de rnams kyi srog gzhom pa'i slad du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: @212a * // de rnams kyi phyogs zhes pa ni rig byed kyi chos la sogs pa ste chos de chos nyams pa dang 'jigs pa'i slad du yin gyi de rnams kyi srog gzhom pa'i slad du ni ma yin no //
translated: The faction of those is the Vedic religion, etc. That religion is for the sake of the destruction of religion and for the sake of fear, but not for the sake of destroying their life.

original: 'dir rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud las rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma gang yin pa de rnams la phyugs kyi skye bo ste mi shes pa rnams bsad pa'i don du mkhas pa ste sangs rgyas pa rnams kyis gsol ba gdab par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud las rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma gang yin pa de rnams la phyugs kyi skye bo ste mi shes pa rnams bsad pa'i don du mkhas pa ste sangs rgyas pa rnams kyis gsol ba gdab par mi bya'o //
translated: Here, those who are wise, that is, Buddhists, should not pray to the Vajra dakinis for the sake of killing the ignorant, that is, the uncultured.

original: gang las ci'i phyir zhe na sems can rnams ni bsrung ba'i don du srid pa gsum gyi bla mas de rnams 'jig rten khams su spros pa ste de'i phyir mchog gi snying rje dang ldan pa de rnams ni 'jig rten rnams srung bar byed cing 'jig rten slu
analyzed: gang las ci'i phyir zhe na sems can rnams ni bsrung ba'i don du srid pa gsum gyi bla mas de rnams 'jig rten khams su spros pa ste de'i phyir mchog gi snying rje dang ldan pa de rnams ni 'jig rten rnams srung bar byed cing 'jig rten slu
translated: Why? Because the dakinis are emanated into the world by the lords of the three worlds for the sake of protecting sentient beings. Therefore, those who are endowed with supreme compassion protect the world and deceive the world.

original: bar byed pa'i sgrub pa po la sdang bar byed do //
analyzed: bar byed pa'i sgrub pa po la sdang bar byed do //
translated: They hate the adept who deceives the world.

original: ci ste bsad pa la sogs pa'i las byas par gyur pa na bsgrub bya dag ni las kyi mthu yis shi bar gyur na de'i tshe 'di ni sgrub pa po yi bdud yin te bdag gis bsad do zhes pa'i nga rgyal las dman pa'i las kyis sgrub pa
analyzed: ci ste bsad pa la sogs pa'i las byas par gyur pa na bsgrub bya dag ni las kyi mthu yis shi bar gyur na de'i tshe 'di ni sgrub pa po yi bdud yin te bdag gis bsad do zhes pa'i nga rgyal las dman pa'i las kyis sgrub pa
translated: If, when one has performed the action of killing and so on, the victim dies through the power of the action, at that time this is the māra of the practitioner.🔽

original: po dmyal bar 'gro'o //
analyzed: po dmyal bar 'gro'o //
translated: But if, when the rite of killing and so on is performed, the victim dies by the power of the rite, then this is the magician’s demon, and because of the pride of thinking “I have killed,” the magician will go to hell because of his inferior action.

original: nga rgyal med cing nga yir 'dzin pa med pa ni dman pa'i las mi byed de bdag nyid la ji lta ba de bzhin du sems can rnams la lta'o //
analyzed: nga rgyal med cing nga yir 'dzin pa med pa ni dman pa'i las mi byed de bdag nyid la ji lta ba de bzhin du sems can rnams la lta'o //
translated: But if he is without pride and without the thought “mine,” he will not perform inferior actions, and he will regard sentient beings as he regards himself.🔽Here, the minds of all beings in cyclic existence are attached to the results of nonvirtue. With this knowledge, the greedy one

original: 'dir 'khor ba pa'i skyes bu rnams kyi sems ni kun nas mi dge'i 'bras bu'i dbang gis phran tshogs rig pa la rjes chags rig pa 'di yis srid pa gsum po mtha' dag skad cig gi ni bdag gi dbang du byed pa'o zhes pa'i bsam pa brkam chags
analyzed: 'dir 'khor ba pa'i skyes bu rnams kyi sems ni kun nas mi dge'i 'bras bu'i dbang gis phran tshogs rig pa la rjes chags rig pa 'di yis srid pa gsum po mtha' dag skad cig gi ni bdag gi dbang du byed pa'o zhes pa'i bsam pa brkam chags
translated: should think, “I will bring the entire three worlds under my control in an instant.”

original: sems kyis sbyin dang ye shes rnam par spangs nas shi bar gyur pa dmyal bar rab tu 'jug / phyis ni ste shi bar gyur pa'i rjes la rdzas gzhan gyi dbang dang rang gi chung ma gzhan gyi dbang du 'gyur te kye ma 'khor ba pa rnams kyi
analyzed: sems kyis sbyin dang ye shes rnam par spangs nas shi bar gyur pa dmyal bar rab tu 'jug / phyis ni ste shi bar gyur pa'i rjes la rdzas gzhan gyi dbang dang rang gi chung ma gzhan gyi dbang du 'gyur te kye ma 'khor ba pa rnams kyi
translated: Later, after death, he will be under the power of other substances and under the power of another's wife.

original: gzhan la chags pa ni ngan pa'i chos la rab tu 'jug go zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan la chags pa ni ngan pa'i chos la rab tu 'jug go zhes pa'o //
translated: Attachment to others is the entry into bad dharmas.

original: bsdus pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po dus kyi 'khor lo'i rgyas 'grel rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'jug pa stong phrag bcu gnyis pa dri ma med pa'i 'od kyi ye shes kyi le'u las rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud la sogs pa spro ba'i mdor bsdus chen po ste dang
analyzed: bsdus pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po dus kyi 'khor lo'i rgyas 'grel rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'jug pa stong phrag bcu gnyis pa dri ma med pa'i 'od kyi ye shes kyi le'u las rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud la sogs pa spro ba'i mdor bsdus chen po ste dang
translated: In the Stainless Light, a commentary on the root tantra of the Condensed Tantra of the Wheel of Time, a king of tantras, in the chapter on wisdom, there is a great summary of the emanation of the Yoginī Tantras and so forth.🔽It says:

original: po'o / // / yod min med min yod med min //
analyzed: po'o / // / yod min med min yod med min //
translated: Not existent, not nonexistent, not existent and nonexistent,

original: gnyi ga'i bdag nyid min pa'ang min //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i bdag nyid min pa'ang min //
translated: Not the nature of both,

original: @212b mtha' bzhi las ni rnam grol ba //
analyzed: @212b mtha' bzhi las ni rnam grol ba //
translated: Liberated from the four extremes,

original: bde chen sku la phyag 'tshal nas //
analyzed: bde chen sku la phyag 'tshal nas //
translated: I pay homage to the body of great bliss.

original: dang po'i sangs rgyas ris med las //
analyzed: dang po'i sangs rgyas ris med las //
translated: The four bodies of the Buddhas

original: 'jam pa'i rdo rjes rab phyung ba //
analyzed: 'jam pa'i rdo rjes rab phyung ba //
translated: are extracted by Mañjuvajra from the first Buddha, who is without parts.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi sku bzhi yi //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi sku bzhi yi //
translated: The characteristics of the four bodies of the Buddhas

original: mtshan nyid de ni dgrol bar bya //
analyzed: mtshan nyid de ni dgrol bar bya //
translated: are to be explained.

original: shes rab ma yin pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir shes rab ni cha bco lnga'i bdag nyid de dkar po'i phyogs so //
analyzed: shes rab ma yin pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir shes rab ni cha bco lnga'i bdag nyid de dkar po'i phyogs so //
translated: Not wisdom, etc. Here, wisdom is the fifteen parts, the bright fortnight.

original: thabs ni nag po'i phyogs te zla ba'i cha nyams pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thabs ni nag po'i phyogs te zla ba'i cha nyams pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Means is the dark fortnight, because the parts of the moon decrease.

original: de bzhin du dkar po ni mtshan mo dang nag po ni nyin mo'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dkar po ni mtshan mo dang nag po ni nyin mo'o //
translated: Similarly, the bright is the night, and the dark is the day.

original: de'i phyir lhan cig skyes pa'i sku ni shes rab ma yin thabs kyang min pa 'di ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi lhan cig skyes pa'i sku ste de ltar yod pa dka' po'i phyogs ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir lhan cig skyes pa'i sku ni shes rab ma yin thabs kyang min pa 'di ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi lhan cig skyes pa'i sku ste de ltar yod pa dka' po'i phyogs ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the innate body is neither wisdom nor means. This is the innate body of the Buddhas. Thus, it is not the side of existence, which is difficult.

original: med pa ste cha'i dngos po med pa nag po'i phyogs ma yin no //
analyzed: med pa ste cha'i dngos po med pa nag po'i phyogs ma yin no //
translated: It is not nonexistence, the absence of the entity of parts, which is the dark side.

original: yod med min te 'di dag phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir tshogs pa med do //
analyzed: yod med min te 'di dag phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir tshogs pa med do //
translated: It is not both existent and nonexistent, because these are mutually contradictory and there is no combination.

original: gnyi ga'i bdag nyid min pa'ang min zhes pa ni dkar po dang nag po'i phyogs 'di dag ma gtogs pa yang lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba de ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i bdag nyid min pa'ang min zhes pa ni dkar po dang nag po'i phyogs 'di dag ma gtogs pa yang lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba de ma yin no //
translated: It is not the nature of both, meaning that the innate bliss is not other than these white and black aspects.

original: de ltar mtha' bzhi yongs su dag pas cha bcu drug pa stong pa nyid kyi chos can ni lhan cig skyes pa'i skur gsungs te rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi bzhi pa zad pa las rgyu mthun pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de ltar mtha' bzhi yongs su dag pas cha bcu drug pa stong pa nyid kyi chos can ni lhan cig skyes pa'i skur gsungs te rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi bzhi pa zad pa las rgyu mthun pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Thus, since it is completely pure of the four extremes, the sixteen parts are said to be the innate body, the nature of emptiness, the characteristic of the natural outflow from the exhaustion of the fourth of the yoginīs.

original: de ltar na ma ning ngo zhes grub bo //
analyzed: de ltar na ma ning ngo zhes grub bo //
translated: Thus, it is established as the neuter.

original: 'dir lhan cig skyes pa'i sku ni rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir lhan cig skyes pa'i sku ni rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: Here, the innate body is the perfection of one’s own welfare.🔽The perfection of the welfare of others is the dharmakāya that arises from the exhaustion of deep sleep.🔽That is also definitely the separation of wisdom and consciousness, which is free from darkness.

original: gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa la shin tu gnyid log pa zad pa las chos kyi skur gyur pa ste de yang shes rab thabs kyi rang bzhin nges par mun pa dang bral ye shes dang ni rnam shes dbye ba las zhes pa la 'dir ye shes
analyzed: gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa la shin tu gnyid log pa zad pa las chos kyi skur gyur pa ste de yang shes rab thabs kyi rang bzhin nges par mun pa dang bral ye shes dang ni rnam shes dbye ba las zhes pa la 'dir ye shes
translated: Here, wisdom is the perfection of one’s own welfare.

original: ni rnal 'byor pa'i 'dzin par byed pa'i sems so //
analyzed: ni rnal 'byor pa'i 'dzin par byed pa'i sems so //
translated: The mind that apprehends is the yogi's mind.

original: rnam shes ni sems gzhan shes pa ste gzung bar bya ba shes bya'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rnam shes ni sems gzhan shes pa ste gzung bar bya ba shes bya'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Consciousness is the knowledge of other minds, the characteristic of the object of knowledge that is to be apprehended.

original: de ltar rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi 'dzin par byed pa'i sems ni shes rab ste brtags pa dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi 'dzin par byed pa'i sems ni shes rab ste brtags pa dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Thus, the yogi's mind that apprehends is wisdom, because it is free from conceptualization.

original: thabs gzung bar bya ba'i sems ni brtags pa gzhan te snying rje'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: thabs gzung bar bya ba'i sems ni brtags pa gzhan te snying rje'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The mind that apprehends the method is another conceptualization, characterized by compassion.

original: 'dzin par byed pa dang gzung bar bya ba'i dbye ba des shes rab dang thabs kyi rang bzhin gyi gzhan gyi don byed pa po ni chos kyi sku ste de yang lhan cig skyes pa las byung bar gyur pa'o //🔽de ltar lte bar lhan @213a * //
analyzed: 'dzin par byed pa dang gzung bar bya ba'i dbye ba des shes rab dang thabs kyi rang bzhin gyi gzhan gyi don byed pa po ni chos kyi sku ste de yang lhan cig skyes pa las byung bar gyur pa'o // de ltar lte bar lhan @213a * //
translated: By that division into apprehender and apprehended, the one who acts for the benefit of others, having the nature of wisdom and method, is the dharmakāya, which arises from the connate.

original: cig skyes pa rgyu mthun pa dang snying kha chos kyi 'khor lor rnam par smin pa'o //
analyzed: cig skyes pa rgyu mthun pa dang snying kha chos kyi 'khor lor rnam par smin pa'o //
translated: Thus, the connate is at the navel, the natural outflow, and the fully matured is at the heart, the dharmacakra.

original: chos kyi sku 'di ni gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa la longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ste sgra brnyan lta bu sems can du ma'i don ni byed pa po zhes pa 'dir lha'i mig gis 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs gang zhig mthong ba ni gzugs🔽brnyan gyi rnam pa dang ba ste de la sgra gang zhig rgyu ba de ni sgra brnyan no //
analyzed: chos kyi sku 'di ni gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa la longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ste sgra brnyan lta bu sems can du ma'i don ni byed pa po zhes pa 'dir lha'i mig gis 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs gang zhig mthong ba ni gzugs brnyan gyi rnam pa dang ba ste de la sgra gang zhig rgyu ba de ni sgra brnyan no //
translated: Here, the divine eye sees any form in the past or future, which is a clear image. The sound that moves there is an echo.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ni shes rab dang thabs kyi rang bzhin lha'i rna ba'i rnam par shes pa ni 'dzin par byed pa ste sgra brnyan ni gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ni shes rab dang thabs kyi rang bzhin lha'i rna ba'i rnam par shes pa ni 'dzin par byed pa ste sgra brnyan ni gzung bar bya'o //
translated: The sambhogakāya is the nature of wisdom and method, which is the divine ear consciousness that apprehends, and the echo is what is apprehended.

original: des na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi grangs shes te bskal pa che ge mo dang dus che ge mo dang lo che ge mo dang zla ba che ge mo dang phyogs che ge mo dang nyin zhag che ge mo la sogs pa la che ge🔽mo byung bar gyur to //
analyzed: des na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi grangs shes te bskal pa che ge mo dang dus che ge mo dang lo che ge mo dang zla ba che ge mo dang phyogs che ge mo dang nyin zhag che ge mo la sogs pa la che ge🔽mo byung bar gyur to //
translated: Therefore, it knows the enumeration of the past and future, such as “So-and-so arose in such-and-such an eon, such-and-such a time, such-and-such a year, such-and-such a month, such-and-such a direction, such-and-such a day, and so on.”

original: che ge mo 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: che ge mo 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
translated: So-and-so will appear.🔽 It is by that that sentient beings are disciplined.

original: des sems can rnams 'dul bar byed pa ste steng du khu ba rnams kyis rmi lam gyi gnas skabs zad pa las mgrin par longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku skyes bu byed pa'o //
analyzed: des sems can rnams 'dul bar byed pa ste steng du khu ba rnams kyis rmi lam gyi gnas skabs zad pa las mgrin par longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku skyes bu byed pa'o //
translated: In the throat, from the exhaustion of the dream state, is the enjoyment body, the agent of the person.

original: sems can rnams ni smin pa'i slad du yang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku 'di ni sprul pa'i skur 'gyur te shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid can gcig kyang sems can rnams la sprul pa sna tshogs ston par byed pa'i phyir du ma'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams ni smin pa'i slad du yang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku 'di ni sprul pa'i skur 'gyur te shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid can gcig kyang sems can rnams la sprul pa sna tshogs ston par byed pa'i phyir du ma'o //
translated: For the sake of the maturation of sentient beings, this enjoyment body becomes the emanation body, because it is the one with the nature of wisdom and method that manifests various emanations for sentient beings.

original: de ltar gcig dang du ma dag ni don dam par sbyor ba ste shes rab dang thabs so //
analyzed: de ltar gcig dang du ma dag ni don dam par sbyor ba ste shes rab dang thabs so //
translated: Thus, the one and the many are applied ultimately, that is, to wisdom and method.

original: kun rdzob tu ni gcig dang du ma 'gal lo //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni gcig dang du ma 'gal lo //
translated: Conventionally, the one and the many are contradictory.

original: de yang sad pa'i gnas skabs zad pa las dpral bar sprul pa'i sku dri ma dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: de yang sad pa'i gnas skabs zad pa las dpral bar sprul pa'i sku dri ma dang bral ba ste /
translated: Moreover, from the exhaustion of the waking state, in the forehead is the emanation body, which is free from stains.

original: gzugs rnams ma lus kun tu ston //
analyzed: gzugs rnams ma lus kun tu ston //
translated: It manifests all forms without exception.

original: nor bu chen po rin chen tog ces pa'o //
analyzed: nor bu chen po rin chen tog ces pa'o //
translated: The great jewel is the crest jewel.

original: de ltar lhan cig skyes pa'i sku gcig pu ste de nyid chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa'ang sprul pa'o zhes pa rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: de ltar lhan cig skyes pa'i sku gcig pu ste de nyid chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa'ang sprul pa'o zhes pa rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: Thus, the single, co-emergent body is the Dharma Body, the Enjoyment Body, and the Emanation Body, in four aspects.

original: sngar gsungs pa'i rdo rje sems dpa' de nyid gcig pu 'di ni dus mtha'i sprin dang mtshungs pa nag po'i he ru kar ni byung bar gyur te 'pho ba med pa'i chos kyis rnam par shes pa gzhan de ni he ru ka'o //
analyzed: sngar gsungs pa'i rdo rje sems dpa' de nyid gcig pu 'di ni dus mtha'i sprin dang mtshungs pa nag po'i he ru kar ni byung bar gyur te 'pho ba med pa'i chos kyis rnam par shes pa gzhan de ni he ru ka'o //
translated: That very Vajrasattva mentioned previously, alone, arises as the black Heruka, who is like the cloud at the end of time. The other consciousness, which is the unchanging reality, is Heruka.

original: de yang gdug pa rnams ni smin pa'i don du rdo rje sems dpa' spros pa'o //
analyzed: de yang gdug pa rnams ni smin pa'i don du rdo rje sems dpa' spros pa'o //
translated: Moreover, in order to ripen the wicked, Vajrasattva emanates.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' de yang rmongs pa rnams smin pa'i don du gzugs gzhan de ni @213b dam tshig rgyal ba ste rnam par snang mdzad du byung bar gyur to //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' de yang rmongs pa rnams smin pa'i don du gzugs gzhan de ni @213b dam tshig rgyal ba ste rnam par snang mdzad du byung bar gyur to //
translated: That Vajrasattva, in order to ripen the ignorant, takes on another form, the pledge Victor, who arises as Vairochana.

original: de yang rin chen dbang po ni sdug bsngal ldan pa rnams la sbyin pa'i don te 'pho ba med pa'i chos kyis tshor ba gzhan de ni sdug bsngal thams cad 'phrog par byed pa rin chen 'byung ldan du byung bar gyur to //
analyzed: de yang rin chen dbang po ni sdug bsngal ldan pa rnams la sbyin pa'i don te 'pho ba med pa'i chos kyis tshor ba gzhan de ni sdug bsngal thams cad 'phrog par byed pa rin chen 'byung ldan du byung bar gyur to //
translated: Moreover, Ratnasaṃbhava is for the sake of giving to those who are suffering. That other feeling by the dharmas of non-transmigration is Ratnasaṃbhava, who has arisen in order to take away all suffering.

original: de yang pad 'dzin chags can rnams kyi chags pa'i slad du ste 'pho ba med pa'i chos kyis 'du shes gzhan gang yin pa de ni 'pho ba med pa'i bde ba ster bar byed pa po snang ba mtha' yas su byung bar gyur to //
analyzed: de yang pad 'dzin chags can rnams kyi chags pa'i slad du ste 'pho ba med pa'i chos kyis 'du shes gzhan gang yin pa de ni 'pho ba med pa'i bde ba ster bar byed pa po snang ba mtha' yas su byung bar gyur to //
translated: Moreover, he is the lotus-holder for the sake of the passion of the passionate. That other perception by the dharmas of non-transmigration is the giver of the bliss of non-transmigration, who has arisen as Amitābha.

original: de yang bgegs rnams rnam par gzhom pa'i don du phyag gi padma ral gri ste 'pho ba med pa'i chos kyis 'du byed gzhan gang yin pa de ni sems sgrib pa med par byed pas bdud la sogs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par 'joms par byed pa don yod
analyzed: de yang bgegs rnams rnam par gzhom pa'i don du phyag gi padma ral gri ste 'pho ba med pa'i chos kyis 'du byed gzhan gang yin pa de ni sems sgrib pa med par byed pas bdud la sogs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par 'joms par byed pa don yod
translated: Moreover, his lotus hand is a sword for the sake of completely destroying obstacles. That other compositional factor by the dharmas of non-transmigration is Amoghasiddhi, who has arisen as the one who makes the mind unobstructed and thus completely destroys the obstructions of Māra and so on.

original: grub par byung bar gyur to zhes pa ste sangs rgyas lnga rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: grub par byung bar gyur to zhes pa ste sangs rgyas lnga rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: The phrase became accomplished refers to the five pure buddhas.

original: da ni khams lnga rnams gsungs pa zhe sdang zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir tha mal pa'i zhe sdang zad pa'i zhe sdang chen po las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ma stong pa nyid rnam pa thams cad pa sna tshogs yum gang yin pa de
analyzed: da ni khams lnga rnams gsungs pa zhe sdang zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir tha mal pa'i zhe sdang zad pa'i zhe sdang chen po las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ma stong pa nyid rnam pa thams cad pa sna tshogs yum gang yin pa de
translated: Now, the five elements are mentioned, beginning with anger. Here, from the great anger that is the exhaustion of ordinary anger, is Prajñāpāramitā, the mother of the varieties of emptiness in all its aspects.

original: ni rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma rdo rje mkha' 'gro mar byung bar gyur to //
analyzed: ni rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma rdo rje mkha' 'gro mar byung bar gyur to //
translated: She is Vajradhātvīśvarī, who arises as Vajraḍāka.

original: de bzhin du gti mug zad pa'i gti mug chen po las spyan ma'o //🔽mchog gi snying rje m'a ma k'i ni nga rgyal zad pa'i nga rgyal chen po'i rgyu las byung bar gyur to //
analyzed: de bzhin du gti mug zad pa'i gti mug chen po las spyan ma'o // mchog gi snying rje m'a ma k'i ni nga rgyal zad pa'i nga rgyal chen po'i rgyu las byung bar gyur to //
translated: Similarly, from the great delusion that is the exhaustion of delusion, is Locanā.🔽From the cause of great pride that is the exhaustion of pride, is supreme compassion, Māmakī.

original: chags pa zad pa'i chags pa chen po las de ni gos dkar mo'o //
analyzed: chags pa zad pa'i chags pa chen po las de ni gos dkar mo'o //
translated: From the great passion that is the exhaustion of passion, is Pāṇḍaravāsinī.

original: phrag dog zad pa'i phrag dog chen po las de ni mtha' dag yon tan gter sgrol mar byung bar gyur to //🔽de ltar nam mkha'i khams gzhan dang sa'i khams gzhan dang chu'i khams gzhan dang me'i khams gzhan dang rlung gi khams gzhan no zhes pa khams kyi mtshan nyid de sgrib pa med pa'i gzugs dang mi 'pho ba'i bden pa las so zhes grub po //🔽dus kyi 'khor lo dang sna tshogs yum thabs dang shes rab gcig tu 'dres par gyur pa sna tshogs gzugs can gnyis po 'di dag ni yul dang yul can gzhan rnams thams cad du yang byung bar gyur te /
analyzed: phrag dog zad pa'i phrag dog chen po las de ni mtha' dag yon tan gter sgrol mar byung bar gyur to // de ltar nam mkha'i khams gzhan dang sa'i khams gzhan dang chu'i khams gzhan dang me'i khams gzhan dang rlung gi khams gzhan no zhes pa khams kyi mtshan nyid de sgrib pa med pa'i gzugs dang mi 'pho ba'i bden pa las so zhes grub po // dus kyi 'khor lo dang sna tshogs yum thabs dang shes rab gcig tu 'dres par gyur pa sna tshogs gzugs can gnyis po 'di dag ni yul dang yul can gzhan rnams thams cad du yang byung bar gyur te /
translated: From the great envy that is the exhaustion of envy, she is the one who releases the treasure of all good qualities.🔽Thus, the other space element, the other earth element, the other water element, the other fire element, and the other wind element—these are the characteristics of the elements, which are established from the form that is free of obscuration and the truth that is not subject to transition.🔽The Kālacakra and the various mothers, method and wisdom, become a single unity. These two, which have various forms, arise in all other objects and subjects.

original: dri gzhan la sogs pa'i yul de rnams dang rna ba gzhan la sogs pa'i yul can de rnams dang ngag dang lag pa gzhan la sogs pa rnams dang las kyi dbang @214a * //
analyzed: dri gzhan la sogs pa'i yul de rnams dang rna ba gzhan la sogs pa'i yul can de rnams dang ngag dang lag pa gzhan la sogs pa rnams dang las kyi dbang @214a * //
translated: Those objects, such as smell, and those subjects, such as the ear, and the other objects, such as speech and the hands, and the other actions, such as the feet, and the other objects, such as the anus, and the other subjects, such as the penis, and the other objects, such as the mind, and the other subjects, such as the eyes, and the other objects, such as the body, and the other subjects, such as the tongue, and the other objects, such as the skin, and the other subjects, such as the nose, and the other objects, such as the ears, and the other subjects, such as the body, and the other objects, such as the mind, and the other subjects, such as the body, and the other objects, such as the body, and the other subjects, such as the body, and the other objects, such as the body, and the other subjects, such as the body, and the other objects, such as the body, and the other subjects, such as the body, and the other objects, such as the body, and the other subjects, such as the body, and the other objects, such as the body, and the other subjects, such as the body, and the other objects, such as the body, and the other subjects, such as the body, and the other objects, such as the body, and the other subjects, such as the body, and the other objects, such as the body, and the other subjects, such as the body, and the other objects, such as the body, and the other subjects, such as the body, and the other objects, such as the body, and the other subjects, such as the body, and the other objects, such as the body, and the other subjects, such as the body, and the other objects, such as the body, and the other subjects,

original: po'i bya ba gzhan la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: po'i bya ba gzhan la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: and so on, are the activities of the body.🔽Thus, it is said:

original: de skad du thams cad nas ni phyag dang zhabs //🔽kun nas spyan dang dbu dang zhal //
analyzed: de skad du thams cad nas ni phyag dang zhabs // kun nas spyan dang dbu dang zhal //
translated: Hands and feet are everywhere,🔽Eyes and faces are everywhere,

original: kun nas gsan ldan 'jig rten mtha' //
analyzed: kun nas gsan ldan 'jig rten mtha' //
translated: Ears are everywhere, and the world is everywhere.

original: thams cad khyab par bzhugs pa ni //
analyzed: thams cad khyab par bzhugs pa ni //
translated: He is present everywhere,🔽as Vajrasattva.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' zhes dang / de bzhin du /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' zhes dang / de bzhin du /
translated: And thus:

original: bdag rig gzhan rig thams cad pa //
analyzed: bdag rig gzhan rig thams cad pa //
translated: He knows himself and others in all ways,🔽The supreme person who benefits all,

original: kun la phan pa'i gang zag mchog /'jig rten dpe las 'das pa ste //
analyzed: kun la phan pa'i gang zag mchog /'jig rten dpe las 'das pa ste //
translated: Beyond all worldly examples,🔽The supreme lord of knowledge and the known.

original: shes dang shes bya'i bdag po mchog / ces pa dang de bzhin du /
analyzed: shes dang shes bya'i bdag po mchog / ces pa dang de bzhin du /
translated: And thus:

original: don grub bsam pa grub pa ste //
analyzed: don grub bsam pa grub pa ste //
translated: He is the accomplished meaning, the accomplished thought,

original: kun tu rtog pa thams cad spangs //
analyzed: kun tu rtog pa thams cad spangs //
translated: Abandoning all conceptual thoughts,

original: rnam par mi rtog khams mi zad //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog khams mi zad //
translated: The nonconceptual realm, inexhaustible,🔽The supreme realm of reality, inexhaustible.

original: chos dbyings dam pa zad mi shes zhes pa ni mtshan yang dag par brjod pa las ye shes kyi sku'i ma tshan nyid do //
analyzed: chos dbyings dam pa zad mi shes zhes pa ni mtshan yang dag par brjod pa las ye shes kyi sku'i ma tshan nyid do //
translated: This is the nature of the body of wisdom as described in the Discourse of the Praise in Honor of One Worthy of Honor.

original: da ni sems can gyi bsam pa'i dbang gis sangs rgyas rnams kyi bzhugs pa sna tshogs pa gsungs pa phung po lnga zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: da ni sems can gyi bsam pa'i dbang gis sangs rgyas rnams kyi bzhugs pa sna tshogs pa gsungs pa phung po lnga zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Now, the various abodes of the Buddhas by the power of the thoughts of sentient beings are stated, beginning with “the five aggregates,” and so on.

original: 'dir nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i sgrib pa dang bral ba rnams kyi mngal du 'jug pa dang phung po lnga 'dzin pa dang rdo rje btsun mo'i bha ga rnams la bzhugs pa ste bud med kyi mngal du skye ba gang yin pa de ni brtse ba yis
analyzed: 'dir nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i sgrib pa dang bral ba rnams kyi mngal du 'jug pa dang phung po lnga 'dzin pa dang rdo rje btsun mo'i bha ga rnams la bzhugs pa ste bud med kyi mngal du skye ba gang yin pa de ni brtse ba yis
translated: Here, the entry into the womb of those free from the obscurations of afflictions, and so on, the grasping of the five aggregates, and the abodes in the bhaga of the Vajra Queen, that is, the birth in the womb of a woman, is by compassion

original: tha mal pa'i skye bo des pa rnam par ma bsgrubs shing bsod nams bsags pa min pa rnams smin pa'i slad du ste /
analyzed: tha mal pa'i skye bo des pa rnam par ma bsgrubs shing bsod nams bsags pa min pa rnams smin pa'i slad du ste /
translated: for the sake of the maturation of ordinary beings who are not established in the practice and who have not accumulated merit.

original: de skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: de skad du gsungs pa /
translated: Thus it is stated:

original: gang phyir rdo rje'i sku yi lus //
analyzed: gang phyir rdo rje'i sku yi lus //
translated: “Since the body of the vajra body

original: sangs rgyas rnams ni mi rtag na //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams ni mi rtag na //
translated: is impermanent, the Buddhas

original: chu shing snying po dang mtshungs pa'i //
analyzed: chu shing snying po dang mtshungs pa'i //
translated: are like the core of the plantain tree,

original: skye bo gzhan la ci zhig sems zhes pa la sogs pa rtag par smra ba rnams smin par bya ba'i slad du'o //
analyzed: skye bo gzhan la ci zhig sems zhes pa la sogs pa rtag par smra ba rnams smin par bya ba'i slad du'o //
translated: what do you think of other beings?” and so on.

original: slar yang gtsang ma'i gnas la sogs par skye ba gang yin pa de ni lha nyid du gyur pa'i nyan thos rnams kyi nga rgyal nyams par bya ba'i slad du ste lha nyid 'di ni ltung ba'i dus su sdug bsngal chen po'o zhes bstan pas de rnams smin🔽par byed do //
analyzed: slar yang gtsang ma'i gnas la sogs par skye ba gang yin pa de ni lha nyid du gyur pa'i nyan thos rnams kyi nga rgyal nyams par bya ba'i slad du ste lha nyid 'di ni ltung ba'i dus su sdug bsngal chen po'o zhes bstan pas de rnams smin par byed do //
translated: Again, the birth in the Pure Abodes and so forth is for the sake of reducing the pride of the Sravakas who have become gods, because they are taught that this godhood is a great suffering at the time of falling, and thus they are ripened.

original: gang zhig ae wam yi ge ste stong pa nyid la gnas pa de ni mchog gi nges pa can rab 'byor la sogs pa rnams dang byams pa la sogs pa rnams sku bzhi pa bstan pas mchog yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyid la dgod pa'i slad
analyzed: gang zhig ae wam yi ge ste stong pa nyid la gnas pa de ni mchog gi nges pa can rab 'byor la sogs pa rnams dang byams pa la sogs pa rnams sku bzhi pa bstan pas mchog yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyid la dgod pa'i slad
translated: The one who abides in the letter E-VAM, emptiness, is established in the supreme, perfect enlightenment of the fourfold body of the supreme vehicle, for the sake of establishing Subhuti and so forth and Maitreya and so forth in the supreme, perfect enlightenment of the fourfold body.

original: du'o // stong pa'i dngos po ni stong pa nyid de 'dir 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i shes bya ni stong pa'o //
analyzed: du'o // stong pa'i dngos po ni stong pa nyid de 'dir 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i shes bya ni stong pa'o //
translated: The entity of emptiness is emptiness. Here, the object of knowledge of the past and future is empty.

original: de mthong ba ni dngos po stong pa nyid zab pa dang rgya @214b che ba ste 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po med pa'i phyir zab pa'o //
analyzed: de mthong ba ni dngos po stong pa nyid zab pa dang rgya @214b che ba ste 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po med pa'i phyir zab pa'o //
translated: Seeing that is the profound and vast emptiness of things, because past and future things do not exist, it is profound.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa mthong ba'i phyir rgya che ba'o //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa mthong ba'i phyir rgya che ba'o //
translated: Because past and future are seen, it is vast.

original: de skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: de skad du gsungs pa /
translated: It is said:

original: stong nyid smra ba'i khyu mchog ste //
analyzed: stong nyid smra ba'i khyu mchog ste //
translated: The supreme leader of those who proclaim emptiness,

original: zab cing rgya che sgra sgrogs pa //🔽chos kyi dung ste sgra chen ldan //
analyzed: zab cing rgya che sgra sgrogs pa // chos kyi dung ste sgra chen ldan //
translated: Proclaiming the profound and vast,🔽The Dharma conch, endowed with great sound,

original: chos kyi gand'i sgra bo che //
analyzed: chos kyi gand'i sgra bo che //
translated: The great sound of the Dharma drum,

original: mi gnas mya ngan 'das pa po //
analyzed: mi gnas mya ngan 'das pa po //
translated: The one who attains nonabiding nirvana,

original: phyogs bcu'i chos kyi rnga bo che //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i chos kyi rnga bo che //
translated: The great Dharma drum of the ten directions,

original: gzugs med gzugs bzang dam pa ste //
analyzed: gzugs med gzugs bzang dam pa ste //
translated: The formless one, the excellent form,

original: sna tshogs gzugs can yid las skyes //
analyzed: sna tshogs gzugs can yid las skyes //
translated: The various forms, born from the mind,

original: gzugs rnams thams cad snang ba'i dpal //
analyzed: gzugs rnams thams cad snang ba'i dpal //
translated: The glory of the appearance of all forms,🔽The bearer of all reflections.
