original: gzugs brnyan ma lus 'chang ba po zhes pa ni mtshan yang dag par brjod pa las bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan ma lus 'chang ba po zhes pa ni mtshan yang dag par brjod pa las bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa'o //
translated: This is the identification of the Blessed One from the Praise in Hundred and Fifty Verses.

original: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa dgu bcu rtsa gnyis kyi rjes la tshigs su bcad pa bco lnga ni go sla'o //
analyzed: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa dgu bcu rtsa gnyis kyi rjes la tshigs su bcad pa bco lnga ni go sla'o //
translated: Here, after the ninety-two verses, the fifteen verses are easy to understand.

original: de nas ye shes zhes pa la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig ni sbas pa ste de nyid dgrol bar bya'o //🔽'dir dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bsgom pa la dam tshig sems dpa' rdzogs par byas te de nas ye shes kyi 'khor lo dgug pa dang gzhug pa dang / bcing ba dang mnyes pa dang ro mnyam pa sngags pas bya ba ni dza:h'um bam ho:zhes pas rdo rje lcags kyus dgug pa dang rdo rjes gzhug pa dang rdo rje zhags pas bcing ba dang dril bus mnyes pa ste shar dang lho dang nub dang byang gi sgo
analyzed: de nas ye shes zhes pa la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig ni sbas pa ste de nyid dgrol bar bya'o // 'dir dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bsgom pa la dam tshig sems dpa' rdzogs par byas te de nas ye shes kyi 'khor lo dgug pa dang gzhug pa dang / bcing ba dang mnyes pa dang ro mnyam pa sngags pas bya ba ni dza:h'um bam ho:zhes pas rdo rje lcags kyus dgug pa dang rdo rjes gzhug pa dang rdo rje zhags pas bcing ba dang dril bus mnyes pa ste shar dang lho dang nub dang byang gi sgo
translated: Then, the one verse beginning with “knowledge” and so on is hidden, and that itself should be unraveled.🔽Here, having completed the pledge-being meditation on the mandala circle, then the knowledge circle should be summoned, caused to enter, bound, delighted, and made of the same taste by the mantrin with JAH HUM BAM HOH.

original: rnams su gnas pa'i khro bo'i rgyal po rnams kyis so //
analyzed: rnams su gnas pa'i khro bo'i rgyal po rnams kyis so //
translated: The summoning with the vajra hook, the causing to enter with the vajra, the binding with the vajra noose, and the delighting with the bell are by the kings of wrathful ones abiding at the east, south, west, and north gates.

original: rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud la ni rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma rnams kyis te thams cad du grags so //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud la ni rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma rnams kyis te thams cad du grags so //
translated: In the Yoginī Tantras, the Vajra Ḍākinīs do so; this is well known everywhere.

original: de nyid nang du gsungs pa ye shes dgug pa byed pa 'dir ni lus la slar yang shin tu stobs zhes pa ni na chung dang rab tu 'grogs pa la ye shes sems dpa' ni khu ba ste dgongs pa'i skad kyis gzhan no //
analyzed: de nyid nang du gsungs pa ye shes dgug pa byed pa 'dir ni lus la slar yang shin tu stobs zhes pa ni na chung dang rab tu 'grogs pa la ye shes sems dpa' ni khu ba ste dgongs pa'i skad kyis gzhan no //
translated: Here, in the very powerful body, the wisdom being is the semen, which is the other one, the one spoken of in the esoteric language.

original: de'i dgug pa ni srog la sogs pa'i rlung gi tshogs kyis dbye ba ste steng du spyi bor byang chub kyi sems yongs su gang bar byed do zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de'i dgug pa ni srog la sogs pa'i rlung gi tshogs kyis dbye ba ste steng du spyi bor byang chub kyi sems yongs su gang bar byed do zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Its summoning is the division by the group of the prāṇa and so on winds, which means that it fills the head cakra with bodhicitta.

original: de ni gzhug pa rmugs byed kyis zhes pa ni mes de zhu bar byas nas zhu ba thig le'i gzugs mgrin pa dang snying kha dang lte ba dang gsang ba'i padma la rab tu gzhug pa byed do //
analyzed: de ni gzhug pa rmugs byed kyis zhes pa ni mes de zhu bar byas nas zhu ba thig le'i gzugs mgrin pa dang snying kha dang lte ba dang gsang ba'i padma la rab tu gzhug pa byed do //
translated: That is the insertion by the stupefier, which means that the fire melts it, and the melted form of the bindu is inserted into the throat, heart, navel, and secret lotus.

original: rings byed ces pa sa'i khams ni thig le'i gzugs de'i bcing ba byed de mchog gi bde ba'i dbang gis shin tu mgyogs @215a * //🔽pas 'ongs pa ni 'gror mi ster ro //
analyzed: rings byed ces pa sa'i khams ni thig le'i gzugs de'i bcing ba byed de mchog gi bde ba'i dbang gis shin tu mgyogs @215a * // pas 'ongs pa ni 'gror mi ster ro //
translated: The “swift one” is the earth element, which binds the form of the drop, because of the power of supreme bliss, it comes very quickly and does not allow emission.

original: khengs byed ni chu'i khams te thig le'i khu ba dang ba gsang ba'i padma dang rdo rje nor bu la gnas pa ni g-yo ba zhes brjod cing de mi 'pho ba'i bde ba'i dbang las chu'i khams kyis mnyes pa ste lus la bsil ba nyid du byed do
analyzed: khengs byed ni chu'i khams te thig le'i khu ba dang ba gsang ba'i padma dang rdo rje nor bu la gnas pa ni g-yo ba zhes brjod cing de mi 'pho ba'i bde ba'i dbang las chu'i khams kyis mnyes pa ste lus la bsil ba nyid du byed do
translated: The “swollen” is the water element, which is the clear fluid of the drop located in the secret lotus and the vajra jewel, called “moving.” Because of the power of the bliss of its nonemission, the water element is satisfied and causes coolness in the body.

original: zhes pa'i don to ;
analyzed: zhes pa'i don to ;
translated: This is the meaning.

original: / slar yang gnas de nas steng du 'gro ba'i don du rgyu mthun pa'i bde ba de nyid spyan ma la sogs pa rnams kyis sngar brjod pa'i rdo rje'i glu rnams kyis rab tu sad par byed do //
analyzed: / slar yang gnas de nas steng du 'gro ba'i don du rgyu mthun pa'i bde ba de nyid spyan ma la sogs pa rnams kyis sngar brjod pa'i rdo rje'i glu rnams kyis rab tu sad par byed do //
translated: Again, in order to go upward from that place, that very concordant bliss is awakened by Locanā and so forth with the vajra songs previously mentioned.

original: de nas lte bar rgyu mthun pa nyid kyi don du spyan mas skul bar byed do //
analyzed: de nas lte bar rgyu mthun pa nyid kyi don du spyan mas skul bar byed do //
translated: Then, in order to go to the navel, Locanā urges him.

original: snying khar rnam par smin pa'i don du m'a ma k'i dang mgrin par skyes bu byed pa'i don du gos dkar mo dang spyi bor dri ma dang bral ba'i don du sgrol mas so //
analyzed: snying khar rnam par smin pa'i don du m'a ma k'i dang mgrin par skyes bu byed pa'i don du gos dkar mo dang spyi bor dri ma dang bral ba'i don du sgrol mas so //
translated: At the heart, for the sake of the maturation of the mind, by Māmakī; at the throat, for the sake of the activity of the person, by Pāṇḍaravāsinī; and at the crown of the head, for the sake of freedom from stains, by Tārā.

original: de lta bu la sogs pa rnams kyis bslang ba bde ba chen po dri ma dang bral bar gyur pas phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa thams cad sgrib pa med par byed do //
analyzed: de lta bu la sogs pa rnams kyis bslang ba bde ba chen po dri ma dang bral bar gyur pas phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa thams cad sgrib pa med par byed do //
translated: Thus, by these and others, the great bliss that is aroused becomes free from stains, and all the aggregates, constituents, sense fields, and so forth become free from obscurations.

original: de las rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis thams cad mkhyen pa'i gnas su 'gyur te brtags pa'i dkyil 'khor la rnal 'byor ma'i glus bslang bas ni ma yin no zhes pa ni nges pa'i don to //
analyzed: de las rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis thams cad mkhyen pa'i gnas su 'gyur te brtags pa'i dkyil 'khor la rnal 'byor ma'i glus bslang bas ni ma yin no zhes pa ni nges pa'i don to //
translated: From that, the yogins and yoginīs will attain the state of omniscience, not by being aroused by the songs of the yoginīs in the imagined maṇḍala. This is the definitive meaning.

original: rgyud thams cad la kun rdzob dang don dam pas kyang ngo //
analyzed: rgyud thams cad la kun rdzob dang don dam pas kyang ngo //
translated: In all the tantras, it is also by the relative and ultimate.

original: de nas dbyug pa sngon po la sogs pa las kyi dbang po dang bya ba rnams kyis bdud la sogs pa rnams la bsnun pa la sogs pa byas nas nam mkha' la 'gro ba dang 'ong ba la sogs pa byed de mi 'jigs pa bzhi'i stobs kyis bdud
analyzed: de nas dbyug pa sngon po la sogs pa las kyi dbang po dang bya ba rnams kyis bdud la sogs pa rnams la bsnun pa la sogs pa byas nas nam mkha' la 'gro ba dang 'ong ba la sogs pa byed de mi 'jigs pa bzhi'i stobs kyis bdud
translated: Then, with the limbs of action such as the blue club, and so on, he strikes Mara and so on, and he goes and comes in the sky and so on.

original: kyi ris thams cad pham par byas nas sngar brjod pa'i mtshan nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pas chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu skor bar byed do zhes pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: kyi ris thams cad pham par byas nas sngar brjod pa'i mtshan nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pas chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu skor bar byed do zhes pa nges pa'o //
translated: By the power of the four fearlessnesses, having defeated all the classes of Mara, he turns the wheel of Dharma with the characteristics described above.

original: de bzhin du sgrib pa med pa'i bde ba las gzhan gang cung zad spros pa yod pa dag kyang khyab bdag gi dkyil 'khor la ni 'byung po las skyes mthar zhes pa phyed dang bcas pa'i phye ba phrag gsum gyi mthar thug pa'i ste nang du ba spu'i
analyzed: de bzhin du sgrib pa med pa'i bde ba las gzhan gang cung zad spros pa yod pa dag kyang khyab bdag gi dkyil 'khor la ni 'byung po las skyes mthar zhes pa phyed dang bcas pa'i phye ba phrag gsum gyi mthar thug pa'i ste nang du ba spu'i
translated: In the same way, whatever elaborations there are, which are other than the unobstructed bliss, arise in the mandala of the lord of beings, up to the end of the three and a half myriads.

original: mthar thug pa sgrib pa med pa'i khams kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: mthar thug pa sgrib pa med pa'i khams kyi tshogs so //
translated: Up to the end of the pores, the assembly of the unobstructed realm.

original: sems can kun gyi don du mchog gi yon tan rnam mang 'di rnams rang gi lus la rig par bya /
analyzed: sems can kun gyi don du mchog gi yon tan rnam mang 'di rnams rang gi lus la rig par bya /
translated: For the sake of all sentient beings, these many supreme qualities should be known in one’s body.

original: de bzhin rgyud dang sngags ni rnam mang rigs la @215b gnas rnams rnal 'byor ma dang rnal 'byor dbye bas te 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub kyi slad du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin rgyud dang sngags ni rnam mang rigs la @215b gnas rnams rnal 'byor ma dang rnal 'byor dbye bas te 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub kyi slad du'o //
translated: Likewise, the many tantras and mantras are in the families, the yoginīs and yogins, by the division of the worldly and transcendent powers.

original: dus kyi 'khor lo 'dir ni dbang bskur rnam pa gnyis kyang bu yi yon tan dbang gis 'jig rten pa dang bla na med pa'i lam 'dod pa rnams kyi yon tan dbang gis bla na med pa'o zhes pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: dus kyi 'khor lo 'dir ni dbang bskur rnam pa gnyis kyang bu yi yon tan dbang gis 'jig rten pa dang bla na med pa'i lam 'dod pa rnams kyi yon tan dbang gis bla na med pa'o zhes pa nges pa'o //
translated: Here in the Kālacakra, the two types of initiations are also of two types, due to the qualities of the disciple, the worldly and the unexcelled, for those who desire the path of the unexcelled, due to the qualities of the disciple.🔽Now, beginning with “that which is wisdom,” he explains the meaning of the worldly and transcendent initiations. Here, “that which is wisdom” and so on refers to the four initiations:

original: da ni gang zhig shes rab ces pa la sogs pas 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dbang gi don gsungs te 'dir gang zhig rgod pa dang lta ba dang lag pa bcangs pa dang gnyis gnyis 'khyud pa zhes pa ni dbang rnam pa bzhi ste slob
analyzed: da ni gang zhig shes rab ces pa la sogs pas 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dbang gi don gsungs te 'dir gang zhig rgod pa dang lta ba dang lag pa bcangs pa dang gnyis gnyis 'khyud pa zhes pa ni dbang rnam pa bzhi ste slob
translated: the student’s shaking, looking, clapping, and embracing in pairs.

original: dpon dang gsang ba dang shes rab ye shes dang slar yang de bzhin gyi sgras gsungs pa bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: dpon dang gsang ba dang shes rab ye shes dang slar yang de bzhin gyi sgras gsungs pa bzhi pa'o //
translated: The four are mentioned by the words “master,” “secret,” “wisdom-knowledge,” and “again, just so.”

original: de bzhin du 'dus pa la sogs pa las bum pa la sogs pa'i dbang de ni kun rdzob tu slob dpon byed pa'i slad du mtshon pa tsam ste re kho na nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dus pa la sogs pa las bum pa la sogs pa'i dbang de ni kun rdzob tu slob dpon byed pa'i slad du mtshon pa tsam ste re kho na nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: Similarly, in the Guhyasamaja and so on, the water and so on initiations are merely symbolic for the sake of the master’s activity in the conventional sense, but they are not the ultimate reality.

original: dbang bskur nas ni de nyid bshad ces gsungs pa'i phyir rgod pa dang lta ba dang lag pa bcangs pa dang gnyis gnyis sbyor ba zhes pa dbang rnam pa bzhi ni de kho na nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang bskur nas ni de nyid bshad ces gsungs pa'i phyir rgod pa dang lta ba dang lag pa bcangs pa dang gnyis gnyis sbyor ba zhes pa dbang rnam pa bzhi ni de kho na nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Since it is said that “having conferred the initiation, one should explain reality,” the four initiations called “wild, gazing, holding hands, and coupling” are not the ultimate reality.

original: 'dir de kho na nyid ni gnyis gnyis 'khyud pa med pa ste las kyi phyag rgya'i rgyu las skyes pa ni rnam par dpyad na gnyis su med pa'i ye shes su mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir de kho na nyid ni gnyis gnyis 'khyud pa med pa ste las kyi phyag rgya'i rgyu las skyes pa ni rnam par dpyad na gnyis su med pa'i ye shes su mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, reality is not the coupling of the two, but the wisdom that is nondual when analyzed, which is born from the cause of the karmamudra.

original: 'dir gal te shes rab kyi rgyu las skyes pa'i bde ba thabs kyi shes rab ye shes yin na de'i che thabs kyi rgyu las skyes pa ni shes rab kyi thabs ye shes su 'gyur te dngos grub kyi slad du'o //🔽gal te gnyi ga'i ye shes kyi dbye ba las de ltar ye shes gnyis su 'gyur ro zhe na de'i phyir gnyis su med par mi 'gyur te gnyis su med pa med pa'i phyir sangs rgyas nyid med do //
analyzed: 'dir gal te shes rab kyi rgyu las skyes pa'i bde ba thabs kyi shes rab ye shes yin na de'i che thabs kyi rgyu las skyes pa ni shes rab kyi thabs ye shes su 'gyur te dngos grub kyi slad du'o // gal te gnyi ga'i ye shes kyi dbye ba las de ltar ye shes gnyis su 'gyur ro zhe na de'i phyir gnyis su med par mi 'gyur te gnyis su med pa med pa'i phyir sangs rgyas nyid med do //
translated: Here, if the bliss born from the cause of wisdom is the wisdom of the method, then that born from the cause of the method would be the wisdom of the method, because of the power of the result.🔽If the wisdom of the method is the wisdom of the method, and the wisdom of wisdom is the wisdom of wisdom, then the wisdom of the method and the wisdom of wisdom would be two different wisdoms.

original: ci ste shes rab kyi ye shes /
analyzed: ci ste shes rab kyi ye shes /
translated: If that is so, then there would be no nonduality, and because of the nonexistence of nonduality, there would be no buddhahood.

original: shes rab ye shes yin pa de lta na yang skyon te thabs kyi ye shes ni thabs ye shes so zhes grub bo //
analyzed: shes rab ye shes yin pa de lta na yang skyon te thabs kyi ye shes ni thabs ye shes so zhes grub bo //
translated: If the wisdom of wisdom is the wisdom of wisdom, then there is the fault that the wisdom of the method would be the wisdom of the method.

original: de'i phyir thabs kyi 'gyur pa'i bde ba byis pa dang dar ba bab pa rnam pa gnyis dang shes rab kyi g-yo ba'i bde ba rgan po ste gnyis po dag gang gi tshe phyag rgya chen po'i sgo nas mi g-yo bar gyur pa de'i tshe dbang po gnyis
analyzed: de'i phyir thabs kyi 'gyur pa'i bde ba byis pa dang dar ba bab pa rnam pa gnyis dang shes rab kyi g-yo ba'i bde ba rgan po ste gnyis po dag gang gi tshe phyag rgya chen po'i sgo nas mi g-yo bar gyur pa de'i tshe dbang po gnyis
translated: Therefore, when the bliss of the movement of means, which is twofold, of the young and the middle-aged, and the bliss of the movement of wisdom, which is twofold, of the old and the very old, become unmoving through the door of the Great Seal, then the two organs

original: dang bral ba gnyis su med pa'o //
analyzed: dang bral ba gnyis su med pa'o //
translated: are free from the two, nondual.

original: de'i phyir shes rab kyi nu ma la reg pa la @216a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir shes rab kyi nu ma la reg pa la @216a * //
translated: Therefore, touching the breast of wisdom and so forth

original: sogs pa ni lam la gzhug pa'i don du 'jig rten par bstan to //
analyzed: sogs pa ni lam la gzhug pa'i don du 'jig rten par bstan to //
translated: are taught in the world for the sake of engaging the path.

original: 'jig rten 'das pa'i dbang gang mchog gi rgyal ba'i bdag po'i phyag rgya'i mchog la rjes su sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'das pa'i dbang gang mchog gi rgyal ba'i bdag po'i phyag rgya'i mchog la rjes su sbyor ba'o //
translated: The supramundane empowerment is the supreme union with the supreme seal of the lord of victors.

original: de nyid gsungs pa sems kyi snang ba tsam zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa ste go sla'o //
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa sems kyi snang ba tsam zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa ste go sla'o //
translated: That is stated in the verse “mind’s mere appearance” and so on, which is easy to understand.

original: shes rab ye shes zhes pa la sogs pa dgrol bar bya ste 'dir shes rab dang ye shes ni grangs bzhin du 'dzin par byed pa'i sems dang / 'dzin par byed pa'i sems de yi gzung bar bya ba du ba la sogs pa rnam pa bcu po gang yin pa me long la pra phab pa'i snang ba lta bu de nyid ni ye shes te gzung bar bya ba'i sems so zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: shes rab ye shes zhes pa la sogs pa dgrol bar bya ste 'dir shes rab dang ye shes ni grangs bzhin du 'dzin par byed pa'i sems dang / 'dzin par byed pa'i sems de yi gzung bar bya ba du ba la sogs pa rnam pa bcu po gang yin pa me long la pra phab pa'i snang ba lta bu de nyid ni ye shes te gzung bar bya ba'i sems so zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Here, wisdom is the mind that apprehends, and intuition is the object of that apprehending mind, which is the ten aspects such as smoke, etc., which are like the appearances in a mirror.

original: de ltar me long la rang gi mig gi gzugs brnyan ni rang gi mig gi gzung bar bya ba yin pa de bzhin du shes rab ye shes kyang ngo //
analyzed: de ltar me long la rang gi mig gi gzugs brnyan ni rang gi mig gi gzung bar bya ba yin pa de bzhin du shes rab ye shes kyang ngo //
translated: Just as the reflection of one's eye is the object of one's eye, so is the intuition of wisdom.

original: dbang bskur 'di la zhugs pa gang yin pa zhes pa ni 'dir 'dzin par byed pa'i sems kyi gzung bar bya ba'i sems de la rab tu zhugs pa ni phyi rol gyi yul rnams la rab tu mi 'jug pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dbang bskur 'di la zhugs pa gang yin pa zhes pa ni 'dir 'dzin par byed pa'i sems kyi gzung bar bya ba'i sems de la rab tu zhugs pa ni phyi rol gyi yul rnams la rab tu mi 'jug pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: One who has entered this consecration means that one who has entered that mind which is the object of the apprehending mind does not enter into external objects.

original: yan lag drug las so sor sdud pa dang bsam gtan dang srog rtsol dang 'dzin pa ni zhugs pa zhes brjod cing zhugs pa de las mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba 'pho med lhan cig skyes pa 'gyur med nyid ni bzhi pa ste zhes pa bde ba🔽byis pa dang dar la bab pa dang g-yo ba rnams kyi mchog 'jig rten pa'i dpe las 'das pa 'jig rten gsum gyi spyod pa las grol ba zhes pa'i don te rgod pa dang lta ba dang reg pa dang 'khyud pa dang lag pa bcangs pas 'khrig pa
analyzed: yan lag drug las so sor sdud pa dang bsam gtan dang srog rtsol dang 'dzin pa ni zhugs pa zhes brjod cing zhugs pa de las mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba 'pho med lhan cig skyes pa 'gyur med nyid ni bzhi pa ste zhes pa bde ba byis pa dang dar la bab pa dang g-yo ba rnams kyi mchog 'jig rten pa'i dpe las 'das pa 'jig rten gsum gyi spyod pa las grol ba zhes pa'i don te rgod pa dang lta ba dang reg pa dang 'khyud pa dang lag pa bcangs pas 'khrig pa

It is free from the conduct of the three worlds.

original: sangs rgyas zhal te ye shes la zhal 'di slob dpon gang gi thugs la gnas pa zhes pa bsgoms pa ste rang gis nyams su myong ba dang slob ma rnams la bstan pa'i slad du dus thams cad du zhal la gnas par gyur pa de ni dpal ldan
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhal te ye shes la zhal 'di slob dpon gang gi thugs la gnas pa zhes pa bsgoms pa ste rang gis nyams su myong ba dang slob ma rnams la bstan pa'i slad du dus thams cad du zhal la gnas par gyur pa de ni dpal ldan
translated: That face, which abides at all times, is the glorious

original: bla ma ste rdo rje 'dzin pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: bla ma ste rdo rje 'dzin pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: guru, that is, the Vajra Holder.

original: gzhan dbang po gnyis kyi bde ba rtogs par byed pa po rnams ni ma @216b yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dbang po gnyis kyi bde ba rtogs par byed pa po rnams ni ma @216b yin no //
translated: It is not the case that the other [masters] who are the realizers of the bliss of the two organs are [the glorious guru].

original: da ni nam mkhar zhes pa la sogs pas rang gi sems 'di'i snang ba la rab tu gzhug pa gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni nam mkhar zhes pa la sogs pas rang gi sems 'di'i snang ba la rab tu gzhug pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, beginning with “in the sky,” he teaches the appearance of this mind.

original: 'dir sngags kyi theg pa dang pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa la rnal 'byor goms pa rnam pa gnyis te nam mkha' dang bla gab med pa la rnal 'byor goms pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir sngags kyi theg pa dang pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa la rnal 'byor goms pa rnam pa gnyis te nam mkha' dang bla gab med pa la rnal 'byor goms pa'o //
translated: Here, in the Mantra Vehicle and the Perfection Vehicle, there are two kinds of yogic practice: the practice of yoga in the sky and in the open air.

original: gang zhig nam mkha' la rnal 'byor goms par byed pa des mtshan mo bug pa med pa'i khyim du mun pa la nam mkhar kun nas zhen pa'i sems dang mig mi 'dzums shing rdo rje'i lam du rab tu zhugs pa zhes pa 'dir dbu mar srog rab tu
analyzed: gang zhig nam mkha' la rnal 'byor goms par byed pa des mtshan mo bug pa med pa'i khyim du mun pa la nam mkhar kun nas zhen pa'i sems dang mig mi 'dzums shing rdo rje'i lam du rab tu zhugs pa zhes pa 'dir dbu mar srog rab tu
translated: Whoever cultivates yoga in space, at night in a house without holes, in the darkness, with the mind and eyes focused on space, and enters the vajra path,

original: zhugs pas stong pa kho na las du ba la sogs pa'i mtshan ma mthong ste nam mkhar kun nas zhen pa'i sems dang mig ni mi 'dzums rdo rje'i lam du rab tu zhugs pas stong pa las ni du ba smig rgyu rab gsal dri ma med pa'i mkha'
analyzed: zhugs pas stong pa kho na las du ba la sogs pa'i mtshan ma mthong ste nam mkhar kun nas zhen pa'i sems dang mig ni mi 'dzums rdo rje'i lam du rab tu zhugs pas stong pa las ni du ba smig rgyu rab gsal dri ma med pa'i mkha'
translated: here, by the life-force entering the central channel, one sees the signs of smoke and so forth only from emptiness. With the mind and eyes focused on space, not closing, and entering the vajra path, from emptiness, one sees smoke, mirage, clear spotless space

original: snang nyid dang mar me dang zhes pa ni mtshan mo'i rnal 'byor gyis mthong ngo //
analyzed: snang nyid dang mar me dang zhes pa ni mtshan mo'i rnal 'byor gyis mthong ngo //
translated: luminosity, and a lamp. This is seen by the yoga of night.🔽Then, looking at a cloudless sky, from that sky, by the yoga of day, one sees the sign of the moon.

original: de nas sprin med pa'i nam mkha' la blta ste nam mkha' de las kyang nyin mo'i rnal 'byor gyis nam mkha' las byung rang byung ba /
analyzed: de nas sprin med pa'i nam mkha' la blta ste nam mkha' de las kyang nyin mo'i rnal 'byor gyis nam mkha' las byung rang byung ba /
translated: Arisen from space, self-arisen,

original: shes rab ye shes me bo che zhes pa 'bar ba mthong ste sprin med pa'i nam mkha' la'o //
analyzed: shes rab ye shes me bo che zhes pa 'bar ba mthong ste sprin med pa'i nam mkha' la'o //
translated: The great fire of the wisdom-gnosis is seen to blaze, in the cloudless sky.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Similarly,

original: 'od chen rnam par snang par byed //
analyzed: 'od chen rnam par snang par byed //
translated: the great light illuminates.

original: ye shes snang ba lam me ba ni zla ba snang ba'o //
analyzed: ye shes snang ba lam me ba ni zla ba snang ba'o //
translated: The shining light of gnosis is the moon.

original: 'gro ba'i mar me ni nyi ma'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i mar me ni nyi ma'o //
translated: The lamp of beings is the sun.

original: ye shes sgron ni rdo rje ste sgra gcan no //
analyzed: ye shes sgron ni rdo rje ste sgra gcan no //
translated: The lamp of gnosis is the vajra, i.e., Rāhu.

original: gzi brjid chen po 'od gsal ba ni glog ste mchog gi cha'o //
analyzed: gzi brjid chen po 'od gsal ba ni glog ste mchog gi cha'o //
translated: The great splendor is the shining light, i.e., the supreme portion of lightning.

original: sngags mchog mnga' bdag rig sngags rgyal ni thig le'o //
analyzed: sngags mchog mnga' bdag rig sngags rgyal ni thig le'o //
translated: The lord of supreme mantras, the king of awareness mantras, is the bindu.

original: de ltar mtshan ma rnam pa bcu ste 'dus pa la sogs pa las mtshan mo'i rnal 'byor dang mtshan yang dag par brjod pa las nyin mo'i rnal 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: de ltar mtshan ma rnam pa bcu ste 'dus pa la sogs pa las mtshan mo'i rnal 'byor dang mtshan yang dag par brjod pa las nyin mo'i rnal 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
translated: Thus, there are ten signs. The Bhagavān has taught them in the Guhyasamāja and so forth, with the yoga of the night, and in the Nāmasaṃgīti, with the yoga of the day.

original: de nas gsang sngags rgyal po don chen byed ces pa ni bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad pa'i gzugs mthong ba'o //
analyzed: de nas gsang sngags rgyal po don chen byed ces pa ni bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad pa'i gzugs mthong ba'o //
translated: Then, the king of mantras, the great meaning-maker, is seeing the form of all aspects, such as the vase, cloth, and so forth.

original: de'i dbus su ste /
analyzed: de'i dbus su ste /
translated: In the middle of that,

original: thig le'i dbus su sangs rgyas gzugs ni rdzas med pa'i phyir dang brtags pa med pa'i phyir yul dang rnam par bral ba du ma longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //🔽de nas gzugs kyi rnal 'byor gyis gzhom du med pa'i sgra gang yin pa de nyid thos te de ltar gzugs snang ba @217a * //
analyzed: thig le'i dbus su sangs rgyas gzugs ni rdzas med pa'i phyir dang brtags pa med pa'i phyir yul dang rnam par bral ba du ma longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o // de nas gzugs kyi rnal 'byor gyis gzhom du med pa'i sgra gang yin pa de nyid thos te de ltar gzugs snang ba @217a * //
translated: In the middle of the bindu, the form of the Buddha is the sambhogakāya, which is free from objects and aspects because it is not a substance and is not imputed.

original: las sprul pa'i sku dang sgra snang ba las longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: las sprul pa'i sku dang sgra snang ba las longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Then, through the yoga of form, one hears the sound that is invincible. Thus, the nirmāṇakāya is from the appearance of form, and the sambhogakāya is from the appearance of sound.🔽This is the meaning.

original: 'dir nyin mo'i rnal 'byor ni nam mkha' chu 'dzin bral ba dag la rnal 'byor pa yis bgrad pa'i mig gis blta bar bya ba ste snga dro dang phyi dro nyi ma la rgyab bstan nas so //
analyzed: 'dir nyin mo'i rnal 'byor ni nam mkha' chu 'dzin bral ba dag la rnal 'byor pa yis bgrad pa'i mig gis blta bar bya ba ste snga dro dang phyi dro nyi ma la rgyab bstan nas so //
translated: Here, the yoga of the day is that the yogi should look with wide-open eyes at a clear sky free from clouds, in the morning and evening, facing the sun.

original: rnam pa gzhan du na nyi ma'i 'od zer gyis rab rib tu 'gyur te de yis zhes pa ni gnod pa las so //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du na nyi ma'i 'od zer gyis rab rib tu 'gyur te de yis zhes pa ni gnod pa las so //
translated: Otherwise, the eyes will be damaged by the sun’s rays.

original: nyi ma so sor blta bar bya ste thig le'i dbus su re kh'a nag po skra'i tshad tsam dri med 'od zer 'phro ba dus kyi rtsa zhes pa aa ba dh'u t'i la mthong bar gyur gyi bar du'o //
analyzed: nyi ma so sor blta bar bya ste thig le'i dbus su re kh'a nag po skra'i tshad tsam dri med 'od zer 'phro ba dus kyi rtsa zhes pa aa ba dh'u t'i la mthong bar gyur gyi bar du'o //
translated: One should look at it every day, until one sees in the center of the drop a black line the size of a hair, radiating stainless light rays, called the “time channel,” that is, the central channel.

original: nang du 'dus pa kun mkhyen gzugs ni khams gsum po ma lus pa chu la nyi ma lta bu gos pa med pa kha dog sna tshogs te /
analyzed: nang du 'dus pa kun mkhyen gzugs ni khams gsum po ma lus pa chu la nyi ma lta bu gos pa med pa kha dog sna tshogs te /
translated: The form of the Omniscient One, gathered within, is the entire three worlds, like the sun in the water, unstained, of various colors,

original: rnam pa kun ldan rang sems yul dang rnam par bral ba dag go //
analyzed: rnam pa kun ldan rang sems yul dang rnam par bral ba dag go //
translated: endowed with all aspects, one’s own mind, free from objects and aspects, pure.

original: gzhan gyi sems ni min pa nyid ces pa gzhan gyi sems ni ma yin te gzhan gyi sems shes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems ni min pa nyid ces pa gzhan gyi sems ni ma yin te gzhan gyi sems shes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Not the mind of another” means it is not the mind of another, because there is no knowledge of another’s mind.

original: 'dir de bzhin gshegs pa'i sha'i spyan gyis dang por rang gi sems kyi snang ba mthong zhing lha la sogs pa'i spyan gyis gzhan gyi sems kyi shes pa mthong ste des na chos yang dag par sdud pa las bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan lnga zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dir de bzhin gshegs pa'i sha'i spyan gyis dang por rang gi sems kyi snang ba mthong zhing lha la sogs pa'i spyan gyis gzhan gyi sems kyi shes pa mthong ste des na chos yang dag par sdud pa las bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan lnga zhes gsungs so //
translated: Here, the tathāgata first sees the appearances of his own mind with the fleshly eye, and with the divine eye and so forth he sees the consciousnesses of other minds. Therefore, in the Dharmasaṃgīti Sūtra, the Bhagavat spoke of the five eyes.

original: de ltar rim pas sha'i spyan dang lha'i spyan dang sangs rgyas kyi spyan dang shes rab kyi spyan dang ye shes kyi spyan ni bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar rim pas sha'i spyan dang lha'i spyan dang sangs rgyas kyi spyan dang shes rab kyi spyan dang ye shes kyi spyan ni bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, in stages, the fleshly eye, the divine eye, the buddha eye, the wisdom eye, and the gnosis eye arise through the power of meditation.

original: de'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pas ma gzigs pa cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pas ma gzigs pa cung zad kyang med do //
translated: Therefore, there is nothing whatsoever that is not seen by the omniscient one.

original: de nas gzugs ni mthong bar gyur na nyin zhag so so'i dus su srog gi rlung ni 'gog pa zhes pa bum pa can rab tu bya ste 'od zer 'khor lo rang gi lus la yongs su bskor zhing 'khor par byed pa mthong gi bar du'o zhes pa
analyzed: de nas gzugs ni mthong bar gyur na nyin zhag so so'i dus su srog gi rlung ni 'gog pa zhes pa bum pa can rab tu bya ste 'od zer 'khor lo rang gi lus la yongs su bskor zhing 'khor par byed pa mthong gi bar du'o zhes pa
translated: Then, when forms are seen, one should practice the “cessation of the life-force vāyu” every day, which is the vase yoga, until one sees the light-circle cakra completely surrounding one’s body.

original: sngar brjod pa'i gzugs las nang du'o //🔽de nas zla ba drug gis sngom brtson te las dang po pa'i tshangs par spyod pa rnams la reg byas dman pa zhes pa dbang po gnyis kyi 'khrig pa dang bral ba'i bde ba mnyam pa ste mi 'gyur pa'i bde ba lam gyi sems zhes pa stong pa
analyzed: sngar brjod pa'i gzugs las nang du'o // de nas zla ba drug gis sngom brtson te las dang po pa'i tshangs par spyod pa rnams la reg byas dman pa zhes pa dbang po gnyis kyi 'khrig pa dang bral ba'i bde ba mnyam pa ste mi 'gyur pa'i bde ba lam gyi sems zhes pa stong pa
translated: From the form previously described, in the inner.

original: nyid kyi gzugs kyi sems su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyid kyi gzugs kyi sems su 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, in six months, the ascetic, the beginner, the celibate, the inferior tactile, the bliss free from the union of the two organs, the unchanging bliss, the mind of the path, the mind of the form of emptiness, will become the mind of the form of emptiness.🔽Then, in one instant, the characteristic of manifest complete enlightenment is the extreme of attachment and the extreme of nonattachment, the instant.

original: de nas skad cig gcig gis mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i mtshan nyid ni chags @217b dang chags bral mtha' thog la gnas skad cig ma zhes pa la chags pa zhes pa ni dkar po'i phyogs te de'i mthar gnas pa ni cha bcu drug pa'i mtshan nyid
analyzed: de nas skad cig gcig gis mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i mtshan nyid ni chags @217b dang chags bral mtha' thog la gnas skad cig ma zhes pa la chags pa zhes pa ni dkar po'i phyogs te de'i mthar gnas pa ni cha bcu drug pa'i mtshan nyid
translated: The attachment is the bright side, and abiding at its end is the characteristic of the sixteenth part.

original: do // chags bral ni nag po'o //
analyzed: do // chags bral ni nag po'o //
translated: The nonattachment is the dark side.

original: de'i dang po la gnas pa ni nag po'i phyogs la ma zhugs pa ste mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i dus kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de'i dang po la gnas pa ni nag po'i phyogs la ma zhugs pa ste mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i dus kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: Abiding at its beginning is the characteristic of the time of manifest complete enlightenment, not entering the dark side.

original: skad cig ma de nyid kyang dbugs kyi grangs zhes pa nyi khri chig stong drug brgya'i grangs 'phel lo //
analyzed: skad cig ma de nyid kyang dbugs kyi grangs zhes pa nyi khri chig stong drug brgya'i grangs 'phel lo //
translated: In that very instant, the number of breaths increases by the number called twenty-one thousand six hundred.

original: gsang bar rdo rje nor bu'i rtse mo las skad cig ma brgya phrag sum cu rtsa drug gis 'phel to //
analyzed: gsang bar rdo rje nor bu'i rtse mo las skad cig ma brgya phrag sum cu rtsa drug gis 'phel to //
translated: In the secret place, the tip of the vajra jewel, the instant increases by thirty-six hundred.

original: de'i grangs kyi srog rnams bsad nas gsang ba'i padmar phyin pa des sa gnyis su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i grangs kyi srog rnams bsad nas gsang ba'i padmar phyin pa des sa gnyis su 'gyur ro //
translated: Having killed the number of those vital drops, it arrives at the secret lotus, and that is the second stage.

original: de bzhin du lte ba dang snying ga dang mgrin pa dang dpral bar bzhi dang drug dang brgyad dang sa bcu rnams su 'gyur zhing gtsug tor du srog thams cad zad pas sa bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: de bzhin du lte ba dang snying ga dang mgrin pa dang dpral bar bzhi dang drug dang brgyad dang sa bcu rnams su 'gyur zhing gtsug tor du srog thams cad zad pas sa bcu gnyis so //
translated: In the same way, at the navel, heart, throat, and forehead, there are four, six, eight, and ten stages, and at the crown, all vital drops are exhausted, so there are twelve stages.

original: de'i phyir ao dd'a 'bar ba'i bar te gsang bar 'ongs pa dang khyad par dga' ba lhan skyes dag gi dbus lte ba dang gnyid dang gnyid yur gyi mtshams snying ga dang ye shes rnam shes dag gi dbus mgrin par gnyis gnyis sbyor ba la /
analyzed: de'i phyir ao dd'a 'bar ba'i bar te gsang bar 'ongs pa dang khyad par dga' ba lhan skyes dag gi dbus lte ba dang gnyid dang gnyid yur gyi mtshams snying ga dang ye shes rnam shes dag gi dbus mgrin par gnyis gnyis sbyor ba la /
translated: Therefore, up to the blazing of the oṃ, having arrived at the secret place, the two special innate joys are in the center of the navel, sleep and the end of sleep are in the center of the heart, and the two of pristine consciousness and consciousness are in the center of the throat.

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs dang ye shes kyi thig le'i gzugs kyis dpral ba nas 'ongs pa'i bde ba gang yin pa khu ba'i bde ba de yi 'phel ba ste steng du 'gro bar rab tu bya'o //
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs dang ye shes kyi thig le'i gzugs kyis dpral ba nas 'ongs pa'i bde ba gang yin pa khu ba'i bde ba de yi 'phel ba ste steng du 'gro bar rab tu bya'o //
translated: The increase of that bliss of the seminal drop, which is the bliss of the seminal drop, which is the bliss that comes from the forehead by the form of the seminal drop of body, speech, mind, and gnosis, should be made to go upward.

original: bla ma'i nges pa'i dbang gis zhes pa sngar gsungs pa'i srog 'gog pa las dpral ba'i bar du 'phel bar 'gyur te 'di la ngo mtshar med do //
analyzed: bla ma'i nges pa'i dbang gis zhes pa sngar gsungs pa'i srog 'gog pa las dpral ba'i bar du 'phel bar 'gyur te 'di la ngo mtshar med do //
translated: By the power of the guru’s certainty, the increase to the forehead from the stopping of the life-force as previously explained, there is no wonder here.

original: de ltar nyon mongs bdud rnams bcom nas rgyal ba'i bdag por 'jug ste zhes pa g-yon dang g-yas par song ba'i srog rnams bsad nas rgyal ba'i bdag po stong pa nyid kyi gzugs la 'jug ste lo yi sbyor bas rnal 'byor pa bzang po aa ba dh'u t'i
analyzed: de ltar nyon mongs bdud rnams bcom nas rgyal ba'i bdag por 'jug ste zhes pa g-yon dang g-yas par song ba'i srog rnams bsad nas rgyal ba'i bdag po stong pa nyid kyi gzugs la 'jug ste lo yi sbyor bas rnal 'byor pa bzang po aa ba dh'u t'i
translated: Thus, having conquered the demons of the afflictions, one enters into the lord of victors, having killed the life-forces that go to the left and right, one enters into the lord of victors, the form of emptiness.

original: la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: la gnas pa'o //
translated: By the yoga of the year, the good yogī abides in the avadhūti.

original: de'i phyir bum pa can gyis bde ba chen po'i skad cig bskyed nas bde ba 'phel bar bya'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bum pa can gyis bde ba chen po'i skad cig bskyed nas bde ba 'phel bar bya'o zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: Therefore, having generated the moment of great bliss by the vase-shaped holding, the increase of bliss should be made. This is the certainty.

original: da ni sa zhes pa la sogs pas gzugs kyi mtshan nyid gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni sa zhes pa la sogs pas gzugs kyi mtshan nyid gsungs te /
translated: Now, beginning with “earth,” he teaches the characteristics of form.

original: 'dir stong pa rab tu snang ba rdzas med pa sa yi rnam par mthong ste sra ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir stong pa rab tu snang ba rdzas med pa sa yi rnam par mthong ste sra ba ma yin no //
translated: Here, one sees the aspect of earth as empty, insubstantial, and not solid.

original: zhu ba chu'i rnam pa ni @218a * //
analyzed: zhu ba chu'i rnam pa ni @218a * //
translated: The aspect of water is fluidity.

original: smig rgyu'i chu bzhin du chu yang ma yin te gsher ba nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smig rgyu'i chu bzhin du chu yang ma yin te gsher ba nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Like a mirage, water is not water, because it lacks liquidity.

original: de bzhin du me'i rnam pa ni me min no //
analyzed: de bzhin du me'i rnam pa ni me min no //
translated: Similarly, the aspect of fire is not fire.

original: g-yo ba rlung gi lus ni rdzas med ba'i phyir gang zhig g-yo ba med pa'i de ni rlung ma yin no //
analyzed: g-yo ba rlung gi lus ni rdzas med ba'i phyir gang zhig g-yo ba med pa'i de ni rlung ma yin no //
translated: The body of wind, which moves, is not wind, because it lacks movement.

original: rdzas med pa'i phyir stong pa'i rnam pa yin pa de lta na yang mthong ngo //
analyzed: rdzas med pa'i phyir stong pa'i rnam pa yin pa de lta na yang mthong ngo //
translated: Although it is the aspect of emptiness, it is seen because it is insubstantial.

original: sgyu ma'i grong khyer bzhin du dkar po la sogs pa'i kha dog dang ldan yang rdzas med pa'i phyir kha dog ma yin no //
analyzed: sgyu ma'i grong khyer bzhin du dkar po la sogs pa'i kha dog dang ldan yang rdzas med pa'i phyir kha dog ma yin no //
translated: Like an illusory city, it has the color of white, etc., but it is not color, because it is insubstantial.

original: rnam pa kun ldan yin yang dus thams cad du byis pa rnams kyis mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa kun ldan yin yang dus thams cad du byis pa rnams kyis mthong ba yin no //
translated: Although it has all aspects, it is seen by the childish at all times.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: nyon mongs bdud kyi mthu las te g-yon pa dang g-yas pa'i rtsa las rog rab tu rgyu ba las so zhes pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs bdud kyi mthu las te g-yon pa dang g-yas pa'i rtsa las rog rab tu rgyu ba las so zhes pa nges pa'o //
translated: From the power of the demon of affliction, that is, from the movement of the left and right channels.

original: da ni n'a da zhes pa la sogs pas rtsa'i bgrod pa'i skad du gnas gsungs te 'dir n'a da ni snying gar thugs kyi thig le shin tu gnyid log pa'i gnas skabs skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: da ni n'a da zhes pa la sogs pas rtsa'i bgrod pa'i skad du gnas gsungs te 'dir n'a da ni snying gar thugs kyi thig le shin tu gnyid log pa'i gnas skabs skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: Now, beginning with “The nāḍī,” he teaches the locations of the movement of the nāḍīs. Here, the nāḍī is the place of the bindu of mind in the heart, which generates the state of deep sleep.

original: thig le zhes pa ni dpral bar sku'i thig le sad pa'i gnas skabs skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: thig le zhes pa ni dpral bar sku'i thig le sad pa'i gnas skabs skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: The bindu is the place of the bindu of body in the forehead, which generates the state of waking.

original: cha zhes pa ni mgrin par gsung gi thig le rmi lam skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: cha zhes pa ni mgrin par gsung gi thig le rmi lam skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: The part is the place of the bindu of speech in the throat, which generates dreams.

original: ye shes zhes pa ni lte bar ye shes kyi thig le bzhi pa'i gnas skabs skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes zhes pa ni lte bar ye shes kyi thig le bzhi pa'i gnas skabs skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: The gnosis is the place of the bindu of gnosis in the navel, which generates the fourth state.

original: bdud rtsi'i gnas su son pa lu gu rgyud du bcings pa'i rtsa zhes pa la bdud rtsi'i gnas ni dpral ba'o //
analyzed: bdud rtsi'i gnas su son pa lu gu rgyud du bcings pa'i rtsa zhes pa la bdud rtsi'i gnas ni dpral ba'o //
translated: The nāḍī that reaches the place of amṛta is the bound chain. The place of amṛta is the forehead.

original: der son pa ni bdud rtsi'i gnas su son pa ste la la n'a dang ra sa n'a dang aa ba dh'u t'i'o //
analyzed: der son pa ni bdud rtsi'i gnas su son pa ste la la n'a dang ra sa n'a dang aa ba dh'u t'i'o //
translated: Reaching there is reaching the place of nectar, which is the lalanā, rasanā, and avadhūtī.

original: de rnams kyang lu gu rgyud du bcings pas lte ba dang snying ga'i bar du lam gsum byas nas slar yang aa ba dh'u t'i ni dbus su snying ga'i lte ba phug nas 'gro'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyang lu gu rgyud du bcings pas lte ba dang snying ga'i bar du lam gsum byas nas slar yang aa ba dh'u t'i ni dbus su snying ga'i lte ba phug nas 'gro'o //
translated: Since those are bound in a chain, after making three paths between the navel and the heart, they again enter the center of the avadhūtī, piercing the center of the heart.

original: la la n'a dang ra sa n'a ni g-yon dang g-yas kyi 'dab mar rab tu rgyu bas so //
analyzed: la la n'a dang ra sa n'a ni g-yon dang g-yas kyi 'dab mar rab tu rgyu bas so //
translated: The lalanā and rasanā move through the left and right petals.

original: de nas snying ga'i dang mgrin pa'i bar du slar yang lam gsum byas nas 'gro'o //
analyzed: de nas snying ga'i dang mgrin pa'i bar du slar yang lam gsum byas nas 'gro'o //
translated: Then, after making three paths between the heart and the throat, they move again.

original: de bzhin du mgrin pa dang dpral ba'i bar du lam gsum dang dpral ba dang gtsug tor gyi bar du lam gsum ste de ltar lam gsum bzhi byas nas la la n'a ni sna g-yon pa'i bu gnas gzhan gyi gnas su bcu gnyis mtha' dang cha'i mthar 'gro
analyzed: de bzhin du mgrin pa dang dpral ba'i bar du lam gsum dang dpral ba dang gtsug tor gyi bar du lam gsum ste de ltar lam gsum bzhi byas nas la la n'a ni sna g-yon pa'i bu gnas gzhan gyi gnas su bcu gnyis mtha' dang cha'i mthar 'gro
translated: Similarly, there are three paths between the throat and the forehead and three paths between the forehead and the crown. Thus, after making three sets of three paths, the lalanā moves to the left nostril and the rasanā moves to the right nostril.

original: ste nang gi le'u las gsungs so //
analyzed: ste nang gi le'u las gsungs so //
translated: The other locations are explained in the Inner chapter.

original: ra sa n'a ni g-yas nas so //
analyzed: ra sa n'a ni g-yas nas so //
translated: The rasana is on the right.

original: aa ba dh'u t'i ni cig car sna bug @218b gnyis nas 'gro'o //
analyzed: aa ba dh'u t'i ni cig car sna bug @218b gnyis nas 'gro'o //
translated: The avadhuti moves through both nostrils simultaneously.

original: de bzhin du 'og tu lte ba dang gsang ba'i bar du lam gsum byas nas bshad ba dang gci ba'i rtsa ni g-yon dang g-yas nas song ste gsang ba'i padma la dbus su dung can ma'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'og tu lte ba dang gsang ba'i bar du lam gsum byas nas bshad ba dang gci ba'i rtsa ni g-yon dang g-yas nas song ste gsang ba'i padma la dbus su dung can ma'o //
translated: Similarly, below, between the navel and the secret cakra, there are three paths. The feces and urine channels move on the left and right and the conch-shaped channel is in the center of the secret lotus.

original: gsang ba'i padma'i 'og tu dri chen gyi rtsa dbus nas 'gro ste rtags sam bha ga la g-yon nas gci ba'i rtsa 'gro zhing g-yas nas khu ba'i rtsa 'gro'o //
analyzed: gsang ba'i padma'i 'og tu dri chen gyi rtsa dbus nas 'gro ste rtags sam bha ga la g-yon nas gci ba'i rtsa 'gro zhing g-yas nas khu ba'i rtsa 'gro'o //
translated: Below the secret lotus, the feces channel moves in the center and the urine channel moves on the left and the semen channel moves on the right of the bhaga.

original: rtsa'i kun du spyod pa ni nang gi le'u las sngar gsungs so //
analyzed: rtsa'i kun du spyod pa ni nang gi le'u las sngar gsungs so //
translated: The conduct of the channels was previously explained in the chapter on the inner elements.

original: de ltar srog dang thur sel lam gsum zhes pa rnams zhes pa ste steng du srog gi g-yon dang g-yas dang dbu ma'i lam rnams dang 'og tu thur sel gyi bshang ba dang gci ba dang khu ba'i lam rnams so //
analyzed: de ltar srog dang thur sel lam gsum zhes pa rnams zhes pa ste steng du srog gi g-yon dang g-yas dang dbu ma'i lam rnams dang 'og tu thur sel gyi bshang ba dang gci ba dang khu ba'i lam rnams so //
translated: Thus, the life-force, downward-voiding, and three paths are the upper path of the life-force on the left, right, and middle and the lower path of the downward-voiding, which is the path of feces, urine, and semen.

original: rdo rje dang bcas padma ni bu med rnams kyi skye gnas te g-yo ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rdo rje dang bcas padma ni bu med rnams kyi skye gnas te g-yo ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The lotus with the vajra is the womb of those without sons, because of its mobility.

original: nor bu dang bcas pa'i rdo rje ni 'gyur pa'i phyir te chu skyes ldan pa nyid ni kha 'byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nor bu dang bcas pa'i rdo rje ni 'gyur pa'i phyir te chu skyes ldan pa nyid ni kha 'byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The vajra with the jewel is the womb of those with sons, because of its transformation. The possession of the lotus is the womb of those with sons and daughters, because of its opening.

original: rlung gnyis yang dag phrad pa'i dbus su zhes pa lte bar srog dang thur sel gyi rlung yang dag par phrad pa'i dbus su yul zhes pa rnam dbye med pa'i tshig ste yul rnams la yul can mig la sogs pa rnams 'byung ba dang rab tu 'jug pa
analyzed: rlung gnyis yang dag phrad pa'i dbus su zhes pa lte bar srog dang thur sel gyi rlung yang dag par phrad pa'i dbus su yul zhes pa rnam dbye med pa'i tshig ste yul rnams la yul can mig la sogs pa rnams 'byung ba dang rab tu 'jug pa
translated: In the middle of the union of the two winds, in the navel, in the middle of the union of the life-force and downward-voiding winds, the objects, a word without a case ending, the objects, the eye, etc., arise and enter.

original: ni lte bar te de nyid ni sngar brjod zin to //
analyzed: ni lte bar te de nyid ni sngar brjod zin to //
translated: In the navel, that has been mentioned before.

original: du ba la sogs rnams kyi mtshan ma 'dzin pa ni aa ba dh'u t'i'i sgo nas te kyang gi sgras lte ba de nyid la'o //
analyzed: du ba la sogs rnams kyi mtshan ma 'dzin pa ni aa ba dh'u t'i'i sgo nas te kyang gi sgras lte ba de nyid la'o //
translated: The apprehension of the signs of smoke, etc., is through the door of the avadhūtī, and also in the navel itself, the word “also” indicating that.

original: 'di rnams thams cad gsang bar bya ste byis pa'i skye bo rnams la sba bar bya'o zhes pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams thams cad gsang bar bya ste byis pa'i skye bo rnams la sba bar bya'o zhes pa nges pa'o //
translated: All of this should be kept secret, and should be kept from the childish, is the conclusion.

original: da ni dbu mar srog ces pa la sogs pas rnal 'byor nye bar bsdu ba gsungs te 'dir dang por rnal 'byor pas dbu mar srog ni rab tu gzhug par bya ste gang gis mtshan ma mthong bar 'gyur pa aa ba dh'u t'i ra ro //
analyzed: da ni dbu mar srog ces pa la sogs pas rnal 'byor nye bar bsdu ba gsungs te 'dir dang por rnal 'byor pas dbu mar srog ni rab tu gzhug par bya ste gang gis mtshan ma mthong bar 'gyur pa aa ba dh'u t'i ra ro //
translated: Now, beginning with “the life-force in the central channel,” he teaches the yoga of withdrawal. Here, first, the yogī should enter the life-force into the central channel, by which the signs will be seen.

original: 'di ni dpal ldan bla ma zhes pa sangs rgyas kyi sku rdo rje ste zhal gcig tu brjod do //
analyzed: 'di ni dpal ldan bla ma zhes pa sangs rgyas kyi sku rdo rje ste zhal gcig tu brjod do //
translated: This is the glorious guru, the body vajra of the Buddha, who is said to have one face.

original: de nas nyi ma dang bcas te g-yas pa'i bgrod pa dang lhan cig tu ri bong can gyi bgrod pa zhes pa g-yon gyi rtsa'i bgrod pa la srog bcings pa'o zhes pa nges pa ste srog rtsol ni gnyis pa gsung rdo rje'o //
analyzed: de nas nyi ma dang bcas te g-yas pa'i bgrod pa dang lhan cig tu ri bong can gyi bgrod pa zhes pa g-yon gyi rtsa'i bgrod pa la srog bcings pa'o zhes pa nges pa ste srog rtsol ni gnyis pa gsung rdo rje'o //
translated: Then, together with the sun, the life-force is bound in the path of the rabbit, that is, the path of the left channel, together with the right path. This is the ascertainment. The life-force control is the second, the speech vajra.

original: phyag rgya rab tu 'grogs la sems zhes pa gzugs la rjes su chags pa byang chub kyi sems zhu ba dang mchog gi bde ba la gnas rdo rje yang dag @219a * //
analyzed: phyag rgya rab tu 'grogs la sems zhes pa gzugs la rjes su chags pa byang chub kyi sems zhu ba dang mchog gi bde ba la gnas rdo rje yang dag @219a * //
translated: “The mind in the consort’s path” is the melting of the bodhicitta through passion for form and abiding in supreme bliss. The vajra is fully raised.

original: bslang ba yang gsum pa thugs kyi zhal lo //
analyzed: bslang ba yang gsum pa thugs kyi zhal lo //
translated: This is the third, the mind face.

original: ci ste gzugs kyi sgo nas dga' bar ma gyur na de'i tshe padmar rdo rje'i sgra'am zhes pa dal bu dag gis bya'o //
analyzed: ci ste gzugs kyi sgo nas dga' bar ma gyur na de'i tshe padmar rdo rje'i sgra'am zhes pa dal bu dag gis bya'o //
translated: If one does not become pleased by way of form, then at that time one should do it slowly with the sound of the vajra in the lotus.

original: ci ste bud med ma rnyed na de'i tshe rang gi lag pa'i padmas gsor bar bya'o //
analyzed: ci ste bud med ma rnyed na de'i tshe rang gi lag pa'i padmas gsor bar bya'o //
translated: If one does not find a woman, then at that time one should do it with one's own lotus hand.

original: bde ba 'phel ba'i slad du ste ltung ba'i slad du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bde ba 'phel ba'i slad du ste ltung ba'i slad du ni ma yin no //
translated: For the sake of increasing bliss, not for the sake of emission.

original: de ltar sa bon gtong ba min pa'i bde ba de ni 'chi ba'i 'jigs 'phrog tu 'gyur zhing 'di ni dpal ldan bla ma'i zhal bzhi pa ste ye shes rdo rje'o zhes pa rnal 'byor goms pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar sa bon gtong ba min pa'i bde ba de ni 'chi ba'i 'jigs 'phrog tu 'gyur zhing 'di ni dpal ldan bla ma'i zhal bzhi pa ste ye shes rdo rje'o zhes pa rnal 'byor goms pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: In that way, that bliss which is not emitted is the snatcher of the fear of death. This is the four-faced glorious guru, Jnanavajra. This is the certainty of the practice of yoga.

original: da ni sa zhes pa la sogs pas dkyil 'khor lnga zad pa gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni sa zhes pa la sogs pas dkyil 'khor lnga zad pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, beginning with earth, he speaks of the exhaustion of the five mandalas.

original: 'dir gang gi tshe khro bo'i lta bas stong pa la sems bkod pa'i rnal 'byor pa mig mi 'dzums par gyur pa de'i tshe g-yon nam g-yas su sa zhes pa ni nye bar mtshon pa ste gang gi tshe g-yas su sa rab tu 'bab pa'i dus su rnal
analyzed: 'dir gang gi tshe khro bo'i lta bas stong pa la sems bkod pa'i rnal 'byor pa mig mi 'dzums par gyur pa de'i tshe g-yon nam g-yas su sa zhes pa ni nye bar mtshon pa ste gang gi tshe g-yas su sa rab tu 'bab pa'i dus su rnal
translated: Here, when the yogi, by the wrathful gaze, has placed his mind in emptiness, and his eyes are wide open, then, to the left or right, the earth, etc.,

original: 'byor pa sgom par byed na de'i tshe cho ga 'di'o //
analyzed: 'byor pa sgom par byed na de'i tshe cho ga 'di'o //
translated: are indicated. When the earth enters the right channel, then, at that time, the yogi should meditate, and this is the rite.

original: g-yon pa'i rtsa la rab tu 'bab pa'i dus su ni ma yin te nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'i rim pa la so //
analyzed: g-yon pa'i rtsa la rab tu 'bab pa'i dus su ni ma yin te nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'i rim pa la so //
translated: It is not when the earth enters the left channel.

original: des na g-yon nam g-yas su dkyil 'khor gang 'bab pa de'i srog gi chos can nyid kyi phyir de nyid dkyil 'khor du gsungs so //
analyzed: des na g-yon nam g-yas su dkyil 'khor gang 'bab pa de'i srog gi chos can nyid kyi phyir de nyid dkyil 'khor du gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, since the mandala that enters to the left or right is the nature of the life-force, that is said to be the mandala.

original: des na g-yas kyi rtsa la sa'i dkyil 'khor las srog chu'i dkyil 'khor la 'jug ste de bzhin du ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor gyi bar du'o //
analyzed: des na g-yas kyi rtsa la sa'i dkyil 'khor las srog chu'i dkyil 'khor la 'jug ste de bzhin du ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor gyi bar du'o //
translated: Thus, in the right channel, the life-force enters the water mandala from the earth mandala, and likewise up to the wisdom mandala.

original: g-yon gyi rtsa la ni nam mkha' la sogs pa 'jug go //
analyzed: g-yon gyi rtsa la ni nam mkha' la sogs pa 'jug go //
translated: In the left channel, it enters the space mandala, etc.

original: de bzhin du stong pa nges par du ba la sogs pa'i mtshan ma rnam pa bcu ru 'gyur zhing mtshan ma ni rnam pa thams cad pa'i gzugs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du stong pa nges par du ba la sogs pa'i mtshan ma rnam pa bcu ru 'gyur zhing mtshan ma ni rnam pa thams cad pa'i gzugs su 'gyur ro //
translated: Likewise, emptiness definitely becomes the ten aspects of the signs of smoke, etc., and the sign becomes the form of all aspects.

original: gzugs las 'gyur ba med pa'i bde bar 'gyur te de nyid ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: gzugs las 'gyur ba med pa'i bde bar 'gyur te de nyid ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ye shes so //
translated: From that, there is the bliss that is not changed from form, and that is the wisdom of the perfection of wisdom.

original: ye shes las ni rdzu 'phrul nam mkha' la 'gro ba la sogs pa dang dngos grub khams gsum gyi dbang phyug sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur te mi bdag skyes bu rnams kyi skye ba 'di nyid la'o zhes pa lam la rab tu zhugs pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes las ni rdzu 'phrul nam mkha' la 'gro ba la sogs pa dang dngos grub khams gsum gyi dbang phyug sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur te mi bdag skyes bu rnams kyi skye ba 'di nyid la'o zhes pa lam la rab tu zhugs pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: From wisdom, there is the power of the three realms, such as the magical power of flying in the sky, etc., and the power of buddhahood, in this very life of the human beings, the lords of men.

original: da ni sku bzhi rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba bcu drug gsungs pa 'dod pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir kun 'byung gi bden pa las gang na skyu gcig yod pa de na @219b gzhan gsung dang thugs la sogs pa rnams kyang ngo //
analyzed: da ni sku bzhi rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba bcu drug gsungs pa 'dod pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir kun 'byung gi bden pa las gang na skyu gcig yod pa de na @219b gzhan gsung dang thugs la sogs pa rnams kyang ngo //
translated: Now, the sixteen divisions of the four bodies are stated, beginning with “desire,” etc. Here, where there is one part of the truth of the origin, there are the others, such as speech, mind, etc.

original: 'dod pa zhes pa lus kyi dga' ba 'gags pa las sangs rgyas kyi sprul ba'i skur nges par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa zhes pa lus kyi dga' ba 'gags pa las sangs rgyas kyi sprul ba'i skur nges par 'gyur ro //
translated: The “desire” is the cessation of the joy of the body, which is ascertained as the emanation body of the Buddha.

original: rdzogs pa ste /
analyzed: rdzogs pa ste /
translated: The “perfection”

original: ngag gi dga' ba zad pa gang yin pa de ni sprul pa di yi gsung nyid do //
analyzed: ngag gi dga' ba zad pa gang yin pa de ni sprul pa di yi gsung nyid do //
translated: is the exhaustion of the joy of speech, which is the speech of the emanation body.

original: 'bar ba sprul pa'i thugs te 'bar ba zhes pa ni sems kyi dga' ba 'gags pa'o //
analyzed: 'bar ba sprul pa'i thugs te 'bar ba zhes pa ni sems kyi dga' ba 'gags pa'o //
translated: The “blazing” is the mind of the emanation body, and “blazing” is the cessation of the joy of the mind.

original: sprul pa'i mchog gi bde ba byed pa'i ye shes rdo rje ni ao dd'a ste ye shes kyi dga' ba 'gags pa'o //
analyzed: sprul pa'i mchog gi bde ba byed pa'i ye shes rdo rje ni ao dd'a ste ye shes kyi dga' ba 'gags pa'o //
translated: The “vajra of the exalted wisdom that creates the bliss of the supreme emanation” is Oddiyana, the cessation of the joy of exalted wisdom.

original: de ltar sprul pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: de ltar sprul pa bzhi'o //
translated: Thus there are four emanations.

original: de bzhin du longs spyod rdzogs pa bzhi ni dga' ba longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ste lus kyi mchog dga' 'gags pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du longs spyod rdzogs pa bzhi ni dga' ba longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ste lus kyi mchog dga' 'gags pa'o //
translated: Similarly, the four enjoyments are the enjoyment body of joy, the cessation of the supreme joy of the body.

original: mchog dga' dang bcas khyad par dga' ba rim pas 'di yi ni zhes pa mchog dga' ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i gsung ste ngag gi mchog dga' zad pa'o //
analyzed: mchog dga' dang bcas khyad par dga' ba rim pas 'di yi ni zhes pa mchog dga' ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i gsung ste ngag gi mchog dga' zad pa'o //
translated: The “supreme joy together with the special joy” is the speech of the enjoyment body, the exhaustion of the supreme joy of speech.

original: khyad par dga' ba ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i thugs te sems kyi mchog dga' 'gags pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par dga' ba ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i thugs te sems kyi mchog dga' 'gags pa'o //
translated: The special joy is the mind of perfect rapture, the cessation of the supreme joy of the mind.

original: de ltar gsung dang thugs so //
analyzed: de ltar gsung dang thugs so //
translated: Thus, the speech and mind are explained.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i ye shes rdo rje ste ye shes kyi mchog dga' 'gags pa'o zhes pa longs spyod rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i ye shes rdo rje ste ye shes kyi mchog dga' 'gags pa'o zhes pa longs spyod rdzogs pa'o //
translated: The innate joy is the gnosis-vajra of perfect rapture, the cessation of the supreme joy of gnosis.

original: de nas chos kyi bzhi ni 'dar ba nyid ces pa lus kyi khyad par dga' ba ste de 'gags pa ni srid pa gsum gyis btud pa chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: de nas chos kyi bzhi ni 'dar ba nyid ces pa lus kyi khyad par dga' ba ste de 'gags pa ni srid pa gsum gyis btud pa chos kyi sku'o //
translated: Then, the four of reality are the trembling itself, the special joy of the body, the cessation of which is the reality body, bowed to by the three worlds.

original: 'byung ba chos de yi gsung du 'gyur zhes pa ste ngag gi khyad par dga' ba 'gags pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba chos de yi gsung du 'gyur zhes pa ste ngag gi khyad par dga' ba 'gags pa'o //
translated: The element is the speech of that reality, the cessation of the special joy of speech.

original: gnyid yur ni sems kyi khyad par dga' ba 'gags pa ste chos kyi thugs so //
analyzed: gnyid yur ni sems kyi khyad par dga' ba 'gags pa ste chos kyi thugs so //
translated: Sleep is the special joy of the mind, the cessation of which is the mind of reality.

original: gnyid de ye shes kyi khyad par dga' ba 'gags pa ni chos 'di yi srid pa'i 'jigs 'joms ye shes so //
analyzed: gnyid de ye shes kyi khyad par dga' ba 'gags pa ni chos 'di yi srid pa'i 'jigs 'joms ye shes so //
translated: That sleep is the special joy of gnosis, the cessation of which is the gnosis of this reality, the destroyer of the fear of existence.

original: yi ge nyid ces pa ni lus kyi lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba ste de 'gags pa ni dag pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: yi ge nyid ces pa ni lus kyi lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba ste de 'gags pa ni dag pa'i sku'o //
translated: The “very letters” are the innate joy of the body, and its “cessation” is the pure body.

original: dbyangs dang bral ba'i cha dang thig le n'a da rim pa yis nas pa la cha zhes pa ni ngag gi lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba 'gags pa ste dag pa'i gsung ngo //
analyzed: dbyangs dang bral ba'i cha dang thig le n'a da rim pa yis nas pa la cha zhes pa ni ngag gi lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba 'gags pa ste dag pa'i gsung ngo //
translated: The “part without sound” and the “drop” are the stages of the nada. The “part” is the cessation of the innate joy of speech, which is the pure speech.

original: thig le zhes pa ni sems kyi lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba 'gags pa ste dag pa'i thugs so //
analyzed: thig le zhes pa ni sems kyi lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba 'gags pa ste dag pa'i thugs so //
translated: The “drop” is the cessation of the innate joy of the mind, which is the pure mind.

original: n'a da zhes pa ye shes kyi lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba 'gags pa ste dag pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: n'a da zhes pa ye shes kyi lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba 'gags pa ste dag pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The “nada” is the cessation of the innate joy of gnosis, which is the pure gnosis.

original: de ltar bde 'byung dag pa'i @220a * //
analyzed: de ltar bde 'byung dag pa'i @220a * //
translated: Thus, the pure body, which is the source of bliss,

original: sku rdo rje sems dpa'i ye shes rdo rje rnam gsum srid par gnas pa ste dga' ba bcu drug gi dbye bas phye ba'o //
analyzed: sku rdo rje sems dpa'i ye shes rdo rje rnam gsum srid par gnas pa ste dga' ba bcu drug gi dbye bas phye ba'o //
translated: is the gnosis vajra of Vajrasattva, abiding in existence in three stages, divided by the sixteen joys.

original: de nyid rnam pa bcu drug rig ces gsungs pa'i phyir de nyid rnam pa bcu drug ni mi 'gyur pa'i bde ba chen po dang rnam pa bcu gnyis ni don dam pa dang kun rdzob ste sangs rgyas rnams dang 'khor ba pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: de nyid rnam pa bcu drug rig ces gsungs pa'i phyir de nyid rnam pa bcu drug ni mi 'gyur pa'i bde ba chen po dang rnam pa bcu gnyis ni don dam pa dang kun rdzob ste sangs rgyas rnams dang 'khor ba pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: Because it is said, “It is the knowledge of the sixteen aspects of reality.” The sixteen aspects of reality are the unchanging great bliss and the twelve aspects are the ultimate and the relative, of the buddhas and of those in cyclic existence.

original: des na yan lag bcu gnyis 'gags shing srog zad pas rdo rje nyi ma snang ba che /
analyzed: des na yan lag bcu gnyis 'gags shing srog zad pas rdo rje nyi ma snang ba che /
translated: Therefore, the twelve branches cease and, because life is exhausted, the vajra sun is the great light.

original: bden don rnam pa bcu gnyis ldan zhes pa ste rdul 'gags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bden don rnam pa bcu gnyis ldan zhes pa ste rdul 'gags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It possesses the twelve aspects of reality, because the particles cease.

original: cha bcu drug gi khu ba 'gags pas rdo rje zla ba dri med 'od ;
analyzed: cha bcu drug gi khu ba 'gags pas rdo rje zla ba dri med 'od ;
translated: Because the sixteen parts of the semen cease, the vajra moon is the stainless light.

original: / de nyid rnam pa bcu drug rig ces pa ste bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo grub bo //
analyzed: / de nyid rnam pa bcu drug rig ces pa ste bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo grub bo //
translated: It is the knowledge of the sixteen aspects of reality. The Bhagavān Kālacakra is accomplished.

original: da ni sad pa la sogs pa 'gags pa gsungs pa sad pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir 'khor ba pa rnams kyi lus la gnas pa zhes pa spyi bor gnas pa'i byang chub kyi sems ni sad pa'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur zhing dbugs la zhen pa
analyzed: da ni sad pa la sogs pa 'gags pa gsungs pa sad pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dir 'khor ba pa rnams kyi lus la gnas pa zhes pa spyi bor gnas pa'i byang chub kyi sems ni sad pa'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur zhing dbugs la zhen pa
translated: “Attached to the breath”

original: zhes pa mgrin par gnas pa ni rmi lam gyi rang bzhin du 'gyur te gnas skabs gnyi ga la yul rnams rnam par dpyod do //
analyzed: zhes pa mgrin par gnas pa ni rmi lam gyi rang bzhin du 'gyur te gnas skabs gnyi ga la yul rnams rnam par dpyod do //
translated: is located at the throat, and is the nature of dreams. In both states, objects are analyzed.

original: g-yo med sems la zhen pa zhes pa snying gar gnas pa ni slar yang gzhan ba'i 'di ni sems gsum pa ste shin tu gnyid log pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: g-yo med sems la zhen pa zhes pa snying gar gnas pa ni slar yang gzhan ba'i 'di ni sems gsum pa ste shin tu gnyid log pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: “Attached to the mind without movement” is located at the heart, and is the third mind, the nature of deep sleep.

original: ye shes la gnas zhes pa ni lte bar gnas pa bzhi pa'i rang bzhin te bud med dang rab tu 'grogs pa las byang chub sems ni zhu bar gyur pa na 'pho ba'i skad cig gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: ye shes la gnas zhes pa ni lte bar gnas pa bzhi pa'i rang bzhin te bud med dang rab tu 'grogs pa las byang chub sems ni zhu bar gyur pa na 'pho ba'i skad cig gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: “Abiding in gnosis” is located at the navel, and is the nature of the fourth, the characteristic of the moment of emission when the bodhicitta melts through intercourse with a woman.

original: sems rnam pa bzhi po de nyid 'gags pa ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi sprul pa dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang chos dang lhan cig skyes pa'i sku'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems rnam pa bzhi po de nyid 'gags pa ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi sprul pa dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang chos dang lhan cig skyes pa'i sku'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: The cessation of just those four kinds of mind becomes the characteristic of the emanation body, the beatific body, and the innate body of the buddhas.

original: des na sprul pa la sogs dag gi sems kyi rdo rje rnam ba bzhir ni rim pas nges par rab tu 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: des na sprul pa la sogs dag gi sems kyi rdo rje rnam ba bzhir ni rim pas nges par rab tu 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: Thus, the four kinds of mind, the mind of emanation, and so on, are definitely the four vajras in sequence.

original: de ltar 'khor ba pa rnams kyi sad pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi sems rnam pa bzhi ni srid pa rnam pa gsum la gnas pa rnams kyi thig le'i dbus su ste byang chub kyi sems kyi rten la byang chub kyi sems de nyid do //
analyzed: de ltar 'khor ba pa rnams kyi sad pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi sems rnam pa bzhi ni srid pa rnam pa gsum la gnas pa rnams kyi thig le'i dbus su ste byang chub kyi sems kyi rten la byang chub kyi sems de nyid do //
translated: Thus, the four kinds of mind, characterized by waking and so on, of those in cyclic existence, in the center of the drop, that is, in the support of the bodhicitta, of those abiding in the three states of existence, is just the bodhicitta.

original: rnal 'byor dbang po rnams kyis bde mnyam 'bras steng zhes pa mi 'gyur ba'i bde @220b ba'i 'bras bu ster ba khyab byed dag ni thar pa'i skad du bsrung bar bya'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor dbang po rnams kyis bde mnyam 'bras steng zhes pa mi 'gyur ba'i bde @220b ba'i 'bras bu ster ba khyab byed dag ni thar pa'i skad du bsrung bar bya'o //
translated: The yogic masters should protect the universal pervaders, which bestow the result of the bliss of equality, in the language of liberation.

original: thig le btang ste rten lhung bar gyur na rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi mchog gi bde ba skye ba'i sa bon rten song ba la brten pa byang chub kyi sems kyi thar pa gang na yod /
analyzed: thig le btang ste rten lhung bar gyur na rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi mchog gi bde ba skye ba'i sa bon rten song ba la brten pa byang chub kyi sems kyi thar pa gang na yod /
translated: If the bindu is emitted and falls, then the seed of the supreme bliss of the yogi/nī is lost, and the bodhicitta that is based on that seed has no liberation anywhere.🔽Therefore, this moment of the bliss of samsara should be abandoned by those who are diligent in vows at all times.

original: de'i phyir 'khor ba'i bde ba'i skad cig 'di ni sdom brtson rnams kyis thams cad dus su spang bar bya zhes pa ste 'gyur pa dang 'dzag ba dang g-yo ba spang bar bya'o zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'khor ba'i bde ba'i skad cig 'di ni sdom brtson rnams kyis thams cad dus su spang bar bya zhes pa ste 'gyur pa dang 'dzag ba dang g-yo ba spang bar bya'o zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa'o //
translated: The Bhagavān’s definitive statement is that “the emission, dripping, and movement should be abandoned.”🔽The yogi/nī should practice until the natural and other stains are purified.

original: rnal 'byor pas rgyu mthun pa la sogs pa dri ma dang bral bar gyur gyi bar du steng du bya ste ji ltar byon pa de bzhin gshegs pa'o zhes pa mi 'gyur pa'i bde ba skyed pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas rgyu mthun pa la sogs pa dri ma dang bral bar gyur gyi bar du steng du bya ste ji ltar byon pa de bzhin gshegs pa'o zhes pa mi 'gyur pa'i bde ba skyed pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: The definitive statement that generates unchanging bliss is “the Tathāgata is just as he came.”

original: gang phyir aa sogs zhes pa la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gzhan ni mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i ye shes grub pa las rgyas par brjod par bya ste des na 'dir yongs su bcad pa'o //
analyzed: gang phyir aa sogs zhes pa la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gzhan ni mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i ye shes grub pa las rgyas par brjod par bya ste des na 'dir yongs su bcad pa'o //
translated: The other verse beginning with “Because of the a and so on” should be explained extensively in the Supreme Unsurpassed Wisdom, and so it is not set forth here.

original: bsdus pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po dus kyi 'khor lo'i rgyas 'grel rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'jug pa stong phrag bcu gnyis pa dri ma med pa'i 'od las sku bzhi la sogs pa'i rnam par dag pa nges pa'i mdor bsdus chen po ste gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: bsdus pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po dus kyi 'khor lo'i rgyas 'grel rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'jug pa stong phrag bcu gnyis pa dri ma med pa'i 'od las sku bzhi la sogs pa'i rnam par dag pa nges pa'i mdor bsdus chen po ste gnyis pa'o /
translated: This concludes the second chapter, the great summary of the purities of the four bodies and so on, from the Stainless Light, the commentary on the king of tantras, the Kālacakra Tantra, which is consistent with the root tantra in twelve thousand chapters.

original: // / dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: // / dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to glorious Vajrasattva.

original: phyag rgya chen mo la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen mo la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the great seal.

original: mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i bde ba la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i bde ba la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the supreme, unchanging bliss.

original: bla ma dang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: bla ma dang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the gurus, buddhas, and bodhisattvas.

original: khro bo'i rgyal po dang rdo rje mkha' 'gro dang rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma rnams la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: khro bo'i rgyal po dang rdo rje mkha' 'gro dang rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma rnams la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the King of Wrathful Ones, to the Vajraḍāka, and to the Vajraḍākinī.

original: gang phyir gcig nyid aa sogs ka sogs ri bong can dang nyin byed rdo rje can gyi gdan min zhing //
analyzed: gang phyir gcig nyid aa sogs ka sogs ri bong can dang nyin byed rdo rje can gyi gdan min zhing //
translated: Because of the single one, there is no seat of the moon and sun in the a, ka, etc., and in the vajra-holder.

original: h'um yig nyid kyis mtshan ma dang ni yongs su gyur pa gzhan pa kha dog gzugs dag mi 'dod de //
analyzed: h'um yig nyid kyis mtshan ma dang ni yongs su gyur pa gzhan pa kha dog gzugs dag mi 'dod de //
translated: The sign and the complete transformation into another color and form are not accepted by the syllable hūṃ.

original: 'gyur med dag gis bskyed cing 'gyur pa nyams par gyur pa mchog gi dbang po dag dang ldan pa ni //
analyzed: 'gyur med dag gis bskyed cing 'gyur pa nyams par gyur pa mchog gi dbang po dag dang ldan pa ni //
translated: The one who is generated by the unchanging, who has the supreme organ, who has the loss of change,🔽has the totality of aspects, the totality of the bindu, the lord of the victors, the holder of the illusion of diversity.

original: rnam pa kun ldan thig le mtha' dag rgyal ba'i bdag po sna tshogs sgyu ma 'dzin pa 'di la'o zhes pa la 'dir gang phyir te gang gi phyir 'gyur pa med pa las byung ba lhan cig skyes pa'i sku la a'a li k'a li dang padma dang zla
analyzed: rnam pa kun ldan thig le mtha' dag rgyal ba'i bdag po sna tshogs sgyu ma 'dzin pa 'di la'o zhes pa la 'dir gang phyir te gang gi phyir 'gyur pa med pa las byung ba lhan cig skyes pa'i sku la a'a li k'a li dang padma dang zla
translated: Here, because of the single one, there is no seat of the moon and sun in the innate body that arises from the unchanging, in the a, ka, etc., and in the lotus, moon, and sun of the vajra-holder.

original: ba dang nyi ma'i gdan dang h'um yig yongs su gyur pa'i mtshan @221a * //
analyzed: ba dang nyi ma'i gdan dang h'um yig yongs su gyur pa'i mtshan @221a * //
translated: The sign and the complete transformation into another color and form are not accepted by the syllable hūṃ.

original: ma las skyes pa'i gzugs dang kha dog dang phyag dang dbyibs yongs su brtags pa'i chos bkag pa de'i phyir gang phyir zhes pa la sogs pas bcom ldan 'das kyis mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i ye shes grub pa gsungs te gcig nyid aa sogs ka sogs zhes pa
analyzed: ma las skyes pa'i gzugs dang kha dog dang phyag dang dbyibs yongs su brtags pa'i chos bkag pa de'i phyir gang phyir zhes pa la sogs pas bcom ldan 'das kyis mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i ye shes grub pa gsungs te gcig nyid aa sogs ka sogs zhes pa
translated: of the one.”🔽The “one” is the union of the vowels and consonants.

original: la aa sogs ni aa yig la sogs pa dbyangs kyi tshogs pa ha yig zla ba ste dbyangs so so yang ngo //
analyzed: la aa sogs ni aa yig la sogs pa dbyangs kyi tshogs pa ha yig zla ba ste dbyangs so so yang ngo //
translated: The “vowels” are the group of vowels beginning with “a,” and the moon is🔽the letter “ha.”🔽The “consonants” are the group of consonants beginning with “ka,” and the

original: ka yig la sogs pa gsal byed kyi tshogs pa ksha yig nyi ma ste gsal byed so so yang ngo //🔽aa sogs ka sogs dag las ri bong can dang nyin byed de yang na ha yig dang ksha yig dag gis so //
analyzed: ka yig la sogs pa gsal byed kyi tshogs pa ksha yig nyi ma ste gsal byed so so yang ngo // aa sogs ka sogs dag las ri bong can dang nyin byed de yang na ha yig dang ksha yig dag gis so //
translated: sun is the letter “kṣa.”🔽The “one” is the union of the vowels and consonants.

original: gcig nyid ces pa aa yig dang pa yig dag gcig tu byas pa ni pa yig gsal byed kyi bdag nyid can padma'o //
analyzed: gcig nyid ces pa aa yig dang pa yig dag gcig tu byas pa ni pa yig gsal byed kyi bdag nyid can padma'o //
translated: The “one” is the union of the letters “a” and “pa,” which is the letter “pa,”🔽which is the nature of the consonants, the lotus.
