original: aa yig gi bdag nyid can nam ha yig gi bdag nyid can zla ba'i dkyil 'khor dang ra yig gi bdag nyid can nam ksha yig gi bdag nyid can nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: aa yig gi bdag nyid can nam ha yig gi bdag nyid can zla ba'i dkyil 'khor dang ra yig gi bdag nyid can nam ksha yig gi bdag nyid can nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The moon disk is the nature of the letter A or the letter Ha, and the sun disk is the nature of the letter Ra or the letter KṢa.

original: brten pa rdo rje can gyi ste rdo rje ni gcad du med ba mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i bde ba'i ye shes mi 'pho ba'o //
analyzed: brten pa rdo rje can gyi ste rdo rje ni gcad du med ba mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i bde ba'i ye shes mi 'pho ba'o //
translated: The “vajra-possessor’s seat” is the vajra, which is the indestructible, supreme, unchanging bliss, the gnosis that is not transferred.

original: de 'di la yod pa'i phyir rdo rje can te brten pa rdo rje can 'di'i gdan ni rten no //
analyzed: de 'di la yod pa'i phyir rdo rje can te brten pa rdo rje can 'di'i gdan ni rten no //
translated: Since he has that, he is the “vajra-possessor,” and his “seat” is the support.

original: min zhes pa ni rten gdan sel ba /
analyzed: min zhes pa ni rten gdan sel ba /
translated: “Not” is the negation of the support and seat.

original: de bzhin du h'um yig yongs su gyur pa las rdo rje'i mtshan ma dang rdo rje'i mtshan ma yongs su gyur pa las lha'i sku kha dog dang phyag dang dbyibs yongs su brtags pa'i chos rten pa'i mtshan nyid mi 'dod de ci'i phyir zhe na mngon par zhen
analyzed: de bzhin du h'um yig yongs su gyur pa las rdo rje'i mtshan ma dang rdo rje'i mtshan ma yongs su gyur pa las lha'i sku kha dog dang phyag dang dbyibs yongs su brtags pa'i chos rten pa'i mtshan nyid mi 'dod de ci'i phyir zhe na mngon par zhen
translated: Similarly, one should not assert that the vajra-sign that arises from the transformation of the letter HŪM, or the deity’s body that arises from the transformation of the vajra-sign, has the characteristics of a supported phenomenon that is imputed to have color, hands, and shape, because it has the characteristic of attachment

original: pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir dang 'gyur pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir dang 'gyur pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir ro //
translated: and the nature of change.

original: 'dir aa yig la sogs pa dbyangs rnams dang ka yig la sogs pa gsal byed rnams te 'gyur par gyur pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnams ni bstan bcos rig pa rnams kyis mi 'gyur par brjod de de skad du yang smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir aa yig la sogs pa dbyangs rnams dang ka yig la sogs pa gsal byed rnams te 'gyur par gyur pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnams ni bstan bcos rig pa rnams kyis mi 'gyur par brjod de de skad du yang smras pa /
translated: Thus it is said:🔽“imperishable, unmoving, not going to another place”

original: mi 'gyur zhing mi g-yo ste gzhan gyi gnas su mi 'gro'o zhes pa mi 'gyur pa'i sgras dbyangs brjod do //
analyzed: mi 'gyur zhing mi g-yo ste gzhan gyi gnas su mi 'gro'o zhes pa mi 'gyur pa'i sgras dbyangs brjod do //
translated: The word “imperishable” refers to the vowels.

original: des sngags pa ngan pa 'khrul pas mi 'gyur pa nyid kyis dbyangs kyi tshogs sam gsal byed kyi tshogs 'dzin no //
analyzed: des sngags pa ngan pa 'khrul pas mi 'gyur pa nyid kyis dbyangs kyi tshogs sam gsal byed kyi tshogs 'dzin no //
translated: Because of the error of the bad mantra practitioner, the collection of vowels or the collection of consonants is grasped as imperishable.

original: don dam par dbyangs dang gsal byed kyi tshogs ni mi 'gyur pa ma yin te mi 'gyur pa'i sgras ni mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i bde ba'i ye shes rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: don dam par dbyangs dang gsal byed kyi tshogs ni mi 'gyur pa ma yin te mi 'gyur pa'i sgras ni mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i bde ba'i ye shes rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: In ultimate truth, the collection of vowels and consonants is not imperishable. The word “imperishable” refers to the gnosis of supreme unchanging bliss, Vajrasattva.

original: de bzhin du yid skyob par gyur pa nyid kyi phyir sngags kyang mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i @221b ye shes su brjod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du yid skyob par gyur pa nyid kyi phyir sngags kyang mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i @221b ye shes su brjod do //
translated: In the same way, because it protects the mind, the mantra is also said to be the gnosis of supreme unchanging bliss.

original: da bzhin du gzhan nang gi rig pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ma rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba phyag rgya chen mo lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i gzugs can ma chos kyi dbyings kyi rgyu mthun par rdzogs pa'i gnas skabs te rdo rje sems dpa'
analyzed: da bzhin du gzhan nang gi rig pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ma rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba phyag rgya chen mo lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i gzugs can ma chos kyi dbyings kyi rgyu mthun par rdzogs pa'i gnas skabs te rdo rje sems dpa'
translated: Likewise, the perfection of wisdom, the mother of the victors, is the great seal, the form of innate joy, the natural luminosity of inner awareness, the cause of the dharmadhatu, the perfected state, Vajrasattva,

original: dang sangs rgyas kyi yum rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i dbang po rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin pa mchog gi dbang po'i spyod yul mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i bde ba'i rang bzhin rdul phra rab kyi chos las 'das pa me long gi pra phab pa dang rmi
analyzed: dang sangs rgyas kyi yum rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i dbang po rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin pa mchog gi dbang po'i spyod yul mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i bde ba'i rang bzhin rdul phra rab kyi chos las 'das pa me long gi pra phab pa dang rmi
translated: and the mother of the buddhas. She is not the domain of the faculties of dependent origination, but the domain of the supreme faculty, the nature of supreme unchanging bliss, beyond the phenomena of subtle particles, like a reflection in a mirror, a dream,

original: lam dang mtshungs pa de ni rgyal ba rnams kyi lhan cig skyes pa'i skur gsungs te mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: lam dang mtshungs pa de ni rgyal ba rnams kyi lhan cig skyes pa'i skur gsungs te mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir ro //
translated: and an illusion. She is said to be the innate body of the victors because of her nature of supreme unchanging bliss.

original: 'dir 'gyur med rnams ni gzugs dang tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed dang rnam par shes pa sgrib pa med pa rnams 'gyur med lnga ste stong pa chen por gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dir 'gyur med rnams ni gzugs dang tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed dang rnam par shes pa sgrib pa med pa rnams 'gyur med lnga ste stong pa chen por gsungs so //
translated: Here, the five unchanging [natures] are the five unchanging [natures] of form, feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness, which are free from obscurations. These are said to be the great emptiness.

original: de bzhin du sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang nam mkha'i khams sgrib pa med pa rnams 'gyur med lngar gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang nam mkha'i khams sgrib pa med pa rnams 'gyur med lngar gsungs so //
translated: Similarly, the five unchanging [natures] are the five unchanging [natures] of the earth, water, fire, wind, and space elements, which are free from obscurations.

original: 'gyur med drug ni mig dang rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus dang yid sgrib pa med pa rnams te so so rang rang gi yul 'dzin pa spangs pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'gyur med drug ni mig dang rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus dang yid sgrib pa med pa rnams te so so rang rang gi yul 'dzin pa spangs pa rnams so //
translated: The six unchanging [natures] are the six unchanging [natures] of the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind, which are free from obscurations and have abandoned the apprehension of their individual objects.

original: de bzhin du gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya dang chos kyi khams sgrib pa med pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya dang chos kyi khams sgrib pa med pa /
translated: Similarly, the six unchanging [natures] are the six unchanging [natures] of the form, sound, smell, taste, tactile objects, and phenomena elements, which are free from obscurations.

original: rnams kyang 'gyur med drug tu gsungs te phung po dang khams dang skye mched 'di rnams gcig tu ro mnyam par gyur pa ni thig le stong par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnams kyang 'gyur med drug tu gsungs te phung po dang khams dang skye mched 'di rnams gcig tu ro mnyam par gyur pa ni thig le stong par 'gyur ro //
translated: These aggregates, elements, and sense bases, which have become of one taste, become the empty bindu.

original: thig le de yang mi 'pho bar gyur na mchog tu mi 'gyur par brjod do //🔽mchog tu mi 'gyur pa yang aa yig ste aa yig las byung ba ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyi rdo rje sems dpa' ma ning gi go 'phang lhan cig skyes pa'i sku zhes brjod de shes pa dang shes bya'i
analyzed: thig le de yang mi 'pho bar gyur na mchog tu mi 'gyur par brjod do // mchog tu mi 'gyur pa yang aa yig ste aa yig las byung ba ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyi rdo rje sems dpa' ma ning gi go 'phang lhan cig skyes pa'i sku zhes brjod de shes pa dang shes bya'i
translated: And that bindu, if it does not move, is said to be supreme.

original: bdag nyid rgyu dang 'bras bu dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid rgyu dang 'bras bu dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And supreme is the letter A, and that which arises from the letter A is the perfect Buddha, the nature of wisdom and method, the state of Vajrasattva, the nondual body, which is said to be the innate body, because it is the nature of the knower and the known, and it is the inseparability of cause and effect.

original: de yang bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo ste mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i bde ba'i go 'phang ngo //
analyzed: de yang bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo ste mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i bde ba'i go 'phang ngo //
translated: And that is the Bhagavat, the Wheel of Time, the state of supreme bliss.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen po'i bstod pa las tshigs su bcad pa dang pos gsungs pa yang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen po'i bstod pa las tshigs su bcad pa dang pos gsungs pa yang /
translated: And the Bhagavat, in the praise of the great mandala of the vajra realm in the Litany of the Names of Manjushri, says in the first verse:

original: 'di ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das //
analyzed: 'di ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das //
translated: Thus the Bhagavat Buddha

original: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas aa las byung //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas aa las byung //
translated: arises from the perfect Buddha A.

original: aa ni yig 'bru kun gyi mchog / don chen @222a * //
analyzed: aa ni yig 'bru kun gyi mchog / don chen @222a * //
translated: the great meaning,

original: 'gyur med dam pa yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'gyur med dam pa yin zhes pa'o //
translated: the unchanging, the sublime.

original: de bzhin du bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes kyi bstod pa las tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pas gsungs pa 'di lta sta /
analyzed: de bzhin du bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes kyi bstod pa las tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pas gsungs pa 'di lta sta /
translated: Likewise, the second verse of the praise of the wisdom of purposeful activity states:

original: gsang sngags don kun skyed pa po //
analyzed: gsang sngags don kun skyed pa po //
translated: The producer of all the meanings of secret mantra,

original: thig le chen po yi ge med //
analyzed: thig le chen po yi ge med //
translated: the great drop, without letters,

original: stong pa chen po 'gyur med lnga //
analyzed: stong pa chen po 'gyur med lnga //
translated: the five unchanging great emptinesses,

original: thig le stong pa 'gyur med drug ces pa'o //
analyzed: thig le stong pa 'gyur med drug ces pa'o //
translated: the six unchanging empty drops.

original: de bzhin du rtsa ba'i rgyud las gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du rtsa ba'i rgyud las gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
translated: Likewise, the root tantra states:

original: aa sogs ka sogs mnyam sbyor ba //
analyzed: aa sogs ka sogs mnyam sbyor ba //
translated: The union of the a and the ka,🔽in the seat of Vajrasattva,

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i gdan du dang // 'gyur med las byung sku la ni //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i gdan du dang // 'gyur med las byung sku la ni //
translated: in the body arisen from the unchanging,

original: h'um yig la sogs mi 'dod do zhes so //
analyzed: h'um yig la sogs mi 'dod do zhes so //
translated: the letter hūṃ and so on are not desired.

original: 'gyur med 'dis bskyed cing 'gyur pa nyams par gyur pa mchog gi dbang po dag dang ldan pa ni zhes pa la 'gyur pa ni skye ba dang 'gags pa'i gnas skabs kyi mtshan nyid de 'pho ba'i skad cig go //
analyzed: 'gyur med 'dis bskyed cing 'gyur pa nyams par gyur pa mchog gi dbang po dag dang ldan pa ni zhes pa la 'gyur pa ni skye ba dang 'gags pa'i gnas skabs kyi mtshan nyid de 'pho ba'i skad cig go //
translated: Change is the characteristic of the state of arising and ceasing, that is, the moment of transition.

original: de gang la 'gags par gyur ba de ni mchog tu mi 'gyur pa 'pho ba med pa'i skad cig ste dus zhes brjod cing de nyid rdo rje ste shes pa'o //
analyzed: de gang la 'gags par gyur ba de ni mchog tu mi 'gyur pa 'pho ba med pa'i skad cig ste dus zhes brjod cing de nyid rdo rje ste shes pa'o //
translated: That which has ceased in that is the supreme unchanging, the moment without transition, called time, and that itself is the vajra, that is, consciousness.

original: dus de'i sgrib pa med pa'i phung po dang khams dang skye mched ni 'khor lo zhes brjod cing srid pa gsum gcig pa nyid de sgrib pa med pa'i shes bya'o //
analyzed: dus de'i sgrib pa med pa'i phung po dang khams dang skye mched ni 'khor lo zhes brjod cing srid pa gsum gcig pa nyid de sgrib pa med pa'i shes bya'o //
translated: The unobstructed aggregates, elements, and sense bases of that time are called the wheel, and are the oneness of the three worlds, that is, the unobstructed object of knowledge.

original: de nyid ni rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen po zhes brjod de rnam pa kun ldan dbang po thams cad pa thig le'i rang bzhin sna tshogs sgyu ma 'dzin pa ste bcom ldan 'das kyi sku shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: de nyid ni rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen po zhes brjod de rnam pa kun ldan dbang po thams cad pa thig le'i rang bzhin sna tshogs sgyu ma 'dzin pa ste bcom ldan 'das kyi sku shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid can no //
translated: That is called the great maṇḍala of the vajra realm, endowed with all aspects, possessing all faculties, the nature of the bindu, the apprehender of the various illusions, the body of the Bhagavān, the nature of wisdom and method.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyud kyi rgyal po'i le'u lnga pa'i rnam pa lnga'i bstod pa las tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pas gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyud kyi rgyal po'i le'u lnga pa'i rnam pa lnga'i bstod pa las tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pas gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
translated: The Bhagavān praised the five aspects of the king of tantras in two verses in the fifth chapter, as follows:

original: dus dang sna tshogs la sogs rdo rje dang ni skyes bu dpe med kun 'gro spros pa med pa ste //
analyzed: dus dang sna tshogs la sogs rdo rje dang ni skyes bu dpe med kun 'gro spros pa med pa ste //
translated: The vajra of time, variety, and so on, the incomparable being, the all-pervading, the unelaborate,

original: ther zug tu gnas snyan dang shangs dang zhal dang spyan dang dbu dang phyag dang zhabs ni thams cad pa //
analyzed: ther zug tu gnas snyan dang shangs dang zhal dang spyan dang dbu dang phyag dang zhabs ni thams cad pa //
translated: The eternal, the ear, the nose, the face, the eyes, the head, the hands, and all the feet,

original: 'byung po'i mtha' ste 'byung po'i mgon po mchog gi srid pa gsum 'dzin rgyu rnams dag gi rgyur gyur pa //
analyzed: 'byung po'i mtha' ste 'byung po'i mgon po mchog gi srid pa gsum 'dzin rgyu rnams dag gi rgyur gyur pa //
translated: The end of beings, the protector of beings, the supreme holder of the three existences, the cause of the causes of the pure,

original: rig pa la sogs rnal 'byor dag gis rtogs bya mchog bde'i go 'phang dus kyi 'khor lo la phyag 'tshal zhes so //
analyzed: rig pa la sogs rnal 'byor dag gis rtogs bya mchog bde'i go 'phang dus kyi 'khor lo la phyag 'tshal zhes so //
translated: The supreme state of bliss that is to be realized by the yogis of the Veda and so on is the Wheel of Time.

original: de bzhin du gzhan nang gi rig pa yang bcom ldan 'das kyis nang gi le'u las tshigs su bcad pa dgu bcu rtsa lnga pas gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan nang gi rig pa yang bcom ldan 'das kyis nang gi le'u las tshigs su bcad pa dgu bcu rtsa lnga pas gsungs pa /
translated: In the same way, the inner science was taught by the Lord in the Inner chapter in the ninety-fifth verse:

original: yan lag dang @222b bcas rig byed dran pa'i gzhung dang bcas dang rtog ge grub pa'i mthar ldan 'jig rten du //
analyzed: yan lag dang @222b bcas rig byed dran pa'i gzhung dang bcas dang rtog ge grub pa'i mthar ldan 'jig rten du //
translated: The world has the Veda with its branches, the texts of the Smritis, and the conclusions of logic.

original: snyan ngag mkhan po rgyas pa me la sogs pa rnams kyis byas pa'i bstan bcos gzhan yang rig pa min /
analyzed: snyan ngag mkhan po rgyas pa me la sogs pa rnams kyis byas pa'i bstan bcos gzhan yang rig pa min /
translated: The treatises composed by other poets, such as the extensive one on fire, are not the science.

original: rig pa zhes pa nang rig 'gyur med kyang ste 'jig rten 'dir ni thub pa rnams kyis rab gsungs nyid //
analyzed: rig pa zhes pa nang rig 'gyur med kyang ste 'jig rten 'dir ni thub pa rnams kyis rab gsungs nyid //
translated: The science is the unchanging inner science, which was taught by the sages in this world.

original: gang las 'jig rten gsum po mtha' dag tu 'gyur mi yi bdag po slar yang gang la thim pa'o zhes pa ste slar yang bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid de nyid shes pa dang shes bya'i 'brel pas gsungs te 'dir
analyzed: gang las 'jig rten gsum po mtha' dag tu 'gyur mi yi bdag po slar yang gang la thim pa'o zhes pa ste slar yang bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid de nyid shes pa dang shes bya'i 'brel pas gsungs te 'dir
translated: The Bhagavān Kālacakra, the nature of method and wisdom, is taught by the connection of the knower and the known.

original: mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i shes pa sgrib pa thams cad zad pa'i rgyur gyur pa ni dus zhes brjod de thabs so //
analyzed: mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i shes pa sgrib pa thams cad zad pa'i rgyur gyur pa ni dus zhes brjod de thabs so //
translated: Here, the supreme unchanging consciousness, which is the cause of the exhaustion of all obscurations, is called “time,” which is the method.

original: khams gsum pa'i shes bya dngos po mtha' yas pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'khor lo ste de nyid ni shes rab po //
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i shes bya dngos po mtha' yas pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'khor lo ste de nyid ni shes rab po //
translated: The characteristic of the known of the three realms, which is the infinite things, is the “wheel,” which is the wisdom.

original: shes pa dang shes bya 'di dag gcig pa nyid ni dus kyi 'khor lo zhes pa ste bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyud kyi rgyal po'i le'u lnga pa las tshigs su bcad pa drug cu rtsa gsum pas dus kyi 'khor lo gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: shes pa dang shes bya 'di dag gcig pa nyid ni dus kyi 'khor lo zhes pa ste bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyud kyi rgyal po'i le'u lnga pa las tshigs su bcad pa drug cu rtsa gsum pas dus kyi 'khor lo gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
translated: The identity of these two, the knower and the known, is called “Kālacakra.” The Bhagavān taught the Kālacakra in the fifth chapter of the King of Tantras in sixty-three verses, as follows.

original: mtha' yas sangs rgyas zhing rnams dang ni dpag med yon tan rnams dang nam mkha' la sogs khams rnams dang // gnas dang skye dang nyams pa rnam gsum zhes pa'i srid pa dang ni 'gro ba drug gi sems can kun //
analyzed: mtha' yas sangs rgyas zhing rnams dang ni dpag med yon tan rnams dang nam mkha' la sogs khams rnams dang // gnas dang skye dang nyams pa rnam gsum zhes pa'i srid pa dang ni 'gro ba drug gi sems can kun //
translated: and existence with its three states of birth, abiding, and death, and all the beings of the six realms,

original: sangs rgyas khro bo lha tshogs rnams dang snying rje'i thugs ldan byang chub sems dpa' btsun mor bcas rnams te //
analyzed: sangs rgyas khro bo lha tshogs rnams dang snying rje'i thugs ldan byang chub sems dpa' btsun mor bcas rnams te //
translated: the hosts of wrathful buddhas, and the bodhisattvas with their compassionate minds and their queens,

original: 'di dag rnams ni srid pa gsum gyis phyag byas rgyal ba'i bde 'byung gcig pu'i 'khor lo gcig yin no zhes so //
analyzed: 'di dag rnams ni srid pa gsum gyis phyag byas rgyal ba'i bde 'byung gcig pu'i 'khor lo gcig yin no zhes so //
translated: these are the single wheel of the single source of bliss of the Victor, which is worshipped by the three worlds.

original: shes pa'i rang bzhin ni dus dang shes bya'i mtshan nyid ni 'khor lo ste shes pa dang shes bya 'di dag gcig pa nyid ni dus kyi 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: shes pa'i rang bzhin ni dus dang shes bya'i mtshan nyid ni 'khor lo ste shes pa dang shes bya 'di dag gcig pa nyid ni dus kyi 'khor lo'o //
translated: The nature of consciousness is time, and the characteristics of the object of consciousness are the wheel. The oneness of consciousness and the object of consciousness is the wheel of time.

original: brjod pa'i rim pa 'dis bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo de nyid ae wam gi yi ge rdo rje sems dpa' ste rgyal ba rnams kyis rgyud thams cad las yang dag par brjod pa'o //
analyzed: brjod pa'i rim pa 'dis bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo de nyid ae wam gi yi ge rdo rje sems dpa' ste rgyal ba rnams kyis rgyud thams cad las yang dag par brjod pa'o //
translated: By this statement, the Bhagavān Kālacakra, who is the syllable evaṃ, Vajrasattva, is declared in all the tantras by the victors.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi le'u lnga pa las gsungs pa yang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi le'u lnga pa las gsungs pa yang /
translated: The Bhagavān also says in the fifth chapter of the Root Tantra:

original: ye shes kun nas gcad du med //
analyzed: ye shes kun nas gcad du med //
translated: The pristine consciousness that cannot be cut

original: rdo rje zhes ni mngon par brjod //
analyzed: rdo rje zhes ni mngon par brjod //
translated: is declared to be the vajra.

original: srid gsum gcig nyid sems dpa' ste //
analyzed: srid gsum gcig nyid sems dpa' ste //
translated: The one of the three existences is the sattva,

original: rdo rje sems dpa' zhes par bshad ces so //🔽@223a * // de'i phyir 'gyur pa med pa las skyes pa rnam pa thams cad pa'i thig le lhan cig skyes pa'i sku mtha' dag rgyal ba'i bdag po sna tshogs sgyu ma 'dzin pa 'di la phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub kyi don du /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' zhes par bshad ces so // @223a * // de'i phyir 'gyur pa med pa las skyes pa rnam pa thams cad pa'i thig le lhan cig skyes pa'i sku mtha' dag rgyal ba'i bdag po sna tshogs sgyu ma 'dzin pa 'di la phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub kyi don du /
translated: explained to be Vajrasattva.

original: rten dang brten pa'i 'brel pa mi 'dod de /
analyzed: rten dang brten pa'i 'brel pa mi 'dod de /
translated: Therefore, in order to attain the mahāmudrā siddhi, the lord of victors, the illusion of variety, who is born from the unchanging, the bindu of all aspects, the body of the innate, the totality, is not asserted to have a relationship of support and supported.

original: ji ltar 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub sgrub pa'i don du rten dang brten pa'i 'brel pa 'dod pa de bzhin du rnal 'byor pa mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i bde ba sgrub pa la mngon par dga' ba bla ma dam pa'i man ngag thob pa /
analyzed: ji ltar 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub sgrub pa'i don du rten dang brten pa'i 'brel pa 'dod pa de bzhin du rnal 'byor pa mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i bde ba sgrub pa la mngon par dga' ba bla ma dam pa'i man ngag thob pa /
translated: Just as one desires the connection of the support and the supported for the sake of accomplishing mundane powers, in the same way, the yogi who delights in accomplishing the supreme unchanging bliss obtains the intimate instructions of the sublime guru.

original: gdug pa'i grogs yongs su spangs pa /
analyzed: gdug pa'i grogs yongs su spangs pa /
translated: He completely abandons evil friends.

original: du ba la sogs pa'i mtshan ma bsgoms pa /
analyzed: du ba la sogs pa'i mtshan ma bsgoms pa /
translated: He meditates on the signs of smoke and so forth.

original: las dang po pa dbu ma rnam par sbyangs pa /
analyzed: las dang po pa dbu ma rnam par sbyangs pa /
translated: The beginner purifies the central channel.

original: sems can thams cad la bu gcig pa lta bur mchog tu brtse pa'i sems rjes su bcings pa //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la bu gcig pa lta bur mchog tu brtse pa'i sems rjes su bcings pa //
translated: He is bound by the mind of supreme love for all sentient beings as if they were his only child.

original: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bden pa la brten pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bden pa la brten pa /
translated: He relies on the mundane and transcendent truths.

original: bu dang chung ma la sogs pa dang rang gi lus la ltos pa med pa /
analyzed: bu dang chung ma la sogs pa dang rang gi lus la ltos pa med pa /
translated: He is indifferent to his own body and to his son, wife, and so on.

original: tshogs khang dang gtsug lag khang dang bla ma'i rdzas nye bar longs spyod pa las phyi rol du gyur pa /
analyzed: tshogs khang dang gtsug lag khang dang bla ma'i rdzas nye bar longs spyod pa las phyi rol du gyur pa /
translated: He is outside of the enjoyment of the guru's possessions, the temple, and the monastery.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i lam la brten pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i lam la brten pa /
translated: He relies on the path of the buddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: byams pa dang snying rje dang dga' ba dang btang snyoms te tshangs pa'i gnas bzhis rnam par gnas pa /
analyzed: byams pa dang snying rje dang dga' ba dang btang snyoms te tshangs pa'i gnas bzhis rnam par gnas pa /
translated: They abide in the four divine abodes of love, compassion, joy, and equanimity.

original: zhi ba'i las la sogs pa 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub sgrub pa la mngon par dga' ba spangs pa /
analyzed: zhi ba'i las la sogs pa 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub sgrub pa la mngon par dga' ba spangs pa /
translated: They have abandoned delight in accomplishing mundane powers such as pacifying activity and so forth.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i go 'phang la 'dzeg par 'dod pa /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i go 'phang la 'dzeg par 'dod pa /
translated: They aspire to ascend to the state of omniscience.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa'i sgom pa yongs su spangs pa /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa'i sgom pa yongs su spangs pa /
translated: They have abandoned conceptual meditations such as the maṇḍala wheel.

original: nam mkha'i khams la rnam pa thams cad pa'i stong pa nyid me long gi phra phab pa bzhin du skye ba med pa'i chos nges par mthong ba /
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams la rnam pa thams cad pa'i stong pa nyid me long gi phra phab pa bzhin du skye ba med pa'i chos nges par mthong ba /
translated: They definitely see the unborn phenomena of the emptiness of all aspects in the element of space, like a reflection in a mirror.

original: rang gi sems kyis spros pa'i rab tu snang ba rmi lam dang mtshungs pa'i don du sems pa /
analyzed: rang gi sems kyis spros pa'i rab tu snang ba rmi lam dang mtshungs pa'i don du sems pa /
translated: They think that the appearances created by their own minds are like dreams.

original: rdul phra rab tshogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi chos rnam par dpyad pa'i stong pa chad pa'i stong pa nyid las ring du byas pa /
analyzed: rdul phra rab tshogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi chos rnam par dpyad pa'i stong pa chad pa'i stong pa nyid las ring du byas pa /
translated: They are far removed from the emptiness of the emptiness of the analysis of phenomena that are the nature of a collection of subtle particles.

original: nang gi bde ba rang rig par bya ba'i chos la rjes su chags pa /
analyzed: nang gi bde ba rang rig par bya ba'i chos la rjes su chags pa /
translated: He is attached to the Dharma that is to be known by oneself, the inner bliss.

original: phyi rol gyi dbang pos rang rig par bya ba'i bde ba'i chos yongs su spangs pa /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dbang pos rang rig par bya ba'i bde ba'i chos yongs su spangs pa /
translated: He has completely abandoned the Dharma of bliss that is to be known by oneself through the external senses.

original: shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid can /
analyzed: shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid can /
translated: He is the embodiment of wisdom and method.

original: byang chub kyi sems brtan par byed pa la gcig tu @223b mkhas pa /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems brtan par byed pa la gcig tu @223b mkhas pa /
translated: He is skilled in stabilizing the mind of enlightenment.

original: mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i bde ba chen po'i shes rab ye shes kyi lam gyi man ngag thob pas rten dang brten pa mtshan ma dang kha dog dang phyag dang dbyibs dang dkyil 'khor gyi lha yongs su brtags pa'i chos mi 'dod do //
analyzed: mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i bde ba chen po'i shes rab ye shes kyi lam gyi man ngag thob pas rten dang brten pa mtshan ma dang kha dog dang phyag dang dbyibs dang dkyil 'khor gyi lha yongs su brtags pa'i chos mi 'dod do //
translated: He does not accept the Dharma of examining the signs, colors, hands, shapes, and deities of the maṇḍala, which is the path of the wisdom of the supreme, unchanging great bliss, having obtained the esoteric instructions.

original: gzhan yang rnam par rtog pa'i sems la dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo gnas pa med de gang gi phyir skye pa dang 'gag pa'i chos can nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam par rtog pa'i sems la dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo gnas pa med de gang gi phyir skye pa dang 'gag pa'i chos can nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, the maṇḍala wheel does not exist in the mind of conceptual thought because it has the nature of arising and ceasing.

original: 'dir skad cig gi gang la rnal 'byor pas gtso bo sgom par byed pa'i skad cig de la shar la sogs pa'i lha rnams med cing skad cig gang la shar gyi lha sgom par byed pa'i skad cig de la gtso bo la sogs pa rnams med de de
analyzed: 'dir skad cig gi gang la rnal 'byor pas gtso bo sgom par byed pa'i skad cig de la shar la sogs pa'i lha rnams med cing skad cig gang la shar gyi lha sgom par byed pa'i skad cig de la gtso bo la sogs pa rnams med de de
translated: Here, in the moment when the yogi meditates on the principal deity, the deities of the east and so on do not exist. In the moment when the yogi meditates on the deity of the east, the principal deity and so on do not exist.

original: ltar rim pas lha rnams thams cad med do //
analyzed: ltar rim pas lha rnams thams cad med do //
translated: In this way, all the deities do not exist.

original: gang gi tshe sngon po'i zhal sgom par byed pa de'i tshe dmar po la sogs pa'i zhal rnams med cing gang gi tshe dmar po'i zhal sgom par byed pa de'i tshe sngon po la sogs pa rnams med de de ltar rim pas zhal thams cad med do //
analyzed: gang gi tshe sngon po'i zhal sgom par byed pa de'i tshe dmar po la sogs pa'i zhal rnams med cing gang gi tshe dmar po'i zhal sgom par byed pa de'i tshe sngon po la sogs pa rnams med de de ltar rim pas zhal thams cad med do //
translated: When one meditates on the blue face, the red and so on do not exist. When one meditates on the red face, the blue and so on do not exist. In this way, all the faces do not exist.

original: gang gi dus na rdo rje'i mtshan ma sgom par byed pa de'i dus na ral gri la sogs pa'i mtshan ma rnams med cing gang gi dus na ral gri'i mtshan ma sgom par byed pa de'i dus na rdo rje la sogs pa'i mtshan ma rnams med de de
analyzed: gang gi dus na rdo rje'i mtshan ma sgom par byed pa de'i dus na ral gri la sogs pa'i mtshan ma rnams med cing gang gi dus na ral gri'i mtshan ma sgom par byed pa de'i dus na rdo rje la sogs pa'i mtshan ma rnams med de de
translated: When one meditates on the vajra sign, at that time the signs of the sword and so on do not exist. When one meditates on the sign of the sword, at that time the signs of the vajra and so on do not exist.🔽In that case, since all signs would become nonexistent in sequence, how could the consciousness of a vase exist? When the consciousness of a vase ceases, the consciousness of a woolen cloth arises.

original: ltar rim pas mtshan ma thams cad med par 'gyur pa'i phyir ca ltar yod pa bum pa'i shes pa 'gags par gyur pa na snam bu'i shes pa skye bar 'gyur pa ji lta ba de bzhin du dkyil 'khor gyi gtso bo'i shes pa 'gags pa na shar gyi
analyzed: ltar rim pas mtshan ma thams cad med par 'gyur pa'i phyir ca ltar yod pa bum pa'i shes pa 'gags par gyur pa na snam bu'i shes pa skye bar 'gyur pa ji lta ba de bzhin du dkyil 'khor gyi gtso bo'i shes pa 'gags pa na shar gyi
translated: In the same way, when the consciousness of the principal deity of the maṇḍala ceases, the consciousness of the eastern deity arises.

original: lha'i shes pa skye bar 'gyur ba de ltar skyes pa rnams ni skyes pa 'gags pa'i phyir med cing ma skyes pa rnams ni ma skyes pa'i phyir med pa skyes pa dang ma skyes pa dag med pa'i phyir thams cad med do //
analyzed: lha'i shes pa skye bar 'gyur ba de ltar skyes pa rnams ni skyes pa 'gags pa'i phyir med cing ma skyes pa rnams ni ma skyes pa'i phyir med pa skyes pa dang ma skyes pa dag med pa'i phyir thams cad med do //
translated: In that case, since those that have arisen cease, they do not exist. Since those that have not arisen do not arise, they do not exist. Since those that have arisen and those that have not arisen do not exist, everything does not exist.

original: de'i phyir rnal 'byor pas phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub kyi don du rnam par rtog pa'i bsgom pa mi bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnal 'byor pas phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub kyi don du rnam par rtog pa'i bsgom pa mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the yogi should not cultivate the Mahāmudrā for the sake of the attainment of conceptual meditation.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes la bstod pa las tshigs su bcad pa bcvo lnga pas gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes la bstod pa las tshigs su bcad pa bcvo lnga pas gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
translated: The Bhagavān has said in the Praise of the Wisdom of the Extremely Pure Dharmadhātu in the Saṃpuṭa-nāma-dhāraṇī:

original: don grub bsam pa grub pa ste //
analyzed: don grub bsam pa grub pa ste //
translated: “The one who has accomplished the goal, who has accomplished his intentions,

original: kun du rtog pa thams cad spangs //
analyzed: kun du rtog pa thams cad spangs //
translated: who has abandoned all conceptual thoughts,

original: rnam par mi rtog khams mi zad //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog khams mi zad //
translated: who is non-conceptual, whose realm is inexhaustible,

original: chos dbyings dam pa zad mi shes zhes so //
analyzed: chos dbyings dam pa zad mi shes zhes so //
translated: is the supreme dharmadhātu, which is inexhaustible.”

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i nga rgyal yang mi @224a * //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i nga rgyal yang mi @224a * //
translated: One should not even have the pride of being Vajrasattva.

original: bya ste stong pa de nyid las tshigs su bcad pa bcu gsum pas bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa //
analyzed: bya ste stong pa de nyid las tshigs su bcad pa bcu gsum pas bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa //
translated: The Bhagavān has said in the thirteenth verse of that very emptiness:

original: rig pa dang ni zhabs su ldan //
analyzed: rig pa dang ni zhabs su ldan //
translated: “The one who is endowed with knowledge and feet,🔽the Sugata, the supreme knower of the world,

original: bde gshegs 'jig rten rig pa'i mchog / bdag gir mi 'dzin ngar mi 'dzin //
analyzed: bde gshegs 'jig rten rig pa'i mchog / bdag gir mi 'dzin ngar mi 'dzin //
translated: who does not grasp as ‘mine’ and does not grasp as ‘I,’

original: bden pa gnyis kyi tshul la gnas zhes pa ste de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung 'di'i phyir rnam par rtog pa'i sgom pa dang rdo rje sems dpa'i nga rgyal yang don dam pa'i bden pa la brten pa'i rnal 'byor pas mi bya'o //
analyzed: bden pa gnyis kyi tshul la gnas zhes pa ste de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung 'di'i phyir rnam par rtog pa'i sgom pa dang rdo rje sems dpa'i nga rgyal yang don dam pa'i bden pa la brten pa'i rnal 'byor pas mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the practitioner who is based on ultimate truth should not perform conceptual meditation or the pride of Vajrasattva.

original: 'o na bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa de kho na nyid rig pas rgyud kyi rgyal po thams cad las dang por bsrung ba'i 'khor lo bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: 'o na bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa de kho na nyid rig pas rgyud kyi rgyal po thams cad las dang por bsrung ba'i 'khor lo bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Then, the Bhagavān, the Tathāgata, knowing reality, said, First, the practitioner should meditate on the protection wheel in all the kings of tantras.

original: de nas rang gi snying gar zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la lha'i sa bon gyi yi ge bsam zhing rnam par thar pa'i sgo la sogs pa dag par byas nas /
analyzed: de nas rang gi snying gar zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la lha'i sa bon gyi yi ge bsam zhing rnam par thar pa'i sgo la sogs pa dag par byas nas /
translated: Then, in one's heart, on a moon maṇḍala, one should think of the seed syllable of the deity and purify the door of liberation and so on.

original: nam mkha'i mthil du ye shes kyi sa bon gyi 'od zer rnams kyis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams sad par byas te /
analyzed: nam mkha'i mthil du ye shes kyi sa bon gyi 'od zer rnams kyis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams sad par byas te /
translated: Then, in the center of space, one should awaken the tathāgatas with the light rays of the seed syllable of gnosis.

original: de rnams la sngags pas mchod pa byas nas sdig pa bshags pa dang bsod nams la rjes su yi rang ba dang gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba dang bdag nyid kyi dngos po dbul ba dang byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa dang lam la brten pa dang stong🔽pa nyid la dmigs par bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams la sngags pas mchod pa byas nas sdig pa bshags pa dang bsod nams la rjes su yi rang ba dang gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba dang bdag nyid kyi dngos po dbul ba dang byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa dang lam la brten pa dang stong pa nyid la dmigs par bya'o //
translated: Having worshipped them, the mantrin should confess his sins, rejoice in the merit, go for refuge, offer himself, generate the spirit of enlightenment, rely on the path, and meditate on emptiness.

original: de nas chos 'byung nam mkha'i khams kyi rang bzhin bsgom par bya ste de'i dbus su h'um yig yongs su gyur pa las rdo rje'i sa gzhi'o //
analyzed: de nas chos 'byung nam mkha'i khams kyi rang bzhin bsgom par bya ste de'i dbus su h'um yig yongs su gyur pa las rdo rje'i sa gzhi'o //
translated: Then he should meditate on the source of phenomena, the nature of the realm of space, in the middle of which is a vajra ground arisen from the transformation of the syllable hūṃ.

original: yang na shes rab kyi rgyud kyi dgongs pa rlung la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor rnams dang lhun po'i steng du khang pa brtsegs pa'am rdo rje'i gur ro //
analyzed: yang na shes rab kyi rgyud kyi dgongs pa rlung la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor rnams dang lhun po'i steng du khang pa brtsegs pa'am rdo rje'i gur ro //
translated: Or, according to the intention of the wisdom tantras, it is the maṇḍalas of wind and so on and the stacked-up palace or vajra tent above Meru.

original: de nas sku rdo rje yongs su gyur pa las dkyil 'khor mtshan nyid thams cad yang dag par rdzogs pa zla ba dang nyid ma'i gdan dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de nas sku rdo rje yongs su gyur pa las dkyil 'khor mtshan nyid thams cad yang dag par rdzogs pa zla ba dang nyid ma'i gdan dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Then, from the transformation of Body Vajra, the maṇḍala is complete in all characteristics, endowed with seats of the moon and sun.

original: yang na pam yig yongs su gyur pa las padma dang aa yig yongs su gyur pa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ram ra yig yongs su gyur pa las nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: yang na pam yig yongs su gyur pa las padma dang aa yig yongs su gyur pa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ram ra yig yongs su gyur pa las nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: Or else, from the transformation of the syllable pam, there is a lotus, and from the transformation of the syllable a, there is a moon disk, or from the transformation of the syllable ra, there is a sun disk.

original: de'i steng du a'a li dang k'a li las zla ba dang nyi ma dang ye shes kyi sa bon gyi yi ge rnams kyis me long lta bu dang mnyam pa nyid dang so sor rtog pa dang bya ba grub pa dang shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos
analyzed: de'i steng du a'a li dang k'a li las zla ba dang nyi ma dang ye shes kyi sa bon gyi yi ge rnams kyis me long lta bu dang mnyam pa nyid dang so sor rtog pa dang bya ba grub pa dang shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos
translated: Upon that, from the vowels and consonants, there is the moon and sun, and the seed syllables of the gnoses, which are the mirror-like gnosis, the gnosis of uniformity, the individually discerning gnosis, the gnosis of successful activities, and the gnosis of reality’s purity,

original: kyi dbyings te ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid kyi @224b lha'i gzugs bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: kyi dbyings te ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid kyi @224b lha'i gzugs bsgom par bya'o //
translated: which are the divine forms that are the nature of the five gnoses.

original: de nas sku dang gsungs dang thugs kyi rdo rje shes rab kyi chags pas zhu pa la lha mo rnams kyis rdo rje'i glu rnams kyis rab tu bskul ta slar yang sku dang gsung dang thugs byin gyis brlabs pa rang gi mtshan ma las rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nas sku dang gsungs dang thugs kyi rdo rje shes rab kyi chags pas zhu pa la lha mo rnams kyis rdo rje'i glu rnams kyis rab tu bskul ta slar yang sku dang gsung dang thugs byin gyis brlabs pa rang gi mtshan ma las rdzogs pa'o //
translated: Then, the melting of the vajra body, speech, and mind through the passion of wisdom is the urging with the vajra songs of the goddesses. Again, the consecration of the body, speech, and mind is the perfection from one’s own insignia.

original: de nas dkyil 'khor la lha'i tshogs spro ba dang ye shes kyi 'khor lo dgug pa dang gzhug pa dang bcing ba dang mnyes pa dang dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor la ro mnyam par byed pa dang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang lha mo rnams kyis dbang
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor la lha'i tshogs spro ba dang ye shes kyi 'khor lo dgug pa dang gzhug pa dang bcing ba dang mnyes pa dang dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor la ro mnyam par byed pa dang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang lha mo rnams kyis dbang
translated: Then, isn’t it taught that one should emanate the assembly of deities into the maṇḍala, summon the gnosis wheel, induct it, bind it, delight it, equalize the taste in the pledge maṇḍala, confer empowerment with all the tathāgatas and goddesses,

original: bskur ba dang rdo rje'i cod pan dang rgyan dang ldan pa dang rdo rje sems dpa'i nga rgyal dang gzugs su sngags pas bdag nyid bsgom par bya'o zhes gsungs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: bskur ba dang rdo rje'i cod pan dang rgyan dang ldan pa dang rdo rje sems dpa'i nga rgyal dang gzugs su sngags pas bdag nyid bsgom par bya'o zhes gsungs pa ma yin nam /
translated: and be empowered with the vajra crown and ornaments, and the mantra practitioner should meditate on oneself with the pride of Vajrasattva?

original: 'dir ci ltar dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo sgom pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i sgom pa'o zhes de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsungs la dgag pa brjod ces 'ga' zhig mngon par sems pa 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dir ci ltar dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo sgom pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i sgom pa'o zhes de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsungs la dgag pa brjod ces 'ga' zhig mngon par sems pa 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Here, some may think and say, “How is it that the meditation on the maṇḍala wheel is conceptual meditation?”

original: de'i phyir brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, I will explain.

original: 'dir 'di ni bden te bcom ldan 'das de kho na nyid rig pas kun rdzob kyi bden pa la brten nas sems can gyi bsam pa'i dbang gis byis pa'i blo can brtson 'grus dman pa don dam pa'i de kho na nyid la yongs su rtog par mi byed
analyzed: 'dir 'di ni bden te bcom ldan 'das de kho na nyid rig pas kun rdzob kyi bden pa la brten nas sems can gyi bsam pa'i dbang gis byis pa'i blo can brtson 'grus dman pa don dam pa'i de kho na nyid la yongs su rtog par mi byed
translated: Here this is true: the Bhagavat, knowing reality, in dependence on conventional truth, in consideration of the thoughts of sentient beings, taught the knowledge of dependent origination to those who are childish, who are of low perseverance, who do not fully understand the ultimate reality,

original: pa zab pa dang rgya che ba'i ye shes la sems skrag pa zhi ba la sogs pa'i las sgrub pa la mngon par dga' ba dbang po yul la nye bar longs spyod pa la chags par ral gri dang ril bu dang mig sman dang bcud dang bcud lan
analyzed: pa zab pa dang rgya che ba'i ye shes la sems skrag pa zhi ba la sogs pa'i las sgrub pa la mngon par dga' ba dbang po yul la nye bar longs spyod pa la chags par ral gri dang ril bu dang mig sman dang bcud dang bcud lan
translated: who delight in the pacification of the fear of the profound and vast pristine wisdom, and so on, who delight in the accomplishment of action, who are attached to the enjoyment of the objects of the sense organs, who delight in the accomplishment of mundane powers, such as the sword, the pill, eye medicine,🔽elixirs, and the return of the dead to life.

original: dang 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub sgrub pa la mngon par dga' ba rnams la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i shes pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i dbang po'i spyod yul nyi tshe ba nyi tshe ba'i don byed nus pa gsungs so //
analyzed: dang 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub sgrub pa la mngon par dga' ba rnams la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i shes pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i dbang po'i spyod yul nyi tshe ba nyi tshe ba'i don byed nus pa gsungs so //
translated: He taught the knowledge of dependent origination, the object of the sense organs of dependent origination, which is limited and able to perform a limited function.

original: nyi tshe ba'i don byed nus pa de nyid kyi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung 'di ni don dam pa'i bden pa la brten pa ma yin no /
analyzed: nyi tshe ba'i don byed nus pa de nyid kyi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung 'di ni don dam pa'i bden pa la brten pa ma yin no /
translated: Because it is a limited, functional object, this speech of the Tathāgata is not based on ultimate truth.

original: 'on kyang nyi tshe ba'i don byed nus pa rnam par rtog pa'i bsam gtan dang sngags dang nor bu dang rdo ba dang ral gri dang ril bu dang bcud dang bcud len la sogs pa rdzas nyi tshe ba rnams kyi mthu yang brtag par bya ba ma yin
analyzed: 'on kyang nyi tshe ba'i don byed nus pa rnam par rtog pa'i bsam gtan dang sngags dang nor bu dang rdo ba dang ral gri dang ril bu dang bcud dang bcud len la sogs pa rdzas nyi tshe ba rnams kyi mthu yang brtag par bya ba ma yin
translated: However, the power of limited, functional objects—such as the substances of limited, conceptual meditative absorption, spells, jewels, stones, swords, pills, elixirs, and so on—is not to be doubted.

original: par de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa de ji lta ba de bzhin du de yang blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: par de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa de ji lta ba de bzhin du de yang blta bar bya'o //
translated: Just as the Tathāgata has said, so should you view it.
Here,

original: dkar po'i bsam gtan zhi ba'i gzugs ni zhi ba'i las byed kyi gsad pa la sogs pa mi byed do //
analyzed: dkar po'i bsam gtan zhi ba'i gzugs ni zhi ba'i las byed kyi gsad pa la sogs pa mi byed do //
translated: the form of the peaceful meditative absorption of virtue performs peaceful activity, but not killing and so on.

original: de bzhin du nag po'i bsam gtan drag po'i gzugs ni gsad pa byed kyi dbang du bya ba la sogs pa mi byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du nag po'i bsam gtan drag po'i gzugs ni gsad pa byed kyi dbang du bya ba la sogs pa mi byed do //
translated: Similarly, the form of the fierce meditative absorption of nonvirtue performs killing, but not magnetizing and so on.

original: de bzhin du dmar po'i bsam gtan chags pa'i gzugs ni dbang du bya ba byed kyi rengs pa la sogs pa mi byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du dmar po'i bsam gtan chags pa'i gzugs ni dbang du bya ba byed kyi rengs pa la sogs pa mi byed do //
translated: Similarly, the form of the meditation of red passion acts to enthrall, but not to paralyze and so on.

original: de bzhin du ser po'i bsam gtan rengs pa'i gzugs ni rengs pa byed kyi zhi ba la sogs pa mi byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du ser po'i bsam gtan rengs pa'i gzugs ni rengs pa byed kyi zhi ba la sogs pa mi byed do //
translated: Similarly, the form of the meditation of yellow paralysis paralyzes, but not to pacify and so on.

original: de bzhin dug la yang shes par bya ste dpral bar thig le dkar po'i gzugs kyi bsam gtan ni dug med par byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin dug la yang shes par bya ste dpral bar thig le dkar po'i gzugs kyi bsam gtan ni dug med par byed do //
translated: Similarly, it should be understood for poison: the meditation of the form of a white drop on the forehead acts to remove poison.

original: dmar po'i bsam gtan ni dug skyod par byed do //
analyzed: dmar po'i bsam gtan ni dug skyod par byed do //
translated: The meditation of red acts to move the poison.

original: nag po'i bsam gtan ni dug 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: nag po'i bsam gtan ni dug 'jug par byed do //
translated: The meditation of black acts to spread the poison.

original: ser po'i bsam gtan ni dug rengs par byed de rnam par rtog pa'i bsam gtan nye tshe ba ni nyi tshe ba'i don bya ba byed do //
analyzed: ser po'i bsam gtan ni dug rengs par byed de rnam par rtog pa'i bsam gtan nye tshe ba ni nyi tshe ba'i don bya ba byed do //
translated: The meditation of yellow acts to paralyze the poison. The meditation of conceptual thought acts to accomplish a limited purpose.

original: de bzhin du nor bu dang sngags rang sman rnams la yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du nor bu dang sngags rang sman rnams la yang rig par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, it should be understood for gems, mantras, and herbs.

original: 'dir sngags kyang bsgrubs par gyur na gang zhig zhi ba byed pa de ni gsad pa la sogs pa'i las mi byed do //
analyzed: 'dir sngags kyang bsgrubs par gyur na gang zhig zhi ba byed pa de ni gsad pa la sogs pa'i las mi byed do //
translated: If one accomplishes a mantra here for pacifying, then it will not perform the action of killing, etc.

original: gang zhig gsad pa byed pa de ni dbang la sogs pa mi byed do //
analyzed: gang zhig gsad pa byed pa de ni dbang la sogs pa mi byed do //
translated: If one performs killing, then it will not perform the action of controlling, etc.

original: gang zhig dbang du bya ba byed pa de ni rengs pa la sogs pa mi byed do //
analyzed: gang zhig dbang du bya ba byed pa de ni rengs pa la sogs pa mi byed do //
translated: If one performs the action of controlling, then it will not perform the action of paralyzing, etc.

original: gang zhig rengs pa byed pa de ni zhib la sogs pa mi byed do //
analyzed: gang zhig rengs pa byed pa de ni zhib la sogs pa mi byed do //
translated: If one performs the action of paralyzing, then it will not perform the action of pacifying, etc.

original: de'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i shes pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bya ba nus par mi 'gyur te de bzhin du ral gri la sogs pa'i grub pa yang ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i shes pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bya ba nus par mi 'gyur te de bzhin du ral gri la sogs pa'i grub pa yang ngo //
translated: Therefore, mundane knowledge will not be able to perform the action of supramundane omniscience, and likewise, the accomplishment of the sword, etc. will not be able to perform the action of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: 'o na sngags gcig kyang bsgrubs par gyur na las thams cad byed par bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa ma yin nam ci ltar nyi tshe bar 'gyur zhes 'dir 'ga' zhig gi sems 'byung bar 'gyur te de'i phyir brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'o na sngags gcig kyang bsgrubs par gyur na las thams cad byed par bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa ma yin nam ci ltar nyi tshe bar 'gyur zhes 'dir 'ga' zhig gi sems 'byung bar 'gyur te de'i phyir brjod par bya'o //
translated: But if one accomplishes a single mantra, will it not perform all actions? Has not the Blessed One said this? How can it be limited? This thought may arise for some here, so it should be explained.

original: 'dir sngags gcig kyang bsgrubs par gyur na las thams cad byed pa 'di ni de ltar tshad ma ma yin te gang gi phyir bya ba'i dbye ba las so //
analyzed: 'dir sngags gcig kyang bsgrubs par gyur na las thams cad byed pa 'di ni de ltar tshad ma ma yin te gang gi phyir bya ba'i dbye ba las so //
translated: Here, if one mantra is accomplished, it performs all actions. This is not so, because of the division of rites.

original: 'dir sngags gcig la yang bya ba'i dbye bas dbye ba yod de de yang de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa 'di ltar zhi ba la sngags kyi bzlas pa na ma:li mtha' can dang rgyas pa la sv'a h'a'i tha' can dang dgug pa la boo shat kyi mtha' can
analyzed: 'dir sngags gcig la yang bya ba'i dbye bas dbye ba yod de de yang de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa 'di ltar zhi ba la sngags kyi bzlas pa na ma:li mtha' can dang rgyas pa la sv'a h'a'i tha' can dang dgug pa la boo shat kyi mtha' can
translated: Here, even one mantra has a division due to the division of rites. And that is stated by the Tathāgata as follows: For pacification, the mantra recitation ends with maṁ, for prosperity with svāhā, for summoning with vauṣaṭ,

original: dang dbye ba la h'um yig gi mtha' can dang dbang du bya ba la bo shat kyi mtha' can dang bsad pa la phat kyi mtha' can no //
analyzed: dang dbye ba la h'um yig gi mtha' can dang dbang du bya ba la bo shat kyi mtha' can dang bsad pa la phat kyi mtha' can no //
translated: for separation with the syllable hūṁ, for subjugation with vaṣaṭ, and for killing with phaṭ.

original: de bzhin du sbyin @225b sreg gi bya ba la yang thab kyi dbye bas dbye ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyin @225b sreg gi bya ba la yang thab kyi dbye bas dbye ba gsungs pa /
translated: Similarly, in the rite of homa, a division is stated due to the division of the hearth.

original: 'dir zlum po'i thab tu au du ma b'a ra la sogs pa'o ma can gyi shing gi yam shing dang / ng'ur ba dang 'o ma rnams kyis sbyin sreg byas pa'i sngags ni zhib byed kyi rgyas pa la sogs pa'i las mi byed do //
analyzed: 'dir zlum po'i thab tu au du ma b'a ra la sogs pa'o ma can gyi shing gi yam shing dang / ng'ur ba dang 'o ma rnams kyis sbyin sreg byas pa'i sngags ni zhib byed kyi rgyas pa la sogs pa'i las mi byed do //
translated: Here, in the round hearth, with the kindling wood of udumbara and so on, which are wet, and with curds and milk, the mantra does not perform the action of pacifying, increasing, and so on.

original: gru bzhi'i thab tu sngar brjod pa'i yam shing dang 'bru dang dmar rnams kyis sbyin sreg byas pa ni rgyas pa byed kyi gsad pa la sogs pa mi byed do //
analyzed: gru bzhi'i thab tu sngar brjod pa'i yam shing dang 'bru dang dmar rnams kyis sbyin sreg byas pa ni rgyas pa byed kyi gsad pa la sogs pa mi byed do //
translated: In the square hearth, with the kindling wood, grains, and red substances mentioned above, the burnt offering performs increasing, but not killing and so on.

original: gzhu'i rnam pa'i thab tu rus pa'i yam shing dang mi'i sha dang dug dang khrag rnams kyis sbyin sreg byas pa ni gsad pa byed kyi bsgrad pa la sogs pa mi byed do //
analyzed: gzhu'i rnam pa'i thab tu rus pa'i yam shing dang mi'i sha dang dug dang khrag rnams kyis sbyin sreg byas pa ni gsad pa byed kyi bsgrad pa la sogs pa mi byed do //
translated: In the hearth shaped like a bow, with the kindling wood of bone, human flesh, poison, and blood, the burnt offering performs killing, but not paralyzing and so on.

original: zur lnga pa'i thab tu bya rog gi mjug ma dang mi'i zhag dang skye tshe rnams kyis sbyin sreg byas pa ni bskrad pa byed kyi dbang du bya ba la sogs pa mi byed do //
analyzed: zur lnga pa'i thab tu bya rog gi mjug ma dang mi'i zhag dang skye tshe rnams kyis sbyin sreg byas pa ni bskrad pa byed kyi dbang du bya ba la sogs pa mi byed do //
translated: In the hearth with five corners, with the burnt offering of the tail of a crow, human fat, and black mustard seeds, the burnt offering performs expelling, but not enthralling and so on.

original: zur bdun pa'i thab tu kim shu ka'i yam shing dang me tog dmar po dang rdo rje'i chus sbyin sreg byas pa ni dgug pa phyed kyi dbang du bya ba la sogs pa mi byed do //
analyzed: zur bdun pa'i thab tu kim shu ka'i yam shing dang me tog dmar po dang rdo rje'i chus sbyin sreg byas pa ni dgug pa phyed kyi dbang du bya ba la sogs pa mi byed do //
translated: In a triangular hearth, one should offer oblations of sticks of the kimshuka tree, red flowers, and vajra water. This is for the purpose of summoning, not for the purpose of paralyzing, etc.

original: zur gsum pa'i thab tu seng ldeng gi ya ma shing dang rdul dang bil ba'i me tog rnams kyis sbyin sreg byas pa ni dbang du bya ba byed kyi rengs pa la sogs pa mi byed do //🔽zur brgyad pa'i thab tu bil ba'i yam shing dang me tog rnying pa dang mchil ma rnams kyis sbyin sreg byas pa ni rengs pa byed kyi rmongs pa la sogs pa mi byed do //
analyzed: zur gsum pa'i thab tu seng ldeng gi ya ma shing dang rdul dang bil ba'i me tog rnams kyis sbyin sreg byas pa ni dbang du bya ba byed kyi rengs pa la sogs pa mi byed do // zur brgyad pa'i thab tu bil ba'i yam shing dang me tog rnying pa dang mchil ma rnams kyis sbyin sreg byas pa ni rengs pa byed kyi rmongs pa la sogs pa mi byed do //
translated: In a triangular hearth, one should offer oblations of sticks of the dhak tree, dust, and bilva flowers. This is for the purpose of enthralling, not for the purpose of paralyzing, etc.🔽In an octagonal hearth, one should offer oblations of bilva sticks, old flowers, and saliva. This is for the purpose of paralyzing, not for the purpose of confusing, etc.

original: zur drug pa'i thab tu aa rka'i yam shing dang gser shing gi me tog dang chang rnams kyis sbyin sreg byed pa ni rmongs pa byed kyi zhi ba la sogs pa mi byed do //
analyzed: zur drug pa'i thab tu aa rka'i yam shing dang gser shing gi me tog dang chang rnams kyis sbyin sreg byed pa ni rmongs pa byed kyi zhi ba la sogs pa mi byed do //
translated: In a hexagonal hearth, one should offer oblations of sticks of the arka tree, flowers of the gold-leaf tree, and beer. This is for the purpose of confusing, not for the purpose of pacifying, etc.

original: de bzhin du rdul tshon gyi dbye bas dbye ba gsungs te zhi ba dang rgyas pa la rdul tshon dkar ba dang gsad pa dang bskrad pa la rdul tshon nag po dang dbang dang dgug pa la rdul tshon dmar po dang rengs pa dang / rmongs pa la rdul tshon ser ba dang slar gso ba la rdul tshon ljang khu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rdul tshon gyi dbye bas dbye ba gsungs te zhi ba dang rgyas pa la rdul tshon dkar ba dang gsad pa dang bskrad pa la rdul tshon nag po dang dbang dang dgug pa la rdul tshon dmar po dang rengs pa dang / rmongs pa la rdul tshon ser ba dang slar gso ba la rdul tshon ljang khu'o //
translated: Likewise, it is said that there are divisions by way of the divisions of colored powders: for pacifying and increasing, white colored powders; for killing and expelling, black colored powders; for controlling and summoning, red colored powders; for paralyzing and confusing, yellow colored powders; and for reviving, green colored powders.

original: de bzhin du bgrang phreng gi dbye bas dbye ba gsungs te zhi ba la sngags kyi bzlas pa shel gyi bgrang phreng so //
analyzed: de bzhin du bgrang phreng gi dbye bas dbye ba gsungs te zhi ba la sngags kyi bzlas pa shel gyi bgrang phreng so //
translated: Likewise, it is said that there are divisions by way of the divisions of rosaries: for pacifying, a crystal rosary for mantra repetitions;

original: rgyas pa la mu tig gi rdog pa'i bgrang dang bsad pa la mi'i so'i bgrang phreng dang bskrad pa la rnga mo'i so'i bgrang ngam bong bu'o so'i bgrang phreng dang dbang la bod tse'i bgrang phreng dang dgug pa la padma'i sa bon gyi bgrang phreng ngam tsandan dmar
analyzed: rgyas pa la mu tig gi rdog pa'i bgrang dang bsad pa la mi'i so'i bgrang phreng dang bskrad pa la rnga mo'i so'i bgrang ngam bong bu'o so'i bgrang phreng dang dbang la bod tse'i bgrang phreng dang dgug pa la padma'i sa bon gyi bgrang phreng ngam tsandan dmar
translated: for increasing, a pearl rosary; for killing, a human bone rosary; for expelling, a camel bone rosary or a donkey bone rosary; for controlling, a bod tree rosary; for summoning, a lotus seed rosary or a red sandalwood rosary; for paralyzing, a human bone rosary; for confusing, a dog tooth rosary; and for reviving, a green bamboo rosary.

original: po'i bgrang phreng dang rengs pa la ru d'a ksha'i @226a * //
analyzed: po'i bgrang phreng dang rengs pa la ru d'a ksha'i @226a * //
translated: For paralysis, a rosary of rudraksha.

original: bgrang phreng dang rmongs pa la lung tang gi bgrang phreng dang slar gso ba la sngags bzlas pa mar ga ta'i bgrang phreng gis so //
analyzed: bgrang phreng dang rmongs pa la lung tang gi bgrang phreng dang slar gso ba la sngags bzlas pa mar ga ta'i bgrang phreng gis so //
translated: For confusion, a rosary of lungtend. For restoration, a rosary of maragata.

original: de ltar sngags dang sman dang nor bu dang ral gri dang bcud dang bcud len la sogs pa grub pa'i rdzas bsgrubs pa rnams la yang nyi tshe ba'i yon tan yod kyi mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i yon tan med do //
analyzed: de ltar sngags dang sman dang nor bu dang ral gri dang bcud dang bcud len la sogs pa grub pa'i rdzas bsgrubs pa rnams la yang nyi tshe ba'i yon tan yod kyi mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i yon tan med do //
translated: Thus, the substances for the accomplishments of mantra, medicine, jewels, sword, elixir, and so on, have limited qualities, but do not have the qualities of the supreme.

original: 'dir stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing du ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis sbrul pa'i sku du ma dang sna tshogs pa'i skad rnams kyis cig car sems can gyi don byed pa de ltar nyi tshe ba bsgrubs pa 'di
analyzed: 'dir stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing du ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis sbrul pa'i sku du ma dang sna tshogs pa'i skad rnams kyis cig car sems can gyi don byed pa de ltar nyi tshe ba bsgrubs pa 'di
translated: Here, in the buddhafield of the trichiliocosm, the Bhagavān simultaneously benefits sentient beings with many emanation bodies and various languages.

original: rnams kyis ni rnal 'byor pas sems can gyi don byed par mi nus te nyi tshe ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rnams kyis ni rnal 'byor pas sems can gyi don byed par mi nus te nyi tshe ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The first two lines show that the yogi is not able to benefit sentient beings, because he is limited.🔽

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi bstod pa las tshigs su bcad pa dang po gsum gyis gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi bstod pa las tshigs su bcad pa dang po gsum gyis gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
translated: The first three verses of the praise of discerning wisdom in the Bhagavatī Prajñāpāramitā Sūtra say:

original: yang dag bdag med de bzhin nyid //
analyzed: yang dag bdag med de bzhin nyid //
translated: The true absence of self, suchness,

original: yang dag mtha' ste yi ge med //
analyzed: yang dag mtha' ste yi ge med //
translated: The perfect end, the unelaborate,

original: stong nyid smra ba'i khyu mchog ste //
analyzed: stong nyid smra ba'i khyu mchog ste //
translated: The supreme speaker on emptiness,

original: zab cing rgya che sgra sgrogs pa //🔽chos kyi dung ste sgra chen ldan //
analyzed: zab cing rgya che sgra sgrogs pa // chos kyi dung ste sgra chen ldan //
translated: The one who proclaims the profound and vast,🔽The Dharma conch, the great sound,

original: chos kyi gand'i sgra po che //
analyzed: chos kyi gand'i sgra po che //
translated: The great sound of the Dharma drum,

original: mi gnas mya ngan 'das pa po //
analyzed: mi gnas mya ngan 'das pa po //
translated: The one who attains nonabiding nirvāṇa,

original: phyogs bcu'i chos kyi rnga bo che //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i chos kyi rnga bo che //
translated: The great Dharma drum of the ten directions,

original: gzugs med gzugs bzang ngam pa ste //
analyzed: gzugs med gzugs bzang ngam pa ste //
translated: The formless one with a beautiful form,

original: sna tshogs gzugs can yid las skyes //🔽gzugs rnams thams cad snang ba'i dpal //
analyzed: sna tshogs gzugs can yid las skyes // gzugs rnams thams cad snang ba'i dpal //
translated: The one born from the mind with various forms,🔽The glory of the appearance of all forms,

original: gzugs brnyan ma lus 'chang ba po zhes so //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan ma lus 'chang ba po zhes so //
translated: The one who holds all reflections.

original: de bzhin du rgyud kyi rgyal po'i lnga pa ye shes kyi le'u las tshigs su bcad pa dgu bcu rtsa bdun pas thams cad mkhyen ba'i gsung bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyud kyi rgyal po'i lnga pa ye shes kyi le'u las tshigs su bcad pa dgu bcu rtsa bdun pas thams cad mkhyen ba'i gsung bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
translated: Likewise, in the fifth chapter of the King of Tantras, the chapter on pristine consciousness, in ninety-seven verses, the speech of the omniscient Bhagavān is as follows:

original: dung 'gro yi dags lha min rnams dang lto 'phye lha dang mi ni 'phags pa bod la sogs rnams la //
analyzed: dung 'gro yi dags lha min rnams dang lto 'phye lha dang mi ni 'phags pa bod la sogs rnams la //
translated: “The gods, nāgas, yakṣas, pretas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and humans, the āryas, and so on,

original: byung dang 'byung 'gyur da ltar byung ba rnam pa gsum dang rtag tu bden pa'i chos ni gsung byed cing //
analyzed: byung dang 'byung 'gyur da ltar byung ba rnam pa gsum dang rtag tu bden pa'i chos ni gsung byed cing //
translated: always speak the true Dharma in the three times, the past, the present, and the future.

original: rang rang skad gzhan dag gis srid pa gsum po ma tshang med pa lam la yang dag 'god byed pa //
analyzed: rang rang skad gzhan dag gis srid pa gsum po ma tshang med pa lam la yang dag 'god byed pa //
translated: In their own languages, they establish the three existences in the path without exception.

original: 'di ni bde mnyam 'bras bu ster ba thams cad mkhyen pa'i gsung ste lha yi skad kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni bde mnyam 'bras bu ster ba thams cad mkhyen pa'i gsung ste lha yi skad kyang ma yin no //
translated: This is the speech of the omniscient one, who bestows the result of the state of union, not the speech of the gods.”

original: slar yang le'u de nyid las de'i gong gi tshigs su bcad pas thams cad mkhyen pa'i sku dang gsung gi bya ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: slar yang le'u de nyid las de'i gong gi tshigs su bcad pas thams cad mkhyen pa'i sku dang gsung gi bya ba gsungs pa /
translated: Again, in that chapter, above that, the activities of the body and speech of the omniscient one are stated in a verse:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: “It is as follows:

original: skye ba snga mar rang gi snying gis bskyed pa'i zhi dang chags pa la sogs dngos po @226b rnams kyis ni //
analyzed: skye ba snga mar rang gi snying gis bskyed pa'i zhi dang chags pa la sogs dngos po @226b rnams kyis ni //
translated: By the things that are born from his own heart in previous lives, such as his peace and love,

original: bag chags stobs kyis 'khor lor gnas pa gcig ni du mar mthong ste smon lam yon tan dbang gis so //
analyzed: bag chags stobs kyis 'khor lor gnas pa gcig ni du mar mthong ste smon lam yon tan dbang gis so //
translated: one who abides in the wheel is seen as many by the power of his habitual tendencies, by the power of his aspirational prayers and good qualities.🔽The single voice of the one with many forms enters into the hearts of living beings by means of his individual forms.

original: don gcig du ma'i skad ni rang rang dngos po rnams kyis srog chags rnams kyi snying la rab tu 'jug / gnas can rnams kyi bsod nams slad du 'khor lo la gnas bsod snyoms la ni rnam par rgyu ru gshegs zhes so //
analyzed: don gcig du ma'i skad ni rang rang dngos po rnams kyis srog chags rnams kyi snying la rab tu 'jug / gnas can rnams kyi bsod nams slad du 'khor lo la gnas bsod snyoms la ni rnam par rgyu ru gshegs zhes so //
translated: For the sake of the merit of those who abide in the wheel, he goes for alms, moving about in the world.

original: 'dir ji ltar thams cad mkhyen pa'i sku dang gsung dang thugs dang ye shes rnam pa thams cad pa rnam par rtog pa med pa don bya ba thams cad nus par gyur pa de bzhin du rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa'i bsam gtan dang sngags
analyzed: 'dir ji ltar thams cad mkhyen pa'i sku dang gsung dang thugs dang ye shes rnam pa thams cad pa rnam par rtog pa med pa don bya ba thams cad nus par gyur pa de bzhin du rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa'i bsam gtan dang sngags
translated: Here, just as the omniscient one’s body, speech, mind, and gnosis are endowed with all aspects, are nonconceptual, and are able to perform all benefits, in the same way, the yogis’ conceptual meditative absorption and mantras

original: la sogs pa bsgrubs pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i don bya ba nus par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: la sogs pa bsgrubs pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i don bya ba nus par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and so on, would not be able to perform the function of omniscience.

original: don de bzhin du 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyis zad par sa la sogs pa mngon sum du byas pa yang nyi tshe bar 'gyur te gang gi phyir nyi tshe ba'i rdzu 'phrul spro bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don de bzhin du 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyis zad par sa la sogs pa mngon sum du byas pa yang nyi tshe bar 'gyur te gang gi phyir nyi tshe ba'i rdzu 'phrul spro bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the same way, the pervasions of earth, etc. that are actualized by the passionless would be limited, because they would be limited magical emanations.

original: 'dir 'dod chags dang bral ba gang zhig sa'i zad par mngon sum du byed pa ni sa'i zad par spro bar byed kyi chu la sogs pa'i zad par spro bar mi nus so //
analyzed: 'dir 'dod chags dang bral ba gang zhig sa'i zad par mngon sum du byed pa ni sa'i zad par spro bar byed kyi chu la sogs pa'i zad par spro bar mi nus so //
translated: Here, the passionless one who actualizes the pervasion of earth would emanate the pervasion of earth, but would not be able to emanate the pervasion of water, etc.

original: de bzhin du stong pa'i zad par ji srid par zad par so so la yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du stong pa'i zad par ji srid par zad par so so la yang rig par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the pervasion of emptiness should be understood as far as the pervasion of each.

original: 'dir dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo can gang zhig 'dus pa'i dkyil 'khor spro bar byed pa des ni 'khor lo sdom pa'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa spro bar mi nus so //
analyzed: 'dir dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo can gang zhig 'dus pa'i dkyil 'khor spro bar byed pa des ni 'khor lo sdom pa'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa spro bar mi nus so //
translated: Here, the one who emanates the mandala of the assembly of the mandala of Cakrasamvara would not be able to emanate the mandala of Cakrasaṃvara, etc.

original: gang zhig 'khor lo sdom pa spro bar byed pa des ni 'dus ba la sogs pa spro bar mi nus te nyi tshe ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gang zhig 'khor lo sdom pa spro bar byed pa des ni 'dus ba la sogs pa spro bar mi nus te nyi tshe ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Whoever delights in the Cakrasaṃvara mandala cannot delight in the Guhyasamāja and so forth, because they are limited.

original: ci ste dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo gcig mngon sum du byas par gyur na dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo thams cad dang khams gsum po yang mngon sum du byas par 'gyur te gzhan khams gsum pa dang phung po dang khams dang skye mched kyi dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor
analyzed: ci ste dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo gcig mngon sum du byas par gyur na dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo thams cad dang khams gsum po yang mngon sum du byas par 'gyur te gzhan khams gsum pa dang phung po dang khams dang skye mched kyi dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor
translated: If one were to manifest the Cakrasaṃvara mandala, one would manifest all the mandalas and the three realms, because there is nothing outside of the mandala of the aggregates, constituents, and sense spheres of the three realms.

original: lo las phyi rol ni yod pa ma yin no zhes pa 'ga' zhig gi bsam pa 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: lo las phyi rol ni yod pa ma yin no zhes pa 'ga' zhig gi bsam pa 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Some might think this.

original: de'i phyir brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, I will explain.

original: 'dir gal te zad par gyi khams sam dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo gcig mngon sum du byas par gyur na khams gsum po mngon sum du byas par 'gyur zhing thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs par yang 'gyur na de'i tshe thams cad mkhyen pa'i go 'phang thob
analyzed: 'dir gal te zad par gyi khams sam dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo gcig mngon sum du byas par gyur na khams gsum po mngon sum du byas par 'gyur zhing thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs par yang 'gyur na de'i tshe thams cad mkhyen pa'i go 'phang thob
translated: If one directly perceives the element or wheel of the mandala of totality, one would directly perceive the three realms and one would also attain omniscience.

original: pa'i slad du thams cad mkhyen pa @227a * //🔽nyid dang lam mkhyen pa nyid dang lam gyi rnam pa mkhyen pa nyid dang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mngon sum du byed pa zhes bya bar mi 'gyur te zad par sa la sogs pa'am dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo gcig mngon sum du byas na yang
analyzed: pa'i slad du thams cad mkhyen pa @227a * // nyid dang lam mkhyen pa nyid dang lam gyi rnam pa mkhyen pa nyid dang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mngon sum du byed pa zhes bya bar mi 'gyur te zad par sa la sogs pa'am dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo gcig mngon sum du byas na yang
translated: At that time, it would not be called “the direct perception of omniscience,🔽the knowledge of the path, the knowledge of the aspects of the path, and the knowledge of all aspects” in order to attain the state of omniscience.

original: dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur zhing nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas nyid dang grub pa nyid ces bya bar mi 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur zhing nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas nyid dang grub pa nyid ces bya bar mi 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If one directly perceives the element of earth and so on or the wheel of the mandala, one would become a perfect buddha and it would not be called “the state of śrāvaka, pratyekabuddha, and siddha.”

original: 'dir theg pa gsum las bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung thos pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing che ge mo dang 'jig rten gyi khams che ge mor bskal pa che ge mo la che ge mo'i rigs las che ge mo'i sras skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis
analyzed: 'dir theg pa gsum las bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung thos pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing che ge mo dang 'jig rten gyi khams che ge mor bskal pa che ge mo la che ge mo'i rigs las che ge mo'i sras skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis
translated: Here, from among the three vehicles, one hears the speech of the Bhagavat: “In such and such a buddhafield, in such and such a world system, in such and such an eon, the son of such and such a family, such and such a being, adorned with the thirty-two marks of a great being

original: dang dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus brgyan pa mngon par shes pa drug dang ldan pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa byung bar 'gyur te gnas che ge mor mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: dang dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus brgyan pa mngon par shes pa drug dang ldan pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa byung bar 'gyur te gnas che ge mor mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
translated: and the eighty minor marks, endowed with the six superknowledges, will appear as a tathagata. He will fully awaken to buddhahood in such and such a place.

original: gnas che ge mor bzhugs so //
analyzed: gnas che ge mor bzhugs so //
translated: He will dwell in such and such a place.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba mdzad do //
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba mdzad do //
translated: He will turn the wheel of Dharma.

original: mos pa sna tshogs pa'i sems can rnams la skad sna tshogs rnams kyis chos che ge mo bstan to //
analyzed: mos pa sna tshogs pa'i sems can rnams la skad sna tshogs rnams kyis chos che ge mo bstan to //
translated: He will teach such and such a Dharma to sentient beings with various inclinations, in various languages.”

original: gnas che ge mor sku gdung chen po yang dag par bstan pa mdzad nas yongs su mya ngan las 'das te sku gdung de rnams kyi cho 'phrul chen po phul du byung ba mthong nas lha dang lha ma yin dang mi rnams kyis sku gdung de rnams la
analyzed: gnas che ge mor sku gdung chen po yang dag par bstan pa mdzad nas yongs su mya ngan las 'das te sku gdung de rnams kyi cho 'phrul chen po phul du byung ba mthong nas lha dang lha ma yin dang mi rnams kyis sku gdung de rnams la
translated: Having manifested a great body in such and such a place, he passed into parinirvāṇa. Having seen the great, excellent miracles of those relics, the gods, asuras, and humans made offerings to those relics.

original: mchod pa byed pa ste de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi zhing che ge mo dang 'jig rten gyi khams che ge mor bskal pa che ge mo la skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu dang mngon par shes pa drug
analyzed: mchod pa byed pa ste de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi zhing che ge mo dang 'jig rten gyi khams che ge mor bskal pa che ge mo la skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu dang mngon par shes pa drug
translated: In the same way, in such and such a buddha field, in such and such a world system, in such and such an eon, a great being appeared, endowed with the thirty-two marks of a great being, the eighty minor marks, and the six superknowledges.

original: dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pa byung ste gnas che ge mor mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
