analyzed: dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pa byung ste gnas che ge mor mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
translated: He became fully enlightened in such and such a place.

original: yul che ge mor bzhugs so //
analyzed: yul che ge mor bzhugs so //
translated: He resided in such and such a place.

original: gnas che ge mor chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba mdzad do //
analyzed: gnas che ge mor chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba mdzad do //
translated: He turned the wheel of Dharma in such and such a place.

original: mos pa sna tshogs pa'i sems can rnams la sna tshogs pa'i skad rnams kyis chos che ge mo bstan to //
analyzed: mos pa sna tshogs pa'i sems can rnams la sna tshogs pa'i skad rnams kyis chos che ge mo bstan to //
translated: He teaches the Dharma with various languages to sentient beings with various inclinations.

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnams su cig car sku'i rdzu 'phrul bstan to //
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnams su cig car sku'i rdzu 'phrul bstan to //
translated: He displays his magical body simultaneously in the trichiliocosm.

original: gnas che ge mor sku gdung chen po yang dag par bstan pa mdzad nas yongs su mya ngan las 'das te sku gdung de rnams kyi 'phro ba chen po phul du byung @227b ba mthong nas lha dang lha ma yin dang mi rnams kyis sku gdung rnams mchod🔽par byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gnas che ge mor sku gdung chen po yang dag par bstan pa mdzad nas yongs su mya ngan las 'das te sku gdung de rnams kyi 'phro ba chen po phul du byung @227b ba mthong nas lha dang lha ma yin dang mi rnams kyis sku gdung rnams mchod par byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Having displayed his great body in such and such a place, he passes into parinirvāṇa, and his relics are seen to be distributed in a great, excellent way, and are worshipped by gods, asuras, and humans.

original: de'i phyir dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo gcig mngon sum du byas par gyur pa na rnal 'byor pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su mi 'gyur te gang gi phyir chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba med pa'i phyir dang de bzhin gshegs pas lung bstan pa med
analyzed: de'i phyir dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo gcig mngon sum du byas par gyur pa na rnal 'byor pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su mi 'gyur te gang gi phyir chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba med pa'i phyir dang de bzhin gshegs pas lung bstan pa med
translated: Therefore, when a single maṇḍala wheel is actualized, the yogin does not become a perfect buddha, because the wheel of Dharma is not turned and there is no prophecy by the Tathāgata.

original: pa'i phyir ro //🔽'dir ji ltar mgon po byams pa de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du de bzhin gshegs pas lung bstan pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus su 'byung bar 'gyur pa thal ba'i dbang po la sogs pa gzhan rnams kyang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'byung bar 'gyur ro
analyzed: pa'i phyir ro // 'dir ji ltar mgon po byams pa de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du de bzhin gshegs pas lung bstan pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus su 'byung bar 'gyur pa thal ba'i dbang po la sogs pa gzhan rnams kyang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'byung bar 'gyur ro
translated: Because of that.🔽Here, just as the Lord Maitreya was predicted by the Tathagata to become a Tathagata, and just as other beings such as Indraraja were predicted by the Tathagata to appear in the future, so also the Tathagata predicted that the perfect Buddhas would appear.

original: zhes de bzhin gshegs pas lung bstan pa de bzhin du dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo gcig mngon sum du byas pa'i rnal 'byor pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes ba ni 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: zhes de bzhin gshegs pas lung bstan pa de bzhin du dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo gcig mngon sum du byas pa'i rnal 'byor pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes ba ni 'ga' yang med do //
translated: In the same way, there is no one who can say that the yogi who has actualized the single mandala circle will become a perfect Buddha Bhagavat.

original: 'on kyang sems can gyi bsam pa'i dbang gis ral gri dang ril bu dang mig sman dang bcud dang bcud len la sogs pa 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub sgrub pa'i don du dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo sgom pa bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs te de'i phyir dkyil 'khor
analyzed: 'on kyang sems can gyi bsam pa'i dbang gis ral gri dang ril bu dang mig sman dang bcud dang bcud len la sogs pa 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub sgrub pa'i don du dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo sgom pa bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs te de'i phyir dkyil 'khor
translated: However, in accordance with the thoughts of sentient beings, the Bhagavān taught the meditation of the maṇḍalacakra for the purpose of accomplishing mundane feats such as the sword, pill, eye medicine, elixir, and alchemical powers.

original: gyi 'khor lo'i lha mngon sum du byas pa las ral gri la sogs pa'i dngos grub rnams 'grub par 'gyur gyi sgrub pa po thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du ni 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gyi 'khor lo'i lha mngon sum du byas pa las ral gri la sogs pa'i dngos grub rnams 'grub par 'gyur gyi sgrub pa po thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du ni 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the maṇḍalacakra is the cause of the accomplishment of the sword and so on, but not the cause of the accomplishment of omniscience.

original: gal te dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo sgom pa'i stobs kyis sgrub pa po thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'grub par 'gyur na de'i tshe ci'i don du grub pa rnams 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung rang gi gzhung la ston par byed /
analyzed: gal te dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo sgom pa'i stobs kyis sgrub pa po thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'grub par 'gyur na de'i tshe ci'i don du grub pa rnams 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung rang gi gzhung la ston par byed /
translated: If the maṇḍalacakra were the cause of the accomplishment of omniscience, then for what purpose would the Bhagavān teach the accomplishment of the sword and so on in his own scriptures?

original: de'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub rnams thams cad mkhyen pa'i yon tan ster bar byed pa por mi 'gyur te nyi tshe ba nyid kyi phyir dang thams cad mkhyen pa'i gsung med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub rnams thams cad mkhyen pa'i yon tan ster bar byed pa por mi 'gyur te nyi tshe ba nyid kyi phyir dang thams cad mkhyen pa'i gsung med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, mundane spiritual powers do not bestow the qualities of omniscience, because they are limited and because they are not the speech of the Omniscient One.

original: sgrib pa dang bcas pa'i lus kyi rdzu 'phrul yang dag par ston pa'i phyir sgrib pa dang bcas pa'i chos mngon sum du byas pa na rnal 'byor pa thams cad mkhyen par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgrib pa dang bcas pa'i lus kyi rdzu 'phrul yang dag par ston pa'i phyir sgrib pa dang bcas pa'i chos mngon sum du byas pa na rnal 'byor pa thams cad mkhyen par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: When one manifests a Dharma that is limited because it displays only the miraculous powers of the body, one does not become omniscient.

original: de'i phyir sgrib pa med pa'i chos mngon sum du byas @228a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir sgrib pa med pa'i chos mngon sum du byas @228a * //
translated: Therefore, when one manifests a Dharma that is free of limitations, one becomes omniscient.

original: par gyur na rnal 'byor pa thams cad mkhyen par 'gyur te sgrib pa med pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid las thams cad mkhyen pa'i lha'i mig dang lha'i rna ba dang gzhan gyi sems shes pa dag sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa dang thams cad du 'gro ba'i
analyzed: par gyur na rnal 'byor pa thams cad mkhyen par 'gyur te sgrib pa med pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid las thams cad mkhyen pa'i lha'i mig dang lha'i rna ba dang gzhan gyi sems shes pa dag sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa dang thams cad du 'gro ba'i
translated: The divine eye, divine ear, knowledge of others’ minds, and recollection of past states of the omniscient one are free of limitations because they are the characteristics of a Dharma that is free of limitations.

original: rdzu 'phrul dang zag pa thams cad zad pa dang gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang las kyi rnam par smin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang khams gcig dang du ma mkhyen pa'i stobs dang dbang po'i mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang🔽mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs dang sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gyur pa'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs dang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par bya ba mkhyen pa'i stobs dang skye ba du ma'i rtogs pa brjod pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang mngon par shes pa thams cad
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul dang zag pa thams cad zad pa dang gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang las kyi rnam par smin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang khams gcig dang du ma mkhyen pa'i stobs dang dbang po'i mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs dang sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gyur pa'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs dang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par bya ba mkhyen pa'i stobs dang skye ba du ma'i rtogs pa brjod pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang mngon par shes pa thams cad
translated: The power of knowledge of bases and nonbases, the power of knowledge of the results of evolutionary actions, the power of knowledge of the single and multiple elements, the power of knowledge of the superior and inferior faculties of beings,🔽the power of knowledge of the various resolves of beings, the power of knowledge of the paths that lead everywhere, the power of knowledge of the recollection of former existences, the power of knowledge of deaths and births of beings,

original: mkhyen pa'i stobs dang zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mkhyen pa'i stobs dang zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs su 'gyur ro //
translated: the power of knowledge of the extinction of the outflows, and the power of knowledge of all the superknowledges.

original: de bzhin du kun du 'od nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor chen po mdzes pa'i sa dang bdud rtsi'i 'od zla ba chen po 'od gsal ba'i sa dang nam mkha'i 'od nam mkha' ltar rab tu gnas pa'i ba dang rdo rje'i 'od yid dga' ba'i sa dang rin chen 'od🔽mngon par dbang bskur ba la gnas pa'i sa dang padma'i 'od rang bzhin gyis dag pa'i chos dri ma med pa yongs su 'dzin pa'i na dang sangs rgyas kyi las byed pa'i ba dang dpe med pa'i sa dang dpe thams cad kyi dpe rab tu rtogs par byed
analyzed: de bzhin du kun du 'od nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor chen po mdzes pa'i sa dang bdud rtsi'i 'od zla ba chen po 'od gsal ba'i sa dang nam mkha'i 'od nam mkha' ltar rab tu gnas pa'i ba dang rdo rje'i 'od yid dga' ba'i sa dang rin chen 'od mngon par dbang bskur ba la gnas pa'i sa dang padma'i 'od rang bzhin gyis dag pa'i chos dri ma med pa yongs su 'dzin pa'i na dang sangs rgyas kyi las byed pa'i ba dang dpe med pa'i sa dang dpe thams cad kyi dpe rab tu rtogs par byed
translated: Similarly, the ground of the great beautiful sun mandala of universal light, the ground of the great moon of the light of nectar, the ground of the space of clear light, the ground of the space of the light of space, the ground of the delight of the vajra light, the ground of the light of jewels,🔽the ground of the consecration, the ground of the light of the lotus, the ground of the stainless pure nature that is fully embraced, the ground of the activity of the buddhas, the ground of the example, and the ground of the realization of all examples.🔽🔽

original: pa'i sa dang shes rab kyi 'od bla na med pa'i sa dang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'od gsal ba chen po'i sa dang / so so'i bdag nyid rig pa rnal 'byor pa'i ye shes rdzogs par byed pa'i sa'o //
analyzed: pa'i sa dang shes rab kyi 'od bla na med pa'i sa dang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'od gsal ba chen po'i sa dang / so so'i bdag nyid rig pa rnal 'byor pa'i ye shes rdzogs par byed pa'i sa'o //
translated: Similarly, the level of the beautiful great orb of the sun is the level of Universal Light; the level of the great moon of the light of nectar is the level of clear light; the level of the light of space is the level of the firm foundation like space; the level of the light of the vajra is the level of the delightful mind; the level of the light of the jewel is the level of the consecration; the level of the light of the lotus is the level of the immaculate nature that holds the stainless Dharma; the level of the light of the deeds of the Buddha is the level of the inconceivable; the level of the realization of all examples is the level of the example of all examples; the level of the light of wisdom is the unsurpassable level; the level of the great clear light of omniscience is the level of the completion of the wisdom of the yogi who knows his own nature.

original: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa la 'khrul pa mi mnga' ba dang ca co mi mnga' ba dan dran pa nyams pa mi mnga' ba dang thugs mnyam par ma bzhag pa mi mnga' ba dang tha dad pa nyid kyi 'du shes mi mnga' ba dang so sor
analyzed: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa la 'khrul pa mi mnga' ba dang ca co mi mnga' ba dan dran pa nyams pa mi mnga' ba dang thugs mnyam par ma bzhag pa mi mnga' ba dang tha dad pa nyid kyi 'du shes mi mnga' ba dang so sor
translated: Likewise, the Tathagata has no error, no babbling, no loss of mindfulness, no non-equipoise, no discriminations of multiplicity, no indifference due to lack of conscientious attitude, no discrimination of phenomena, no discrimination of events, no discrimination of self, no discrimination of beings, no discrimination of life-force, no discrimination of person.

original: ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms mi mnga' ba dang / 'dun pa yongs su nyams pa mi mnga' ba dang brtson 'grus yongs su nyams pa mi mnga' ba dang dran @228b pa yongs su nyams pa mi mnga' ba dang ting nge 'dzin yongs su nyams pa mi mnga' ba dang shes rab yongs su nyams pa mi mnga' ba
analyzed: ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms mi mnga' ba dang / 'dun pa yongs su nyams pa mi mnga' ba dang brtson 'grus yongs su nyams pa mi mnga' ba dang dran @228b pa yongs su nyams pa mi mnga' ba dang ting nge 'dzin yongs su nyams pa mi mnga' ba dang shes rab yongs su nyams pa mi mnga' ba
translated: Likewise, the Tathagata has no error, no babbling, no loss of mindfulness, no lack of meditative equipoise, no discrimination of difference, no indifference that is not discerning, no loss of interest, no loss of diligence, no loss of mindfulness, no loss of meditative stabilization, and no loss of wisdom.

original: dang rnam par grol ba'i ye shes gzigs pa yongs su nyams pa mi mnga' ba dang / 'das pa'i dus la ma thogs ma chags shing smon pa med pa'i ye shes gzigs pa rab tu 'jug pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus la ma thogs ma chags shing smon pa med pa'i ye shes gzigs pa rab tu 'jug pa dang da ltar byung ba'i dus la
analyzed: dang rnam par grol ba'i ye shes gzigs pa yongs su nyams pa mi mnga' ba dang / 'das pa'i dus la ma thogs ma chags shing smon pa med pa'i ye shes gzigs pa rab tu 'jug pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus la ma thogs ma chags shing smon pa med pa'i ye shes gzigs pa rab tu 'jug pa dang da ltar byung ba'i dus la
translated: His wisdom vision of liberation and omniscience is never impaired. His wisdom vision of the past is unobstructed and unattached, and he engages in the wisdom vision of the future without obstruction or attachment.🔽His wisdom vision of the present is unobstructed and unattached, and he engages in the wisdom vision of the future without obstruction or attachment.

original: ma thogs ma chags shing smon pa med pa'i ye shes gzigs pa rab tu 'jug pa dang / sku'i phrin las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes rjes su 'brang ba dang / gsung gi phrin las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes rjes su 'brang ba dang thugs kyi phrin las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes rjes su 'brang ba'o //
analyzed: ma thogs ma chags shing smon pa med pa'i ye shes gzigs pa rab tu 'jug pa dang / sku'i phrin las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes rjes su 'brang ba dang / gsung gi phrin las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes rjes su 'brang ba dang thugs kyi phrin las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes rjes su 'brang ba'o //
translated: All his physical actions are preceded and followed by wisdom, all his verbal actions are preceded and followed by wisdom, and all his mental actions are preceded and followed by wisdom.

original: de'i phyir thams cad du dus thams cad kyi tshe mnyam pa nyid la legs par rab tu gnas pa ste stong pa nyid la yang dag par rjes su gnas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad du dus thams cad kyi tshe mnyam pa nyid la legs par rab tu gnas pa ste stong pa nyid la yang dag par rjes su gnas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, he is always and in every way well-established in sameness, because he is truly established in emptiness.

original: shes rab yongs su dag pa ni de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur te sgrib pa med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro //🔽dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo gcig la gzugs kyi lha dang grangs dang kha dog dang phyag dang dbyibs dang rnam par rtog pa'i rdzu 'phrul spro ba'i phyir rdo rje sems dpa' stobs bcu par 'gyur pa sgrib pa dang bcas pa shes rab yongs su dag pa ni 'ga'
analyzed: shes rab yongs su dag pa ni de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur te sgrib pa med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro // dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo gcig la gzugs kyi lha dang grangs dang kha dog dang phyag dang dbyibs dang rnam par rtog pa'i rdzu 'phrul spro ba'i phyir rdo rje sems dpa' stobs bcu par 'gyur pa sgrib pa dang bcas pa shes rab yongs su dag pa ni 'ga'
translated: He becomes a Tathāgata, with completely purified wisdom, because he is characterized by the absence of obscurations.

original: yang med do //
analyzed: yang med do //
translated: There is no one who, with a completely purified wisdom, becomes a Vajrasattva with ten powers, in a single maṇḍala circle, due to the emanation of the magic of form, number, color, hands, shape, and conceptualization.

original: 'on kyang thams cad mkhyen pa'i lam nyams pa de ni log pa'i nga rgyal gyis zil gyis mnan par gyur pa na bdag kyang rdo rje sems dpa' stobs bcu pa'o zhes de ltar rlom par byed do //
analyzed: 'on kyang thams cad mkhyen pa'i lam nyams pa de ni log pa'i nga rgyal gyis zil gyis mnan par gyur pa na bdag kyang rdo rje sems dpa' stobs bcu pa'o zhes de ltar rlom par byed do //
translated: However, when one who has lost the path of omniscience is overwhelmed by false pride, one becomes conceited, thinking, “I am also a Vajrasattva with ten powers.”

original: 'di ni stobs bcu pa ma yin te stobs bcu pa'i 'gal zla nyi tshe ba rmongs pa chen po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni stobs bcu pa ma yin te stobs bcu pa'i 'gal zla nyi tshe ba rmongs pa chen po'o //
translated: This is not the tenth power, but a limited, lesser power, a great delusion.

analyzed: 'dir rnal 'byor pa 'di'i sangs rgyas nyid ni sngon med pa shin tu rmad du byung ba chen po ste sgrib pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, the Buddhahood of this yogi is unprecedented, a great wonder, because it is endowed with all obscurations.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi bstod pa las tshigs su bcad pa dgu pas gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi bstod pa las tshigs su bcad pa dgu pas gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
translated: The Bhagavat has said in the Namasamgitipratyavekshanajnanastava, in the ninth verse:

original: sdug bsngal gsum gyi sdug @229a * //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gsum gyi sdug @229a * //
translated: Suffering from the suffering of the three sufferings,

analyzed: bsngal zhing // gsum sel mtha' yas grol gsum thob //

analyzed: sgrib pa kun las nges par grol //
translated: definitely liberated from all obscurations,

original: mkha' ltar mnyam pa nyid la gnas zhes so //
analyzed: mkha' ltar mnyam pa nyid la gnas zhes so //
translated: abiding in the equality of space.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung 'di'i phyir rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs sgom pa'i stobs kyis rnal 'byor pa thams cad mkhyen par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung 'di'i phyir rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs sgom pa'i stobs kyis rnal 'byor pa thams cad mkhyen par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: For this reason, the yogi does not become omniscient by the power of meditating on conceptual forms.

original: 'o na de bzhin gshegs pas rgyud kyi rgyal po thams cad las phung po rnams ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams dang khams rnams ni spyan ma la sogs pa'i lha mo rnam dang dbang po drug ni sa'i snying po la sogs pa'i byang
analyzed: 'o na de bzhin gshegs pas rgyud kyi rgyal po thams cad las phung po rnams ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams dang khams rnams ni spyan ma la sogs pa'i lha mo rnam dang dbang po drug ni sa'i snying po la sogs pa'i byang
translated: Well then, in all the kings of tantras the Tathagata taught that the aggregates are the buddhas such as Vairochana, the constituents are the goddesses such as Lochana, the six senses are the bodhisattvas such as Kshitigarbha, the six objects are the female bodhisattvas such as Mamaki, and the six elements are the wrathful kings such as Achala.🔽

original: chub sems dpa' rnams dang yul rnams ni gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i lha mo rnams dang gti mug la sogs pa ni gshin rje mthar byed la sogs pa'i khro bo'i rgyal po rnams su gsungs pa ma yin nam de'i phyir sems can rnams kyi lus ni
analyzed: chub sems dpa' rnams dang yul rnams ni gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i lha mo rnams dang gti mug la sogs pa ni gshin rje mthar byed la sogs pa'i khro bo'i rgyal po rnams su gsungs pa ma yin nam de'i phyir sems can rnams kyi lus ni
translated: Well then, since the Tathāgata has said in all the kings of tantras that the aggregates are the buddhas such as Vairocana, the constituents are the goddesses such as Buddhalocanā, the six sense faculties are the bodhisattvas such as Kṣitigarbha, the objects are the goddesses such as Rūpavajrā, and delusion and so on are the wrathful kings such as Yamāntaka,🔽some will think that the bodies of sentient beings are

original: sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa'i sku'o zhes pa 'ga' zhig gi bsam pa 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa'i sku'o zhes pa 'ga' zhig gi bsam pa 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: the nirmāṇakāya of the buddhas.

original: de'i phyir brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, I will explain this.

original: 'dir rmongs pa rnams kyis sems can rnam gyi lus ni sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa'i sku'o zhes brjod par bya ba gang yin pa gang zhig yongs su brtags na mi 'grig pa 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir rmongs pa rnams kyis sems can rnam gyi lus ni sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa'i sku'o zhes brjod par bya ba gang yin pa gang zhig yongs su brtags na mi 'grig pa 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung ma yin no //
translated: Here, the statement of the ignorant that the bodies of sentient beings are the emanation body of the Buddha is something to be examined, for it is not the speech of the Tathāgata.

original: gal te don da pa'i den par sems can rnams kyi lus sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa'i sku yin na de'i tshe khams gsum na gnas pa'i sems can thams cad sngon du yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su grub par gyur te sngon du rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas
analyzed: gal te don da pa'i den par sems can rnams kyi lus sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa'i sku yin na de'i tshe khams gsum na gnas pa'i sems can thams cad sngon du yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su grub par gyur te sngon du rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas
translated: If the bodies of sentient beings were the emanation body of the Buddha in the sense of being real, then all sentient beings dwelling in the three realms would have already become perfect buddhas, because they would have already been perfect buddhas.

original: nyid yin pa'i phyir sangs rgyas nyid kyi slad du thos pa dang bsam pa dang sgom pa dang spyan pa la sogs pa'i bya ba don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyid yin pa'i phyir sangs rgyas nyid kyi slad du thos pa dang bsam pa dang sgom pa dang spyan pa la sogs pa'i bya ba don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: For the sake of buddhahood, the activities of listening, reflection, and meditation would be pointless, because they would already be perfect buddhas.

original: sems can thams cad la skye ba dang 'gag pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la skye ba dang 'gag pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: All sentient beings would be without birth and cessation.

original: 'khor bar bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang bkres pa dang skom pa la sogs pa'i gnod pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'khor bar bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang bkres pa dang skom pa la sogs pa'i gnod pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: There would be no harm in cyclic existence, such as pleasure and pain, hunger and thirst, and so on.

original: mngon par shes pa drug la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi yon tan gyi 'byor pa rnams dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa drug la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi yon tan gyi 'byor pa rnams dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: One would possess the wealth of the qualities of a buddha, such as the six superknowledges.

original: 'di @229b ni mthong ba dang thos pa dang rjes su dpag pa dang de bzhin gshegs pas lung bstan pa yang med do //
analyzed: 'di @229b ni mthong ba dang thos pa dang rjes su dpag pa dang de bzhin gshegs pas lung bstan pa yang med do //
translated: This is not seen, heard, or inferred, nor is it taught by the Tathāgata.

original: de'i phyir sems can rnams ni sangs rgyas su mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sems can rnams ni sangs rgyas su mi 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, sentient beings do not become buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi yon tan med pa'i phyir dang 'khor bar rnam par gnas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi yon tan med pa'i phyir dang 'khor bar rnam par gnas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not have the qualities of a buddha and because they remain in cyclic existence.

original: bcom ldan 'das mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi bstod pa las tshigs su bcad pa bcu gsum pas gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi bstod pa las tshigs su bcad pa bcu gsum pas gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
translated: The Blessed One said this in the Praise of the Completely Pure Sphere of Phenomena from the Sutra of the True Recitation of the Names, in the thirteenth verse:

original: 'khor ba'i pha rol mthar son pa //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i pha rol mthar son pa //
translated: Having reached the end, the far shore of cyclic existence,

original: bya ba byas pa skam sar gnas //
analyzed: bya ba byas pa skam sar gnas //
translated: having done what was to be done, one abides on dry land.

original: shes pa 'ba' zhig nges gsal ba //
analyzed: shes pa 'ba' zhig nges gsal ba //
translated: Consciousness alone is definitely clear.

original: shes rab mtshon chas rnam 'joms pa zhes pa ste de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung 'di'i phyir sems can rnam gyi lus ni sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa'i skur mi 'gyur ro //🔽'on te sgom pa goms pa'i dbang gis phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i rnam par 'gyur te de nyid kyis na sangs rgyas nyid du yang de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa ma yin nam zhes pa 'ga' zhig gi bsam
analyzed: shes rab mtshon chas rnam 'joms pa zhes pa ste de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung 'di'i phyir sems can rnam gyi lus ni sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa'i skur mi 'gyur ro // 'on te sgom pa goms pa'i dbang gis phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i rnam par 'gyur te de nyid kyis na sangs rgyas nyid du yang de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa ma yin nam zhes pa 'ga' zhig gi bsam
translated: Because of this statement of the Tathāgata, the bodies of sentient beings do not become the emanation body of the Buddha.

original: pa 'byung bar 'gyur te //
analyzed: pa 'byung bar 'gyur te //
translated: But perhaps someone thinks: “By the power of cultivating meditation, the aggregates, elements, sense bases, and so on, become the form of the maṇḍala circle, and by that alone, the Tathāgata has said it is buddhahood.”

original: de'i phyir brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, I will explain.

original: dir byis pa'i skye bo rnams kyis brjod par bya ba gang yin pa goms pa'i dbang gis phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i rnam par 'gyur la de nyid kyis na sangs rgyas nyid du yang de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs
analyzed: dir byis pa'i skye bo rnams kyis brjod par bya ba gang yin pa goms pa'i dbang gis phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i rnam par 'gyur la de nyid kyis na sangs rgyas nyid du yang de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs
translated: The childish, due to the power of habit, express what is to be expressed in the form of the maṇḍala wheels of the aggregates, constituents, and sense spheres, and the Tathāgata has said that very thing is buddhahood.

original: pa de ni ma yin pa ste gang gi phyir bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa de ni ma yin pa ste gang gi phyir bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is not so, because there is no accumulation of merit and wisdom.

original: 'dir gal te rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs ma gtogs par sgom pa goms pa'i dbang gis phung po dang khams dang / skye mched la sogs pa dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i rnam par 'gyur zhing rnam par rtog pa'i sgom pa'i dbang gis sangs rgyas nyid du yang 'gyur na de'i tshe bsod nams dman pa gzhan zhig nga ni rgyal po zhes sems par byed pa de yang goms pa las
analyzed: 'dir gal te rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs ma gtogs par sgom pa goms pa'i dbang gis phung po dang khams dang / skye mched la sogs pa dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i rnam par 'gyur zhing rnam par rtog pa'i sgom pa'i dbang gis sangs rgyas nyid du yang 'gyur na de'i tshe bsod nams dman pa gzhan zhig nga ni rgyal po zhes sems par byed pa de yang goms pa las
translated: Here, if buddhahood were to arise from the power of meditating on the aggregates, constituents, sources, and so on as the form of the mandala circle, apart from the accumulation of merit and wisdom of yogins, then at that time even another person of inferior merit who thinks “I am a king” would become a king through meditation.

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs ma gtogs par rgyal por 'gyur te 'di ni mthong ba yang @230a * //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs ma gtogs par rgyal por 'gyur te 'di ni mthong ba yang @230a * //
translated: Apart from the accumulation of merit, he would become a king through meditation.

original: med do // ji ltar log pa'i rnam par rtog pas bsod nams kyi tshogs dang bral ba rnam par rtog pa'i rang bzhin sgom pa goms pa'i bdag gis rgyal por mi 'gyur pa de bzhin du bsod nams dang ye shes kyis dman pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnam par rtog pa goms
analyzed: med do // ji ltar log pa'i rnam par rtog pas bsod nams kyi tshogs dang bral ba rnam par rtog pa'i rang bzhin sgom pa goms pa'i bdag gis rgyal por mi 'gyur pa de bzhin du bsod nams dang ye shes kyis dman pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnam par rtog pa goms
translated: No, it does not.

original: pa'i dbang gis bskal pa du ma rnams kyis kyang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su mi 'gyur te bsod nams dang ye shes med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa'i dbang gis bskal pa du ma rnams kyis kyang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su mi 'gyur te bsod nams dang ye shes med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Just as a king who is devoid of the accumulation of merit due to false imagination and who is habituated to the cultivation of the nature of imagination does not become a king, in the same way, a practitioner who is devoid of merit and wisdom and who is habituated to the power of imagination does not become a perfect buddha even in many eons, because of the absence of merit and wisdom.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi bstod pa las tshigs su bcad pa bcu drug pas gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi bstod pa las tshigs su bcad pa bcu drug pas gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
translated: The Bhagavān has said in the Praise of the Very Pure Dharma Realm, in the sixteenth verse:

original: bsod nams ldan pa bsod nams tshogs //
analyzed: bsod nams ldan pa bsod nams tshogs //
translated: Endowed with merit, the accumulation of merit,

original: ye shes ye shes 'byung gnas che //
analyzed: ye shes ye shes 'byung gnas che //
translated: Wisdom, the great source of wisdom,

original: ye shes ldan pa yod med shes //
analyzed: ye shes ldan pa yod med shes //
translated: Endowed with wisdom, knowing existence and nonexistence,

original: tshogs gnyis tshogs ni bsags pa po zhes pa ste /
analyzed: tshogs gnyis tshogs ni bsags pa po zhes pa ste /
translated: The accumulator of the two accumulations.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung 'di'i phyir bsod nams dang ye shes kyis dman pa rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs sgom pa sgom pa'i dbang gis sangs rgyas su mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung 'di'i phyir bsod nams dang ye shes kyis dman pa rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs sgom pa sgom pa'i dbang gis sangs rgyas su mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of this statement of the Bhagavat, one who is deficient in merit and wisdom does not become a Buddha by the power of cultivating the form of conceptual thought.

original: 'o na gal te gzugs kyi sgom pa rnam par rtog pa yin zhing rnam par rtog pa las rnal 'byor pa sangs rgyas su mi 'gyur na de'i tshe lus 'di dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i lha tshogs rnams kyis rnam par sbyang bar bya'o zhes de bzhin gshegs pas
analyzed: 'o na gal te gzugs kyi sgom pa rnam par rtog pa yin zhing rnam par rtog pa las rnal 'byor pa sangs rgyas su mi 'gyur na de'i tshe lus 'di dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i lha tshogs rnams kyis rnam par sbyang bar bya'o zhes de bzhin gshegs pas
translated: Now, if the cultivation of form is conceptual thought, and the yogin does not become a Buddha from conceptual thought, then at that time the body is to be purified by the assembly of deities of the mandala circle.🔽What is the meaning of the statement of the Tathagata?

original: gsungs pa ci'i don du yin zhes pa 'ga' zhig gi bsam pa 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gsungs pa ci'i don du yin zhes pa 'ga' zhig gi bsam pa 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: The thought of some will arise.

original: de'i phyir brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be stated.

original: 'dir ni 'di ni bden te /
analyzed: 'dir ni 'di ni bden te /
translated: Here, this is true.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas dam tshig gi skad kyis so sor rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa de rnams rab tu bstan gyi bum pa dag snam bu'i sgra bzhin du brjod bya brjod byed kyi dngos po las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas dam tshig gi skad kyis so sor rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa de rnams rab tu bstan gyi bum pa dag snam bu'i sgra bzhin du brjod bya brjod byed kyi dngos po las ni ma yin no //
translated: The Tathagata has taught them by means of the language of commitment, just as the word pot is taught in regard to cloth.

original: 'on kyang bud med kyi dbang po padma dang skyes pa'i dbang po rdo rje dang bshang ba rnam par snang mdzad dang gci ba mi bskyod pa dag khrag rin chen 'byung ldan dang khu ba snang ba mtha' yas dang sha don yod grub pa ste 'di rnam gyis
analyzed: 'on kyang bud med kyi dbang po padma dang skyes pa'i dbang po rdo rje dang bshang ba rnam par snang mdzad dang gci ba mi bskyod pa dag khrag rin chen 'byung ldan dang khu ba snang ba mtha' yas dang sha don yod grub pa ste 'di rnam gyis
translated: But the female organ is the lotus, the male organ is the vajra, excrement is Vairocana, urine is Akshobhya, blood is Ratnasambhava, semen is Amitabha, and flesh is Amoghasiddhi.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga po rnams bdud rtsi lnga po rnams kyi @230b ming du gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga po rnams bdud rtsi lnga po rnams kyi @230b ming du gsungs te /
translated: The five Tathagatas are said to be the names of the five nectars.

original: don dam pa'i rigs pas ni lha ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam pa'i rigs pas ni lha ma yin no //
translated: But not by means of ultimate reasoning, because they are not gods.

original: de'i phyir dul ba'i lus 'di ni lha'i skur brjod par mi nus te snying po med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir dul ba'i lus 'di ni lha'i skur brjod par mi nus te snying po med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, this tamed body cannot be said to be the body of a god, because it is devoid of essence.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyi bstod pa las tshigs su bcad pa nyi shu pa la sogs pa gsum gyis gsungs pa 'di lta ste //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyi bstod pa las tshigs su bcad pa nyi shu pa la sogs pa gsum gyis gsungs pa 'di lta ste //
translated: The Bhagavat, in the Praise of the Wisdom of the Pure Dharmadhatu of the Namasamgiti, spoke three verses beginning with the twentieth:🔽The sole lord of the vajra of solidity,🔽the lord of beings from the moment of birth,

original: gcig pu sra mkhregs rdo rje'i bdag / skyes ma thag pa 'gro ba'i bdag / nam mkha' las byung rang byung ba //
analyzed: gcig pu sra mkhregs rdo rje'i bdag / skyes ma thag pa 'gro ba'i bdag / nam mkha' las byung rang byung ba //

original: shes rab ye shes me bo che //
analyzed: shes rab ye shes me bo che //
translated: the great fire of wisdom and gnosis,

original: 'od chen rnam par snang bar byed //🔽ye shes snang ba lam me ba //
analyzed: 'od chen rnam par snang bar byed // ye shes snang ba lam me ba //
translated: the great light, the illuminator,🔽the lamp of the light of gnosis,

original: 'gro ba'i mar me ye shes sgron //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i mar me ye shes sgron //
translated: the lamp of beings, the lamp of gnosis,

original: gzi brjid chen po 'od gsal ba //
analyzed: gzi brjid chen po 'od gsal ba //
translated: the great splendor, the clear light,

original: sngags mchog mnga' bdag rig sngags rgyal //
analyzed: sngags mchog mnga' bdag rig sngags rgyal //
translated: the lord of the supreme mantra, the king of knowledge mantras,

original: gsang sngags rgyal pa don ched byed //
analyzed: gsang sngags rgyal pa don ched byed //
translated: the king of secret mantras, the one who accomplishes great meaning,

analyzed: gtsug tor chen po rmad byung gtsug / nam mkha'i bdag po sna tshogs ston zhes pa ste /

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung 'di'i phyir nyi tshe ba'i lus ni sangs rgyas kyi skur mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung 'di'i phyir nyi tshe ba'i lus ni sangs rgyas kyi skur mi 'gyur ro //

original: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa gzugs can du mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa gzugs can du mi 'gyur na /
translated: If the Tathāgata does not become material,

original: 'o na de'i tshe lhums su 'jug pa dang / gzhon nu rol rtsed mdzad pa dang / bzo thams cad yang dag par ston pa dang / khab nas nges par 'byung ba dang / byang chub kyi snying po la bzhugs pa dang / bdud kyi dpung 'joms pa dang /

translated: then at that time, the entry into the womb, the playing of games as a youth, the display of all the arts, the departure from home, the sitting at the site of awakening, the destruction of the army of Māra,

original: lha las babs pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor ba dang / skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad bcu dang / 'od kyi dkyil 'khor 'od ma gang ba dang / spyod lam bzhi la sogs pa'i bya ba dang /
analyzed: lha las babs pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor ba dang / skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad bcu dang / 'od kyi dkyil 'khor 'od ma gang ba dang / spyod lam bzhi la sogs pa'i bya ba dang /
translated: the descent from the gods, the turning of the wheel of the Dharma, the thirty-two marks of a great being, the eighty minor marks, the halo extending the length of his body, the activities of the four modes of conduct,

original: nam mkha' la gshegs pa dang / byon pa dang / de'i sems can gyi don gyi bya ba rnams su mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' la gshegs pa dang / byon pa dang / de'i sems can gyi don gyi bya ba rnams su mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and the going and coming in the sky and all the activities for the benefit of sentient beings would not occur.

original: de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das kyis bskyed pa nyan thos kyi dge 'dun yang med par 'gyur zhing yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po dang cho 'phrul chen po phul du byung ba yang dag par ston pa med par 'gyur ro //🔽srid pa gsum na gnas pa rnams @231a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das kyis bskyed pa nyan thos kyi dge 'dun yang med par 'gyur zhing yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po dang cho 'phrul chen po phul du byung ba yang dag par ston pa med par 'gyur ro // srid pa gsum na gnas pa rnams @231a * //
translated: Likewise, the community of disciples generated by the Lord would not exist, and the great parinirvāṇa and the great, excellent miracles would not be demonstrated.

original: kyis mchod par bya ba'i dbu skra dang tshems dang sha dang rus pa la sogs pa dang sku gdung spro ba med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kyis mchod par bya ba'i dbu skra dang tshems dang sha dang rus pa la sogs pa dang sku gdung spro ba med par 'gyur ro //
translated: The relics of the Tathāgata, which are worshipped by those dwelling in the three worlds, would not exist.

original: gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam 'phrul shin tu rmad du byung ba ni bcom ldan 'das gzugs dang ldan pa las 'gyur gyi gzugs dang mi ldan pa las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam 'phrul shin tu rmad du byung ba ni bcom ldan 'das gzugs dang ldan pa las 'gyur gyi gzugs dang mi ldan pa las ni ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, the Tathāgata’s marvelous magical emanations occur from the Lord’s possession of form, not from his lack of form.

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi gzugs kyi sku sgrub pa ni log par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi gzugs kyi sku sgrub pa ni log par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the establishment of the Lord’s form body would not be reversed.

original: zhes pa 'dir 'ga' zhig gi bsam pa 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes pa 'dir 'ga' zhig gi bsam pa 'byung bar 'gyur te /

original: de'i phyir brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be stated.

original: 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyi gzugs kyi sku sgrub pa ni log par mi 'gyur ro zhes byis pa'i skye bo rnams kyis brjod par bya ba gang yin pa 'di ni de ltar bden pa ma yin te gang gi phyir skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid kyi
analyzed: 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyi gzugs kyi sku sgrub pa ni log par mi 'gyur ro zhes byis pa'i skye bo rnams kyis brjod par bya ba gang yin pa 'di ni de ltar bden pa ma yin te gang gi phyir skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid kyi
translated: Here, the childish say, “The accomplishment of the Bhagavān’s form body is not erroneous.” This is not so, because🔽he has the nature of arising and passing away.

original: phyir ro // 'dir gal te don dam par bcom ldan 'das lhums nas 'byung ba dang sems can thams cad kyi don gyi slad du gshegs pa dang byon pa'i bya ba dang yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po dang sku gdung yang dag par ston pa yod na de'i
analyzed: phyir ro // 'dir gal te don dam par bcom ldan 'das lhums nas 'byung ba dang sems can thams cad kyi don gyi slad du gshegs pa dang byon pa'i bya ba dang yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po dang sku gdung yang dag par ston pa yod na de'i
translated: Here, if the Bhagavān’s birth from the womb, his going forth for the sake of all sentient beings, his activities, and his great parinirvāṇa and display of relics exist ultimately,

original: tshe de bzhin gshegs pa'i sgrub pa 'bras bu med par 'gyur te gang gi phyir sku gdung yang dag par ston pa'i phyir dang yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshe de bzhin gshegs pa'i sgrub pa 'bras bu med par 'gyur te gang gi phyir sku gdung yang dag par ston pa'i phyir dang yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i phyir ro //
translated: then at that time the accomplishment of the Tathāgata would be fruitless, because of the display of relics and because of great parinirvāṇa.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi gzugs kyi sku ni bsgrubs kyang ma bsgrubs pa kho na ste skyes pa'i sku rnam par nyams pa gang yin pa de bsgrubs pas ci ltar sgrub pa po'i lus nyams par med par byed par 'gyur rang nyid ma grub pas gzhan sgrub par byed
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi gzugs kyi sku ni bsgrubs kyang ma bsgrubs pa kho na ste skyes pa'i sku rnam par nyams pa gang yin pa de bsgrubs pas ci ltar sgrub pa po'i lus nyams par med par byed par 'gyur rang nyid ma grub pas gzhan sgrub par byed
translated: The Bhagavān’s form body is not established, even though it is established. How could the one who establishes it, whose body is impaired, make the body of the one who establishes it free from impairment?

original: pa 'di ni phyin ci log go //
analyzed: pa 'di ni phyin ci log go //
translated: This is a perversion, since he himself is not established.

original: ci ste sku gdung yang dag par ston pa phul du byung ba'i mtshan nyid chen po yod na 'dir sku gdung rnams yang dag par bstan par gyur pa nad ni sku gdung gi phung por gyur pa'i sku'i skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang dpe
analyzed: ci ste sku gdung yang dag par ston pa phul du byung ba'i mtshan nyid chen po yod na 'dir sku gdung rnams yang dag par bstan par gyur pa nad ni sku gdung gi phung por gyur pa'i sku'i skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang dpe
translated: If the relics have the characteristics of a great, excellent manifestation, then here the relics would be manifested. But the body of the one who has the collection of relics, the body of the great being, has lost the thirty-two marks,

original: byad bzang po brgyad cu dang 'od kyi dkyil 'khor 'od ma gang ba rnams rnam par nyams so //
analyzed: byad bzang po brgyad cu dang 'od kyi dkyil 'khor 'od ma gang ba rnams rnam par nyams so //
translated: the eighty minor marks, and the orb of light.

original: sngar gyi sku med pa'i phyir sku gdung gi phung po ni rdo rje'i skur mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngar gyi sku med pa'i phyir sku gdung gi phung po ni rdo rje'i skur mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The collection of relics is not the vajra body, because the previous body does not exist.

original: sku med na rdo rje sems @231b dpa' gzhan gyi sgrub pa med do //
analyzed: sku med na rdo rje sems @231b dpa' gzhan gyi sgrub pa med do //
translated: If there is no body, there is no accomplishment of any other Vajrasattva.

original: 'dir phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir de kho na nyid dang mi ldan pa ni nyams te skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir de kho na nyid dang mi ldan pa ni nyams te skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Here, because of mutual contradiction, one who is not endowed with reality is ruined, because one would have the nature of arising and ceasing.

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can gyi rdo rje sems dpa' sgrub pa yin na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang stong pa nyid dang dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang yang dag par spong ba dang rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang dbang po dang
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can gyi rdo rje sems dpa' sgrub pa yin na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang stong pa nyid dang dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang yang dag par spong ba dang rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang dbang po dang
translated: If one accomplishes a Vajrasattva who has the nature of arising and ceasing, one would not accomplish the perfection of wisdom, emptiness, the applications of mindfulness, the right efforts, the bases of supernatural power, the faculties,

translated: the powers, the branches of enlightenment, the path, the truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the doors of liberation, the higher perceptions, the meditative stabilizations, the dhāraṇīs, the powers, the fearlessnesses,🔽the

analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa dang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: The four right discriminations and the eighteen unshared qualities of the Buddha would be meaningless.

original: gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba dang sdig pa bshags pa dang bsod nams la rjes su yi rang ba dang / byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa dang bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa du ma rnams don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba dang sdig pa bshags pa dang bsod nams la rjes su yi rang ba dang / byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa dang bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa du ma rnams don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Taking refuge in the Three Jewels, confessing evil deeds, rejoicing in merit, generating the thought of awakening, the collections of merit and wisdom, and the many bodhisattva practices would be meaningless.

original: thos pa dang bsam pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab khyad par can rnams khyad par can ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thos pa dang bsam pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab khyad par can rnams khyad par can ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: The special wisdoms that come from hearing and reflection would not be special.

original: shes rab dang thabs kyi rang bzhin gyi sgrub pa rnams ngan pa'i sgrub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes rab dang thabs kyi rang bzhin gyi sgrub pa rnams ngan pa'i sgrub par 'gyur ro //
translated: The practices that are the nature of wisdom and method would be bad practices.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa zab pa dang rgya che ba'i chos rtogs pa yang ngan pa rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa zab pa dang rgya che ba'i chos rtogs pa yang ngan pa rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The realization of the profound and vast Dharma of ultimate truth would be a bad realization.

original: 'jig rten kun rdzob kyi bden pa 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub sgrub pa'i slad du rdo rdze phur bu dang rdo rje ra ba dang rdo rje gur dang bsrung ba'i 'khor lo la sogs pas bskor ba dang phung po dang khams dang skye mched dang sku dang gsung
analyzed: 'jig rten kun rdzob kyi bden pa 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub sgrub pa'i slad du rdo rdze phur bu dang rdo rje ra ba dang rdo rje gur dang bsrung ba'i 'khor lo la sogs pas bskor ba dang phung po dang khams dang skye mched dang sku dang gsung
translated: In order to accomplish mundane feats of the relative truth of the world, the vajra stakes, vajra fence, vajra tent, protection wheel, and so on are arranged. The aggregates, elements, sense bases, body, speech,

original: dang thugs byin gyis brlab pa dang sgo skyong dgod pa dang ye shes sems dpa' gzhug pa dang mngon par dbang bskur ba la sogs pa rdzogs pa dang ra ba lnga'i 'od kyi tshogs kyi dkyil 'khor gyi sprul pa 'jig rten gyi khams rnams su nges gdul bar🔽bya ba'i sems can rnams kyi sems can gyi don gyi tshogs dang mchod pa rab 'byam @232a * //
analyzed: dang thugs byin gyis brlab pa dang sgo skyong dgod pa dang ye shes sems dpa' gzhug pa dang mngon par dbang bskur ba la sogs pa rdzogs pa dang ra ba lnga'i 'od kyi tshogs kyi dkyil 'khor gyi sprul pa 'jig rten gyi khams rnams su nges gdul bar bya ba'i sems can rnams kyi sems can gyi don gyi tshogs dang mchod pa rab 'byam @232a * //
translated: and mind are blessed, the door guardians are set, the awareness beings are invited, the actual empowerments are conferred, and so on are complete. The emanations of the maṇḍala of the assembly of light of the five fences are sent to the world systems to tame the assemblies of sentient beings to be tamed.🔽The accumulation of sentient beings’ benefit and the accumulation of offerings are meaningless at all times.

original: bsags pa thams cad thams cad kyi tshe don med par 'gyur te de ltar yang ma yin no //
analyzed: bsags pa thams cad thams cad kyi tshe don med par 'gyur te de ltar yang ma yin no //
translated: That is not the case.

original: de'i phyir skye ba dang 'gag pa'i chos can gyi rdo rje sems dpa' la stobs bcu dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams mi srid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir skye ba dang 'gag pa'i chos can gyi rdo rje sems dpa' la stobs bcu dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams mi srid do //
translated: Therefore, the ten powers, the four forms of fearlessness, and so on are impossible for Vajrasattva, who has the attributes of arising and ceasing.

original: gzhan yang ci gal te bcom ldan 'das gzugs can yin na de'i tshe phyogs gcig tu gnas pas gang g'a klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams rnams su ri bo du ma'i rdul dang mnyam pa'i sems can gyi rigs rnams kyi don bya ba byed
analyzed: gzhan yang ci gal te bcom ldan 'das gzugs can yin na de'i tshe phyogs gcig tu gnas pas gang g'a klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams rnams su ri bo du ma'i rdul dang mnyam pa'i sems can gyi rigs rnams kyi don bya ba byed
translated: Moreover, if the Bhagavat has a form body, then he would be unable to perform the benefit of sentient beings in world systems as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River, which are located in one direction, just as he is able to perform the benefit of sentient beings in world systems as numerous as the atoms of many mountains.

original: nus par mi 'gyur te gzugs kyi sku yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nus par mi 'gyur te gzugs kyi sku yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because he has a form body.🔽If you say that the form body of the Bhagavat goes to one world system and performs the benefit of sentient beings who reside there, and then goes to another world system and then to another,

original: ci ste byis pa'i blo can rnams kyi tshig gzugs kyi skus kyang 'jig rten gyi khams gcig tu gshegs te de na gnas pa'i sems can rnams kyi don bya ba mdzad nas de nas kyang 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan du gshegs shing de nas kyang gzhan du gshegs🔽pa mdzad do zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste byis pa'i blo can rnams kyi tshig gzugs kyi skus kyang 'jig rten gyi khams gcig tu gshegs te de na gnas pa'i sems can rnams kyi don bya ba mdzad nas de nas kyang 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan du gshegs shing de nas kyang gzhan du gshegs🔽pa mdzad do zhe na /
translated: then the Bhagavat would be a childish being.

original: 'di nyid ni rigs pas mi 'thad de gang gi phyir phyogs kyi cha gcig kho na la 'jig rten gyi khams rnams tshad dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir phyogs bcu'i char yang dag par gnas pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnams dang mtha' yas pa mtha' yas pa'i sems
analyzed: 'di nyid ni rigs pas mi 'thad de gang gi phyir phyogs kyi cha gcig kho na la 'jig rten gyi khams rnams tshad dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir phyogs bcu'i char yang dag par gnas pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnams dang mtha' yas pa mtha' yas pa'i sems
translated: This is not logically feasible, because the world systems are limitless in size, and they are located in the ten directions.

original: can rnams lta ci smos gzugs kyi skus gshegs nas sems can gyi don mdzad par ni bskal pa du ma rnams kyis kyang mi nus so //
analyzed: can rnams lta ci smos gzugs kyi skus gshegs nas sems can gyi don mdzad par ni bskal pa du ma rnams kyis kyang mi nus so //
translated: It is impossible for the form body to go to the world systems located in the ten directions and to benefit sentient beings there, even in many eons.

original: ci ste bsam gtan dang sngags kyi stobs kyis sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'jig rten gyi khams du ma na gnas pa'i sems can rnams bkug nas mdun du bzhag ste de rnams la chos bstan pa mdzad do //
analyzed: ci ste bsam gtan dang sngags kyi stobs kyis sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'jig rten gyi khams du ma na gnas pa'i sems can rnams bkug nas mdun du bzhag ste de rnams la chos bstan pa mdzad do //
translated: But if, by the power of concentration and mantra, many sentient beings from many world systems are summoned and placed in front of the Buddha and he teaches them the Dharma,

original: de rnams lam la bkod nas rang rang gi 'jig rten gyi khams su gtong ngo zhe na /
analyzed: de rnams lam la bkod nas rang rang gi 'jig rten gyi khams su gtong ngo zhe na /
translated: and after they are placed on the path, they are sent to their own world systems.

original: de nyid shin tu phyin ci log pa ste nam mkha'i khongs thams cad du 'jig rten gyi khams du ma na gnas pa grangs med pa'i sems can gzugs can rnams rdul phra rab kyi gzugs kyis kyang mdun du gnas par bya bar mi nus so //
analyzed: de nyid shin tu phyin ci log pa ste nam mkha'i khongs thams cad du 'jig rten gyi khams du ma na gnas pa grangs med pa'i sems can gzugs can rnams rdul phra rab kyi gzugs kyis kyang mdun du gnas par bya bar mi nus so //
translated: That is a great error, because it is impossible for the many sentient beings who have form and who dwell in the many world-realms in all the realms of space to be present in front of the form-body of the Buddha in the form of atoms.

original: ci ste byis pa'i blo can rnams kyi tshig gzugs kyi sku 'dis kyang sangs rgyas kyi zhing gcig la stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i @232b 'jig rten gyi khams rnams su gnas pa'i sems can rnams kyi don bya ba mdzad do zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste byis pa'i blo can rnams kyi tshig gzugs kyi sku 'dis kyang sangs rgyas kyi zhing gcig la stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i @232b 'jig rten gyi khams rnams su gnas pa'i sems can rnams kyi don bya ba mdzad do zhe na /
translated: If the foolish say that the Buddha acts for the welfare of sentient beings who dwell in the world-realms of a billion-world universe with this form-body,

original: tshig 'di ni don dam pa'i rigs pas rnam par dpyad na don med pa ste ji ltar dbang phyug gi tshig bka' yis grub cing rigs pa'i tshad ma dang bral ba bzhin no //
analyzed: tshig 'di ni don dam pa'i rigs pas rnam par dpyad na don med pa ste ji ltar dbang phyug gi tshig bka' yis grub cing rigs pa'i tshad ma dang bral ba bzhin no //
translated: this statement is meaningless when analyzed with reasoning directed at the ultimate, just like the statement of a powerful person who is devoid of valid reasoning.

original: 'dir yid ches pa'i lung las dbang phyug ni cha shas med pa kun gyi byed pa po ste de yang bya ba la ltos pa med pa 'dod pas rtsed mo'i don du sna tshogs byed pa'am sdud par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir yid ches pa'i lung las dbang phyug ni cha shas med pa kun gyi byed pa po ste de yang bya ba la ltos pa med pa 'dod pas rtsed mo'i don du sna tshogs byed pa'am sdud par byed pa'o //
translated: Here, the scriptures of the theists are not credible, because they maintain that God, the partless one, is the maker of all and is not dependent on anything else. He creates or destroys the world for the sake of play.

original: de bzhin du de'i chos mi mthun pa las bcom ldan 'das gzugs kyi sku sems can thams cad kyi don byed pa po bka' yis grub pa ste de ltar sangs rgyas pa rnams dang mu stegs pa rnams kyi mkhas pa rnams la yang shes rab dman pa nyid
analyzed: de bzhin du de'i chos mi mthun pa las bcom ldan 'das gzugs kyi sku sems can thams cad kyi don byed pa po bka' yis grub pa ste de ltar sangs rgyas pa rnams dang mu stegs pa rnams kyi mkhas pa rnams la yang shes rab dman pa nyid
translated: In the same way, the Blessed One, the form body of the Buddha, who is the maker of the welfare of all sentient beings, is established by the scriptures. Thus, the wise of both the Buddhists and the non-Buddhists are not distinguished by their inferior wisdom.

original: kyi phyir bye brag med do //
analyzed: kyi phyir bye brag med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no difference.

original: de'i phyir yongs su brtag pa dang bral ba 'di ni bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung du mi 'gyur te bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung ni thog mar dge ba bar du dge ba tha mar dge ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir yongs su brtag pa dang bral ba 'di ni bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung du mi 'gyur te bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung ni thog mar dge ba bar du dge ba tha mar dge ba'o //
translated: Therefore, this is not the speech of the Blessed One, because the speech of the Blessed One is virtuous in the beginning, virtuous in the middle, and virtuous in the end.

original: de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
translated: Similarly, the Blessed One said:

original: bsregs bcad brdar ba'i gser bzhin du //
analyzed: bsregs bcad brdar ba'i gser bzhin du //
translated: Like gold tested by burning, cutting, and rubbing,

original: mkhas pa rnams kyis yongs brtags nas //
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams kyis yongs brtags nas //
translated: The wise should examine it

original: bdag gsung blang bya dge slong dag / gus pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag gsung blang bya dge slong dag / gus pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: and accept my speech, O monks, not out of respect.

original: zhes pa ste bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung 'di'i phyir mtshan yang dag par brjod pas yongs su brtags nas /
analyzed: zhes pa ste bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung 'di'i phyir mtshan yang dag par brjod pas yongs su brtags nas /
translated: For this reason, the Praise in One Hundred and Eight Names should be examined.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gzugs kyi skur mi 'gyur te gang gi phyir nam mkha' las byung ba'i phyir dang rang byung ba'i phyir dang rnam pa kun ldan rnam pa med pa'i phyir dang thig le bzhi 'dzin pa'i phyir dang cha med cha las 'das pa'i phyir dang
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gzugs kyi skur mi 'gyur te gang gi phyir nam mkha' las byung ba'i phyir dang rang byung ba'i phyir dang rnam pa kun ldan rnam pa med pa'i phyir dang thig le bzhi 'dzin pa'i phyir dang cha med cha las 'das pa'i phyir dang
translated: The Bhagavān Buddha is not the rūpakāya because he arises from space, because he is self-arisen, because he possesses all aspects and is aspectless, because he holds the four bindus, because he is partless and beyond parts,🔽and because he is the great bliss of the mind.

original: dga' ba bzhi pa'i rtse mo 'dzin pa'i phyir dang chags bral dang po chags pa che ba'i phyir dang bdag gir mi 'dzin pa'i phyir dang ngar mi 'dzin pa'i phyir dang khams thams cad mi zad pa'i phyir dang gsang sngags don kun skyed pa po'i phyir dang theg
analyzed: dga' ba bzhi pa'i rtse mo 'dzin pa'i phyir dang chags bral dang po chags pa che ba'i phyir dang bdag gir mi 'dzin pa'i phyir dang ngar mi 'dzin pa'i phyir dang khams thams cad mi zad pa'i phyir dang gsang sngags don kun skyed pa po'i phyir dang theg
translated: Because it holds the peak of the fourth joy, because it is the first separation from attachment and the greatest attachment, because it does not grasp as mine, because it does not grasp as I, because it does not exhaust all elements and because it generates all the meanings of secret mantra, the bindu is called the bindu of the great hero.🔽

original: le chen po yi ge med pa'i phyir dang stong pa chen po 'gyur med lnga'i phyir dang thig le stong pa 'gyur med drug gi phyir dang mkha' ltar mnyam pa nyid la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: le chen po yi ge med pa'i phyir dang stong pa chen po 'gyur med lnga'i phyir dang thig le stong pa 'gyur med drug gi phyir dang mkha' ltar mnyam pa nyid la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it holds the peak of the fourth joy, because it is the first separation from attachment, because it is the greatest attachment, because it does not grasp as mine, because it does not grasp as I, because it does not exhaust all elements, because it generates the meaning of all secret mantra, because it is the great vehicle, because it is the syllable-less, because it is the five immutable great emptinesses, because it is the six immutable empty essences, and because it abides in the equality of space.

original: de ltar 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis mtshan yang dag par brjod pa las /
analyzed: de ltar 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis mtshan yang dag par brjod pa las /
translated: Thus, this is the meaning of the praise of the Bhagavān Buddha in the Litany of the Names of Mañjuśrī.

original: @233a * // de nas dpal ldan rdo rje 'chang zhes pa la sogs pa nas ye shes sku nyid khyod la 'dud ces pa'i mthar thug pa tshigs su bcad pa drug cu rtsa gnyis lhag pa'i brgyas rdo rje 'dzin pa'i sku phyag na rdo rje la bden pa gnyi gas rab🔽tu bstan to //
analyzed: @233a * // de nas dpal ldan rdo rje 'chang zhes pa la sogs pa nas ye shes sku nyid khyod la 'dud ces pa'i mthar thug pa tshigs su bcad pa drug cu rtsa gnyis lhag pa'i brgyas rdo rje 'dzin pa'i sku phyag na rdo rje la bden pa gnyi gas rab tu bstan to //
translated: thoroughly teach the body of Vajra Holder, Vajrapāṇi, with both truths.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyud kyi rgyal po'i le'u lnga pa las kyang tshigs su bcad pa dgu bcu rtsa brgyad pas sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa sgyu ma 'byung ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyud kyi rgyal po'i le'u lnga pa las kyang tshigs su bcad pa dgu bcu rtsa brgyad pas sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa sgyu ma 'byung ba gsungs pa /
translated: Also, in the Bhagavān’s King of Tantras in Five Hundred Thousand Lines, the arising of the emanation of the Buddha’s illusion is taught in ninety-eight verses:

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi 'ang rtogs bya min pa dpag med yon tan dang ldan sangs rgyas sprul pa sgyu ma ni //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi 'ang rtogs bya min pa dpag med yon tan dang ldan sangs rgyas sprul pa sgyu ma ni //
translated: The emanation of the Buddha’s illusion, endowed with immeasurable good qualities, is not even to be realized by the buddhas.

original: srid pa gsum gyi gnas su bdag nyid ston par byed de brgya byin dra ba ji bzhin nyid du'o //
analyzed: srid pa gsum gyi gnas su bdag nyid ston par byed de brgya byin dra ba ji bzhin nyid du'o //
translated: It displays itself in the abodes of the three existences, just like Śakra’s net.

original: sna tshogs dngos rnams kyis phyi rgyal ba dang bcas lha mi rnams kyi rang rang sems la rab zhugs pa //
analyzed: sna tshogs dngos rnams kyis phyi rgyal ba dang bcas lha mi rnams kyi rang rang sems la rab zhugs pa //
translated: The various things are well established in the minds of gods and men, including foreigners.

original: 'di ni ma skyes chos te chu la nam mkha' bzhin du 'dir ni skye bar 'khrul pa ster ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni ma skyes chos te chu la nam mkha' bzhin du 'dir ni skye bar 'khrul pa ster ba'o //
translated: This is the unborn reality, which is like space in water, and here it gives rise to the error of birth.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung 'di'i phyir bcom ldan 'das ni gzugs kyi skur mi 'gyur te sangs rgyas thams cad 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung 'di'i phyir bcom ldan 'das ni gzugs kyi skur mi 'gyur te sangs rgyas thams cad 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For this reason, the Bhagavān is not a rūpakāya, because all buddhas are included in him.

original: gal te sangs rgyas gzugs kyi sku yin na de'i tshe rdul phra rab kyi gzugs kyis kyang 'dus par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te sangs rgyas gzugs kyi sku yin na de'i tshe rdul phra rab kyi gzugs kyis kyang 'dus par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the Buddha were a rūpakāya, then even the form of subtle particles would not be included in him.

original: de ltar brjod pa'i rim pas bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung thos te de lta na'ang sems can rnams ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa zab cing rgya che ba'i chos yongs su brtags nas mi 'dzin cing sangs rgyas nyid kyi slad du bla ma yang yongs su brtags
analyzed: de ltar brjod pa'i rim pas bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung thos te de lta na'ang sems can rnams ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa zab cing rgya che ba'i chos yongs su brtags nas mi 'dzin cing sangs rgyas nyid kyi slad du bla ma yang yongs su brtags
translated: In this way, having heard the Bhagavān’s teaching, sentient beings do not grasp the profound and vast Dharma taught by the Bhagavān after examining it, and they do not examine the guru for the sake of buddhahood.

original: nas mi sten te rmongs pa chen po chags pas zil gyis mnan par gyur pa skye ba 'di nyid la bdag cag rnams kyi rul pa'i lus sangs rgyas kyi skur 'gyur ro zhes pa'i bsam pa brkam chags can rnams mi dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang phrad pa dang
analyzed: nas mi sten te rmongs pa chen po chags pas zil gyis mnan par gyur pa skye ba 'di nyid la bdag cag rnams kyi rul pa'i lus sangs rgyas kyi skur 'gyur ro zhes pa'i bsam pa brkam chags can rnams mi dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang phrad pa dang
translated: The thought of those who are greedy, who are overcome by the great delusion of attachment, is: In this very life, our putrid bodies will become the body of a buddha.

original: bla ma dam pa ma yin pa'i man ngag las 'dir rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i bdud rtsi lnga dang go ku da ha na la sogs pa'i sha rnams ni bza' ba rang bzhin gyis dag par de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa ste 'di rnams zos pas
analyzed: bla ma dam pa ma yin pa'i man ngag las 'dir rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i bdud rtsi lnga dang go ku da ha na la sogs pa'i sha rnams ni bza' ba rang bzhin gyis dag par de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa ste 'di rnams zos pas
translated: Due to the instruction of a non-genuine guru, they think, The five nectars of Vairocana and so on and the meats of cow, elephant, horse, and human and so on are pure by nature, as taught by the Tathagata. By eating them,🔽one will obtain an immortal body and Vajrasattva will grant the supreme attainment.

original: rga ba dang 'chi ba med pa'i lus su 'gyur zhing rdo rje sems dpa' yang mchog sbyin par @233b 'gyur ro zhes pa dang gzhan yang rdo rje'i rigs la khro bo'i rgyal po'i ting nge 'dzin gyis srog chags rnams gsad par bya'o //
analyzed: rga ba dang 'chi ba med pa'i lus su 'gyur zhing rdo rje sems dpa' yang mchog sbyin par @233b 'gyur ro zhes pa dang gzhan yang rdo rje'i rigs la khro bo'i rgyal po'i ting nge 'dzin gyis srog chags rnams gsad par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, In the vajra family, one should kill living beings with the concentration of the king of wrathful ones.🔽 By killing them, one will obtain the supreme attainment.

original: ral gri'i rigs la don yod grub pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis mi bden par smra bar bya'o //
analyzed: ral gri'i rigs la don yod grub pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis mi bden par smra bar bya'o //
translated: For the sword family, one should speak untruthfully with Amoghasiddhi’s meditative stabilization.

original: rin po che'i rigs la rin chen 'byung ldan gyi ting nge 'dzin gyis gzhan gyi nor dbrog par bya'o //
analyzed: rin po che'i rigs la rin chen 'byung ldan gyi ting nge 'dzin gyis gzhan gyi nor dbrog par bya'o //
translated: For the jewel family, one should steal the wealth of others with Ratnasaṃbhava’s meditative stabilization.

original: padma'i rigs la snang ba mtha' yas kyi ting nge 'dzin gyis gzhan gyi bud med dbrog par bya'o //
analyzed: padma'i rigs la snang ba mtha' yas kyi ting nge 'dzin gyis gzhan gyi bud med dbrog par bya'o //
translated: For the lotus family, one should steal the wives of others with Amitābha’s meditative stabilization.

original: 'khor lo'i rigs la rnam par snang mdzad kyi ting nge 'dzin gyis bdud rtsi lnga dang sha rnams bza' bar bya'o zhes pa dang gzhan mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams rnal 'byor pas lha'i rnal 'byor gyis bya'o zhes pa ste de ltar gdug pa'i slob dpon
analyzed: 'khor lo'i rigs la rnam par snang mdzad kyi ting nge 'dzin gyis bdud rtsi lnga dang sha rnams bza' bar bya'o zhes pa dang gzhan mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams rnal 'byor pas lha'i rnal 'byor gyis bya'o zhes pa ste de ltar gdug pa'i slob dpon
translated: For the wheel family, one should eat the five nectars and meats with Vairocana’s meditative stabilization.”

original: gyi tshig tshad mar byas nas mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams byed do //
analyzed: gyi tshig tshad mar byas nas mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams byed do //
translated: Thus, taking the words of such a wicked teacher as authoritative, one engages in the paths of the ten nonvirtues.

original: sbyang ba ma byas pa dang rgyas pa ma byas pa dang sngar ba ma byas pa dang bdud rtsir ma byas pa'i rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa rnams za bar byed do //
analyzed: sbyang ba ma byas pa dang rgyas pa ma byas pa dang sngar ba ma byas pa dang bdud rtsir ma byas pa'i rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa rnams za bar byed do //
translated: One should not eat Vairocana, etc., who are not purified, not expanded, not previously made, not made into nectar.

original: bdud rtsi lnga po de rnams ni zab po de rnams la sangs rgyas kyi yon tan ster bar byed pa por mi 'gyur te sangs rgyas kyi gsung ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdud rtsi lnga po de rnams ni zab po de rnams la sangs rgyas kyi yon tan ster bar byed pa por mi 'gyur te sangs rgyas kyi gsung ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Those five nectars are not the bestowers of the qualities of Buddhahood on those who are not profound, because they do not understand the speech of the Buddha.

original: 'o na de bzhin gshegs pas rgyud kyi rgyal po thams cad las bdud rtsi lnga rnams rnal 'byor pas bza' bar bya bar gsungs pa ma yin nam 'dir ci ltar 'di rnams bkag ces 'ga' zhig gi bsam pa 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na de bzhin gshegs pas rgyud kyi rgyal po thams cad las bdud rtsi lnga rnams rnal 'byor pas bza' bar bya bar gsungs pa ma yin nam 'dir ci ltar 'di rnams bkag ces 'ga' zhig gi bsam pa 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: But, one might think, haven't all the kings of tantras taught that the five nectars are to be eaten by the yogī? So why are they prohibited here?

original: de'i phyir brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, we must explain.

original: 'dir byis pa'i skye bo rnams kyis brjod par bya ba gang yin pa de bzhin gshegs pas rgyud kyi rgyal po thams cad las bdud rtsi lnga la sogs pa rnams bza' bar gsungs pa de ni bden te 'on kyang rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi yin gyi tha mal
analyzed: 'dir byis pa'i skye bo rnams kyis brjod par bya ba gang yin pa de bzhin gshegs pas rgyud kyi rgyal po thams cad las bdud rtsi lnga la sogs pa rnams bza' bar gsungs pa de ni bden te 'on kyang rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi yin gyi tha mal
translated: Here, the Tathāgata has taught in all the kings of tantras that the five nectars and so on are to be eaten by childish beings, and that is true, but it is for yogins and yoginīs, not for ordinary

original: pa'i sems can rnams kyi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: pa'i sems can rnams kyi ni ma yin no //
translated: beings.

original: gang dag gi sngags kyi stobs sam bsam gtan gyi stobs kyis sbyang ba byas pa dang / rgyas pa byas pa dang / rab tu 'bar ba byas pa dang / bdud rtsir byas pa'i dug rnams ni dug med par 'gyur pa dang chang rnams ni 'o mar 'gyur pa dang dug gi chu la sogs pa'i gdug pa rnams dang sems can rnams la 'chi ba ster bar byed @234a * //
analyzed: gang dag gi sngags kyi stobs sam bsam gtan gyi stobs kyis sbyang ba byas pa dang / rgyas pa byas pa dang / rab tu 'bar ba byas pa dang / bdud rtsir byas pa'i dug rnams ni dug med par 'gyur pa dang chang rnams ni 'o mar 'gyur pa dang dug gi chu la sogs pa'i gdug pa rnams dang sems can rnams la 'chi ba ster bar byed @234a * //
translated: Those poisons that have been purified, expanded, inflamed, and made into nectar by the power of mantra or the power of meditative concentration will be without poison, and the wines will become milk, and the poisons of water and so on will not harm sentient beings, and they will not die.

original: pa la sogs pa rnams ni bcud len du 'gyur pa dang rus pa rnams ni me tog tu 'gyur pa dang so rnams ni mu tig gi rdog por 'gyur pa dang thod pa ni padmar 'gyur pa dang sha ni pu tra ke shar 'gyur pa dang khrag ni
analyzed: pa la sogs pa rnams ni bcud len du 'gyur pa dang rus pa rnams ni me tog tu 'gyur pa dang so rnams ni mu tig gi rdog por 'gyur pa dang thod pa ni padmar 'gyur pa dang sha ni pu tra ke shar 'gyur pa dang khrag ni
translated: The bones become flowers, the teeth become pearls, the skull becomes a lotus, the flesh becomes putrakésa, the blood becomes

original: sihla kar 'gyur pa dang / gci ba ni gla rtsir 'gyur pa dang khu ba ni ga pur du 'gyur pa dang bshang ba ni bzhi mnyam du 'gyur pa dang / ba spu rnams ni gur gum gyi ge sar du 'gyur pa ste de ltar gdug pa'i rdzas du ma rnams ni gdug pa'i rang bzhin yongs su dor ba'i phyir sbyang ba byas pa dang rgyas pa byas pa dag /
analyzed: sihla kar 'gyur pa dang / gci ba ni gla rtsir 'gyur pa dang khu ba ni ga pur du 'gyur pa dang bshang ba ni bzhi mnyam du 'gyur pa dang / ba spu rnams ni gur gum gyi ge sar du 'gyur pa ste de ltar gdug pa'i rdzas du ma rnams ni gdug pa'i rang bzhin yongs su dor ba'i phyir sbyang ba byas pa dang rgyas pa byas pa dag /
translated: sandalwood, the feces become musk, the semen becomes camphor, the excrement becomes the four equal parts, and the body hairs become saffron filaments. Thus, the many poisonous substances are purified and expanded,

original: rab tu 'bar ba byas pa dang bdud rtsir byas pa rnams dag pa'i rang bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pas rgyud kyi rgyal po thams cad las gsungs pa de ni bden no //
analyzed: rab tu 'bar ba byas pa dang bdud rtsir byas pa rnams dag pa'i rang bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pas rgyud kyi rgyal po thams cad las gsungs pa de ni bden no //
translated: and having been made to blaze and made into nectar, they are the nature of purity. The Tathāgata has said that in all the kings of tantras, and that is true.

original: dug la sogs pa dag pa'i rang bzhin can bdud rtsir byas pa de rnams rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis zos pa yang lus la stobs chen po rgyas par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dug la sogs pa dag pa'i rang bzhin can bdud rtsir byas pa de rnams rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis zos pa yang lus la stobs chen po rgyas par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: The yogins who consume those things, such as poison, which are made into nectar by their pure nature, will also have their bodies pervaded by great strength.

original: bshang ba la sogs pa dag pa'i rang bzhin rnams lus la byugs pa ni mchog gi dri rab tu ldang bar byed do //
analyzed: bshang ba la sogs pa dag pa'i rang bzhin rnams lus la byugs pa ni mchog gi dri rab tu ldang bar byed do //
translated: The supreme fragrance will arise from anointing the body with pure excrement and so on.

original: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa rnams ni rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa rnams ni rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi yin no //
translated: Therefore, the statements of the Tathāgata are for the yogins.

original: gzhan lha dang sngags ma bsgrubs pa bklags pa'i rmongs pa mkhas pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang ldan pa chu skyar gyi sgyu 'dzin pa tshogs khang dang gtsug lag khang gi rdzas la mngon par chags pa dang ldan pa yi dags dang dmyal ba'i skye bar skye ba
analyzed: gzhan lha dang sngags ma bsgrubs pa bklags pa'i rmongs pa mkhas pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang ldan pa chu skyar gyi sgyu 'dzin pa tshogs khang dang gtsug lag khang gi rdzas la mngon par chags pa dang ldan pa yi dags dang dmyal ba'i skye bar skye ba
translated: Others, who are ignorant of the practice of deities and mantras, are arrogant with the pride of being learned, hold the deception of the heron, are attached to the wealth of the assembly hall and temple, and are born as hungry ghosts and hell beings.

original: 'byung ba nges par bcings pa rang gi don dang gzhan gyi don nyams pa rgyud las gsungs pa'i don las phyin ci log gi don ston pa po yongs su brtag pa mi byed pa'i skye bo bdud kyi ris chen po rnams kyi bza' ba ni bcom ldan 'das🔽kyis gsungs pa rnams su mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba nges par bcings pa rang gi don dang gzhan gyi don nyams pa rgyud las gsungs pa'i don las phyin ci log gi don ston pa po yongs su brtag pa mi byed pa'i skye bo bdud kyi ris chen po rnams kyi bza' ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa rnams su mi 'gyur ro //
