translated: The Bhagavān has said that those who do not investigate the meaning of the tantras, which teach the opposite of the meaning of the tantras, are the food of the great classes of māras, who are people who have lost their own and others’ aims by binding the elements.

original: gdug pa'i sems dang ldan pa de rnams kyis dug la sogs pa gdug pa'i rdzas rnams dang bdud rtsi lnga po de rnams sbyang ba byas pa dang / rgyas pa byas pa dang 'bar ba byas pa dang bdud rtsir byas kyang bskal pa du ma rnams kyis kyang gdug pa'i rang bzhin yongs su 'dor bar mi 'gyur zhing gdug pa'i rang bzhin yongs su mdor @234b pa'i phyir dag pa'i rang bzhin du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gdug pa'i sems dang ldan pa de rnams kyis dug la sogs pa gdug pa'i rdzas rnams dang bdud rtsi lnga po de rnams sbyang ba byas pa dang / rgyas pa byas pa dang 'bar ba byas pa dang bdud rtsir byas kyang bskal pa du ma rnams kyis kyang gdug pa'i rang bzhin yongs su 'dor bar mi 'gyur zhing gdug pa'i rang bzhin yongs su mdor @234b pa'i phyir dag pa'i rang bzhin du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who have a poisonous mind, even though they purify, expand, blaze, and make nectar from poisonous substances such as poison and the five nectars, will not relinquish their poisonous nature even in many eons, and because they do not relinquish their poisonous nature, they will not become pure by nature.

original: de'i phyir bsam gtan gyi stobs sam sngags kyi stobs kyis gdug pa'i rdzas de rnams kyi gdug pa'i rang bzhin dbrog par mi nus kyi bar du rigs kyi bu 'am rigs kyi bu mo 'am /🔽dge slong ngam dge slong ma 'am dge bsnyen nam dge bsnyen ma yang rung ste las dang po pa rdo rje theg pa la dga' ba de la rdo rje slob dpon bla ma dam pa las dang po pa'am sngags kyi nus pa dang ldan pas dug la sogs
analyzed: de'i phyir bsam gtan gyi stobs sam sngags kyi stobs kyis gdug pa'i rdzas de rnams kyi gdug pa'i rang bzhin dbrog par mi nus kyi bar du rigs kyi bu 'am rigs kyi bu mo 'am / dge slong ngam dge slong ma 'am dge bsnyen nam dge bsnyen ma yang rung ste las dang po pa rdo rje theg pa la dga' ba de la rdo rje slob dpon bla ma dam pa las dang po pa'am sngags kyi nus pa dang ldan pas dug la sogs
translated: Therefore, until the poisonous nature of those poisonous substances can be removed by the power of meditative stabilization or the power of mantra, a son or daughter of good lineage,🔽whether a beginning monk or nun, or a beginning male or female lay vow holder, who delights in the Vajrayāna, should not be given the definite instruction in eating and anointing with poison and so on,

original: pa dang bdud rtsi lnga la sogs pa bza' ba dang byug pa'i nges pa sbyin par mi bya ste ma dag pa'i dug la sogs pa zos pas 'chi bar 'gyur zhing ma dag pa'i dam tshig byugs pas 'jig rten pas smad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa dang bdud rtsi lnga la sogs pa bza' ba dang byug pa'i nges pa sbyin par mi bya ste ma dag pa'i dug la sogs pa zos pas 'chi bar 'gyur zhing ma dag pa'i dam tshig byugs pas 'jig rten pas smad par 'gyur ro //
translated: or the five nectars and so on, by a holy guru, a vajra master, who is a beginner or who is endowed with the power of mantra. If impure poison and so on is eaten, one will die, and if one anoints with impure pledge substances, one will be reviled by the world.

original: rang gis bsad pas shi ba dang 'jig rten pas smad pa las dmyal bar 'gro bar 'gyur te sngags pa ngan pa rnams kyis sems can gyi bsam pa yongs su spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gis bsad pas shi ba dang 'jig rten pas smad pa las dmyal bar 'gro bar 'gyur te sngags pa ngan pa rnams kyis sems can gyi bsam pa yongs su spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One goes to hell from killing by oneself and dying and being reviled by the world, because bad mantra practitioners completely abandon the thoughts of sentient beings.

original: mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i gsol ba'i 'debs pa las tshigs su bcad pa bcva lnga pas gsungs pa /
analyzed: mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i gsol ba'i 'debs pa las tshigs su bcad pa bcva lnga pas gsungs pa /
translated: In the Supplication of the Recitation of the Names, it is stated in fifteen verses:🔽In order to remove all afflictions

original: nyon mongs ma lus bsal ba dang // mi shes ma lus spang ba'i phyir //
analyzed: nyon mongs ma lus bsal ba dang // mi shes ma lus spang ba'i phyir //
translated: and in order to abandon all ignorance,

original: bsam pa'i khyad par ji bzhin du //
analyzed: bsam pa'i khyad par ji bzhin du //
translated: in accordance with the distinctions of thoughts,

original: sems can rnams la bshad par 'tshal zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams la bshad par 'tshal zhes pa'o //
translated: I request the explanation for sentient beings.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung 'di'i phyir sems can gyi bsam pa'i dbang gis slob ma rnams la rdo rje slob dpon gyis nges pa sbyin par bya ste ji ltar las dang po pa rnams rang gis bsad pas 'chi ba dang 'jig rten pas smad par mi 'gyur par
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung 'di'i phyir sems can gyi bsam pa'i dbang gis slob ma rnams la rdo rje slob dpon gyis nges pa sbyin par bya ste ji ltar las dang po pa rnams rang gis bsad pas 'chi ba dang 'jig rten pas smad par mi 'gyur par
translated: For this reason of the speech of the Bhagavat, the vajra master should give the consecration to the disciples by the power of the thoughts of sentient beings, so that beginners will not die by killing by themselves and will not be reviled by the world.

original: ro // 'dir gal te 'jig rten pas smad pas dmyal bar 'gro bar 'gyur na 'o na de'i tshe lta ba pa thams cad ni phan tshun smod par byed de /
analyzed: ro // 'dir gal te 'jig rten pas smad pas dmyal bar 'gro bar 'gyur na 'o na de'i tshe lta ba pa thams cad ni phan tshun smod par byed de /
translated: If one goes to hell because of being reviled by the world, then at that time all the philosophers would revile each other.

original: phan tshun smad pa las lta ba pa thams cad dmyal bar 'gro ba 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phan tshun smad pa las lta ba pa thams cad dmyal bar 'gro ba 'gyur ro //
translated: And because of mutual revilement, all the philosophers would go to hell.

original: gal te de ltar na tshad ma'i stan bcos rnam dang grub pa'i mtha' thams cad dang 'gal zhing brtul zhugs dang tshul khrims la sogs pa thams cad don med par 'gyur ro zhes pa 'ga' zhig gi bsam pa 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na tshad ma'i stan bcos rnam dang grub pa'i mtha' thams cad dang 'gal zhing brtul zhugs dang tshul khrims la sogs pa thams cad don med par 'gyur ro zhes pa 'ga' zhig gi bsam pa 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: If that is so, then it would contradict all the treatises on logic and all philosophical systems, and all vows and moral discipline would be pointless.

original: de'i phyir brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir brjod par bya'o //
translated: This is the thought of some, and so it must be addressed.

original: 'dir byis pa'i skye bo rnams kyis brjod par bya ba gang yin ma tshad ma'i bstan bcos la sogs pa @235a * //
analyzed: 'dir byis pa'i skye bo rnams kyis brjod par bya ba gang yin ma tshad ma'i bstan bcos la sogs pa @235a * //
translated: Here, what is to be said by childish beings is not at all contradictory to all the treatises on logic and so on,

original: thams cad dang 'gal ba de ni ma yin te gang gi phyir de kho na nyid yongs su brtag par sems pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad dang 'gal ba de ni ma yin te gang gi phyir de kho na nyid yongs su brtag par sems pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are thinking about reality.

original: lta ba po phan tshun smra ba po de rnams kyi lta ba la skyon yod pa ma yin te de kho na nyid yongs su brtag pa la brten pa'i sems kyi phyir dang sems can thams cad la gnod pa byed pa'i sems med pa'i phyir dang sems can
analyzed: lta ba po phan tshun smra ba po de rnams kyi lta ba la skyon yod pa ma yin te de kho na nyid yongs su brtag pa la brten pa'i sems kyi phyir dang sems can thams cad la gnod pa byed pa'i sems med pa'i phyir dang sems can
translated: The views of those who mutually debate about the viewer are not faulty because they are minds that depend on the examination of reality and because they do not have a mind that harms any sentient being.🔽

original: thams cad la phan pa byed pa'i sems kyi phyir ro //🔽'dir ni dug la sogs pa dang bdud rtsi lnga la sogs pa bza' ba dang byug pa ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad de don dam pa yongs su brtag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: thams cad la phan pa byed pa'i sems kyi phyir ro // 'dir ni dug la sogs pa dang bdud rtsi lnga la sogs pa bza' ba dang byug pa ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad de don dam pa yongs su brtag pa ma yin no //
translated: The view of those who mutually speak about the seer is not faulty, because it is the mind that is based on the investigation of reality, because it is the mind that does not harm any sentient being, and because it is the mind that benefits all sentient beings.🔽Here, the eating and anointing with poison, etc., and the five ambrosias, etc., are worldly conventions, not investigations of the ultimate.

original: gang zhig yongs su brtag pa dang 'jig rten pas smad pa las kyang skyon du mi 'gyur pa dug la sogs pa dang bdud rtsi lnga la sogs pa ni de kho na nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig yongs su brtag pa dang 'jig rten pas smad pa las kyang skyon du mi 'gyur pa dug la sogs pa dang bdud rtsi lnga la sogs pa ni de kho na nyid ma yin no //
translated: That which is not faulty even in the investigation and in what is despised by the world is not reality, such as poison, etc., and the five ambrosias, etc.

original: de'i phyir sems can gyi bsam pa'i dbang gis sangs rgyas pa rnams kyi chos bstan pa ste sems can gyi bsam pa dang bral bas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems can gyi bsam pa'i dbang gis sangs rgyas pa rnams kyi chos bstan pa ste sems can gyi bsam pa dang bral bas ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the teaching of the Dharma by the Buddhas is due to the power of the thoughts of sentient beings, not due to the absence of the thoughts of sentient beings.

original: sems can rnams kyi bsam pa yang yul dang rigs kyi tha snyad kyis 'gyur te de'i phyi de rnams kyi yul dang rigs kyi tha snyad kyis 'jig rten kun rdzob kyi bden pas rdo re slob dpon gyis 'jig rten pa'i chos bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi bsam pa yang yul dang rigs kyi tha snyad kyis 'gyur te de'i phyi de rnams kyi yul dang rigs kyi tha snyad kyis 'jig rten kun rdzob kyi bden pas rdo re slob dpon gyis 'jig rten pa'i chos bstan par bya'o //
translated: The thoughts of sentient beings are also due to the conventions of place and caste. Therefore, the teacher should teach the Dharma of the world to those people according to the conventions of place and caste of the world, by means of the conventional truth of the world.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yi shes ni bden pa gnyis ka thun mong ba ste de nyid ni bza' bar bya ba dang bza' bar bya ba ma yin pa'i 'dzin pas mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yi shes ni bden pa gnyis ka thun mong ba ste de nyid ni bza' bar bya ba dang bza' bar bya ba ma yin pa'i 'dzin pas mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But supramundane knowledge is common to both truths. It is not affected by the grasping of what is to be eaten and what is not to be eaten.

original: bza' bar bya ba dang bza' bar bya ba ma yin pa ni lto ba 'gengs pa tsam yin gyi stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa dang mngon par 'dus ma byas pa ste rnam par thar pa'i sgo bzhi rnam par dag pa🔽ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bza' bar bya ba dang bza' bar bya ba ma yin pa ni lto ba 'gengs pa tsam yin gyi stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa dang mngon par 'dus ma byas pa ste rnam par thar pa'i sgo bzhi rnam par dag pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Food and non-food are merely for filling the stomach, but not for the purification of the four gateways to liberation, i.e. emptiness, signlessness, wishlessness, and non-conditioning.

original: de'i phyir las dang po pas yul gyi tha snyad kyis bza' bar bya ba dang bza' bar bya ba ma yin pa dang rigs dang rigs ma yin pa la mngon par bgrod pa yang bya ste yul la la na thod pa can gyi thod pa'i chus rnam par🔽dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir las dang po pas yul gyi tha snyad kyis bza' bar bya ba dang bza' bar bya ba ma yin pa dang rigs dang rigs ma yin pa la mngon par bgrod pa yang bya ste yul la la na thod pa can gyi thod pa'i chus rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the beginner should also proceed to the proper and improper objects by means of the conventions of the objects, food and non-food, and proper and improper. In some places, the skull-cup of the skull-bearer purifies with water.

original: yul la la na ba lang gi sha ni bza' bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: yul la la na ba lang gi sha ni bza' bar bya ba'o //
translated: In some places, the flesh of cows is to be eaten.

original: yul la la na khyi'i sha dang yul la la na rta'i sha dang yul la lan glang po che'i sha'o //
analyzed: yul la la na khyi'i sha dang yul la la na rta'i sha dang yul la lan glang po che'i sha'o //
translated: In some places, the flesh of dogs, in some places, the flesh of horses, in some places, the flesh of elephants.

original: yul la la na mi'i sha ni bza' bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: yul la la na mi'i sha ni bza' bar bya ba'o //
translated: In some places, the flesh of humans is to be eaten.

original: de bzhin du sha gzhan yang yul @235b gyi tha snyad kyis rigs dang rigs ma yin pa thams cad kyis rnam pa thams cad du bza' bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sha gzhan yang yul @235b gyi tha snyad kyis rigs dang rigs ma yin pa thams cad kyis rnam pa thams cad du bza' bar bya ba'o //
translated: In the same way, other meats are to be eaten according to the conventions of place and caste, in all their varieties.

original: yul la la na bram ze rnams chang gi btung ba sgrub bo //🔽yul la la na dmangs rigs zas sgrub bo //
analyzed: yul la la na bram ze rnams chang gi btung ba sgrub bo // yul la la na dmangs rigs zas sgrub bo //
translated: In some places, the Brahmins prepare alcoholic drinks.🔽In some places, the Shudras prepare food.

original: yul la la na rigs can rnams kyi zas rigs can ma yin pas sgrub bo //
analyzed: yul la la na rigs can rnams kyi zas rigs can ma yin pas sgrub bo //
translated: In some places, the food of the Aryas is prepared by those who are not Aryas.

original: yul la la na khyi'i lhag ma bza' bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: yul la la na khyi'i lhag ma bza' bar bya ba'o //
translated: In some places, one should eat the leftovers of dogs.

original: yul la la na zas zos pa'i rjes la kha mi 'khrud do //
analyzed: yul la la na zas zos pa'i rjes la kha mi 'khrud do //
translated: In some places, after eating food, one should not rinse one's mouth.

original: yul la lan phag pa'i sha ni bza' bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: yul la lan phag pa'i sha ni bza' bar bya ba'o //
translated: In some places, the meat of pigs is to be eaten.

original: yul la la na ma he'i sha dang yul la la na ra'i sha'o //
analyzed: yul la la na ma he'i sha dang yul la la na ra'i sha'o //
translated: In some places, the meat of buffaloes and goats.

original: de bzhin du sha gzhan yang yul dang rigs kyi tha snyad kyis rigs dang rigs ma yin pa rnams kyis bza' bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sha gzhan yang yul dang rigs kyi tha snyad kyis rigs dang rigs ma yin pa rnams kyis bza' bar bya ba'o //
translated: In the same way, other meats are to be eaten according to the conventions of place and caste, in all their varieties.

original: yul la la na gtum po rnams ni nyan thos so //
analyzed: yul la la na gtum po rnams ni nyan thos so //
translated: In some places, the violent ones are the Shravakas.

original: yul la la na rigs bzhi'i 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: yul la la na rigs bzhi'i 'jug pa'o //
translated: In some countries, the four castes intermingle.

original: yul la la na thams cad rigs gcig gi 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: yul la la na thams cad rigs gcig gi 'jug pa'o //
translated: In some countries, everyone belongs to the same caste.

original: yul la la na pha shi bar gyur pa na ma bu'i chung mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul la la na pha shi bar gyur pa na ma bu'i chung mar 'gyur ro //
translated: In some countries, when the father dies, the son marries his father’s wife.

original: yul la la na ming pos sring mo bag mar len no //🔽yul la la na zhang po dang 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: yul la la na ming pos sring mo bag mar len no // yul la la na zhang po dang 'brel pa'o //
translated: In some countries, the brother takes the wife of his deceased brother.🔽In some countries, one marries one’s aunt.

original: yul la la na rigs dang rigs ma yin pa rnams phan tshun mngon par 'gro'o //
analyzed: yul la la na rigs dang rigs ma yin pa rnams phan tshun mngon par 'gro'o //
translated: In some countries, one marries one’s cousin.

original: yul la la na bram ze mo rnams smad 'tshong ma'i tha snyad byed do //
analyzed: yul la la na bram ze mo rnams smad 'tshong ma'i tha snyad byed do //
translated: In some countries, the Brahmins are called “prostitutes.”

original: de ltar rnal 'byor pas yul du ma'i tha snyad kyis bza' bar bya ba dang bza' bar bya ba ma yin pa dang rigs dang rigs ma yin pa la mngon par bgrod par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar rnal 'byor pas yul du ma'i tha snyad kyis bza' bar bya ba dang bza' bar bya ba ma yin pa dang rigs dang rigs ma yin pa la mngon par bgrod par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the yogin should not go to any country, or to any place where one should not go, or to any place where one should go, by the designation of the country.

original: de bzhin du rigs kyi lha ni la la'i rigs la klu lha'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rigs kyi lha ni la la'i rigs la klu lha'o //
translated: In the same way, the family gods of some are the gods of the nāgas.

original: la la'i rigs la ra dang la la'i rigs la phag pa dang la la'i rigs la ma he dang la la'i rigs la 'ug pa'o //
analyzed: la la'i rigs la ra dang la la'i rigs la phag pa dang la la'i rigs la ma he dang la la'i rigs la 'ug pa'o //
translated: For some, the species of sheep, for some, the species of pig, for some, the species of buffalo, for some, the species of owl.

original: de bzhin du dud 'gro gzhan rnams kyang gzhan rnams kyi rigs kyi lha ste gsad par bya ba ma yin pa dang bza' bar bya ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dud 'gro gzhan rnams kyang gzhan rnams kyi rigs kyi lha ste gsad par bya ba ma yin pa dang bza' bar bya ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: In the same way, other animals are the gods of other species, and should not be killed or eaten.

original: de bzhin du la la'i rigs la shing p'a la sha lha'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du la la'i rigs la shing p'a la sha lha'o //
translated: In the same way, for some, the palāśa tree is a god;

original: la la'i aa rka dpal la'i aa shva dtha'o //
analyzed: la la'i aa rka dpal la'i aa shva dtha'o //
translated: for some, the arka tree; for some, the aśvattha tree.

original: de bzhin du shing gzhan rnams kyang gzhan rnams kyi lha ste gcad par bya ba ma yin pa dang dbye bar bya ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du shing gzhan rnams kyang gzhan rnams kyi lha ste gcad par bya ba ma yin pa dang dbye bar bya ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: In the same way, other trees are the gods of other species, and should not be cut down or split.

original: 'dir 'jig rten pas kyang yid ches par mthong ste gang gi phyir rang gi rigs la nye bar 'tshe ba'i phyir dang rigs la phan par byed pa'i phyir te 'dir gang @236a * //
analyzed: 'dir 'jig rten pas kyang yid ches par mthong ste gang gi phyir rang gi rigs la nye bar 'tshe ba'i phyir dang rigs la phan par byed pa'i phyir te 'dir gang @236a * //
translated: Here, the worldly person sees that this is credible, because of the harm done to the species and the benefit done to the species.

original: gi lha gang yin pa de bsten pa ni phan pa byed do //
analyzed: gi lha gang yin pa de bsten pa ni phan pa byed do //
translated: For the god of a certain species, when he is worshipped, does good to his worshippers.

original: ma bsten pa ni nye bar 'tshe ba chen po byed do //
analyzed: ma bsten pa ni nye bar 'tshe ba chen po byed do //
translated: Not serving him causes great harm.

original: de'i phyir las dang po pa sngags dang bsam gtan sgrub pa la mngon par dga' bas sngags grub pa'am ye shes grub par gyur gyi bar du yul dang rigs kyi tha snyad kyis tha snyad bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir las dang po pa sngags dang bsam gtan sgrub pa la mngon par dga' bas sngags grub pa'am ye shes grub par gyur gyi bar du yul dang rigs kyi tha snyad kyis tha snyad bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the beginner who delights in mantra and meditation practice should use the conventions of place and caste until he has accomplished the mantra or attained knowledge.

original: de nas rang gi 'dod pas bza' bar bya ba dang bza' bar bya ba ma yin pa dang / bgrod par bya ba dang bgrod par bya ba ma yin pa dang / btung bar bya ba dang btung bar bya ba ma yin pa bya ste de la sus kyang gnod pa bya bar mi nus so //
analyzed: de nas rang gi 'dod pas bza' bar bya ba dang bza' bar bya ba ma yin pa dang / bgrod par bya ba dang bgrod par bya ba ma yin pa dang / btung bar bya ba dang btung bar bya ba ma yin pa bya ste de la sus kyang gnod pa bya bar mi nus so //
translated: Then, by his own desire, he should eat what is to be eaten and what is not to be eaten, go where he is to go and where he is not to go, drink what is to be drunk and what is not to be drunk, and no one will be able to harm him.

original: de ltar las dang po pa ni sngags grub par gyur na rnal 'byor par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar las dang po pa ni sngags grub par gyur na rnal 'byor par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the beginner, when he has accomplished the mantra, becomes a yogin.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo spro ba dang nam mkha' la 'gro ba'i phyir grub pa'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo spro ba dang nam mkha' la 'gro ba'i phyir grub pa'o //
translated: He is accomplished because he emanates the mandala wheel and travels through space.

original: bdud dang nyon mongs pa dang snyoms par 'jug pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa zad pa dang rnam pa thams cad pa spro ba'i rdzu 'phrul ston pa dang chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu skor ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i gsung gis chos kyi phung po'i tshogs mtha' dag ston par byed pa'i dbang gis thams cad mkhyen par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdud dang nyon mongs pa dang snyoms par 'jug pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa zad pa dang rnam pa thams cad pa spro ba'i rdzu 'phrul ston pa dang chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu skor ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i gsung gis chos kyi phung po'i tshogs mtha' dag ston par byed pa'i dbang gis thams cad mkhyen par 'gyur ro //
translated: One becomes omniscient by the power of displaying the miracles of exhausting the obscurations of demons, afflictions, meditative absorptions, and objects of knowledge, emanating in all aspects, turning the wheel of Dharma, and teaching the entire collection of aggregates of Dharma with the speech of omniscience.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i so sor kun du rtog pa'i ye shes kyi bstod pa las tshigs su bcad pa bzhi bcu pa la sogs pa gsum gyis gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi rnal 'byor gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i so sor kun du rtog pa'i ye shes kyi bstod pa las tshigs su bcad pa bzhi bcu pa la sogs pa gsum gyis gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi rnal 'byor gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
translated: The Bhagavān, in the Praise of the Discriminating Wisdom of the Litany of the Names of Mañjuśrī, taught the yoga of nondual wisdom with three four-line verses beginning with:

original: brtson chen sgyu 'phrul dra ba ste //
analyzed: brtson chen sgyu 'phrul dra ba ste //
translated: The great diligent one is the net of illusions,🔽The supreme lord of all tantras,

original: rgyud kun gyi ni bdag po mchog / rdo rje gdan ni ma lus ldan //
analyzed: rgyud kun gyi ni bdag po mchog / rdo rje gdan ni ma lus ldan //
translated: Endowed with all vajra seats,

original: ye shes sku rnams ma lus 'chang //
analyzed: ye shes sku rnams ma lus 'chang //
translated: Holder of all wisdom bodies.

original: kun du bzang po blo gros bzang //
analyzed: kun du bzang po blo gros bzang //
translated: Samantabhadra, good intellect,

original: sa yi snying po 'gro ba 'dzin //
analyzed: sa yi snying po 'gro ba 'dzin //
translated: Kṣitigarbha, holder of beings,

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi chags pa che //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi chags pa che //
translated: Great passion of all buddhas,

original: sangs rgyas sprul pa'i 'khor lo 'chang //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sprul pa'i 'khor lo 'chang //
translated: Holder of the emanation wheel of buddhas,🔽Supreme nature of all things,

original: dngos po kun gyi rang bzhin mchog / dngos po kun gyi rang bzhin 'dzin //
analyzed: dngos po kun gyi rang bzhin mchog / dngos po kun gyi rang bzhin 'dzin //
translated: Holder of the nature of all things,

original: skye med chos te sna tshogs don //
analyzed: skye med chos te sna tshogs don //
translated: Dharma of non-arising, meaning of variety,

original: chos kun ngo bo nyid 'chang ba zhes pa'o //
analyzed: chos kun ngo bo nyid 'chang ba zhes pa'o //
translated: Holder of the essence of all dharmas.

original: de bzhin du rgyud kyi rgyal po'i le'u lnga pa las kyang tshigs su bcad pa drug cu pa la sogs pa gnyis kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyud kyi rgyal po'i le'u lnga pa las kyang tshigs su bcad pa drug cu pa la sogs pa gnyis kyis gsungs pa /
translated: Similarly, in the fifth chapter of the King of Tantras, two verses beginning with the sixtieth verse are stated:

original: de dag rnams kyis dus kyi 'khor lo rdzu 'phrul rab tu gsal byed chen po du ma sprul pa'i sku //
analyzed: de dag rnams kyis dus kyi 'khor lo rdzu 'phrul rab tu gsal byed chen po du ma sprul pa'i sku //
translated: By those, the Wheel of Time, the great illuminator of miracles, the emanation body,

original: rdo rje 'bar ba 'phro ba @236b rnams kyis 'dod pa'i khams na gnas pa lha min dang ni mi rnams dang // longs spyod rdzogs pas gzugs can rnams dang mkha' la rgyal ba'i sras sogs dgra bcom rnams la chos sku yis //
analyzed: rdo rje 'bar ba 'phro ba @236b rnams kyis 'dod pa'i khams na gnas pa lha min dang ni mi rnams dang // longs spyod rdzogs pas gzugs can rnams dang mkha' la rgyal ba'i sras sogs dgra bcom rnams la chos sku yis //
translated: With blazing vajras, in the desire realm, to the demigods and humans, with the enjoyment body, to the embodied ones, and in the sky, to the Victor's sons and so forth, to the arhats, with the dharma body,

original: stong pa'i cha yis srid gsum mtha' dag stong pa'i zad par rlung rnams kyis ni rlung gi zad par te //
analyzed: stong pa'i cha yis srid gsum mtha' dag stong pa'i zad par rlung rnams kyis ni rlung gi zad par te //
translated: By the empty part, the entire triple world is empty; by the wind part, the wind base;

original: me yi cha shas rnams kyis me yi zad par chu yang 'gro la spros pa'i chu yi cha rnams kyis //
analyzed: me yi cha shas rnams kyis me yi zad par chu yang 'gro la spros pa'i chu yi cha rnams kyis //
translated: by the fire part, fire; by the water part, water; by the earth part, earth.

original: 'dzin ma'i cha shas rnams kyis sa yi zad par tshogs pa'i yul rnams kyis ni dngos po'i rang bzhin kun //
analyzed: 'dzin ma'i cha shas rnams kyis sa yi zad par tshogs pa'i yul rnams kyis ni dngos po'i rang bzhin kun //
translated: By the earth part, the earth base; by the object part, all natures of things;🔽by the space part, the space base; by the consciousness part, the consciousness base.

original: kun nas nam mkha' dag dang mtshungs pa gcig gi bdag nyid 'di ni dag pa'i sa la ston par byed //
analyzed: kun nas nam mkha' dag dang mtshungs pa gcig gi bdag nyid 'di ni dag pa'i sa la ston par byed //
translated: Thus, this one nature, which is completely like space, is taught on the pure stage.

original: de ltar sangs rgyas skur gyur bde ba gcig pu'i rang bzhin phyir na 'chi bar yang ni mi 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar sangs rgyas skur gyur bde ba gcig pu'i rang bzhin phyir na 'chi bar yang ni mi 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
translated: Thus, because of being of the nature of the one bliss that is the Buddha body, there is no death.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung 'di'i phyir bdud rtsi lnga bza' ba dang sngags bzlas pa dang dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo rnam par rtog pa'i sgom pa'i stobs kyis rnal 'byor pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung 'di'i phyir bdud rtsi lnga bza' ba dang sngags bzlas pa dang dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo rnam par rtog pa'i sgom pa'i stobs kyis rnal 'byor pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of this statement of the Bhagavat, the yogi does not become a perfect Buddha by the power of the meditation of the conceptual mandala circle, by eating the five nectars, by reciting mantras, and so on.

original: 'o na dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo mngon sum du byas par gyur pa na rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub tu 'gyur par bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa ma yin nam de'i phyir 'dir ci ltar dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo mngon sum du
analyzed: 'o na dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo mngon sum du byas par gyur pa na rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub tu 'gyur par bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa ma yin nam de'i phyir 'dir ci ltar dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo mngon sum du
translated: But, it was taught by the Bhagavat that when the mandala circle is actualized, the yogi attains the Great Seal siddhi. Therefore, here, how is it that even when the mandala circle is actualized, the yogi does not become omniscient?

original: byas kyang rnal 'byor pa thams cad mkhyen par mi 'gyur zhes pa 'dir 'ga' zhig gi bsam pa 'byung par 'gyur te /
analyzed: byas kyang rnal 'byor pa thams cad mkhyen par mi 'gyur zhes pa 'dir 'ga' zhig gi bsam pa 'byung par 'gyur te /
translated: This thought may occur to some.

original: de'i phyir brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be explained.

original: 'dir dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo rnam par rtog pa'i dra ba dang nyi tshe ba dang nyi tshe ba'i dngos grub kyi 'bras bu ster ba ni sngon nyid du brjod zin to //
analyzed: 'dir dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo rnam par rtog pa'i dra ba dang nyi tshe ba dang nyi tshe ba'i dngos grub kyi 'bras bu ster ba ni sngon nyid du brjod zin to //
translated: Here, the wheel of the maṇḍala bestows the fruit of the web of conceptuality and the limited accomplishments.

original: gzhan yang las kyi phyag rgya bzung nas che ge mo grub pa 'di ni rmongs pa rnams kyi 'khrul pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang las kyi phyag rgya bzung nas che ge mo grub pa 'di ni rmongs pa rnams kyi 'khrul pa ste /
translated: Moreover, having taken up a karmamudrā, “this is the accomplishment of so-and-so,” is the delusion of the ignorant.

original: 'dir ril bu'i stobs sam skye ba bdun pa'i stobs sam ;
analyzed: 'dir ril bu'i stobs sam skye ba bdun pa'i stobs sam ;
translated: Here, it is the power of the pill, the power of the one born seven times,

original: ral gri la sogs pa'i stobs sam sngags kyi stobs sam bsam gtan gyi stobs sam /
analyzed: ral gri la sogs pa'i stobs sam sngags kyi stobs sam bsam gtan gyi stobs sam /
translated: the power of the sword, and so on, the power of mantra, the power of concentration,

original: dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo sgrub pa'i stobs kyis mi snang bar 'gyur gyi sgrib pa thams cad las rnam par grol ba'i thams cad mkhyen pa bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems @237a * //🔽dpar 'gyur pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo sgrub pa'i stobs kyis mi snang bar 'gyur gyi sgrib pa thams cad las rnam par grol ba'i thams cad mkhyen pa bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems @237a * //🔽dpar 'gyur pa ni ma yin no //
translated: or the power of accomplishing the maṇḍalacakra that becomes the invisibility, but not the omniscience of the Bhagavān Vajrasattva, who is liberated from all obscurations.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen po'i bstod pa las phyag rgya chen po 'dzin pa gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen po'i bstod pa las phyag rgya chen po 'dzin pa gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
translated: The Bhagavat taught the great seal in the praise of the great vajra realm mandala of the recitation of Mañjuśrī’s name, as follows:

original: bsam gtan chen po'i ting 'dzin gnas //
analyzed: bsam gtan chen po'i ting 'dzin gnas //
translated: Abiding in the meditative stabilization of great concentration,

original: shes rab chen po'i lus 'chang ba //
analyzed: shes rab chen po'i lus 'chang ba //
translated: Embodying the great wisdom,

original: stobs po che la thabs che ba //
analyzed: stobs po che la thabs che ba //
translated: Great strength, great means,

original: smon lam ye shes rgya mtsho ste zhes so //
analyzed: smon lam ye shes rgya mtsho ste zhes so //
translated: An ocean of aspiration and intuition.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung 'di'i phyir 'di ni phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub ma yin te phyag rgya chen po ni chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin med pa'i mtshan nyid can rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ma
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung 'di'i phyir 'di ni phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub ma yin te phyag rgya chen po ni chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin med pa'i mtshan nyid can rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ma
translated: Because of this statement by the Bhagavat, this is not the great seal siddhi, for the great seal is the perfection of wisdom endowed with the most sublime of all aspects, having the character of the absence of intrinsic reality of all phenomena.

original: sangs rgyas skyed par mdzad ma'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas skyed par mdzad ma'o //
translated: It is the mother who gives birth to the buddhas.

original: chos 'byung gi sgras kyang de brjod de chos 'byung gang las rang bzhin med pa'i chos thams cad 'byung bar 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: chos 'byung gi sgras kyang de brjod de chos 'byung gang las rang bzhin med pa'i chos thams cad 'byung bar 'gyur pa'o //
translated: The term source of phenomena also expresses this, for it is the source of phenomena from which all phenomena without intrinsic reality emerge.

original: rang bzhin med pa'i chos rnams ni stobs bcu dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong rnams so //
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa'i chos rnams ni stobs bcu dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong rnams so //
translated: The dharmas without intrinsic nature are the eighty-four thousand aggregates of Dharma, such as the ten powers and the four forms of fearlessness.

original: de rnams 'byung bar gyur pa ni chos 'byung ste sangs rgyas kyi zhing ngo //
analyzed: de rnams 'byung bar gyur pa ni chos 'byung ste sangs rgyas kyi zhing ngo //
translated: The arising of those is the source of Dharma, the buddha field.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gnas te bde ba'i gnas dang skye ba'i gnas so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gnas te bde ba'i gnas dang skye ba'i gnas so //
translated: It is the abode of the buddhas and bodhisattvas, the abode of bliss, the abode of birth.

original: gang las khrag dang gci ba dang khu ba rnams 'byung ba de ni chos 'byung ma yin no //
analyzed: gang las khrag dang gci ba dang khu ba rnams 'byung ba de ni chos 'byung ma yin no //
translated: That from which blood, urine, and semen arise is not the source of Dharma.

original: 'dir 'khor ba pa rnams kyi chags pa dang chags bral gyi zhing ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir 'khor ba pa rnams kyi chags pa dang chags bral gyi zhing ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi ma yin no //
translated: Here, the field of attachment and detachment of transmigrators is not the field of the tathāgatas.

original: de'i phyir chos 'byung ni chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin can sna tshogs yum bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor los 'khyud pa dus thams cad du sgrib pa thams cad dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos 'byung ni chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin can sna tshogs yum bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor los 'khyud pa dus thams cad du sgrib pa thams cad dang bral ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the source of Dharma, which has the nature of the dharmadhātu, is the mother of variety, the Bhagavatī Kālacakramā, who is free from all obscurations at all times.

original: 'dir chags pa ni skye ba'i dus dang 'pho ba ni 'gog pa'i dus te de dag snyoms par zhugs pa ni mi 'gyur pa'i dus so //
analyzed: 'dir chags pa ni skye ba'i dus dang 'pho ba ni 'gog pa'i dus te de dag snyoms par zhugs pa ni mi 'gyur pa'i dus so //
translated: Here, attachment is the time of birth, and transference is the time of cessation. The union of those is the time of non-change.

original: de'i 'khor lo ni rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen po ste phung po dang khams dang skye mched sgrib pa med pa ni rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen po zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de'i 'khor lo ni rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen po ste phung po dang khams dang skye mched sgrib pa med pa ni rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen po zhes brjod do //
translated: His wheel is the great maṇḍala of the vajra realm. The aggregates, elements, and sense bases free of obscuration are called the great maṇḍala of the vajra realm.

original: mi 'gyur ba las skyes pa 'dis ma skyes pa'i phyag rgya chen po la 'khyud pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba las skyes pa 'dis ma skyes pa'i phyag rgya chen po la 'khyud pa'o //
translated: The great seal that is born from non-change is embraced by the non-arisen great seal.

original: gang la la zhig skye ba gzhan gyi bag chags kyi dbang dang bla ma dam pa'i man ngag @237b gis dus du mar nyin dang mtshan mor phyag rgya chen po brtags pa'i chos thams cad dang bral ba rang gi sems kyi snang ba tsam rnam pa thams cad
analyzed: gang la la zhig skye ba gzhan gyi bag chags kyi dbang dang bla ma dam pa'i man ngag @237b gis dus du mar nyin dang mtshan mor phyag rgya chen po brtags pa'i chos thams cad dang bral ba rang gi sems kyi snang ba tsam rnam pa thams cad
translated: Whoever, by the power of the latent tendencies of another birth and the intimate instructions of an excellent guru, at many times during the day and night, examines the great seal free from all phenomena, the mere appearance of one’s mind, free from all aspects,

original: kyi mchog dang ldan pa chen po stong pa nyid lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba skyed par byed pa 'di mngon sum du byas nas 'khyud par byed pa de ni phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub thob pas thams cad mkhyen pa bcom ldan 'das zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: kyi mchog dang ldan pa chen po stong pa nyid lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba skyed par byed pa 'di mngon sum du byas nas 'khyud par byed pa de ni phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub thob pas thams cad mkhyen pa bcom ldan 'das zhes gsungs so //
translated: Having actualized this supreme emptiness, the great bliss that is coemergent, and having embraced it, one attains the siddhi of mahāmudrā and is called the omniscient Bhagavān.

original: de'i phyir las dang po pas rnal 'byor pa'i bya ba mi bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir las dang po pas rnal 'byor pa'i bya ba mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, a beginner should not perform the activities of a yogin.

original: rnal 'byor pas grub pa'i bya ba mi bya'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas grub pa'i bya ba mi bya'o //
translated: A yogin should not perform the activities of a siddha.

original: grub pas thams cad mkhyen pa'i bya ba mi bya'o //
analyzed: grub pas thams cad mkhyen pa'i bya ba mi bya'o //
translated: A siddha should not perform the activities of an omniscient one.

original: de ltar na las dang po pas sngar brjod pa'i rnam pas bza' bar bya ba dang bza' bar bya ba ma yin pa la sogs pa bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na las dang po pas sngar brjod pa'i rnam pas bza' bar bya ba dang bza' bar bya ba ma yin pa la sogs pa bya'o //
translated: Thus, a beginner should eat and not eat and so on in the manner described above.

original: ci ste sdig pa'i blo can lha min gyi bza' bar bya ba bla ma dam pa ma yin pas chos nye bar bstan pa rnams kyi tshig ni 'dir rgyud kyi rgyal po rnams las dam tshig thams cad rnam par rtog pa med pa'i sems kyis bza' bar bya
analyzed: ci ste sdig pa'i blo can lha min gyi bza' bar bya ba bla ma dam pa ma yin pas chos nye bar bstan pa rnams kyi tshig ni 'dir rgyud kyi rgyal po rnams las dam tshig thams cad rnam par rtog pa med pa'i sems kyis bza' bar bya
translated: If you have a sinful mind, then the words of the teachings of the excellent gurus, who are not to be eaten by the demigods, are that all pledges are to be eaten with a nonconceptual mind.

original: bar de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs so //
analyzed: bar de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs so //
translated: The Tathāgata has said this in the king of tantras.

original: de'i phyir dang por re zhig bdud rtsi lnga la sogs pa rnams bdag cag rnams kyis bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir dang por re zhig bdud rtsi lnga la sogs pa rnams bdag cag rnams kyis bza' bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, first of all, we should eat the five nectars and so on.

original: phyi nas de goms pa'i dbang gis dam tshig gi dngos grub 'byung bar 'gyur te dam tshig gi dngos grub kyi dbang gis dug la sogs pa bza' bar bya ba ma yin pa rnams bza' bar bya bar 'gyur zhing bshang ba la sogs pa dri nga ba rnams
analyzed: phyi nas de goms pa'i dbang gis dam tshig gi dngos grub 'byung bar 'gyur te dam tshig gi dngos grub kyi dbang gis dug la sogs pa bza' bar bya ba ma yin pa rnams bza' bar bya bar 'gyur zhing bshang ba la sogs pa dri nga ba rnams
translated: Later, by the power of being accustomed to that, the pledge substances will arise and by the power of the pledge substances, things that are not to be eaten, such as poison, will be eaten and feces and so on, which are foul smelling, will be

original: dri zhim por 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: dri zhim por 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: fragrant.

original: tshig 'di ni mchog tu 'gal te dang por re zhig me la rab tu 'jug par bya zhing phyi nas goms pa'i dbang gis me rengs par byed par 'gyur ram ci de ltar yang ma yin no //
analyzed: tshig 'di ni mchog tu 'gal te dang por re zhig me la rab tu 'jug par bya zhing phyi nas goms pa'i dbang gis me rengs par byed par 'gyur ram ci de ltar yang ma yin no //
translated: This statement is most contradictory. First, one should enter the fire, and then later, by the power of practice, one will be able to stop the fire? That is not so.

original: 'dir gal te gdug pa chen po pha rol slu bar byed pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i bstan pa la co 'dri ba dam tshig chen po 'dral bar byed pa mnar med pa'i dmyal bar 'gro ba ma dag pa'i sems dang ldan pa rnams kyi sems rnam par dag
analyzed: 'dir gal te gdug pa chen po pha rol slu bar byed pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i bstan pa la co 'dri ba dam tshig chen po 'dral bar byed pa mnar med pa'i dmyal bar 'gro ba ma dag pa'i sems dang ldan pa rnams kyi sems rnam par dag
translated: Here, if the minds of those with impure minds, who are great evildoers, who deceive others, who mock the teachings of the Omniscient One, who break the great commitments, who are going to the Avīci hell, are purified,

original: pa yin na de'i tshe de rnams rnal 'byor pa'i bya ba ci'i phyir mi byed /
analyzed: pa yin na de'i tshe de rnams rnal 'byor pa'i bya ba ci'i phyir mi byed /
translated: then at that time, why would they not perform the actions of a yogin?

original: 'dir rnam par dag pa'i sems kyis rnal 'byor pa ni me la rab tu 'jug ste mes 'tshig par mi 'gyur ro //🔽glang po che'i @238a * //
analyzed: 'dir rnam par dag pa'i sems kyis rnal 'byor pa ni me la rab tu 'jug ste mes 'tshig par mi 'gyur ro // glang po che'i @238a * //
translated: Here, the yogin with a purified mind enters the fire, and is not burned by the fire.

original: dbang po myos pa rengs par byed de glang po che'i dbang po myos pas gsod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang po myos pa rengs par byed de glang po che'i dbang po myos pas gsod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: He stops the maddened lord of elephants, and is not killed by the maddened lord of elephants.

original: seng ge dang stag la sogs pa la zhon par byed de seng ge dang stag la sogs pas rnam par 'joms par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: seng ge dang stag la sogs pa la zhon par byed de seng ge dang stag la sogs pas rnam par 'joms par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: He mounts lions, tigers, and so on, and is not harmed by lions, tigers, and so on.

original: bya rog gis btung bar bya ba'i klung du rab tu 'jug ste klung gi rgyun gyis 'khyer bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bya rog gis btung bar bya ba'i klung du rab tu 'jug ste klung gi rgyun gyis 'khyer bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: He enters a river that crows drink from, and is not carried away by the current.

original: dug za bar byed de dug gis brgyal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dug za bar byed de dug gis brgyal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: He eats poison, and is not poisoned.

original: ral gri la sogs pa'i mtshon cha rnams bza' bar byed de mtshon cha rnams kyis kha la gcod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ral gri la sogs pa'i mtshon cha rnams bza' bar byed de mtshon cha rnams kyis kha la gcod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: He eats swords and so on, and his mouth is not cut.

original: de bzhin du bza' bar bya ba dang bza' bar bya ba ma yin pa byed cing rang dang gzhan gyi gzugs yongs su sgyur par byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du bza' bar bya ba dang bza' bar bya ba ma yin pa byed cing rang dang gzhan gyi gzugs yongs su sgyur par byed do //
translated: In the same way, he does what should and should not be done, and transforms his own and others’ bodies.

original: rnal 'byor pa'i bya ba de lta bu rnam pa du ma rnams te las dang po pas byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa'i bya ba de lta bu rnam pa du ma rnams te las dang po pas byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Such are the yogi’s many activities, but a beginner cannot do them.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi rnam par gzhag pa rnam pa bcu gsungs te sems dang po bskyed pa'i rnal 'byor pa dang phyi nas byis par gyur pa dang gzhon nur gyur pa dang las dang po pa dang rnal 'byor spyod pa'i skye bar skyes
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi rnam par gzhag pa rnam pa bcu gsungs te sems dang po bskyed pa'i rnal 'byor pa dang phyi nas byis par gyur pa dang gzhon nur gyur pa dang las dang po pa dang rnal 'byor spyod pa'i skye bar skyes
translated: The Bhagavat has taught that there are thirteen types of yogis: the yogi who has first generated the Thought, the yogi who is a beginner, the yogi who is an old hand, the yogi who is a novice, the yogi who is a beginner, the yogi who is born in the family of yogis,

original: pa dang sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa dang bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa dang phyir mi ldog pa dang dbang bskur ba thob pa dang skye ba gcig gis thogs pa'o //
analyzed: pa dang sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa dang bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa dang phyir mi ldog pa dang dbang bskur ba thob pa dang skye ba gcig gis thogs pa'o //
translated: the yogi who is endowed with application, the yogi who is endowed with intention, the yogi who is irreversible, the yogi who has received consecration, and the yogi who is impeded by one life.

original: de nas byang chub sems pa'i dbang bcur 'gyur te tshe la dbang ba dang las la dbang ba dang yo byad la dbang ba dang mos pa la dbang ba dang smon lam la dbang ba dang chos la dbang ba dang sems la dbang ba dang /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems pa'i dbang bcur 'gyur te tshe la dbang ba dang las la dbang ba dang yo byad la dbang ba dang mos pa la dbang ba dang smon lam la dbang ba dang chos la dbang ba dang sems la dbang ba dang /
translated: Then there are ten masteries of the Bodhisattva: mastery of life, mastery of action, mastery of equipment, mastery of aspiration, mastery of vows, mastery of Dharma, mastery of mind,

original: skye ba la dbang ba dang rdzu 'phrul la dbang ba dang ye shes la dbang pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba la dbang ba dang rdzu 'phrul la dbang ba dang ye shes la dbang pa'o //
translated: mastery of birth, mastery of miracles, and mastery of intuition.

original: de bzhin du sa bcu rnams te rab tu dga' ba dang dri ma med pa dang 'od byed pa dang 'od 'phro ba dang sbyang dka' ba dang mngon du gyur pa dang ring du song ba dang mi g-yo ga dang legs pa'i blo gros dang chos kyi sprin
analyzed: de bzhin du sa bcu rnams te rab tu dga' ba dang dri ma med pa dang 'od byed pa dang 'od 'phro ba dang sbyang dka' ba dang mngon du gyur pa dang ring du song ba dang mi g-yo ga dang legs pa'i blo gros dang chos kyi sprin
translated: Likewise, the ten stages: the Joyous, the Stainless, the Shining, the Blazing, the Difficult to Master, the Manifested, the Gone Afar, the Immovable, the Excellent Intelligence, and the Cloud of Dharma.

original: no ; ; de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa bcu yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: no ; ; de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa bcu yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
translated: Likewise, the ten perfections are completed:

original: sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang bzod pa dang brtson 'grus dang bsam gtan dang shes rab dang thabs dang smon lam dang stobs dang ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang bzod pa dang brtson 'grus dang bsam gtan dang shes rab dang thabs dang smon lam dang stobs dang ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: generosity, morality, patience, effort, meditation, wisdom, means, aspiration, power, and gnosis.

original: de ltar rnal 'byor pa byang chub @238b sems dpar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar rnal 'byor pa byang chub @238b sems dpar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the yogi becomes a bodhisattva.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i bstod pa las tshigs su bcad pa gsum pa dang bzhi pa dag gis gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i bstod pa las tshigs su bcad pa gsum pa dang bzhi pa dag gis gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
translated: The Bhagavat has said in the Praise of the Dharmadhatu of the Mahayana Sutralankara, in the third and fourth verses:

original: pha rol phyin bcu thob pa ste //
analyzed: pha rol phyin bcu thob pa ste //
translated: He has attained the ten perfections.

original: pha rol phyin pa bcu la gnas //🔽pha rol phyin bcu dag pa ste //
analyzed: pha rol phyin pa bcu la gnas // pha rol phyin bcu dag pa ste //
translated: He abides in the ten perfections.🔽He is pure in the ten perfections.

original: pha rol phyin pa bcu yi tshul //
analyzed: pha rol phyin pa bcu yi tshul //
translated: He is the way of the ten perfections.

original: mgon po sa bcu'i dbang phyug ste //
analyzed: mgon po sa bcu'i dbang phyug ste //
translated: He is the lord of the ten grounds, the protector.

original: sa bcu la ni gnas pa po //
analyzed: sa bcu la ni gnas pa po //
translated: He is the one who abides on the ten grounds.

original: shes bcu rnam dag bdag nyid can //
analyzed: shes bcu rnam dag bdag nyid can //
translated: He is the one with the nature of the ten pure knowledges.

original: shes bcu rnam dag 'chang ba po zhes pa ste //
analyzed: shes bcu rnam dag 'chang ba po zhes pa ste //
translated: He is the one who bears the ten pure knowledges.

original: de'i phyir rnal 'byor pa sems rnam par dag pa ni byang chub sems dpar bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnal 'byor pa sems rnam par dag pa ni byang chub sems dpar bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the Blessed One has said that the yogi whose mind is pure is a bodhisattva.

original: 'dir sngags kyi theg pa la 'ga' zhig gis dpa' bo'i rim pa'am rang byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pas mtshan mo dur khrod chen po'i sa la rab tu zhugs te lo gcig gam lo gnyis sam lo bcu gnyis kyi mthar thug par sngags bzlas pa dang sbyin sreg
analyzed: 'dir sngags kyi theg pa la 'ga' zhig gis dpa' bo'i rim pa'am rang byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pas mtshan mo dur khrod chen po'i sa la rab tu zhugs te lo gcig gam lo gnyis sam lo bcu gnyis kyi mthar thug par sngags bzlas pa dang sbyin sreg
translated: Here, in the Mantra Vehicle, some, by the stage of the hero or the stage of self-consecration, enter at night into the ground of the great charnel ground and recite the mantra and perform the fire offering until the end of one year, two years, or twelve years.

original: dang bsam gtan gyi stobs kyis bcom ldan 'das he ru ka dang de bzhin du ri bo dang skyed mos tshal dang chu klung gi mdo dang rgya mtsho'i 'gram la sogs pa skye bo med pa'i gnas rnams su rang dang gzhan gyi don gyi slad du kun du
analyzed: dang bsam gtan gyi stobs kyis bcom ldan 'das he ru ka dang de bzhin du ri bo dang skyed mos tshal dang chu klung gi mdo dang rgya mtsho'i 'gram la sogs pa skye bo med pa'i gnas rnams su rang dang gzhan gyi don gyi slad du kun du
translated: others.🔽Those who are unable to summon the gods in person due to their weak🔽endeavors should perform the recitation of the mantra, fire-offering, torma🔽offering, meditative concentration, and the meditation of the maṇḍala🔽assembly and so forth in their own homes, the place for accomplishing

original: bzang po la sogs pa'i lha mngon sum du bya bar ma nus pa brtson 'grus dman par gyur pa rnams dang las sgrub pa'i yul la rang gi khyim du sngags kyi bzlas pa dang sbyin sreg dang gtor ma dang bsam gtan dang dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo la🔽sogs pa bsgom pa byas nas /
analyzed: bzang po la sogs pa'i lha mngon sum du bya bar ma nus pa brtson 'grus dman par gyur pa rnams dang las sgrub pa'i yul la rang gi khyim du sngags kyi bzlas pa dang sbyin sreg dang gtor ma dang bsam gtan dang dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo la🔽sogs pa bsgom pa byas nas /
translated: the activities.

original: gnas dang dus ma yin pa'i dbang gis sngags kyi lha ma grub cing sems chags pa dang bral ba rnams dang de bzhin du rnam par dag pa'i phyag rgya chen po sgom pa'i lam nyams pa rnams te bla ma dam pa'i man ngag dang bral zhing chad pa
analyzed: gnas dang dus ma yin pa'i dbang gis sngags kyi lha ma grub cing sems chags pa dang bral ba rnams dang de bzhin du rnam par dag pa'i phyag rgya chen po sgom pa'i lam nyams pa rnams te bla ma dam pa'i man ngag dang bral zhing chad pa
translated: Due to the influence of place and time, those who have not accomplished the deity of mantra and are devoid of passion, and likewise those who have lapsed from the path of meditation on the pure great seal, who are devoid of the instructions of a holy guru and have fallen into a great schism,

original: chen por lhung bar gyur pa'i gdug pa'i bla ma rnams kyis byis pa'i blo can zab cing rgya che ba'i chos yongs su brtag pa mi byed pa rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston par 'gyur pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: chen por lhung bar gyur pa'i gdug pa'i bla ma rnams kyis byis pa'i blo can zab cing rgya che ba'i chos yongs su brtag pa mi byed pa rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston par 'gyur pa 'di lta ste /
translated: those evil gurus will teach the perfection of wisdom to those of childish understanding who do not examine the profound and vast Dharma.

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las gsungs pa chos thams cad rnam par rtog pa med pa dang / chos thams cad stong pa dang chos thams @239a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las gsungs pa chos thams cad rnam par rtog pa med pa dang / chos thams cad stong pa dang chos thams @239a * //
translated: Thus, the Bhagavān, the Tathāgata, has taught in the perfection of wisdom that all phenomena are nonconceptual, all phenomena are empty, and all phenomena are signless.

original: cad mtshan ma med pa dang chos thams cad smon pa med pa dang chos thams cad 'dus byas pa dang bral ba dang chos thams cad skye ba dang bral ba dang chos thams cad 'gyur pa med pa dang chos thams cad rgyus stong pa dang chos thams cad
analyzed: cad mtshan ma med pa dang chos thams cad smon pa med pa dang chos thams cad 'dus byas pa dang bral ba dang chos thams cad skye ba dang bral ba dang chos thams cad 'gyur pa med pa dang chos thams cad rgyus stong pa dang chos thams cad
translated: all phenomena are beyond conceptual elaboration, all phenomena are beyond characteristics, all phenomena are beyond aspiration, all phenomena are beyond conditionedness, all phenomena are beyond arising, all phenomena are beyond change, all phenomena are empty of causes, all phenomena are empty of results, all phenomena are empty of inherent nature, and all phenomena are empty of defining attributes.🔽

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
translated: all phenomena are signless, all phenomena are wishless, all phenomena are free from being conditioned, all phenomena are free from arising, all phenomena are unchanging, all phenomena are empty of causes, all phenomena are inconceivable.

original: de'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa'i 'bras bu thob pa'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos thams cad la ltos pa med par bsgom par bya ste gzugs la gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa'i 'bras bu thob pa'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos thams cad la ltos pa med par bsgom par bya ste gzugs la gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, in order to attain the result of omniscience, the bodhisattva mahāsattva should meditate on all phenomena without regard, without abiding in form,

original: tshor ba la ma yin 'du shes lam yin 'du byed rnams la ma yin rnam par shes pa la ma yin no //
analyzed: tshor ba la ma yin 'du shes lam yin 'du byed rnams la ma yin rnam par shes pa la ma yin no //
translated: not in feeling, not in perception, not in volitional factors, and not in consciousness.

original: sa'i khams la gnas par mi bya'o chu'i khams la gnas par mi bya'o me'i khams la ma yin rlung gi khams la ma yin stong pa'i khams la ma yin no //
analyzed: sa'i khams la gnas par mi bya'o chu'i khams la gnas par mi bya'o me'i khams la ma yin rlung gi khams la ma yin stong pa'i khams la ma yin no //
translated: He should not abide in the earth element, not in the water element, not in the fire element, not in the wind element, and not in the space element.

original: mig gi khams la gnas par mi bya'o //🔽gzugs kyi khams la ma yin mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams la ma yin rna ba'i khams la ma yin sgra'i khams la ma yin rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i khams la ma yin sna'i khams la ma yin dri'i khams la ma yin sna'i rnam par shes
analyzed: mig gi khams la gnas par mi bya'o // gzugs kyi khams la ma yin mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams la ma yin rna ba'i khams la ma yin sgra'i khams la ma yin rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i khams la ma yin sna'i khams la ma yin dri'i khams la ma yin sna'i rnam par shes
translated: One should not dwell on the eye constituent.

original: pa'i khams la ma yin lce'i khams la ma yin ro'i khams la ma yin lce'i rnam par shes pa'i khams la ma yin lus kyi khams la ma yin reg bya'i khams la ma yin lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams la ma yin yid kyi khams la ma
analyzed: pa'i khams la ma yin lce'i khams la ma yin ro'i khams la ma yin lce'i rnam par shes pa'i khams la ma yin lus kyi khams la ma yin reg bya'i khams la ma yin lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams la ma yin yid kyi khams la ma
translated: One should not dwell on the form constituent, on the eye consciousness constituent, on the ear constituent, on the sound constituent, on the ear consciousness constituent, on the nose constituent, on the smell constituent, on the nose consciousness constituent, on the tongue constituent, on the taste constituent, on the tongue consciousness constituent, on the body constituent, on the tangible constituent, on the body consciousness constituent, on the thinking-mind constituent,🔽on the dharma constituent, or on the thinking-mind consciousness constituent.

original: yin chos kyi khams la ma yin no yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams la gnas par mi bya'o zhes pa ste de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes rnam par bsam pa med pa ni yang dag par rdzogs
analyzed: yin chos kyi khams la ma yin no yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams la gnas par mi bya'o zhes pa ste de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes rnam par bsam pa med pa ni yang dag par rdzogs
translated: In this way, the inconceivable wisdom of the tathāgatas in the perfection of wisdom is perfectly complete and fully complete.

original: pa'i sangs rgyas nyid thob pa'i slad du bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: pa'i sangs rgyas nyid thob pa'i slad du bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
translated: The Lord has taught this in order to attain the very enlightenment of the Buddhas.

original: bsam pa ni ma yin te gang gi phyir chags pa dang chags bral gyi rang bzhin gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam pa ni ma yin te gang gi phyir chags pa dang chags bral gyi rang bzhin gyi phyir ro //
translated: It is not the intention, because of the nature of attachment and non-attachment.

original: 'dir gang gi tshe sems can rnams kyi bsam pa rab tu 'jug pa de'i tshe mchog tu 'dod pa'i dngos po rnams la chags pa dang mi 'dod pa'i dngos po rnams la chags pa dang bral bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dir gang gi tshe sems can rnams kyi bsam pa rab tu 'jug pa de'i tshe mchog tu 'dod pa'i dngos po rnams la chags pa dang mi 'dod pa'i dngos po rnams la chags pa dang bral bar 'gyur te /
translated: Here, when the intention of beings is engaged, then there is attachment to things that are most desired and non-attachment to things that are not desired.

original: de dag gis 'khor ba'o //
analyzed: de dag gis 'khor ba'o //
translated: By those, there is samsara.

original: @239b gang gi tshe bsam pa med pa rab tu 'jug pa de'i tshe ni 'dod pa'i dngos po rnams la chags pa med cing mi 'dod pa'i dngos po rnams la chags pa dang bral ba med de de ltar chags pa dang chags bral med do //
analyzed: @239b gang gi tshe bsam pa med pa rab tu 'jug pa de'i tshe ni 'dod pa'i dngos po rnams la chags pa med cing mi 'dod pa'i dngos po rnams la chags pa dang bral ba med de de ltar chags pa dang chags bral med do //
translated: When the intention is not engaged, then there is no attachment to desired things and no non-attachment to undesired things. Thus, there is neither attachment nor non-attachment.

original: de dag med pa'i phyir 'khor ba med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de dag med pa'i phyir 'khor ba med pa nyid do //
translated: Because of their non-existence, there is no samsara.

original: 'khor ba med pa'i phyir yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'khor ba med pa'i phyir yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Because samsara does not exist, there is perfect complete buddhahood.

original: de'i phyir sangs rgyas nyid sgrub pa la bsam pa med pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes yin gyi gzhan rnam par rtog pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir sangs rgyas nyid sgrub pa la bsam pa med pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes yin gyi gzhan rnam par rtog pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the absence of thought in the attainment of buddhahood is the wisdom of the Tathagata, not the conceptual meditative stabilization of others.

original: de ltar rab tu mi mkhas pa bsam pa med pa ye shes su 'dod pa chad pa chen por lhung ba 'ga' zhig smra bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar rab tu mi mkhas pa bsam pa med pa ye shes su 'dod pa chad pa chen por lhung ba 'ga' zhig smra bar 'gyur te /
translated: In this way, some who are not skilled in this, who assert the absence of thought to be wisdom, fall into the great nihilism and speak in this way.

original: de'i phyir brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, we will explain.

original: 'dir gal te /
analyzed: 'dir gal te /
translated: Here, if

original: bsam pa'i shes pa med pas sangs rgyas nyid ster bar byed pa yin na de'i tshe sems can thams cad sangs rgyas su ci'i phyir ma gyur 'di rnams kyi yang gnyid mthug po la bsam pa'i shes pa med pa rab tu 'jug cing 'dod pa'i dngos po rnams
analyzed: bsam pa'i shes pa med pas sangs rgyas nyid ster bar byed pa yin na de'i tshe sems can thams cad sangs rgyas su ci'i phyir ma gyur 'di rnams kyi yang gnyid mthug po la bsam pa'i shes pa med pa rab tu 'jug cing 'dod pa'i dngos po rnams
translated: buddhahood were to be granted by the absence of the consciousness of thought, then why would all sentient beings not become buddhas? For them, too, the absence of the consciousness of thought occurs in deep sleep, and they desire things.

original: la chags pa med la mi 'dod pa'i dngos po rnams la chags pa dang bral ba med de de'i phyir shin tu gnyid log pa'i gnas skabs de la chags pa dang chags bral dag tu mi 'gyur pa de bas na bsam pa'i shes pa med pa des sems
analyzed: la chags pa med la mi 'dod pa'i dngos po rnams la chags pa dang bral ba med de de'i phyir shin tu gnyid log pa'i gnas skabs de la chags pa dang chags bral dag tu mi 'gyur pa de bas na bsam pa'i shes pa med pa des sems
translated: But there is no attachment to what is not desired, and no freedom from attachment to what is desired. Therefore, in that state of deep sleep, there is neither attachment nor freedom from attachment.

original: can thams cad yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su 'gyur pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: can thams cad yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su 'gyur pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Thus, because of the absence of the consciousness of thought, sentient beings do not become perfectly enlightened.🔽Therefore, the absence of the consciousness of thought is not the wisdom of the Tathagata.

original: de'i phyir bsam pa'i shes pa med pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes su mi 'gyur te gang gi phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi le'u las ting nge 'dzin rnams bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bsam pa'i shes pa med pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes su mi 'gyur te gang gi phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi le'u las ting nge 'dzin rnams bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs te /
translated: In the chapter on the concentration of the perfection of wisdom, the Blessed One taught the concentrations:

original: de la rin chen sgron ma zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin to zhes so //
analyzed: de la rin chen sgron ma zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin to zhes so //
translated: Among them, the concentration called Jewel Light.

original: 'dir gal te rin chen sgron ma bsam pa'am rab tu snang ba med pa yin na /
analyzed: 'dir gal te rin chen sgron ma bsam pa'am rab tu snang ba med pa yin na /
translated: Here, if the Jewel Light is without thought or appearance,

original: de'i tshe rin chen sgron ma zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin du ci ltar 'gyur de bzhin du ting nge 'dzin gzhan rnams kyang bsam pa med par mi 'gyur te rang rig pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir dang bems po'i stong pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽ci ste byis pa rnams kyi tshig 'di ni gal te de @240a * //
analyzed: de'i tshe rin chen sgron ma zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin du ci ltar 'gyur de bzhin du ting nge 'dzin gzhan rnams kyang bsam pa med par mi 'gyur te rang rig pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir dang bems po'i stong pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro // ci ste byis pa rnams kyi tshig 'di ni gal te de @240a * //
translated: In the same way, the other meditative stabilizations are not non-existent, because they have the character of reflexive awareness and are not the emptiness of matter.

original: bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes rang rig pa yin na de'i tshe ci ltar chos thams cad rang bzhin med par de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs she na /
analyzed: bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes rang rig pa yin na de'i tshe ci ltar chos thams cad rang bzhin med par de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs she na /
translated: If the words of the childish are as follows: “If the Tathāgata’s wisdom is reflexive awareness, then how is it that the Tathāgata taught that all phenomena are essenceless?”

original: 'di la brjod par bya ste 'dir de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes ni chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin med pa nyid rtogs par byed pa zhes bya ba ste dngos po thams cad med pa'i mtshan nyid shin tu gnyid log pa'i sems ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di la brjod par bya ste 'dir de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes ni chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin med pa nyid rtogs par byed pa zhes bya ba ste dngos po thams cad med pa'i mtshan nyid shin tu gnyid log pa'i sems ni ma yin no //
translated: Here we say this: The Tathāgata’s wisdom is that which causes the realization of the essencelessness of all phenomena. It is not the mind of a deep sleep that has the character of the nonexistence of all things.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las gsungs pa yang sems gang zhig yod pa'i sems de ni sems ma yin no zhes pa ste sems ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las gsungs pa yang sems gang zhig yod pa'i sems de ni sems ma yin no zhes pa ste sems ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The Perfection of Wisdom says, “The mind that exists is not the mind.” The mind is said to be naturally luminous.

original: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes rang rig par mi 'gyur na de'i tshe sems can gyi bsam pa'i dbang gis de bzhin gshegs pa chos ston par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes rang rig par mi 'gyur na de'i tshe sems can gyi bsam pa'i dbang gis de bzhin gshegs pa chos ston par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If the wisdom of the Tathāgata were not reflexive awareness, then the Tathāgata would not teach the Dharma in accordance with the mental dispositions of sentient beings.

original: chos thams cad rab tu rtogs pa dang yang dag par rig pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad rab tu rtogs pa dang yang dag par rig pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: This is because he would not have realized and directly perceived all phenomena.

original: ci ste dbang po'i sgo nas rang rig pa yin na de'i tshe cha med pa dang kun du 'gro ba dang thams cad la khyab bar mi 'gyur te thams cad sgrib pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci ste dbang po'i sgo nas rang rig pa yin na de'i tshe cha med pa dang kun du 'gro ba dang thams cad la khyab bar mi 'gyur te thams cad sgrib pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But if it were reflexive awareness in the sense of being a sense faculty, then it would not be partless, all-pervading, and omnipresent, because it would be obstructed in all places.

original: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes ni rang rig pa chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin mkhyen pa rnam par mi rtog cing dbang po med pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes ni rang rig pa chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin mkhyen pa rnam par mi rtog cing dbang po med pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the wisdom of the tathagatas is self knowing, nonconceptual and without sense organs, it is the knowledge of the nature of all phenomena.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i so sor kun du rtog pa'i ye shes kyi bstod pa las tshigs su bcad pa nyi shu pa la sogs pa gsum gyis gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i so sor kun du rtog pa'i ye shes kyi bstod pa las tshigs su bcad pa nyi shu pa la sogs pa gsum gyis gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
translated: The Bhagavat praised the wisdom of discernment in the Twenty Verses and so on of the Praise of the Names of Manjushri:

original: mya ngan 'das zhi legs par ni //🔽myang 'das mya ngan 'das mthar son //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das zhi legs par ni // myang 'das mya ngan 'das mthar son //
translated: Nirvana is peace, excellent,🔽Nirvana is the end of sorrow,

original: bde sdug sel ba mthar gyur pa //
analyzed: bde sdug sel ba mthar gyur pa //
translated: The end of suffering, the end of birth,

original: chags bral lus las 'das pa po //
analyzed: chags bral lus las 'das pa po //
translated: The end of craving, the end of the body.

original: thub pa med pa dpe med pa //
analyzed: thub pa med pa dpe med pa //
translated: The Sage is without compare,

original: mi mngon mi snang gsal byed min //
analyzed: mi mngon mi snang gsal byed min //
translated: Without appearance, not manifest, not illuminating,

original: cha med kun 'gro khyab pa po //
analyzed: cha med kun 'gro khyab pa po //
translated: Partless, omnipresent, pervasive,

original: phra zhing zag med sa bon bral //🔽rdul med rdul bral dri ma med //
analyzed: phra zhing zag med sa bon bral // rdul med rdul bral dri ma med //
translated: Subtle, without taint, free from seeds.🔽Without dust, free from dust, stainless,

original: nyes pa spangs pa skyon med pa //
analyzed: nyes pa spangs pa skyon med pa //
translated: Free from faults, without faults,

original: shin tu sad pa'i bdag / kun shes kun rig dam pa po zhes pa dang de bzhin du bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes kyi bstod pa las tshigs su bcad pa bcu gsum pas gsungs pa 'di @240b lta ste /
analyzed: shin tu sad pa'i bdag / kun shes kun rig dam pa po zhes pa dang de bzhin du bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes kyi bstod pa las tshigs su bcad pa bcu gsum pas gsungs pa 'di @240b lta ste /
translated: The praise of the wisdom of activity also says in the thirteenth verse:

original: bdag rig gzhan rig thams cad pa //
analyzed: bdag rig gzhan rig thams cad pa //
translated: The self-cognizant, the cognizant of others, the all-cognizant,🔽The supreme person who benefits all,

original: kun la phan pa'i gang zag mchog / dper bya kun las 'das pa ste //
analyzed: kun la phan pa'i gang zag mchog / dper bya kun las 'das pa ste //
translated: Beyond all examples,🔽The supreme lord of cognition and the cognized.

original: shes dang shes bya'i bdag po mchog ces pa dang / rgyud kyi rgyal po'i le'u lnga pa las kyang tshigs su bcad pa dgu bcu rtsa dgu pas gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: shes dang shes bya'i bdag po mchog ces pa dang / rgyud kyi rgyal po'i le'u lnga pa las kyang tshigs su bcad pa dgu bcu rtsa dgu pas gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
translated: And the fifty-first chapter of the King of Tantras also says in the ninety-ninth verse:

original: rgyal ba'i sku yi rdo rje yul dang yul can rnams kyi bgrod bya min pa rnam pa thams cad pa //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i sku yi rdo rje yul dang yul can rnams kyi bgrod bya min pa rnam pa thams cad pa //
translated: The vajra body of the Victorious Ones, the object and subject, is not to be traversed in any way.

original: gsung gi rdo rje sems can thams cad rang snying skad rnams dag gis chos ni go bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: gsung gi rdo rje sems can thams cad rang snying skad rnams dag gis chos ni go bar byed pa'o //
translated: The vajra speech of the Victorious Ones, the sounds of the hearts of all sentient beings, causes understanding of the Dharma.

original: rdo rje can gyi thugs kyi rdo rje sems can rnams kyi sems kyi rang bzhin mtha' dag sa la gnas //
analyzed: rdo rje can gyi thugs kyi rdo rje sems can rnams kyi sems kyi rang bzhin mtha' dag sa la gnas //
translated: The vajra of the mind of the vajra-holder is the nature of the mind of all sentient beings.

original: dri med nor bu lta bu dngos po rnams kyi 'dzin byed gang yin de nyid ye shes rdo rje'o zhes pa ste /
analyzed: dri med nor bu lta bu dngos po rnams kyi 'dzin byed gang yin de nyid ye shes rdo rje'o zhes pa ste /
translated: That which is the apprehender of things, stainless like a jewel, is the vajra of wisdom.

original: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes ni dbang po med cing rang rig pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes ni dbang po med cing rang rig pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the wisdom of the Tathāgata is without sense faculties and is reflexive awareness.

original: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes rang rig pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes rang rig pa yin na /
translated: If the wisdom of the Tathāgata is reflexive awareness,

original: 'o na de'i tshe phung po dang khams dang skye mched med pa las srid pa ma yin te bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyud kyi rgyal po rnams las gsungs pa phung po med pa las shes rab ye shes nye bar dmigs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na de'i tshe phung po dang khams dang skye mched med pa las srid pa ma yin te bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyud kyi rgyal po rnams las gsungs pa phung po med pa las shes rab ye shes nye bar dmigs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: then at that time, since there are no aggregates, elements, or sense bases, existence is not possible. The Bhagavān has said in the King of Tantras: “Without the aggregates, the wisdom of insight is not perceived.”

original: dbang po gnyis kyi sbyor ba las byang chub kyi sems 'byung ba'i dus su khyad par dga' ba dang lhan cig skyes pa dag gi dbus su thig le gsum gyi mthar skad cig gcig tsam du kun du bzang po bde ba chen po'i ye shes te 'di nyid
analyzed: dbang po gnyis kyi sbyor ba las byang chub kyi sems 'byung ba'i dus su khyad par dga' ba dang lhan cig skyes pa dag gi dbus su thig le gsum gyi mthar skad cig gcig tsam du kun du bzang po bde ba chen po'i ye shes te 'di nyid
translated: At the time of the arising of the bodhicitta through the union of the two organs, in the middle of the special bliss and the connate, the bindu is at the end of the three, and for just one instant, it is the gnosis of the great bliss of Samantabhadra.

original: ni rang rig par gsungs so //🔽'dir byang chub kyi sems kyi thig le 'byung ba mya ngan 'das pa dang bral ba dbang po med pa kun du bzang po bde ba chen po'i ye shes su ci ltar 'gyur nam mkha'i me tog la mo sham gyi bu yis dri bsnams pa bzhin du rnam
analyzed: ni rang rig par gsungs so // 'dir byang chub kyi sems kyi thig le 'byung ba mya ngan 'das pa dang bral ba dbang po med pa kun du bzang po bde ba chen po'i ye shes su ci ltar 'gyur nam mkha'i me tog la mo sham gyi bu yis dri bsnams pa bzhin du rnam
translated: This is said to be one’s vidyā.🔽Here, some may think, “How can the bindu of bodhicitta that arises and is free from nirvāṇa, which is devoid of organs, become the gnosis of the great bliss of Samantabhadra?

original: par dpyad na don med pa can no zhes pa 'dir 'ga' zhig dag gi bsam pa 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: par dpyad na don med pa can no zhes pa 'dir 'ga' zhig dag gi bsam pa 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: When analyzed, it is meaningless, like the smell of a flower in the sky being smelled by the son of a barren woman.”

original: de'i phyir brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it will be explained.

original: byang chub sems kyi thig le 'gyur pa'i bde ba kun du bzang po'i bde ba chen po shes rab ye shes su de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa 'di ni de ltar ma yin te gang gi phyir bzhi pa de yang de bzhin no zhes pa'i @241a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems kyi thig le 'gyur pa'i bde ba kun du bzang po'i bde ba chen po shes rab ye shes su de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa 'di ni de ltar ma yin te gang gi phyir bzhi pa de yang de bzhin no zhes pa'i @241a * //
translated: The bindu of bodhicitta, the bliss of transformation, is the great bliss of Samantabhadra, the gnosis of wisdom. The Tathāgata taught that. This is not so. Because the fourth is also like that.

original: dgag pa gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgag pa gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is the refutation.

original: 'dir gal te gsum pa 'gyur pa'i bde ba shes rab ye shes kun du bzang po bde ba chen po bzhi pa yin na de'i tshe mngon par brjod zin pa mngon par brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir gal te gsum pa 'gyur pa'i bde ba shes rab ye shes kun du bzang po bde ba chen po bzhi pa yin na de'i tshe mngon par brjod zin pa mngon par brjod par 'gyur ro //
