translated: Here, if the bliss of transformation of the third is the great bliss of Samantabhadra, the gnosis of wisdom, the fourth, then at that time what has already been stated would be stated again.

original: de ltar yang rigs pa ma yin te gang gi phyir zlos pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar yang rigs pa ma yin te gang gi phyir zlos pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is not logical, because the fault of repetition would ensue.

original: ji ltar lag pa zhes brjod pa'i rjes la slar yang lag pa zhes pa dang de bzhin du slar yang zho zhes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar lag pa zhes brjod pa'i rjes la slar yang lag pa zhes pa dang de bzhin du slar yang zho zhes pa bzhin no //
translated: Just as after “hand” is stated again “hand” is stated, and likewise again “curds” is stated.

original: 'di ni byis pa dang smyon pa'i tshig ste mkhas pa rnams kyi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni byis pa dang smyon pa'i tshig ste mkhas pa rnams kyi ni ma yin no //
translated: This is the speech of fools and lunatics, not of the wise.

original: de'i phyir bzhi pa zhes gsungs pa'i phyir gsum par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir bzhi pa zhes gsungs pa'i phyir gsum par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is not the third, because it is called the fourth.

original: de yang de bzhin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir de nyid shes rab ye shes so //
analyzed: de yang de bzhin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir de nyid shes rab ye shes so //
translated: And that is just so, because it is said, “That is just so.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung 'di'i phyir ma rtogs pa nyams pa rnams ni bzhi pa de yang de bzhin no zhes pa'i sgras bcom ldan 'das kyis gsum pa gsungs te bzhi pa zhes bya bar mi 'gyur ro zhes smra ba 'di ni byis pa'i blo can dbang po
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung 'di'i phyir ma rtogs pa nyams pa rnams ni bzhi pa de yang de bzhin no zhes pa'i sgras bcom ldan 'das kyis gsum pa gsungs te bzhi pa zhes bya bar mi 'gyur ro zhes smra ba 'di ni byis pa'i blo can dbang po
translated: Those who have lost the understanding of this statement of the Lord say that the fourth is the third, because of the words, “That is just so,” and it is not the fourth.

original: gnyis las byung ba'i 'gyur pa'i bde ba la mngon par chags pa mi 'gyur pa'i bde ba chen po'i ye shes las nyams pa rnams kyi chos ma yin pa'i rab tu 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis las byung ba'i 'gyur pa'i bde ba la mngon par chags pa mi 'gyur pa'i bde ba chen po'i ye shes las nyams pa rnams kyi chos ma yin pa'i rab tu 'jug pa'o //
translated: Those who have lost the wisdom of the great bliss of non-emission, which is the bliss born of the two organs, are not of the Dharma, because of their attachment to the bliss of emission.

original: de'i phyir byang chub kyi sems 'pho ba'i bde ba ni kun du bzang po'i bde ba chen po'i ye shes bzhi par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub kyi sems 'pho ba'i bde ba ni kun du bzang po'i bde ba chen po'i ye shes bzhi par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the bliss of the emission of the thought of awakening is not the fourth, which is the wisdom of the great bliss of Samantabhadra.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes kyi bstod pa las tshigs su bcad pa gsum pas gsungs pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes kyi bstod pa las tshigs su bcad pa gsum pas gsungs pa /
translated: The Bhagavat has stated this in the third verse of the Praise in Honor of One Worthy of Honor, which is from the Ritual of the Litany of the Names of Manjushri:

original: rnam pa kun ldan rnam pa med //
analyzed: rnam pa kun ldan rnam pa med //
translated: He has all aspects, but is not an aspect.

original: bcu drug phyed phyed thig le 'chang //
analyzed: bcu drug phyed phyed thig le 'chang //
translated: He holds the drop of the half-half of the sixteen.

original: cha med cha las 'das pa ste //
analyzed: cha med cha las 'das pa ste //
translated: He is partless, beyond parts,🔽The peak of the four dhyanas.

original: bsam gtan bzhi yi rtse mo 'chad zhes pa dang / rgyud kyi rgyal po'i le'u lnga pa las kyang tshigs su bcad pa brgya nyi shu rtsa drug pas gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi yi rtse mo 'chad zhes pa dang / rgyud kyi rgyal po'i le'u lnga pa las kyang tshigs su bcad pa brgya nyi shu rtsa drug pas gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
translated: And in the fifth chapter of the King of Tantras, it is stated in the one hundred twenty-sixth verse:

original: de ltar sems ni rnam bzhi srid pa gsum la gnas pa'i srog chags rnams kyi thig le'i dbus su ste //🔽rnal 'byor dbang po rnams kyis bde mnyam 'bras ster khyab byed dag ni thar pa'i slad du bsrung bar bya //
analyzed: de ltar sems ni rnam bzhi srid pa gsum la gnas pa'i srog chags rnams kyi thig le'i dbus su ste // rnal 'byor dbang po rnams kyis bde mnyam 'bras ster khyab byed dag ni thar pa'i slad du bsrung bar bya //
translated: Thus, the mind, which is of four kinds, is in the middle of the drop of all living beings who abide in the three worlds.🔽The lords of yoga, who are the bestowers of the fruit of the bliss of equality, should protect it for the sake of liberation.

original: thig le btang na rnal 'byor @241b rnams kyi mchog gi bde ba skye ba'i sa bon song la thar pa gang //
analyzed: thig le btang na rnal 'byor @241b rnams kyi mchog gi bde ba skye ba'i sa bon song la thar pa gang //
translated: If the drop is lost, the seed of the supreme bliss of the yogis is lost, and there is no liberation.

original: de phyir 'khor ba'i bde ba'i skad cig 'di ni sngom brtson rnams kyis thams cad dus su spang bar bya zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de phyir 'khor ba'i bde ba'i skad cig 'di ni sngom brtson rnams kyis thams cad dus su spang bar bya zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the wise should always avoid this moment of samsaric pleasure.

original: de'i phyir bzhi pa ni gsum par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir bzhi pa ni gsum par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the fourth is not the third.

original: 'dir gal te thig le 'dor ba'i gsum pa shes rab ye shes de nyid bzhi pa yin na de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das bcu drug phyed phyed thig le 'chang bar mi 'gyur zhing gal te bzhi pa khyad par dga' ba yin na de'i tshe dga' ba dang mchog
analyzed: 'dir gal te thig le 'dor ba'i gsum pa shes rab ye shes de nyid bzhi pa yin na de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das bcu drug phyed phyed thig le 'chang bar mi 'gyur zhing gal te bzhi pa khyad par dga' ba yin na de'i tshe dga' ba dang mchog
translated: Here, if the third, the wisdom intuition, which is the emission of the drop, were the fourth, then the Lord would not hold the drop of the half-moon of sixteen parts.

original: dga' dang khyad par dga' ba dang lhan cig skyes pa bsam gtan bzhi pa'i rtse mo 'chang bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dga' dang khyad par dga' ba dang lhan cig skyes pa bsam gtan bzhi pa'i rtse mo 'chang bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the fourth were the special joy, then the joy, the supreme joy, the special joy, and the innate joy would not be the peak of the fourth meditation.

original: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes ni dbang po med cing rang rig pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes ni dbang po med cing rang rig pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the intuition of the Tathagata is without organ and is self-knowing.

original: de'i phyir rnal 'byor pas byang chub kyi sems shin tu brtan par bsrung bar bya ste spang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnal 'byor pas byang chub kyi sems shin tu brtan par bsrung bar bya ste spang bar mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the yogi should protect the thought of enlightenment very firmly and should not abandon it.

original: thig le gzhan byang chub kyi sems kyi thig le dang bral ba gci ba dang chu la sogs pa gang dag lus sam phyi rol la yod kyang sangs rgyas nyid kyi 'bras bu ster bar byed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thig le gzhan byang chub kyi sems kyi thig le dang bral ba gci ba dang chu la sogs pa gang dag lus sam phyi rol la yod kyang sangs rgyas nyid kyi 'bras bu ster bar byed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The bindu that is other than that, the bindu of bodhicitta, is not the bindu of feces, urine, and so on, that exist in the body or externally.

original: gal te bzhi pa shes rab ye shes gsum par mi 'gyur zhing bcom ldan 'das thig le 'chang ba yin na 'o na de'i tshe de yang de bzhin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir shes rab ye shes ci zhig 'byung bar 'gyur zhes 'dir 'ga' zhig smra bar 'gyur🔽te de'i phyir brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te bzhi pa shes rab ye shes gsum par mi 'gyur zhing bcom ldan 'das thig le 'chang ba yin na 'o na de'i tshe de yang de bzhin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir shes rab ye shes ci zhig 'byung bar 'gyur zhes 'dir 'ga' zhig smra bar 'gyur te de'i phyir brjod par bya'o //
translated: If the fourth is not the third, the gnosis of wisdom, and the Bhagavān is the bearer of the bindu, then at that time, since it is said that “it is just so,” what is the arising of the gnosis of wisdom?

original: 'dir rdo rje thig pa la 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bden pa la brten nas bcom ldan 'das kyis shes rab rnam pa gsum rab tu gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir rdo rje thig pa la 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bden pa la brten nas bcom ldan 'das kyis shes rab rnam pa gsum rab tu gsungs te /
translated: Here, some say that since the Bhagavān has said that the three wisdoms are the wisdom of the stage of generation, the wisdom of the stage of completion, and the wisdom of the stage of great completion,🔽the three wisdoms are not the gnosis of wisdom.

original: las kyi phyag rgya dang / shes rab kyi phyag rgya dang / phyag rgya chen mo zhes pa ste mngon par brjod pa gcig las so //
analyzed: las kyi phyag rgya dang / shes rab kyi phyag rgya dang / phyag rgya chen mo zhes pa ste mngon par brjod pa gcig las so //
translated: The seal of action, the seal of wisdom, and the great seal, from a single recitation.

original: de rnams las rnal 'byor pa'i las kyi phyag rgya dang ye shes kyi phyag rgya'i bde ba ni g-yo ba'i mtshan nyid can dang phyag rgya chen mo'i bde ba ni mi g-yo ba'i mtshan nyid can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rnams las rnal 'byor pa'i las kyi phyag rgya dang ye shes kyi phyag rgya'i bde ba ni g-yo ba'i mtshan nyid can dang phyag rgya chen mo'i bde ba ni mi g-yo ba'i mtshan nyid can du 'gyur ro //
translated: Among them, the bliss of the yogin’s seal of action and seal of wisdom is characterized by movement, and the bliss of the great seal is characterized by immobility.

original: 'dir gal te shes rab kyi ye shes ni shes rab ye shes te /
analyzed: 'dir gal te shes rab kyi ye shes ni shes rab ye shes te /
translated: Here, if the wisdom intuition is the intuition of wisdom,

original: 'pho ba'i mtshan nyid can shes rab kyi rgyu las skyes pa'i 'bras bu thabs kyi shes rab ye shes yin na de'i @242a * //
analyzed: 'pho ba'i mtshan nyid can shes rab kyi rgyu las skyes pa'i 'bras bu thabs kyi shes rab ye shes yin na de'i @242a * //
translated: then the result born from the cause of wisdom, which is characterized by movement, is the wisdom intuition of method.

original: tshe thabs kyi rgyu las skyes pa'i 'bras bu ni shes rab kyi thabs ye shes su 'gyur te phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub kyi don du'o //
analyzed: tshe thabs kyi rgyu las skyes pa'i 'bras bu ni shes rab kyi thabs ye shes su 'gyur te phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub kyi don du'o //
translated: At that time, the result born from the cause of method is the method intuition of wisdom, for the sake of the power of the great seal.

original: de ltar na phan tshun ltos pa nyid kyi phyir ye shes gnyis su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na phan tshun ltos pa nyid kyi phyir ye shes gnyis su 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, because of mutual dependence, there are two intuitions.

original: de ltar gnyi ga'i ye shes so sor gyur na gnyis su med pa'i ye shes med do; ;
analyzed: de ltar gnyi ga'i ye shes so sor gyur na gnyis su med pa'i ye shes med do; ;
translated: If the gnosis of both were to become separate, there would be no nondual gnosis.

original: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes med pa'i phyir sangs rgyas nyid kyang med par 'gyur te rnam par dag pa mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i ye shes dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes med pa'i phyir sangs rgyas nyid kyang med par 'gyur te rnam par dag pa mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i ye shes dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because there would be no nondual gnosis, buddhahood itself would not exist, because it would be devoid of the supreme, pure, unchanging gnosis.

original: gal te shes rab kyi ye shes ni shes rab ye shes yin na de'i tshe thabs kyi ye shes ni thabs kyi ye shes so zhes pa ste de ltar na skyon snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: gal te shes rab kyi ye shes ni shes rab ye shes yin na de'i tshe thabs kyi ye shes ni thabs kyi ye shes so zhes pa ste de ltar na skyon snga ma bzhin no //
translated: If the gnosis of wisdom were the gnosis of wisdom, and the gnosis of method were the gnosis of method, then the same error would occur.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i so sor kun tu rtog pa'i ye shes kyi bstod pa las tshigs su bcad pa sum cu rtsa drug pa la sogs pa gnyis kyis rnam par dag pa mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i ye shes gsungs pa 'di lta
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i so sor kun tu rtog pa'i ye shes kyi bstod pa las tshigs su bcad pa sum cu rtsa drug pa la sogs pa gnyis kyis rnam par dag pa mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i ye shes gsungs pa 'di lta
translated: The Bhagavān has taught the supreme, pure, unchanging gnosis in two verses beginning with the thirty-sixth verse of praise to the gnosis of discernment in the Nāmasaṃgīti, as follows:

original: ste / rdo rje rdzogs sangs rgyas pa'i gdan //
analyzed: ste / rdo rje rdzogs sangs rgyas pa'i gdan //
translated: The vajra seat of perfect buddhahood,

original: sangs rgyas brjod pa'i chos 'dzin pa //
analyzed: sangs rgyas brjod pa'i chos 'dzin pa //
translated: He is the holder of the Dharma that is taught by the Buddha.

original: dpal ldan sangs rgyas padma skyes //
analyzed: dpal ldan sangs rgyas padma skyes //
translated: He is the glorious Buddha born from a lotus.

original: kun mkhyen ye shes mdzod 'dzin pa //
analyzed: kun mkhyen ye shes mdzod 'dzin pa //
translated: He is the holder of the treasure of omniscient wisdom.

original: sgyu 'phrul sna tshogs 'chang ba'i rgyal //
analyzed: sgyu 'phrul sna tshogs 'chang ba'i rgyal //
translated: He is the king who holds the various magical powers.

original: sangs rgyas rig sngags chen po 'dzin //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rig sngags chen po 'dzin //
translated: He is the Buddha who holds the great knowledge mantra.

original: rdo rje rnon po ral gri che //
analyzed: rdo rje rnon po ral gri che //
translated: He is the sharp vajra, the great sword.

original: rnam dag 'gyur pa med pa mchog ces pa dang / rgyud kyi rgyal po las kyang sgrub thabs kyi le'u las nyis brgyar gcig gis ma tshang ba'i tshigs su bcad pa dag gis phyag rgya chen po'i mtshan nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: rnam dag 'gyur pa med pa mchog ces pa dang / rgyud kyi rgyal po las kyang sgrub thabs kyi le'u las nyis brgyar gcig gis ma tshang ba'i tshigs su bcad pa dag gis phyag rgya chen po'i mtshan nyid gsungs pa /
translated: The chapter on the sādhana in the king of tantras also teaches the characteristics of the great seal with verses that are one short of two hundred.

original: sems ni rnyog pa dang bcas las kyi phyag rgya 'di dang brtags pa'i ye shes phyag rgya spang bya ste //
analyzed: sems ni rnyog pa dang bcas las kyi phyag rgya 'di dang brtags pa'i ye shes phyag rgya spang bya ste //
translated: The mind with impurities should abandon this karmamudrā and the imagined jñānamudrā.

original: yang dag rdzogs pa'i byang chub ched du rgyal ba mchog gi bskyed ma mchog gi phyag rgya gos pa med //
analyzed: yang dag rdzogs pa'i byang chub ched du rgyal ba mchog gi bskyed ma mchog gi phyag rgya gos pa med //
translated: For the sake of perfect complete enlightenment, the supreme seal of the supreme Victor is unstained.

original: rnam par 'gyur pa med cing mkha' mnyam mun bcom khyab byed rnal 'byor dag gis bgrod bya ther zug gnas //
analyzed: rnam par 'gyur pa med cing mkha' mnyam mun bcom khyab byed rnal 'byor dag gis bgrod bya ther zug gnas //
translated: The yogis who are unchangeable, who are like space, who have destroyed darkness, and who pervade, should go to the eternal abode.

original: ye shes gzi brjid srid pa'i dri ma 'phrog cing dus kyi 'khor los rjes su rig pa bsgom par bya //
analyzed: ye shes gzi brjid srid pa'i dri ma 'phrog cing dus kyi 'khor los rjes su rig pa bsgom par bya //
translated: The yogis should meditate on the knowledge-being, who has the splendor of wisdom, who steals the stains of existence, and who is known by the wheel of time.

original: phyag rgya sgyu ma'i rjes su mthun pa yid dang nam mkha' la ni me long dag la gzugs bzhin te //
analyzed: phyag rgya sgyu ma'i rjes su mthun pa yid dang nam mkha' la ni me long dag la gzugs bzhin te //
translated: The yogis should meditate on the knowledge-being, who is like an illusion, who is in the mind and in the sky, and who is like a form in a mirror.

original: 'jig rten gsum po snang bar byed cing dri ma med glog dang mtshungs pa'i 'od zer du ma 'phro bar byed //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum po snang bar byed cing dri ma med glog dang mtshungs pa'i 'od zer du ma 'phro bar byed //
translated: The yogis should meditate on the knowledge-being, who illuminates the three worlds, who is stainless, and who radiates many light rays that are like lightning.

original: phyi dang @242b lus la dbyer med yul dang rnam par bral ba snang ba tsam ni mkha' la gnas pa yi //
analyzed: phyi dang @242b lus la dbyer med yul dang rnam par bral ba snang ba tsam ni mkha' la gnas pa yi //
translated: The yogis should meditate on the knowledge-being, who is indivisible from the external and the body, who is free from objects, who is mere appearance, who abides in space,🔽who is the mind embracing the nature of the mind, and who is single, although having the forms of many beings.

original: sems la sems kyi rang bzhin 'khyud pa gang zhig 'gro ba du ma'i gzugs can de ni gcig pu'o zhes pa dang / rtsa ba'i rgyud las kyang /
analyzed: sems la sems kyi rang bzhin 'khyud pa gang zhig 'gro ba du ma'i gzugs can de ni gcig pu'o zhes pa dang / rtsa ba'i rgyud las kyang /
translated: The Root Tantra also says:

original: las kyi phyag rgya brtags pa yi //
analyzed: las kyi phyag rgya brtags pa yi //
translated: Having examined the karmamudra,

original: ye shes phyag rgya yongs spangs nas //
analyzed: ye shes phyag rgya yongs spangs nas //
translated: and having abandoned the jnanamudra,

original: mchog tu mi 'gyur sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: mchog tu mi 'gyur sbyor ba yis //
translated: one should meditate on the great seal.

original: phyag rgya chen mo rnam par bsgom zhes pa ste bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa 'di'i phyir las kyi phyag rgya'i bde ba ni kun du bzang po mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i bde bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen mo rnam par bsgom zhes pa ste bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa 'di'i phyir las kyi phyag rgya'i bde ba ni kun du bzang po mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i bde bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of this statement of the Bhagavat, the bliss of the action seal is not the bliss of the universal good, the unchanging bliss.

original: de bzhin du dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo sgom pa rnam par brtags pa'i shes rab kyi bde ba ni kun du bzang po mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba chen por mi 'gyur te rnam par rtog pa yongs su ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo sgom pa rnam par brtags pa'i shes rab kyi bde ba ni kun du bzang po mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba chen por mi 'gyur te rnam par rtog pa yongs su ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Similarly, the bliss of the wisdom of the imagined mandala circle is not the bliss of the universal good, the great unchanging bliss, because discursive thought is not completely abandoned.

original: des na bla ma dam pa ma yin pa'i man ngag las phyag rgya chen po'i ye shes nyams pa rnams phyugs nyid du byed cing sangs rgyas nyid med de phyag rgya chen po'i ye shes med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na bla ma dam pa ma yin pa'i man ngag las phyag rgya chen po'i ye shes nyams pa rnams phyugs nyid du byed cing sangs rgyas nyid med de phyag rgya chen po'i ye shes med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, those who have lost the wisdom of the great seal through the oral instructions of a bad guru become cattle and do not have buddhahood, because they do not have the wisdom of the great seal.

original: phyag rgya chen po'i ye shes rab tu mi gnas pa ni rnal 'byor pa rnams la bla ma dam pa ma yin pa lam dang bral bas rab tu rtogs par bya bar mi nus so //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po'i ye shes rab tu mi gnas pa ni rnal 'byor pa rnams la bla ma dam pa ma yin pa lam dang bral bas rab tu rtogs par bya bar mi nus so //
translated: The pristine consciousness of mahāmudrā, which does not abide, cannot be realized by yogins and yoginīs without a holy guru, because they are devoid of the path.

original: lam yang bzhi pa de yang de bzhin no zhes pa ste de ltar dbang bzhi pa ma rtogs pa'i phyir dbang thams cad don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lam yang bzhi pa de yang de bzhin no zhes pa ste de ltar dbang bzhi pa ma rtogs pa'i phyir dbang thams cad don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: The path is also the fourth.

original: gal te kun du bzang po mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i bde ba de nyid bzhi pa phyag rgya chen po'i ye shes yin zhing phyag rgya chen po dang bral bar mi 'gyur ba de lta na 'o na dbang po gnyis kyi snyoms par 'jug pas bde ba chen
analyzed: gal te kun du bzang po mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i bde ba de nyid bzhi pa phyag rgya chen po'i ye shes yin zhing phyag rgya chen po dang bral bar mi 'gyur ba de lta na 'o na dbang po gnyis kyi snyoms par 'jug pas bde ba chen
translated: If the supreme, unchanging bliss of Samantabhadra is the pristine consciousness of mahāmudrā, and if mahāmudrā is not free, then the bliss of the union of the two organs would not be free from the four movements.🔽If that is the case, then the four empowerments would be meaningless.

original: po sgom pa bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa dang sgom pa 'dis skye ba 'di nyid la sangs rgyas nyid dang rdo rje 'dzin pa nyid du yang gsungs pa 'di ci'i don du yin zhes pa 'ga' zhig gi bsam pa 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: po sgom pa bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa dang sgom pa 'dis skye ba 'di nyid la sangs rgyas nyid dang rdo rje 'dzin pa nyid du yang gsungs pa 'di ci'i don du yin zhes pa 'ga' zhig gi bsam pa 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Some will think, “What is the meaning of the Bhagavān’s statement that buddhahood and vajra holderhood are attained in this very lifetime by this meditation?”

original: de'i phyir brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, I will explain.

original: 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyis dbang po gnyis kyi snyoms par 'jug pas bde ba chen po bsgom par gsungs pa gang yin pa de ni bden te bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyud kyi rgyal po'i le'u lnga pa las tshigs su bcad pa brgya dgu bcu rtsa dgu pas gsungs
analyzed: 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyis dbang po gnyis kyi snyoms par 'jug pas bde ba chen po bsgom par gsungs pa gang yin pa de ni bden te bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyud kyi rgyal po'i le'u lnga pa las tshigs su bcad pa brgya dgu bcu rtsa dgu pas gsungs
translated: Here, the Bhagavān taught the meditation of great bliss by the union of the two organs, and that is true. The Bhagavān taught it in the fifth chapter of the King of Tantras, in the ninety-ninth verse:

original: pa / chags pa gang gis sems can rnams ni nyams par gyur pa de yis skyob pa rnams @243a * //
analyzed: pa / chags pa gang gis sems can rnams ni nyams par gyur pa de yis skyob pa rnams @243a * //
translated: By that passion by which sentient beings are ruined, the protectors

original: ni grol ba ste //
analyzed: ni grol ba ste //
translated: are liberated.

original: sems can rnams kyis nyin zhag so so'i dus su gang zhig srung byed de ni skyob rnams ster bar mdzad //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyis nyin zhag so so'i dus su gang zhig srung byed de ni skyob rnams ster bar mdzad //
translated: That which protects sentient beings day by day is given by the protectors.

original: sems can rnams kyis rang snying la gnas bde ba gang zhig gtong byed de ni rgyal rnams srung bar mdzad //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyis rang snying la gnas bde ba gang zhig gtong byed de ni rgyal rnams srung bar mdzad //
translated: The bliss that is in the hearts of sentient beings, which they give away, is guarded by the Victors.🔽Therefore, this conduct of the supreme Victors is difficult for gods, nagas, and demigods to do.🔽Here, the attachment to transmigration by which sentient beings are impaired, that is, die, is itself, by being free from transmigration, the supreme

original: des na rgyal ba mchog gi spyod pa 'di ni lha klu lha min rnams kyis bya ba dka' bar gyur zhes pa ste 'dir 'pho ba'i chags pa gang gis sems can rnams ni nyams pa ste 'chi bar 'gyur pa de nyid 'pho ba med pa mchog tu mi
analyzed: des na rgyal ba mchog gi spyod pa 'di ni lha klu lha min rnams kyis bya ba dka' bar gyur zhes pa ste 'dir 'pho ba'i chags pa gang gis sems can rnams ni nyams pa ste 'chi bar 'gyur pa de nyid 'pho ba med pa mchog tu mi
translated: non-death.

original: 'gyur par gyur pas skyobs pa sangs rgyas rnams ni grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gyur par gyur pas skyobs pa sangs rgyas rnams ni grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The Buddhas, who are the protectors, are liberated.

original: sems can rnams ni bu dang chung ma la sogs pa gang zhig srung bar byed pa de ni skyob pa rnams kyis ster bar mdzad do //
analyzed: sems can rnams ni bu dang chung ma la sogs pa gang zhig srung bar byed pa de ni skyob pa rnams kyis ster bar mdzad do //
translated: That which sentient beings protect, namely, sons, wives, and so on, is given away by the protectors.

original: sems can rnams kyis bde ba chen po gang zhig gtong bar byed pa de ni sangs rgyas rnams kyis srung bar mdzad de rgyu des na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi rnam 'phrul gyi mdzad pa ni lha dang lha ma yin dang mi dang klu rnams kyis bya🔽ba dka'o // des na rnal 'byor pas byang chub kyi sems de nyid mi 'pho bar byas te rim pa ji lta bas mchog tu mi 'gyur pa bsgrub pa'i don du dbang po gnyis snyoms par 'jug pa'i bde ba bsgom par gsungs kyi byang chub kyi sems 'pho ba'i gnas skabs
analyzed: sems can rnams kyis bde ba chen po gang zhig gtong bar byed pa de ni sangs rgyas rnams kyis srung bar mdzad de rgyu des na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi rnam 'phrul gyi mdzad pa ni lha dang lha ma yin dang mi dang klu rnams kyis bya ba dka'o // des na rnal 'byor pas byang chub kyi sems de nyid mi 'pho bar byas te rim pa ji lta bas mchog tu mi 'gyur pa bsgrub pa'i don du dbang po gnyis snyoms par 'jug pa'i bde ba bsgom par gsungs kyi byang chub kyi sems 'pho ba'i gnas skabs
translated: The buddhas protect that great bliss which sentient beings give up. For that reason, the deeds of the emanations of the Tathagatas are difficult to perform by gods, demigods, humans, and nagas.

original: ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the yogi/nī should prevent the bodhicitta from moving and, in accordance with the stages, cultivate the bliss of the union of the two organs in order to accomplish the supreme unchanging state. It is not the case that the bodhicitta is moved at that time.

original: 'pho ba'i bag chags 'di ni sems can rnams kyi thog ma med pa'i dus nas glo bur gyi dri ma'i rang bzhin te des 'khor ba'o //
analyzed: 'pho ba'i bag chags 'di ni sems can rnams kyi thog ma med pa'i dus nas glo bur gyi dri ma'i rang bzhin te des 'khor ba'o //
translated: This habitual tendency to move is the nature of the adventitious stains of sentient beings from beginningless time, and by it, they cycle.

original: phyag rgya'i sbyor ba gang gis 'pho ba'i bag chags der 'gyur pa'i sbyor ba de nyid kyis mi 'pho ba'i bag chags su 'gyur te dngul chu dang me bzhin no //
analyzed: phyag rgya'i sbyor ba gang gis 'pho ba'i bag chags der 'gyur pa'i sbyor ba de nyid kyis mi 'pho ba'i bag chags su 'gyur te dngul chu dang me bzhin no //
translated: By the same yoga that transforms the habitual propensities of transference into that, the habitual propensities of non-transference occur, like mercury and fire.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyud kyi rgyal po'i sgrub thabs kyi le'u las tshigs su bcad pa nyis brgya nyi shu rtsa bzhi pas gsungs pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyud kyi rgyal po'i sgrub thabs kyi le'u las tshigs su bcad pa nyis brgya nyi shu rtsa bzhi pas gsungs pa /
translated: The Bhagavān has said in the chapter on the means of accomplishment of the king of tantras, in the two hundred twenty-fourth verse:

original: me ni dngul chu'i dgra nyid yin te me dang rnam par bral na rnam yang dngul chu 'ching ba med //
analyzed: me ni dngul chu'i dgra nyid yin te me dang rnam par bral na rnam yang dngul chu 'ching ba med //
translated: Fire is indeed the enemy of mercury; without fire, mercury is never bound.

original: ma bcings na ni gser byed med de gser dang bral na sma bo rnams la longs spyod med pa nyid //
analyzed: ma bcings na ni gser byed med de gser dang bral na sma bo rnams la longs spyod med pa nyid //
translated: Unbound, it does not produce gold; without gold, the poor have no enjoyment.

original: de bzhin bud med sbyor ba bral na rtag tu rnal 'byor pa rnams dag gi sems ni 'ching mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de bzhin bud med sbyor ba bral na rtag tu rnal 'byor pa rnams dag gi sems ni 'ching mi 'gyur //
translated: Likewise, the minds of yogis are always unbound, free from the practice of women.

original: bcings pa med na lus 'bigs med de ma phug lus kyis 'dir ni lhan @243b skyes bde ba ster ba min zhes pa ste 'dir ji ltar me la reg pas dngul chu 'bros par 'gyur te thabs dang bcas pa'i me de nyid kyis 'ching bar byed do //
analyzed: bcings pa med na lus 'bigs med de ma phug lus kyis 'dir ni lhan @243b skyes bde ba ster ba min zhes pa ste 'dir ji ltar me la reg pas dngul chu 'bros par 'gyur te thabs dang bcas pa'i me de nyid kyis 'ching bar byed do //
translated: Here, just as silver mercury flees from fire, but is bound by that very fire together with the means,

original: de bzhin du chos 'byung la reg pas byang chub kyi sems 'bros par byed de de nyid thabs dang bcas pa nyid yin na 'ching bar byed do; ;
analyzed: de bzhin du chos 'byung la reg pas byang chub kyi sems 'bros par byed de de nyid thabs dang bcas pa nyid yin na 'ching bar byed do; ;
translated: so also, the bodhicitta flees from contact with the lotus, but is bound by that very [lotus] together with the means.

original: ji ltar mes dngul chu bcings pas lcags thams cad gser du byed do //
analyzed: ji ltar mes dngul chu bcings pas lcags thams cad gser du byed do //
translated: Just as silver mercury, when bound by fire, turns all iron into gold,

original: de bzhin du chos 'byung gi sbyor bas byang chub kyi sems bcings pas phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa sgrib pa med par byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du chos 'byung gi sbyor bas byang chub kyi sems bcings pas phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa sgrib pa med par byed do //
translated: so also, the bodhicitta, when bound by the application of the lotus, makes the aggregates, elements, sense bases, and so on, free from obscurations.

original: de'i phyir dngul chu dang byang chub kyi sems dag gi mthu ni brtag par bya ba ma yin te rmongs pa rnams kyis rnam par dpyad par bya bar mi nus so //🔽de'i phyir byang chub kyi sems brtan par byed pa'i don du las kyi phyag rgya'i sbyor ba la yang lha'i dmigs pa rab tu gsungs pa ni dngul chu'i bdug pa dang bskal ba la sogs pa lta bu ste phyugs kyi las padmar rab tu zhugs pa'i byang chub
analyzed: de'i phyir dngul chu dang byang chub kyi sems dag gi mthu ni brtag par bya ba ma yin te rmongs pa rnams kyis rnam par dpyad par bya bar mi nus so // de'i phyir byang chub kyi sems brtan par byed pa'i don du las kyi phyag rgya'i sbyor ba la yang lha'i dmigs pa rab tu gsungs pa ni dngul chu'i bdug pa dang bskal ba la sogs pa lta bu ste phyugs kyi las padmar rab tu zhugs pa'i byang chub
translated: Therefore, the power of mercury and bodhicitta is not to be doubted, for the ignorant are unable to analyze it.

original: kyi sems bza' ba ni de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: kyi sems bza' ba ni de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, for the purpose of stabilizing bodhicitta, the application with an action seal is also taught as the deity's focus, like mercury and elixirs, etc. The bodhicitta that is consumed by one who has entered the lotus of the cow-like action is not taught by the Tathāgata.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyud kyi rgyal po'i le'u lnga pa las tshigs su bcad pa bdun cu rtsa gsum pas las kyi phyag rgya la sogs pa sgrub pa gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyud kyi rgyal po'i le'u lnga pa las tshigs su bcad pa bdun cu rtsa gsum pas las kyi phyag rgya la sogs pa sgrub pa gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
translated: The Blessed One taught the accomplishment of the action seal, etc. in the chapter on the five kings of tantras with seventy-three verses, as follows:

original: rgyal ba'i lhan skyes bde ba 'di ni 'phel ba'i don slad dang por las kyi phyag rgya bsten par bya //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i lhan skyes bde ba 'di ni 'phel ba'i don slad dang por las kyi phyag rgya bsten par bya //
translated: For the sake of increasing this innate bliss of the Victor, one should first rely on a karma consort.

original: de nas nyi ma'i gzugs ni lus dang gdong dang rkang pa gtsug tor yan lag thams cad rdzogs pa ste //
analyzed: de nas nyi ma'i gzugs ni lus dang gdong dang rkang pa gtsug tor yan lag thams cad rdzogs pa ste //
translated: Then, the form of the sun is the body, face, feet, and uṣṇīṣa, complete with all limbs.

original: glog gi dbyug pa'i rjes mthun 'pho med bde bskyed par byed ma mtshan nyid yan lag rab tu rdzogs //
analyzed: glog gi dbyug pa'i rjes mthun 'pho med bde bskyed par byed ma mtshan nyid yan lag rab tu rdzogs //
translated: The one who generates unchanging bliss, similar to a lightning flash, is the one with perfect characteristics and limbs.🔽The one who is illuminated by vajras, the one who transforms the body, speech, and mind of the three worlds into the dharmadhātu, and the one who is the essence of the three worlds, is the one who is the essence of the three worlds.

original: rdo rje rnams kyis rab tu snang bar byed ma srid gsum gnas lus chos kyi dbyings ni de nas 'gyur zhes pa dang / slar yang le'u de nyid las tshigs su bcad pa brgya bcu gsum pas gsungs pa /
analyzed: rdo rje rnams kyis rab tu snang bar byed ma srid gsum gnas lus chos kyi dbyings ni de nas 'gyur zhes pa dang / slar yang le'u de nyid las tshigs su bcad pa brgya bcu gsum pas gsungs pa /
translated: Again, in that very chapter, the one hundred thirteenth verse states:

original: sems kyi snang ba tsam ste rang gi yid la skyes pa me long gi ni gzugs brnyan lta bu nyid //
analyzed: sems kyi snang ba tsam ste rang gi yid la skyes pa me long gi ni gzugs brnyan lta bu nyid //
translated: It is merely an appearance of the mind, arisen in one's own mind, like a reflection in a mirror.

original: gang zhig mtha' dag rgyal ba'i sras dang sangs rgyas rnams kyis bsten pa rnal 'byor dbang pos bstan bya ste //
analyzed: gang zhig mtha' dag rgyal ba'i sras dang sangs rgyas rnams kyis bsten pa rnal 'byor dbang pos bstan bya ste //

analyzed: ye shes me lce rab tu rgyas pa de ni bdud dpud  yul dang bcas pa mtha' @244a * // dag sreg byed cing //
translated: demons and their realms.🔽It also burns up attachment to the body, and so on, and bestows the🔽bliss of enlightenment to the yogis through the practice of yoga.

analyzed: lus la chags pa la sogs kyang ste rnal 'byor rnams la lo yi sbyor bas bde mnyam ster bar byed ces pa ste bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa 'di'i phyir dbang po gnyis kyi snyoms par 'jug pas kyang phyi rol gyi dbang po las skyes pa 'gyur bde
translated: Because of this statement of the Bhagavān, the yogi should meditate on🔽this mahāmudrā, which is merely the appearance of one’s mind, up to the

original: ba rnam par spangs nas byang chub kyi mthar thug pa'i bar du phyag rgya chen po rang gi sems kyi snang ba tsam 'di rnal 'byor pas bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: ba rnam par spangs nas byang chub kyi mthar thug pa'i bar du phyag rgya chen po rang gi sems kyi snang ba tsam 'di rnal 'byor pas bsgom par bya'o //
translated: end of enlightenment, having abandoned the bliss that arises from the🔽external sense faculties through the practice of the union of the two organs.

original: 'o na de bzhin gshegs pas phung po dang khams dang skye mched med na dbang po gnyis kyi sbyor ba dang bral ba ni shes rab ye shes rang rig par mi 'gyur te 'pho ba med pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes gsungs pa ma yin nan ci ltar
analyzed: 'o na de bzhin gshegs pas phung po dang khams dang skye mched med na dbang po gnyis kyi sbyor ba dang bral ba ni shes rab ye shes rang rig par mi 'gyur te 'pho ba med pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes gsungs pa ma yin nan ci ltar
translated: Well then, if the aggregates, elements, and media do not exist, the Tathāgata would not have said, “The wisdom intuition is self-knowing, free from the union of the two organs, because it is itself without transference.”🔽How is it?

original: rnal 'byor pas rang gi sems kyi snang ba la rang gi sems rjes su chags par byas nas rang gi sems sgrib pa med par byed cing mi 'gyur pa'i bde ba chen po'i ye shes kyang longs spyod par byed de rdul phra rab tshogs pa'i lus med pa'i
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas rang gi sems kyi snang ba la rang gi sems rjes su chags par byas nas rang gi sems sgrib pa med par byed cing mi 'gyur pa'i bde ba chen po'i ye shes kyang longs spyod par byed de rdul phra rab tshogs pa'i lus med pa'i
translated: The yogi, having caused his mind to delight in the appearances of his own mind, makes his mind free from obscurations and also experiences the intuition of great, unchanging bliss, because there is no body composed of a collection of atoms.

original: phyir ro // 'di nyid ni phyin ci log pa ste lha sbyin bdag nyid kyi phrag par zhon nas grong du 'gro'o zhes pa'i ngag bzhin no zhes pa 'dir 'ga' zhig gi bsam pa 'byung bar 'gyur te de'i phyir brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: phyir ro // 'di nyid ni phyin ci log pa ste lha sbyin bdag nyid kyi phrag par zhon nas grong du 'gro'o zhes pa'i ngag bzhin no zhes pa 'dir 'ga' zhig gi bsam pa 'byung bar 'gyur te de'i phyir brjod par bya'o //
translated: Here someone might think, “This is just a mistake, like the statement, ‘Devadatta rides on his own shoulders and goes to the village.’ ” So we must explain this.

original: 'dir rmongs pa rnams kyis brjod par bya ba gang yin pa rdul phra rab tshogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams ma gtogs pa sems tsam gyis shes rab ye shes rang rig par mi 'gyur pa de ni ma yin te gang gi
analyzed: 'dir rmongs pa rnams kyis brjod par bya ba gang yin pa rdul phra rab tshogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams ma gtogs pa sems tsam gyis shes rab ye shes rang rig par mi 'gyur pa de ni ma yin te gang gi
translated: Here, it is not the case that whatever is expressed by the ignorant is not self-awareness of the wisdom of mind-only, except for the aggregates, elements, and sense-spheres that are the nature of a collection of subtle particles, because

original: phyir glo bur ba'i sems kyi bag chags kyi dbang gis so //
analyzed: phyir glo bur ba'i sems kyi bag chags kyi dbang gis so //
translated: it is due to the power of the latent tendencies of the adventitious mind.

original: 'dir phung po dang khams dang skye mched ces bya ba ni glo bur ba'i sems kyi bag chags so //
analyzed: 'dir phung po dang khams dang skye mched ces bya ba ni glo bur ba'i sems kyi bag chags so //
translated: Here, the so-called aggregates, elements, and sense-spheres are the latent tendencies of the adventitious mind.

original: de'i drin gyis sems la bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba rab tu 'jug ste don dam par rnam par dpyad na lus 'di la nye bar 'tshe ba phra mo yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i drin gyis sems la bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba rab tu 'jug ste don dam par rnam par dpyad na lus 'di la nye bar 'tshe ba phra mo yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Due to its kindness, feelings of pleasure and pain operate in the mind. When this body is ultimately analyzed, there is no subtle harm present.

original: 'dir rdul phra rab tshogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi lus ni rmi lam gyi gnas skabs na rab tu lhung ste gnas shing gang gi sems la sdug bsngal rab tu 'jug pa 'di la nye bar 'tshe ba phra mo 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir rdul phra rab tshogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi lus ni rmi lam gyi gnas skabs na rab tu lhung ste gnas shing gang gi sems la sdug bsngal rab tu 'jug pa 'di la nye bar 'tshe ba phra mo 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Here, the body, which is the nature of an aggregation of subtle particles, falls asleep and remains in a dream state, and the mind experiences suffering. There is not the slightest harm to the body.

original: 'di ni 'jig rten thams cad du rab tu grags pa ste gnas skabs de nyid la sems @244b kyi bag chags kyi bdag nyid kyi lus gzhan rdul phra rab tshogs pa dang bral ba yul gzhan du 'gro bar rab tu snang ste yul gzhan du song ba de'i
analyzed: 'di ni 'jig rten thams cad du rab tu grags pa ste gnas skabs de nyid la sems @244b kyi bag chags kyi bdag nyid kyi lus gzhan rdul phra rab tshogs pa dang bral ba yul gzhan du 'gro bar rab tu snang ste yul gzhan du song ba de'i
translated: This is well known in the world. In that state, another body, which is the nature of the mind’s latent tendencies, free from an aggregation of subtle particles, appears to go to another place.🔽When that body in another place is harmed by thieves and so on, the mind experiences suffering due to that harm.

original: lus la chom rkun la sogs pa rnams kyis nye bar 'tshe ba byas par gyur na nye bar 'tshe ba des sems la sdug bsngal rab tu 'jug cing sdug bsngal des du bar byed de lus med cing chom rkun la sogs pa med par sems kyi sdug bsngal
analyzed: lus la chom rkun la sogs pa rnams kyis nye bar 'tshe ba byas par gyur na nye bar 'tshe ba des sems la sdug bsngal rab tu 'jug cing sdug bsngal des du bar byed de lus med cing chom rkun la sogs pa med par sems kyi sdug bsngal
translated: The mind suffers due to that suffering. The mind suffers, thinking, “My body is harmed.”

original: gyi shes pa rang rig pa rab tu 'jug pa 'di ni rmad du byung ba chen po'o //
analyzed: gyi shes pa rang rig pa rab tu 'jug pa 'di ni rmad du byung ba chen po'o //
translated: The engagement of the self-awareness of the mind is a great wonder.

original: de bzhin du rmi lam du 'dod pa chen po nye bar longs spyod pa rnams kyis sems la bde ba rab tu 'jug ste lus med cing 'dod pa chen po nye bar longs spyod pa rnams med par sems can rnams kyi sems kyi bde ba'i shes pa rang
analyzed: de bzhin du rmi lam du 'dod pa chen po nye bar longs spyod pa rnams kyis sems la bde ba rab tu 'jug ste lus med cing 'dod pa chen po nye bar longs spyod pa rnams med par sems can rnams kyi sems kyi bde ba'i shes pa rang
translated: Likewise, in dreams, the mind is engaged in great desire and great enjoyment, but there is no body and no great desire and enjoyment. The engagement of the self-awareness of the mind of sentient beings in the experience of bliss is

original: rig pa rab tu 'jug pa de nyid ni ngo mtshar ro //🔽nyi tshe ba'i shes pa 'di nyid kyang mkhas pa rnams kyis rnam par dpyad par mi nus na 'khor ba'i bag chags las 'das shing mya ngan las 'das pa'i bag chags las byung ba rnal 'byor pa'i rang rig pa kun tu bzang po mi 'gyur pa'i bde ba
analyzed: rig pa rab tu 'jug pa de nyid ni ngo mtshar ro // nyi tshe ba'i shes pa 'di nyid kyang mkhas pa rnams kyis rnam par dpyad par mi nus na 'khor ba'i bag chags las 'das shing mya ngan las 'das pa'i bag chags las byung ba rnal 'byor pa'i rang rig pa kun tu bzang po mi 'gyur pa'i bde ba
translated: just as wondrous.

original: chen po'i ye shes rmongs pa rnams kyis rnam par brtag par nus pa lta ci smos ;
analyzed: chen po'i ye shes rmongs pa rnams kyis rnam par brtag par nus pa lta ci smos ;
translated: If even this limited knowledge cannot be analyzed by the wise, what need is there to mention the possibility of the ignorant analyzing the self-awareness of the yogi/nī that transcends the latent tendencies of saṃsāra and arises from the latent tendencies of nirvāṇa, the pristine consciousness of great unchanging bliss, Samantabhadra?

original: / ci ste mu stegs pa sdig pa'i blo can srog gi rlung gi de kho na nyid la dga' ba rnams 'dir rmi lam gyi gnas skabs na rdul phra rab 'dus pa'i bdag nyid kyi lus la dbugs 'byung ba dang 'jug pa yod cing dbugs 'byung ba dang
analyzed: / ci ste mu stegs pa sdig pa'i blo can srog gi rlung gi de kho na nyid la dga' ba rnams 'dir rmi lam gyi gnas skabs na rdul phra rab 'dus pa'i bdag nyid kyi lus la dbugs 'byung ba dang 'jug pa yod cing dbugs 'byung ba dang
translated: If the tīrthikas, who have sinful minds and delight in the reality of the life-force wind, have exhalation and inhalation of breath in their bodies, which are of the nature of an aggregation of subtle particles, in the dream state, then they will have exhalation and inhalation of breath in the intermediate state after death.

original: 'jug pa de dag gi mthu las gnas skabs gsum du 'gyur gyi dbugs 'byung ba dang 'jug pa med pa las ni ma yin no zhes pa 'di smra na /
analyzed: 'jug pa de dag gi mthu las gnas skabs gsum du 'gyur gyi dbugs 'byung ba dang 'jug pa med pa las ni ma yin no zhes pa 'di smra na /
translated: If the tīrthikas, who have evil minds and delight in the reality of the life-force wind, say here in the dream state that the body, which is the nature of an aggregation of subtle particles, has exhalation and inhalation, and that from the power of those exhalations and inhalations the three states occur, not from the absence of exhalation and inhalation,

original: 'di nyid rnam par dpyad par bya ste 'dir gal te dbugs 'byung ba dang 'jug pa dag med par sems la rmi lam gyi gnas skabs med na de'i tshe 'chi ba brgyal ba'i gnas skabs su dbugs 'byung ba dang 'jug pa dag med par thun tshod gcig gi
analyzed: 'di nyid rnam par dpyad par bya ste 'dir gal te dbugs 'byung ba dang 'jug pa dag med par sems la rmi lam gyi gnas skabs med na de'i tshe 'chi ba brgyal ba'i gnas skabs su dbugs 'byung ba dang 'jug pa dag med par thun tshod gcig gi
translated: then this should be analyzed. Here, if without exhalation and inhalation the mind does not have the state of dreaming, then at the time of death, when one faints, without exhalation and inhalation, for one period of twenty-four minutes,

original: bar du sems rab tu snang bar ci ltar 'gyur gshin rje'i rgyal po'i bkas gshin rje'i pho nya rnams kyis lus khyer bar byed pa dang gshin rje'i grong khyer rab tu snang @245a * //
analyzed: bar du sems rab tu snang bar ci ltar 'gyur gshin rje'i rgyal po'i bkas gshin rje'i pho nya rnams kyis lus khyer bar byed pa dang gshin rje'i grong khyer rab tu snang @245a * //
translated: In the middle, how does the mind appear? By the order of the king of the Lord of Death, the messengers of the Lord of Death carry the body away and the city of the Lord of Death appears.

original: bar 'gyur zhing gshin rje'i grong khyer der gshin rje'i rgyal po yang rab tu snang bar 'gyur te gshin rje des khyer ba'i lus de'i bsod nams dang sdig pa la rnam par dpyod par byed do //
analyzed: bar 'gyur zhing gshin rje'i grong khyer der gshin rje'i rgyal po yang rab tu snang bar 'gyur te gshin rje des khyer ba'i lus de'i bsod nams dang sdig pa la rnam par dpyod par byed do //
translated: In that city of the Lord of Death, the king of the Lord of Death appears and that Lord of Death examines the body that he has carried there for its merit and sin.

original: rnam par dpyad nas 'di smra ste ji ltar da dung 'di'i tshe zad par ma gyur to //🔽de'i phyir ji srid 'di'i lus 'jig par mi 'gyur gyi bar du yang sems can 'di mi'i 'jig rten du myur du khyer cig ces gshin rje'i pho nya rnams la bsgo bar 'gyur te bsgo ba des gshin rje'i pho nya de rnams kyis de nas lus mi'i 'jig
analyzed: rnam par dpyad nas 'di smra ste ji ltar da dung 'di'i tshe zad par ma gyur to // de'i phyir ji srid 'di'i lus 'jig par mi 'gyur gyi bar du yang sems can 'di mi'i 'jig rten du myur du khyer cig ces gshin rje'i pho nya rnams la bsgo bar 'gyur te bsgo ba des gshin rje'i pho nya de rnams kyis de nas lus mi'i 'jig
translated: Having examined it, he says, “How is it that his life has not yet ended?”

original: rten du 'dor bar byed do /
analyzed: rten du 'dor bar byed do /
translated: Therefore, he orders the messengers of the Lord of Death, “Until this being’s body is destroyed, quickly carry this being back to the human world.” By that order, the messengers of the Lord of Death then cast that body into the human world.

original: dor bar gyur pa na sems kyi bag chags kyi dbang gis slar yang shi ba'i lus de la dbugs 'byung ba dang 'jug pa dag tu 'gyur te de'i tshe bag chags gzhan gyi dbang gis sad pa'i gnas skabs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dor bar gyur pa na sems kyi bag chags kyi dbang gis slar yang shi ba'i lus de la dbugs 'byung ba dang 'jug pa dag tu 'gyur te de'i tshe bag chags gzhan gyi dbang gis sad pa'i gnas skabs su 'gyur ro //
translated: When it is discarded, then again, by the power of the mental latent impressions, the in-breath and out-breath occur in that dead body, and at that time, by the power of other latent impressions, the state of awakening occurs.

original: gnas skabs de la sems rab tu sad pa'i phyir gnyen gyi sde la gshin rje'i rgyal po'i gtam rjod par byed do //
analyzed: gnas skabs de la sems rab tu sad pa'i phyir gnyen gyi sde la gshin rje'i rgyal po'i gtam rjod par byed do //
translated: In that state, because the mind is fully awakened, one tells the story of King Yama to the group of relatives.

original: de'i phyir lus med cing dbugs 'byung ba dang 'jug pa dag kyang med par thog ma med pa'i sems kyi bag chags glo bur ba ni yang dang yang du skye ba'i dbang gis 'gyur te sems can rnams kyi rang bzhin ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir lus med cing dbugs 'byung ba dang 'jug pa dag kyang med par thog ma med pa'i sems kyi bag chags glo bur ba ni yang dang yang du skye ba'i dbang gis 'gyur te sems can rnams kyi rang bzhin ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, without a body and without in-breath and out-breath, the beginningless mental latent impressions arise again and again by the power of birth, but not as the nature of sentient beings.

original: gal te 'khor ba'i bag chags 'di rang bzhin du gyur pa yin na sems can rnams sangs rgyas nyid ces bya bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'khor ba'i bag chags 'di rang bzhin du gyur pa yin na sems can rnams sangs rgyas nyid ces bya bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If this latent impression of cyclic existence were their nature, then sentient beings would not be called “buddhahood.”

original: rgyu gang gis glo bur ba yin pa'i rgyu des 'di zad par 'gyur te de zad pa las sangs rgyas nyid du de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs so //
analyzed: rgyu gang gis glo bur ba yin pa'i rgyu des 'di zad par 'gyur te de zad pa las sangs rgyas nyid du de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs so //
translated: The cause by which it is adventitious is the cause by which it is exhausted. The Tathagata has said that from its exhaustion comes Buddhahood.

original: de ltar rnam pa du mas rnam par dpyad na 'khor ba 'di ni rang gi sems kyi bag chags tsam ste gzhan 'ga' yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa du mas rnam par dpyad na 'khor ba 'di ni rang gi sems kyi bag chags tsam ste gzhan 'ga' yang ma yin no //
translated: Thus, when this cyclic life is analyzed in many ways, it is merely the habitual tendencies of one's own mind, and nothing else.

original: 'khor ba'i bag chags kyang 'pho ba'i mtshan nyid kyi skad cig yin gyi mi 'gyur pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i bag chags kyang 'pho ba'i mtshan nyid kyi skad cig yin gyi mi 'gyur pa ma yin no //
translated: The habitual tendencies of cyclic life are moments having the character of transmigration, and not of non-change.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i bag chags ni mi 'pho ba'i mtshan nyid kyi skad cig yin gyi 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i bag chags ni mi 'pho ba'i mtshan nyid kyi skad cig yin gyi 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: The habitual tendencies of nirvana are moments having the character of non-transmigration, and not of change.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyud kyi rgyal po'i nang gi le'u las tshigs su bcad pa brgya rtsa gnyis pas gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyud kyi rgyal po'i nang gi le'u las tshigs su bcad pa brgya rtsa gnyis pas gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
translated: The Bhagavat has said in the chapter of the king of tantras, in 102 verses:

original: gang zhig gang gi dbus su rab zhugs brtul zhugs nges @245b pa la dga' las kyi zhags pas nges bcings pa //
analyzed: gang zhig gang gi dbus su rab zhugs brtul zhugs nges @245b pa la dga' las kyi zhags pas nges bcings pa //
translated: He who, in the middle of that, is well engaged, delights in the certainty of observances, is bound by the noose of karma.

original: de yi dbus su rang rang bsam pas mi bdag de yi rigs su de yi 'dzin pa dag gis 'gyur //
analyzed: de yi dbus su rang rang bsam pas mi bdag de yi rigs su de yi 'dzin pa dag gis 'gyur //
translated: In the middle of that, by the conception of his own mind, he is born into the family of that king.

original: ji srid sems kyi rang bzhin dag ni rnam gsum srid pa'i dbang gis tshor ba bde dang sdug bsngal ba //
analyzed: ji srid sems kyi rang bzhin dag ni rnam gsum srid pa'i dbang gis tshor ba bde dang sdug bsngal ba //
translated: As long as the nature of the mind is threefold, by the power of existence, with the feelings of pleasure and pain,🔽for that long, O lord of men, you wander in this fearful saṃsāra, in the heavens, in the human realm, and below.

original: de srid 'jigs rung 'khor ba 'dir 'khyam mi yi bdag po mtho ris mi yul dag dang 'og tu yang zhes pa dang / slar yang le'u de nyid las tshigs su bcad pa dgu bcu rtsa bdun pas rnal 'byor gyi bag chags gsungs pa /
analyzed: de srid 'jigs rung 'khor ba 'dir 'khyam mi yi bdag po mtho ris mi yul dag dang 'og tu yang zhes pa dang / slar yang le'u de nyid las tshigs su bcad pa dgu bcu rtsa bdun pas rnal 'byor gyi bag chags gsungs pa /
translated: And again, in that very chapter, the ninety-seventh verse teaches the imprints of yoga:

original: rnal 'byor dbang po rnal 'byor ma thob rab tu g-yo ba'i yid kyis gal te shi bar gyur pa na //
analyzed: rnal 'byor dbang po rnal 'byor ma thob rab tu g-yo ba'i yid kyis gal te shi bar gyur pa na //
translated: If the lord of yoga, not attaining yoga, should die with a very wavering mind,

original: dpal ldan mi yi 'jig rten du ni rab mchog thub pa'i rigs su rnal 'byor ldan par skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: dpal ldan mi yi 'jig rten du ni rab mchog thub pa'i rigs su rnal 'byor ldan par skye bar 'gyur //
translated: he will be born in the glorious human world, in the excellent family of sages, endowed with yoga.

original: sngon gyi goms pa de yis slar yang ye shes rnal 'byor yangs pa dag ni kun du 'dzin par 'gyur //
analyzed: sngon gyi goms pa de yis slar yang ye shes rnal 'byor yangs pa dag ni kun du 'dzin par 'gyur //
translated: By that previous habituation, he will again fully grasp the vast yoga of wisdom.

original: ye shes thob nas mi zad mchog gi gnas su rab 'gro slar yang gang du'ang skye ba ldan pa min zhes pa ste /
analyzed: ye shes thob nas mi zad mchog gi gnas su rab 'gro slar yang gang du'ang skye ba ldan pa min zhes pa ste /
translated: Having attained intuition, one goes to the supreme abode of the inexhaustible, and is never born again anywhere.

original: de'i phyir sems kyi bag chags kyi dbang gis rang rig pa shes rab ye shes su 'gyur gyi rdul phra rab kyi lus kyi nye bar longs spyod pa las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems kyi bag chags kyi dbang gis rang rig pa shes rab ye shes su 'gyur gyi rdul phra rab kyi lus kyi nye bar longs spyod pa las ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, self-awareness becomes the intuition of wisdom through the power of mental predispositions, not through the enjoyment of a subtle material body.

original: ci ste rmi lam gyi gnas skabs su 'khrig pa byas par gyur pa na gnyid log pa'i lus las 'dzag par 'gyur gyi rmi lam gyi sems kyi bag chags kyi lus las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ci ste rmi lam gyi gnas skabs su 'khrig pa byas par gyur pa na gnyid log pa'i lus las 'dzag par 'gyur gyi rmi lam gyi sems kyi bag chags kyi lus las ni ma yin no //
translated: If, in the state of dreaming, one has sexual intercourse, the emission occurs from the sleeping body, not from the body of the dream consciousness’s predispositions.🔽Therefore, the bliss of the great seal arises from the power of this body, not from the body of the consciousness’s predispositions.

original: de'i phyir lus 'di'i mthu las bde ba chen po rang rig par 'gyur gyi sems kyi bag chags kyi lus las ni ma yin no zhes pa dbang po gnyis kyi bde ba la mngon par chags pa 'ga' zhig gi tshig 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir lus 'di'i mthu las bde ba chen po rang rig par 'gyur gyi sems kyi bag chags kyi lus las ni ma yin no zhes pa dbang po gnyis kyi bde ba la mngon par chags pa 'ga' zhig gi tshig 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: This is the statement of someone who is attached to the bliss of the two organs.

original: de'i phyir brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, we must respond to this.

original: 'dir rdul phra rab tshogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi lus las 'dzag par 'gyur gyi sems kyi bag chags kyi lus kyi dbang gis ni ma yin no zhes rmongs ba rnams kyis brjod par bya ba gang yin pa 'di ni de ltar tshad ma ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir rdul phra rab tshogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi lus las 'dzag par 'gyur gyi sems kyi bag chags kyi lus kyi dbang gis ni ma yin no zhes rmongs ba rnams kyis brjod par bya ba gang yin pa 'di ni de ltar tshad ma ma yin te /
translated: Here, the self-entity of the body, which is a collection of subtle particles, would be emitted, but not by the power of the body of the latent tendencies of mind.

original: gang gi phyir gzugs med pa'i srid pa la 'dzag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzugs med pa'i srid pa la 'dzag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is what the confused ones say, but it is not valid because there is emission in the formless realm.

original: 'dir gal te rdul phra rab tshogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi lus med par 'pho bar mi 'gyur zhing @246a * //
analyzed: 'dir gal te rdul phra rab tshogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi lus med par 'pho bar mi 'gyur zhing @246a * //
translated: Here, if the body, which is the self-entity of a collection of subtle particles, does not transfer,

original: 'pho ba med par 'khor bar mi 'gyur la 'khor ba med par bde ba chen po la nye bar dmigs par yang mi 'gyur na de'i tshe /
analyzed: 'pho ba med par 'khor bar mi 'gyur la 'khor ba med par bde ba chen po la nye bar dmigs par yang mi 'gyur na de'i tshe /
translated: it would not cycle without transferring, and without cycling, the observation of great bliss would not occur.

original: gzugs med pa'i ris rnams 'pho ba med par sangs rgyas nyid kyi slad du slar skye ba 'byung bar ci ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i ris rnams 'pho ba med par sangs rgyas nyid kyi slad du slar skye ba 'byung bar ci ltar 'gyur te /
translated: At that time, how could the formless realms arise again for the sake of buddhahood without transferring?

original: rdul phra rab tshogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi lus med pa'i phyir gzugs med pa rnams kyi lus ni kha zas can ma yin no //
analyzed: rdul phra rab tshogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi lus med pa'i phyir gzugs med pa rnams kyi lus ni kha zas can ma yin no //
translated: The bodies of the formless gods are not nourished by food, because they do not have bodies consisting of aggregations of atoms.

original: rdul phra rab tshogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi lus med pa'i phyir khu ba 'pho ba med na khu ba 'pho ba med pa'i phyir de rnams la bad pa med cing 'khor ba med par 'gyur te de ltar yang ma yin no //
analyzed: rdul phra rab tshogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi lus med pa'i phyir khu ba 'pho ba med na khu ba 'pho ba med pa'i phyir de rnams la bad pa med cing 'khor ba med par 'gyur te de ltar yang ma yin no //
translated: If there is no emission of semen, there is no semen, and no blood, and therefore no conception.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gnyis ba nang gi le'u las /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gnyis ba nang gi le'u las /
translated: The Blessed One has said in the second chapter of the Yogacarabhumi,

original: tshigs su bcad pa gsum pas rdul phra rab tshogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi lus dang mi 'gyur pa'i ye shes gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gsum pas rdul phra rab tshogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi lus dang mi 'gyur pa'i ye shes gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
translated: The third verse shows the body consisting of an aggregation of atoms and the unchanging consciousness:

original: lus 'di la ni khams kyi tshogs su mtha' dag ro drug zos shing 'thungs pa dag las 'gyur pa ste //
analyzed: lus 'di la ni khams kyi tshogs su mtha' dag ro drug zos shing 'thungs pa dag las 'gyur pa ste //
translated: This body is the collection of elements, the result of eating and drinking the six flavors.

original: ro drug rnams kyang 'byung ba las te rab gsal nges par 'byung ba'i tshogs kyang nam mkha'i khams las so //
analyzed: ro drug rnams kyang 'byung ba las te rab gsal nges par 'byung ba'i tshogs kyang nam mkha'i khams las so //
translated: The six flavors are from the elements, and the collection of the elements is from the realm of space.

original: stong pa la ni ye shes rnam par bsres pa ro mnyam 'gyur med rtag par yang ni 'gyur pa ste //
analyzed: stong pa la ni ye shes rnam par bsres pa ro mnyam 'gyur med rtag par yang ni 'gyur pa ste //
translated: In emptiness, gnosis is mixed, becoming the unchanging, permanent equal taste.🔽Thus, the abiding in the three kinds of peace in the elements should be known in one’s body.

original: de ltar 'byung pa la gnas zhi ba rnam gsum srid par gnas pa rang gi lus la rig par bya zhes pa la lus 'di la ni zhes pa dud 'gro dang mi'i lus gang la ro drug gi bza' ba dang btung ba yod pa ste lus 'di ni
analyzed: de ltar 'byung pa la gnas zhi ba rnam gsum srid par gnas pa rang gi lus la rig par bya zhes pa la lus 'di la ni zhes pa dud 'gro dang mi'i lus gang la ro drug gi bza' ba dang btung ba yod pa ste lus 'di ni
translated: In this body, which is the body of an animal or a human, there is food and drink of the six tastes. This body

original: ro drug gi bza' ba dang btung ba can no //
analyzed: ro drug gi bza' ba dang btung ba can no //
translated: has food and drink of the six tastes.

original: 'di la khams kyi tshogs su zhes pa spu dang pags pa dang khrag dang sha dang rus pa dang rkang dang khu ba'i khams rnams kyi 'dus pa ni khams kyi tshogs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di la khams kyi tshogs su zhes pa spu dang pags pa dang khrag dang sha dang rus pa dang rkang dang khu ba'i khams rnams kyi 'dus pa ni khams kyi tshogs su 'gyur ro //
translated: In it, the collection of elements, the collection of the elements of hair, skin, blood, flesh, bones, marrow, and semen,

original: gang las zhe na ro drug zos shing 'thungs pa dag las zhes pa ro yang yin la de rnams drug kyang yod pa'i phyir ro drug ste /
analyzed: gang las zhe na ro drug zos shing 'thungs pa dag las zhes pa ro yang yin la de rnams drug kyang yod pa'i phyir ro drug ste /
translated: from what? From the six tastes eaten and drunk. They are tastes and there are six of them, so they are the six tastes.

original: kha ba dang skyur ba dang / lan tshva dang tsha ba dang / mngar ba dang bska ba rnams spu la sogs pa'i khams kyi rang bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes pa dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: kha ba dang skyur ba dang / lan tshva dang tsha ba dang / mngar ba dang bska ba rnams spu la sogs pa'i khams kyi rang bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes pa dgongs pa'o //
translated: The six tastes are sweet, sour, salty, pungent, bitter, and astringent.

original: ro drug rnams kyang 'byung ba las te /
analyzed: ro drug rnams kyang 'byung ba las te /
translated: The six tastes are also from the elements.

original: @246b zhes pa la 'byung ba ni sa dang chu dang / me dang rlung dang / nam mkha'i khams rnams te sra ba dang / gsher ba dang dro ba dang / g-yo ba dang ro'i rdul phra rab kyi rang bzhin rnams so //
analyzed: @246b zhes pa la 'byung ba ni sa dang chu dang / me dang rlung dang / nam mkha'i khams rnams te sra ba dang / gsher ba dang dro ba dang / g-yo ba dang ro'i rdul phra rab kyi rang bzhin rnams so //
translated: The elements are the earth, water, fire, wind, and space elements. They are the natures of the subtle particles of solidity, fluidity, heat, motility, and taste.

original: de'i sa bon dang ldan pa de rnams las kha ba la sogs pa re drug tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i sa bon dang ldan pa de rnams las kha ba la sogs pa re drug tu 'gyur te /
translated: From those that possess the seeds of those, the six tastes such as sweet arise.

original: khams rnams su ro'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes pa dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: khams rnams su ro'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes pa dgongs pa'o //
translated: They become the natures of the tastes in the elements.

original: 'byung ba las 'gyur ro zhes pa ni sems can gyi bsam pa'i dbang gis gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba las 'gyur ro zhes pa ni sems can gyi bsam pa'i dbang gis gsungs pa ste /
translated: That they arise from the elements is stated from the perspective of the power of the thoughts of sentient beings.

original: don dam par rnam par dpyad na khams rnams ror 'gyur ro zhes pa bskyed bya skyed byed kyi 'brel pa las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par rnam par dpyad na khams rnams ror 'gyur ro zhes pa bskyed bya skyed byed kyi 'brel pa las ni ma yin no //
translated: In the ultimate sense, when analyzed, the elements become the essence, not from the relationship of the produced and the producer.

original: 'byung ba'i tshogs kyang nam mkha'i khams las so zhes pa ni /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i tshogs kyang nam mkha'i khams las so zhes pa ni /
translated: The collection of elements also arises from the space element.

original: nam mkha'i khams stong ba'i chos las 'byung ba'i tshogs su 'gyur te sa bon las myu gu bzhin no //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams stong ba'i chos las 'byung ba'i tshogs su 'gyur te sa bon las myu gu bzhin no //
translated: The collection of elements arises from the empty phenomena of the space element, like a sprout from a seed.

original: ji ltar sa bon ma nyams pa las myu gur mi 'gyur zhing sa bon nyams ba las mi 'gyur pa de bzhin du rang bzhin yongs su spangs pa las ma yin zhing bems po'i khams las ma yin la chad pa'i stong pa las ma yin la chad pa'i
analyzed: ji ltar sa bon ma nyams pa las myu gur mi 'gyur zhing sa bon nyams ba las mi 'gyur pa de bzhin du rang bzhin yongs su spangs pa las ma yin zhing bems po'i khams las ma yin la chad pa'i stong pa las ma yin la chad pa'i
translated: Just as a sprout does not arise from a seed that is not damaged and does not arise from a damaged seed, in the same way, it does not arise from the complete abandonment of the nature, nor from the inert element, nor from the empty nihilism.

original: stong pa las ma yin te /
analyzed: stong pa las ma yin te /
translated: It does not arise from empty nihilism.

original: de ltar stong pa las chos thams cad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar stong pa las chos thams cad du 'gyur ro //
translated: In that way, all phenomena arise from emptiness.

original: stong pa la ni ye shes rnam par bsres pa zhes pa la stong pa ni chos rnams la skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa rang gi sems kyi snang ba'o //
analyzed: stong pa la ni ye shes rnam par bsres pa zhes pa la stong pa ni chos rnams la skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa rang gi sems kyi snang ba'o //
translated: In emptiness, wisdom is mixed, that is, in emptiness, the non-arising and non-ceasing of phenomena, the appearances of one’s mind.

original: ye shes ni de rab tu rtogs pa mi 'gyur pa'i bde ba'o //
analyzed: ye shes ni de rab tu rtogs pa mi 'gyur pa'i bde ba'o //
translated: Wisdom is the realization of that, unchanging bliss.

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa med pa'i rang gi sems kyi snang ba de la ye shes rnam par bsres pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa med pa'i rang gi sems kyi snang ba de la ye shes rnam par bsres pa'o //
translated: In the appearances of one’s mind, which are without arising and cessation, wisdom is mixed.

original: rang gi sems kyi snang ba la ro mnyam pa ni gcig tu gyur pa ste shes pa dang shes bya'i 'brel pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi sems kyi snang ba la ro mnyam pa ni gcig tu gyur pa ste shes pa dang shes bya'i 'brel pas ni ma yin no //
translated: Sameness of taste in the appearances of one’s mind is their becoming one, not by the connection of object and subject.

original: 'di nyid ni 'gyur med rtag pa ste mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'di nyid ni 'gyur med rtag pa ste mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: This is itself unchanging and permanent, meaning supreme and unchanging.

original: de ltar 'byung ba la gnas zhi ba zhes pa nyid de ltar rim pa 'dis lus kyi khams la gnas pa ni mi 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'byung ba la gnas zhi ba zhes pa nyid de ltar rim pa 'dis lus kyi khams la gnas pa ni mi 'gyur pa'o //
translated: Thus, abiding in the elements, peace, that is, abiding in the elements of the body in this way, by this process, is unchanging.

original: rnam gsum srid par gnas zhes pa 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med par gnas pa ni rang gi lus la rnal 'byor pas rig par bya ste shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam gsum srid par gnas zhes pa 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med par gnas pa ni rang gi lus la rnal 'byor pas rig par bya ste shes par bya'o //
translated: The yogi should know that the three abodes are the three realms of desire, form, and formlessness, which are located in his own body.

original: des na dud 'gro dang mi rnams kyi khu ba ni sa bon @247a * //
analyzed: des na dud 'gro dang mi rnams kyi khu ba ni sa bon @247a * //
translated: Thus, the semen of animals and humans is the seed

original: te 'khor ba skyed pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: te 'khor ba skyed pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: that is the cause of the arising of samsara.

original: de nyid ro drug po rnams kyi lus la khams nyid du gyur pa rnams ni /
analyzed: de nyid ro drug po rnams kyi lus la khams nyid du gyur pa rnams ni /
translated: That very [semen] is the six tastes in the body, which are the elements.

original: sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / nam mkha'i rdul phra rab 'dus pa'i bdag nyid can dri dang gzugs dang ro dang reg bya dang sgra'i bdag nyid sems can gyi khams te sa bon gyi rang bzhin 'di las las las skyes pa'i lus skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / nam mkha'i rdul phra rab 'dus pa'i bdag nyid can dri dang gzugs dang ro dang reg bya dang sgra'i bdag nyid sems can gyi khams te sa bon gyi rang bzhin 'di las las las skyes pa'i lus skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The element of sentient beings is the nature of smell, form, taste, touch, and sound, which is the collection of the subtle particles of earth, water, fire, wind, and space. From this seed nature, the body arises, born from karma.

original: 'gag par yang 'gyur te 'chi ba'i dus su lnga'i bdag nyid kyi sa bon de nyid nges par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'gag par yang 'gyur te 'chi ba'i dus su lnga'i bdag nyid kyi sa bon de nyid nges par 'byung ngo //
translated: And it ceases, for at the time of death, that very seed of the nature of the five [elements] definitely emerges.

original: slar yang rmi lam gyi lus bzhin du bag chags kyi lus stong pa rdul phra rab kyi tshogs spangs pa ma 'gags pa ste /
analyzed: slar yang rmi lam gyi lus bzhin du bag chags kyi lus stong pa rdul phra rab kyi tshogs spangs pa ma 'gags pa ste /
translated: Again, like the dream body, the body of habitual tendencies is empty, free from the collection of subtle particles, and unceasing.

original: las kyi bag chags las byung ba'i bag chags kyi lus ma 'gags pa de nyid kyis slar yang rdul phra rab tshogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi lus 'dzin no //
analyzed: las kyi bag chags las byung ba'i bag chags kyi lus ma 'gags pa de nyid kyis slar yang rdul phra rab tshogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi lus 'dzin no //
translated: That very body of habitual tendencies, which arises from the habitual tendencies of karma and is unceasing, again takes up a body that is the collection of subtle particles.

original: slar yang rdul phra rab tshogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi lus bzung ba'i phyir sngar gyi lus kyi bag chags yongs su dor nas sems la da ltar gyi lus kyi bag chags skye bar 'gyur ro //🔽rgyu des na sems kyi bag chags kyi phung po stong pa rnams las glo bur ba'i phung po'i chos rnams su 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: slar yang rdul phra rab tshogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi lus bzung ba'i phyir sngar gyi lus kyi bag chags yongs su dor nas sems la da ltar gyi lus kyi bag chags skye bar 'gyur ro // rgyu des na sems kyi bag chags kyi phung po stong pa rnams las glo bur ba'i phung po'i chos rnams su 'gyur zhing /
translated: Because it again takes up a body that is the collection of subtle particles, the habitual tendencies of the previous body are completely discarded, and the habitual tendencies of the present body arise in the mind.🔽For that reason, the empty aggregates of habitual tendencies of the mind become the phenomena of the adventitious aggregates.

original: glo bur pa'i phung po'i chos rnams las sems kyi bag chags kyi phung po stong pa rnams su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: glo bur pa'i phung po'i chos rnams las sems kyi bag chags kyi phung po stong pa rnams su 'gyur ro //
translated: From the phenomena of the adventitious aggregates, the empty aggregates of habitual tendencies of the mind arise.

original: 'jig rten pha rol du ni rdul phra rab tsam yang mi 'gro ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol du ni rdul phra rab tsam yang mi 'gro ste /
translated: Not even an atom goes from this world to the next.

original: gang gi phyir phung po snga ma yongs su dor nas yang phung po gzhan 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir phung po snga ma yongs su dor nas yang phung po gzhan 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one discards the previous aggregates and takes up other aggregates.

original: de ltar brjod pa'i rim pas 'byung ba lnga'i bdag nyid ro drug gi kha zas can rnams kyi lus la 'pho ba'i dus su las las skyes pa'i sa bon 'byung ba lnga'i bdag nyid can 'byung ste /
analyzed: de ltar brjod pa'i rim pas 'byung ba lnga'i bdag nyid ro drug gi kha zas can rnams kyi lus la 'pho ba'i dus su las las skyes pa'i sa bon 'byung ba lnga'i bdag nyid can 'byung ste /
translated: In this way, at the time of transmigration in the bodies of those who eat the six tastes and are composed of the five elements, the seed that arises from karma arises as the five elements.

original: ro drug gi kha zas can rnams kyi sems kyi bag chags kyang /
analyzed: ro drug gi kha zas can rnams kyi sems kyi bag chags kyang /
translated: The mental imprints of those who eat the six tastes

original: 'byung ba lnga'i bdag nyid can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba lnga'i bdag nyid can du 'gyur ro //
translated: also become the five elements.

original: lha rnams kyi lus ni ro drug gi kha zas can dang / 'byung ba lnga'i bdag nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: lha rnams kyi lus ni ro drug gi kha zas can dang / 'byung ba lnga'i bdag nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: The bodies of the gods do not become those who eat the six tastes and are composed of the five elements.

original: ro drug gi kha zas med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ro drug gi kha zas med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not eat the six tastes.

original: zla ba dang / nyi ma la sogs pa 'dod pa na spyod pa drug po de rnams kyi lus ni /
analyzed: zla ba dang / nyi ma la sogs pa 'dod pa na spyod pa drug po de rnams kyi lus ni /
translated: The bodies of the six desire gods such as Candra and Sūrya

original: chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / @247b nam mkha' chogs pa'i bdag nyid can /
analyzed: chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / @247b nam mkha' chogs pa'i bdag nyid can /
translated: The elements are earth, water, fire, air, and space.

original: gzugs dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / sgra ste yon tan bzhi'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: gzugs dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / sgra ste yon tan bzhi'i bdag nyid can no //
translated: The qualities are form, taste, touch, and sound.

original: sa dang / dri'i yon tan dang bral ba ste yang ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sa dang / dri'i yon tan dang bral ba ste yang ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The elements of air and space are devoid of the qualities of smell and taste because they are light.

original: 'pho ba'i dus su khu ba yang de'i rang bzhin gyi bdag nyid de /
analyzed: 'pho ba'i dus su khu ba yang de'i rang bzhin gyi bdag nyid de /
translated: At the time of conception, the semen is of the same nature.

original: sems kyi bag chags kyang de'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: sems kyi bag chags kyang de'i bdag nyid can no //
translated: The mental propensities are also of the same nature.

original: gzugs kyi ris rnams kyi lus ni /
analyzed: gzugs kyi ris rnams kyi lus ni /
translated: The bodies of those in the form realm

original: me dang / rlung dang / ro'i rdul phra rab tshogs pa'i bdag nyid can /
analyzed: me dang / rlung dang / ro'i rdul phra rab tshogs pa'i bdag nyid can /
translated: are composed of particles of fire, air, and taste.

original: ro dang / reg bya dang / sgra'i yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid sa dang / chu dang ; dri dang / gzugs kyi yon tan dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: ro dang / reg bya dang / sgra'i yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid sa dang / chu dang ; dri dang / gzugs kyi yon tan dang bral ba ste /
translated: They are devoid of the qualities of smell, touch, and sound because they are light.

original: 'pho ba'i dus su bcu drug po rnams kyi khu ba yang yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid can dang / sems kyi bag chags kyang de'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: 'pho ba'i dus su bcu drug po rnams kyi khu ba yang yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid can dang / sems kyi bag chags kyang de'i bdag nyid can no //
translated: At the time of conception, the semen of the sixteen types of gods is also composed of the three qualities, and the mental propensities are also of the same nature.

original: gzugs med pa'i ris rnams kyi lus ni /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i ris rnams kyi lus ni /
translated: The bodies of the formless realm gods

original: stong pa'i khams kyi bdag nyid can sems kyi bag chags tsam ste /
analyzed: stong pa'i khams kyi bdag nyid can sems kyi bag chags tsam ste /
translated: are of the nature of the element of space, mere traces of mind,

original: sgra'i yon tan gyi bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: sgra'i yon tan gyi bdag nyid can no //
translated: and of the nature of the quality of sound.

original: khu ba yang sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / dri dang / gzugs dang / ro dang / reg bya'i yon tan spangs pa'o //
analyzed: khu ba yang sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / dri dang / gzugs dang / ro dang / reg bya'i yon tan spangs pa'o //
translated: Semen is also devoid of the qualities of earth, water, fire, wind, smell, form, taste, and touch.

original: sa la sogs pa bzhi po 'di rnams kyi gtso bo'i yon tan 'di la phal pa tsam gyi yon tan yod de rnam pa gzhan du na tshogs pa'i yon tan rnams med par yon tan gcig las 'khor ba'i bag chags su mi 'gyur ro //
