analyzed: sa la sogs pa bzhi po 'di rnams kyi gtso bo'i yon tan 'di la phal pa tsam gyi yon tan yod de rnam pa gzhan du na tshogs pa'i yon tan rnams med par yon tan gcig las 'khor ba'i bag chags su mi 'gyur ro //
translated: These four, earth and so on, have the qualities of the primary elements, but they also have the qualities of the secondary elements. Otherwise, the qualities of the collection would not exist, and the traces of cyclic existence would not arise from a single quality.

original: srid pa gsum po 'di rnams la dmyal ba dang / yi dags dang ; dud 'gro dang / mi dang / lha ma yin dang / rgyal po chen po bzhi'i ris dang / sum cu rtsa gsum dang / 'thab bral dang / dga' ldan dang /
analyzed: srid pa gsum po 'di rnams la dmyal ba dang / yi dags dang ; dud 'gro dang / mi dang / lha ma yin dang / rgyal po chen po bzhi'i ris dang / sum cu rtsa gsum dang / 'thab bral dang / dga' ldan dang /
translated: In these three realms, there are hell beings, hungry ghosts, animals, humans, demigods, the class of the four great kings, the class of the thirty-three, the class of Yāma, the class of Tuṣita, the class of Nirmāṇarati, the class of Para­nirmita­vaśa­vartin, and the class of Brahmā.

original: 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed de 'dod pa bcu gcig go //
analyzed: 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed de 'dod pa bcu gcig go //
translated: Yamas,🔽Tu§itas,

original: tshangs ris dang / tshangs pa mdun na 'don dang / tshangs chen dang / 'od chung dang / tshad med 'od dang / 'od gsal dang / dge chung dang / tshad med dge dang / dge rgyas dang / sprin med dang / bsod nams skyes dang /
analyzed: tshangs ris dang / tshangs pa mdun na 'don dang / tshangs chen dang / 'od chung dang / tshad med 'od dang / 'od gsal dang / dge chung dang / tshad med dge dang / dge rgyas dang / sprin med dang / bsod nams skyes dang /
translated: Nirmfinaratis,🔽Paranirmitavasavartins.🔽The gods of the realm of fine-materiality are of sixteen types:🔽Brahmakayikas,🔽Brahmapurohitas,

original: 'bras bu che ba dang mi che ba dang mi gdung ba dang gya nom snang ba dang 'og min te gzugs bcu drug go //
analyzed: 'bras bu che ba dang mi che ba dang mi gdung ba dang gya nom snang ba dang 'og min te gzugs bcu drug go //
translated: Mahabrahmans,🔽Paritt abhas,🔽Apramanabhas,🔽Abhasvaras,🔽Paritta subhas,🔽Apramanasubhas,🔽Subhakris,🔽Anabhrakas,🔽Punyaprasavas,🔽Brihatphalas,🔽Avrihas,🔽Atapa,s Sudrisas, Sudarsanas, and Akanisthas.🔽The gods of the realm of immateriality are of four types:🔽those who are in the realm of the infinity of space,

original: @248a * // nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang ci yang med pa'i skye mched dang 'du shes med 'du shes med min skya mched de gzugs med pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: @248a * // nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang ci yang med pa'i skye mched dang 'du shes med 'du shes med min skya mched de gzugs med pa bzhi'o //
translated: those who are in the realm of the infinity of consciousness,🔽those who are in the realm of nothingness,🔽those who are in the realm of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: de ltar 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa ste bzhi po rnams la 'pho ba'i dus su go rims ji lta bas yon tan lnga dang bzhi dang gsum dang gcig gi bdag nyid can gyi khu ba 'byung ste sems kyi bag chags kyi dbang gis so //
analyzed: de ltar 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa ste bzhi po rnams la 'pho ba'i dus su go rims ji lta bas yon tan lnga dang bzhi dang gsum dang gcig gi bdag nyid can gyi khu ba 'byung ste sems kyi bag chags kyi dbang gis so //
translated: Thus, when the four, desire, form, and formless [realms] are transmigrated, the semen of the nature of five, four, three, and one qualities arises in order, by the power of the mind's habitual tendencies.

original: rnam pa gzhan du na 'khor bar 'khyam par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du na 'khor bar 'khyam par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, one would not wander in cyclic existence.

original: rgyu 'di'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyud kyi rgyal po'i le'u lnga pa las tshigs su bcad pa lnga bcu rtsa brgyad pas gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rgyu 'di'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyud kyi rgyal po'i le'u lnga pa las tshigs su bcad pa lnga bcu rtsa brgyad pas gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
translated: For this reason, the Bhagavān in the chapter on the king of tantras, with fifty-eight verses, says this:

original: sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang ro dang mchog gi ro ste phra rab rnams ni rnam pa drug / dri la sogs pa re res dman zhing mtha' ma yul dang rnam par bral ba ye shes blta bya rnams //
analyzed: sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang ro dang mchog gi ro ste phra rab rnams ni rnam pa drug / dri la sogs pa re res dman zhing mtha' ma yul dang rnam par bral ba ye shes blta bya rnams //
translated: Earth, water, fire, wind, taste, and supreme taste are the six types of atoms. Deficient by each, such as smell, and finally devoid of objects, the objects of wisdom.

original: 'dod pa gzugs dang gzugs med rnams ni zung dang zung dang ri bong can te mtha' ma chos kyi dbyings //
analyzed: 'dod pa gzugs dang gzugs med rnams ni zung dang zung dang ri bong can te mtha' ma chos kyi dbyings //
translated: The desire realm, the form realm, and the formless realm are the pairs, the moon, and the end, which is the realm of phenomena.

original: rnam pa kun ldan de rnams kun nas rtag tu 'pho med bde ba lhan skyes rten du gyur pa'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa kun ldan de rnams kun nas rtag tu 'pho med bde ba lhan skyes rten du gyur pa'o zhes pa'o //
translated: Endowed with all aspects, always unchanging, bliss, and coemergent, it is the support.

original: rgyu des na sems can gyi bsam pa'i dbang gis de bzhin gshegs pas chos bstan pa ni bye brag tu smra ba dang mdo sde pa dang rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dang dbu ma pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu des na sems can gyi bsam pa'i dbang gis de bzhin gshegs pas chos bstan pa ni bye brag tu smra ba dang mdo sde pa dang rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dang dbu ma pa'o //
translated: For that reason, the teachings of the Tathāgata are the Vaibhāṣika, Sautrāntika, Yogācāra, and Madhyamaka, in accordance with the inclinations of sentient beings.

original: de rnams las bye phrag tu smra ba ni skye ba'i cha shas can gyi sems can rab tu gsal bar byed pa'i bstan bcos so //
analyzed: de rnams las bye phrag tu smra ba ni skye ba'i cha shas can gyi sems can rab tu gsal bar byed pa'i bstan bcos so //
translated: Among them, the Vaibhāṣika is a treatise that illuminates sentient beings who have the aspect of birth.

original: mdo sde pa ni don rab tu gsal bar byed pa'i bstan bcos so //
analyzed: mdo sde pa ni don rab tu gsal bar byed pa'i bstan bcos so //
translated: The Sautrāntika is a treatise that illuminates meaning.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa pa ni rnam par shes pa tsam rab tu gsal bar byed pa'i bstan bcos so //
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa pa ni rnam par shes pa tsam rab tu gsal bar byed pa'i bstan bcos so //
translated: The Yogācāra is a treatise that illuminates mere consciousness.🔽The Madhyamaka is a treatise that illuminates the ultimate.

original: dbu ma pa ni don dam pa'i de kho na nyid rab tu gsal bar byed pa'i bstan bcos te ring ba'i skal ba dang ldan pa dang nye ba'i skal ba dang ldan pa'i sems kyi phyir sems can gyi bsam pa'i dbang gis bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so
analyzed: dbu ma pa ni don dam pa'i de kho na nyid rab tu gsal bar byed pa'i bstan bcos te ring ba'i skal ba dang ldan pa dang nye ba'i skal ba dang ldan pa'i sems kyi phyir sems can gyi bsam pa'i dbang gis bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so
translated: The Madhyamikas say that the Lord taught the treatises that illuminate the ultimate reality, because of the mental dispositions of sentient beings, some of whom are fortunate in the long run, and some of whom are fortunate in the short run.

original: // 'dir sems can rnams ni thog ma med pa'i dus nas mu stegs ba lha dang 'byung bo dang lha ma yin gyi chos la dga' ba thams cad mkhyen pa'i lam nyams pa rigs bzhi dang gcig la brten pa mtho ris kyi 'bras bu'i longs spyod mngon @248b par🔽'dod pa byed pa po dang bdag tu smra ba po rnams so //
analyzed: // 'dir sems can rnams ni thog ma med pa'i dus nas mu stegs ba lha dang 'byung bo dang lha ma yin gyi chos la dga' ba thams cad mkhyen pa'i lam nyams pa rigs bzhi dang gcig la brten pa mtho ris kyi 'bras bu'i longs spyod mngon @248b par 'dod pa byed pa po dang bdag tu smra ba po rnams so //
translated: Here, sentient beings, from beginningless time, have been fond of the doctrines of the tirthikas, gods, elementals, and titans; they have lost the path to omniscience; they are attached to the four castes; they desire the enjoyments of the fruits of high status; they are doers; they are proponents of self.

original: de rnams las sgra smra ba po rnams ni lha dang yi dags kyi chos la brten pa rnams te dbang phyug smra ba po rnams dang bdag smra ba po rnams dang rigs smra ba po rnams kyang ngo //
analyzed: de rnams las sgra smra ba po rnams ni lha dang yi dags kyi chos la brten pa rnams te dbang phyug smra ba po rnams dang bdag smra ba po rnams dang rigs smra ba po rnams kyang ngo //
translated: Among them, the proponents of sound are those who are attached to the doctrines of gods and ghosts, the proponents of isvara, the proponents of self, and the proponents of class.

original: kla klo ni lha min gyi chos la brten pa rnams dang / byed pa por smra ba po rnams dang srog smra ba po rnams te rigs smra ba dang bral ba rnams so //
analyzed: kla klo ni lha min gyi chos la brten pa rnams dang / byed pa por smra ba po rnams dang srog smra ba po rnams te rigs smra ba dang bral ba rnams so //
translated: Barbarians are those who rely on the religion of the asuras, those who are proponents of a creator, and those who are proponents of a life force, but who are devoid of the Vedas.

original: kla klo 'di rnams kyi 'dzin pa gnyi ga ste rdul phra rab tshogs pa'i 'dzin pa dang skye ba'i cha shas can gyi gang zag gi 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: kla klo 'di rnams kyi 'dzin pa gnyi ga ste rdul phra rab tshogs pa'i 'dzin pa dang skye ba'i cha shas can gyi gang zag gi 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The two reifications of these barbarians are the reification of a collection of subtle particles and the reification of a person who has the quality of being born.

original: 'di rnams kyi bsam pa ni gal te rdul phra rab tshogs pa'i bdag nyid can gyi lus la nang du 'jug pa po skye ba'i cha shas can gyi gang zag med na rdul phra rab tshogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi lus rnam par nyams pa'i rjes la lus gzhan
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi bsam pa ni gal te rdul phra rab tshogs pa'i bdag nyid can gyi lus la nang du 'jug pa po skye ba'i cha shas can gyi gang zag med na rdul phra rab tshogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi lus rnam par nyams pa'i rjes la lus gzhan
translated: Their thought is this: If there is no person who has the quality of being born and who is an inner experiencer of a body that is the nature of a collection of subtle particles, then after the body that is the nature of a collection of subtle particles has been destroyed,

original: su zhig gis 'dzin par byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: su zhig gis 'dzin par byed par 'gyur /
translated: who will experience another body?

original: de'i phyir brdzus te byung ba'i gang zag yod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir brdzus te byung ba'i gang zag yod do //
translated: Therefore a person who is spontaneously born exists.

original: des bsgrubs pas mtho ris kyi 'bras bu ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'bras bur 'gyur te mtho ris kyi 'bras bu las gzhan mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba med do zhes pa de kho na nyid 'dri ba'i dus su de rnams kyi rang gi sems
analyzed: des bsgrubs pas mtho ris kyi 'bras bu ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'bras bur 'gyur te mtho ris kyi 'bras bu las gzhan mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba med do zhes pa de kho na nyid 'dri ba'i dus su de rnams kyi rang gi sems
translated: The result of the higher realms that is achieved by that is the result of nirvana, because there is no nirvana called other than the result of the higher realms.

original: kyi bsam pa mngon par mkhyen nas de kho na nyid gsung ba po bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa khur khur ba'i gang zag yod de rtag pa dang mi rtag par bdag mi smra'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: kyi bsam pa mngon par mkhyen nas de kho na nyid gsung ba po bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa khur khur ba'i gang zag yod de rtag pa dang mi rtag par bdag mi smra'o zhes pa'o //
translated: When the time came to ask about reality, the Bhagavān, the speaker of reality, directly understood the thoughts of those who had taken up the burden of the Bhagavān’s speech, saying, “I do not say the person is permanent or impermanent.”

original: de nyid bden te bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid bden te bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is true because it was spoken by the Bhagavān.

original: rmi lam gyi gnas skabs su sems kyi bag chags kyi gang zag ni rtag pa dang mi rtag par brjod par mi nus so //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi gnas skabs su sems kyi bag chags kyi gang zag ni rtag pa dang mi rtag par brjod par mi nus so //
translated: In the context of dreams, the person who is a mental latent imprint cannot be said to be permanent or impermanent.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung 'dis kla klo'i chos spangs nas sangs rgyas pa'i bye brag tu smra ba rnams byung bar gyur to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung 'dis kla klo'i chos spangs nas sangs rgyas pa'i bye brag tu smra ba rnams byung bar gyur to //
translated: By this speech of the Tathāgata, the barbarians abandoned their religion and the Buddhist Vaibhāṣikas arose.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos bstan pa thos te 'dir gang zag tu 'dzin pa yongs su spangs nas 'ga' zhig yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi lam la brten to //🔽mdo sde ba rnams la yang rdul phra rab tshogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi 'dzin pa yod de don du smra ba po 'di rnams kyi bsam pa ni gal te nam mkha'i khongs @249a * //
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos bstan pa thos te 'dir gang zag tu 'dzin pa yongs su spangs nas 'ga' zhig yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi lam la brten to // mdo sde ba rnams la yang rdul phra rab tshogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi 'dzin pa yod de don du smra ba po 'di rnams kyi bsam pa ni gal te nam mkha'i khongs @249a * //
translated: Then, having heard the teaching of the supramundane Dharma from the bodhisattvas, they abandon the apprehension of the person and some of them enter the path to perfect buddhahood.

original: su chud pa rgyu ba dang bcas pa dang rgyu ba med pa'i dngos po med na de'i tshe 'jig rten gsum zhes bya ba med par 'gyur zhing 'khor ba med na bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: su chud pa rgyu ba dang bcas pa dang rgyu ba med pa'i dngos po med na de'i tshe 'jig rten gsum zhes bya ba med par 'gyur zhing 'khor ba med na bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro med par 'gyur ro //
translated: The Sautrantikas also have the apprehension of the self of the collection of subtle particles. The intention of these proponents of objects is as follows. If the three worlds were not included within space, then the three worlds would not exist, and if samsara did not exist, then the happy and miserable destinies would not exist.

original: de bzhin du sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang med par 'gyur zhing mchog gi mya ngan las 'das pa yang med par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de bzhin du sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang med par 'gyur zhing mchog gi mya ngan las 'das pa yang med par 'gyur la /
translated: Likewise, the buddhas and bodhisattvas would not exist, and the supreme nirvana would not exist.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang sku gdung yang dag par ston pa med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang sku gdung yang dag par ston pa med par 'gyur te /
translated: The Blessed One also said, “The relics will not be revealed,

original: rdzas kyi nang du 'jug pa'i don med pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ste /
analyzed: rdzas kyi nang du 'jug pa'i don med pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ste /
translated: because there is no purpose in inserting them into a material object.”

original: de ltar de kho na nyid 'dri ba'i dus su de rnams kyi sems kyi bsam pa mkhyen nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar de kho na nyid 'dri ba'i dus su de rnams kyi sems kyi bsam pa mkhyen nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
translated: Thus, when the time came to inquire about reality, the Blessed One, knowing the thoughts in the minds of those present, said,

original: rdul phra rab tshogs pa'i bdag nyid skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang ldan pa tha ma'i lus yod de gang gi drin gyis yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyid dang mchog gi mya ngan las 'das pa chen por 'gyur ba'o zhes pa de
analyzed: rdul phra rab tshogs pa'i bdag nyid skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang ldan pa tha ma'i lus yod de gang gi drin gyis yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyid dang mchog gi mya ngan las 'das pa chen por 'gyur ba'o zhes pa de
translated: “There is a final body, which is the nature of an aggregation of atoms, endowed with the thirty-two marks of a great being, by whose kindness there is perfect buddhahood and the great supreme nirvāṇa.”

original: nyid bden te /
analyzed: nyid bden te /
translated: That is true,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis sku gdung yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis sku gdung yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the Blessed One revealed the relics.

original: de ltar rdul phra rab tshogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi lus kyi mthu thos nas rigs su smra ba dang sgrar smra ba dang dbang phyug tu smra ba dang byed pa por smra ba spangs nas sangs rgyas pa'i mdo sde pa rnams byung bar gyur to //
analyzed: de ltar rdul phra rab tshogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi lus kyi mthu thos nas rigs su smra ba dang sgrar smra ba dang dbang phyug tu smra ba dang byed pa por smra ba spangs nas sangs rgyas pa'i mdo sde pa rnams byung bar gyur to //
translated: Thus, having heard of the power of the body, which is the collection of atoms, the Buddhists, who are the followers of the sutras, arose, having abandoned the doctrines of the followers of Kapila, Kanada, Isvara, and the creator.

original: slar yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos bstan pa thos nas don gyi 'dzin pa de nyid spangs te 'ga' zhig yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi lam la brten pa byung bar gyur to //
analyzed: slar yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos bstan pa thos nas don gyi 'dzin pa de nyid spangs te 'ga' zhig yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi lam la brten pa byung bar gyur to //
translated: Again, having heard the teachings of the supramundane Dharma for the bodhisattvas, they abandoned the grasping of the meaning of that and some arose who relied on the path of the perfect Buddha.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa pa rnams la yang rnam par shes pa'i 'dzin pa yod de rnam par shes par smra ba po de rnams kyi bsam pa ni khams gsum po mtha' dag ni rnam par shes pa tsam mo //
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa pa rnams la yang rnam par shes pa'i 'dzin pa yod de rnam par shes par smra ba po de rnams kyi bsam pa ni khams gsum po mtha' dag ni rnam par shes pa tsam mo //
translated: The yogacarins also have the grasping of consciousness. The thought of those who are the proponents of consciousness is that the entire three realms is merely consciousness.

original: cha drug gi cha shas can gyi cha yin pa'i phyir rdul phra rab ces bya ba ni med do //
analyzed: cha drug gi cha shas can gyi cha yin pa'i phyir rdul phra rab ces bya ba ni med do //
translated: Because it is a part of the six parts, there is no such thing as an atom.

original: ji ltar rmi lam gyi gnas skabs na rdul phra rab kyi rdzas med kyang sems kyi snang ba tsam gyi don bya ba la rab tu 'jug pa de bzhin du sad pa'i gnas skabs su yod pa ma yin pa'i don gyis don du rab tu snang bar 'gyur
analyzed: ji ltar rmi lam gyi gnas skabs na rdul phra rab kyi rdzas med kyang sems kyi snang ba tsam gyi don bya ba la rab tu 'jug pa de bzhin du sad pa'i gnas skabs su yod pa ma yin pa'i don gyis don du rab tu snang bar 'gyur
translated: Just as in the dream state, although there are no substantial minute particles, yet the mere appearance of mind engages in the performance of actions, so in the waking state, although there are no external objects, the appearance of objects occurs.

original: te rab rib kyi dri mas nye bar bcom pa'i mig gis skra shad 'dzag pa dang gser gyi dung @249b bzhin no //
analyzed: te rab rib kyi dri mas nye bar bcom pa'i mig gis skra shad 'dzag pa dang gser gyi dung @249b bzhin no //
translated: For example, the eye damaged by the cataract of disease sees such things as falling hairs and double moons.

original: de ltar de kho na nyid 'dri ba'i dus su de rnams kyi sems kyi bsam pa mkhyen nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa khams gsum po 'di ni rnam par shes pa tsam ste rnam par shes pa la gzhan 'khor pa med do //
analyzed: de ltar de kho na nyid 'dri ba'i dus su de rnams kyi sems kyi bsam pa mkhyen nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa khams gsum po 'di ni rnam par shes pa tsam ste rnam par shes pa la gzhan 'khor pa med do //
translated: Thus, when the time came to question reality, the Lord, knowing the thoughts of their minds, said, “These three realms are consciousness only; apart from consciousness, there is no other world.”

original: 'jig rten pa'i rnam par shes pa 'gags pa las srid pa'i sa bon 'gag pa nyid de de'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i rnam par shes pa 'gags pa las srid pa'i sa bon 'gag pa nyid de de'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: The seed of existence ceases from the cessation of worldly consciousness, and therefore there is nirvana.

original: 'di nyid bden te bems po ma yin pa las bde ba dang sdug bsngal 'byung bar 'gyur gyi bems po las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di nyid bden te bems po ma yin pa las bde ba dang sdug bsngal 'byung bar 'gyur gyi bems po las ni ma yin no //
translated: This is true, for pleasure and pain arise from that which is not matter, not from matter.🔽What is called pleasure and pain is cyclic existence, and what is called nonexistence is nirvana.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba ste de med pa zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes pa ste de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung thos nas byed pa po dang bdag tu smra ba yongs su spangs te sangs rgyas pa'i
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba ste de med pa zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes pa ste de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung thos nas byed pa po dang bdag tu smra ba yongs su spangs te sangs rgyas pa'i
translated: Thus, having heard the speech of the Bhagavat, the proponents of an agent and self were abandoned and the Buddhists

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa pa rnams byung bar gyur to //
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa pa rnams byung bar gyur to //
translated: arose.

original: slar yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos bstan pa thos nas rnam par shes par smra ba yongs su spangs te 'ga' zhig yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi lam la brten pa 'byung bar gyur to //
analyzed: slar yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos bstan pa thos nas rnam par shes par smra ba yongs su spangs te 'ga' zhig yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi lam la brten pa 'byung bar gyur to //
translated: Again, having heard the teachings of the supramundane Dharma for the bodhisattvas, the proponents of consciousness were abandoned and some relied on the path of the perfect Buddha.

original: de bzhin du rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud rnams las /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud rnams las /
translated: Thus, in the yoginī tantras,

original: sgyu 'phrul chen mo drag chen mo //
analyzed: sgyu 'phrul chen mo drag chen mo //
translated: the Great Illusion, the Great Fierce One,🔽and so on,

original: 'byung dang sdud par byed pa mo //
analyzed: 'byung dang sdud par byed pa mo //
translated: She is the one who creates and withdraws.🔽

original: zhes pa ste /🔽de ltar sems can gyi bsam pa'i dbang gis bcom ldan 'das kyi chos bstan pa de ni bcom ldan 'das kyi mgrin pa dang rkan dang spyi bo dang so dang mchu las skyes pa nyi tshe ba'i sgras ma yin te gang gi phyir mtha' yas pa mtha' yas🔽pa'i sems can gyi skad nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes pa ste / de ltar sems can gyi bsam pa'i dbang gis bcom ldan 'das kyi chos bstan pa de ni bcom ldan 'das kyi mgrin pa dang rkan dang spyi bo dang so dang mchu las skyes pa nyi tshe ba'i sgras ma yin te gang gi phyir mtha' yas pa mtha' yas pa'i sems can gyi skad nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is the female who creates and dissolves.🔽Thus, the teaching of the Dharma by the Lord is not by means of a limited sound that arises from the throat, palate, head, teeth, or lips of the Lord, because the languages of sentient beings are infinite and infinite.

original: 'dir nyi tshe ba'i ngag gis yin na cig car mtha' yas pa mtha' yas pa'i sems can rnams la rang rang gi skad gzhan gyis chos bstan par bya bar bskal pa mtha' yas pas kyang mi nus so //
analyzed: 'dir nyi tshe ba'i ngag gis yin na cig car mtha' yas pa mtha' yas pa'i sems can rnams la rang rang gi skad gzhan gyis chos bstan par bya bar bskal pa mtha' yas pas kyang mi nus so //
translated: If it were by means of a limited speech, it would not be possible even in infinite eons to teach the Dharma by means of each individual language to the infinite and infinite sentient beings simultaneously.

original: de'i phyir sems can gyi bsam pa'i dbang gis bcom ldan 'das kyi gsud du mi 'gyur zhing sems can gyi bsam pa'i dbang gis bcom ldan 'das kyang 'dzin pa dang bcas par 'gyur te 'dzin pa 'dzin pa'i phyir 'khor ba par 'gyur ro //🔽de'i phyir sems can rnams kyi skye ba gzhan gyi bag chags kyi stobs kyis rmi lam du ma skyes pa'i lus @250a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems can gyi bsam pa'i dbang gis bcom ldan 'das kyi gsud du mi 'gyur zhing sems can gyi bsam pa'i dbang gis bcom ldan 'das kyang 'dzin pa dang bcas par 'gyur te 'dzin pa 'dzin pa'i phyir 'khor ba par 'gyur ro // de'i phyir sems can rnams kyi skye ba gzhan gyi bag chags kyi stobs kyis rmi lam du ma skyes pa'i lus @250a * //
translated: Therefore, by the power of the thoughts of sentient beings, the Bhagavat would not be free from excrement, and by the power of the thoughts of sentient beings, the Bhagavat would be one who grasps, because he would grasp grasping.

original: bzhin du bcom ldan 'das kyi sku'i snang ba dang gsung gi snang bar 'gyur ro //🔽ji ltar rmi lam du slob ma rnams kyis mkhan po mthong nas the tshom gyi don 'dri bar byed cing mkhan pos kyang slob ma rnams kyi the tshom gyi don the tshom med bar byed kyang de na mkhan po med de slob ma rnams kyi sems kyi bag
analyzed: bzhin du bcom ldan 'das kyi sku'i snang ba dang gsung gi snang bar 'gyur ro // ji ltar rmi lam du slob ma rnams kyis mkhan po mthong nas the tshom gyi don 'dri bar byed cing mkhan pos kyang slob ma rnams kyi the tshom gyi don the tshom med bar byed kyang de na mkhan po med de slob ma rnams kyi sems kyi bag
translated: Therefore, by the power of the habitual tendencies of the other births of sentient beings, the appearance of the body of the Bhagavat and the appearance of his speech would occur, like an unborn body in a dream.

original: chags kyi snang ba'o //
analyzed: chags kyi snang ba'o //
translated: Just as in a dream, students see their preceptor and ask him about the meaning of a doubt, and the preceptor, without doubt, removes the doubt of the students, but there is no preceptor there, because it is the appearance of the habitual tendencies of the minds of the students.

original: de bzhin du sems can bsod nams dang ldan pa rnams kyi rang gi sems kyi snang ba ste bcom ldan 'das ni skyes pa ma yin zhing 'gags pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems can bsod nams dang ldan pa rnams kyi rang gi sems kyi snang ba ste bcom ldan 'das ni skyes pa ma yin zhing 'gags pa ma yin no //
translated: Likewise, the appearances in the minds of sentient beings who possess merit are the Bhagavān. The Bhagavān is not born and does not cease.

original: rgyu 'dis sangs rgyas pa bzhi bo rnams kyi bag chags kyi stobs kyis bcom ldan 'das kyis gang zag tu smra ba rnams la gang zag mi rtag par bsgom pa gsungs so //🔽don du smra ba rnams la sa la sogs pa'i zad par bsgom pa dang rnam par shes par smra ba rnams la rnam par rig pa tsam gyi ting nge 'dzin dang dbu ma pa rnams la rmi lam lta bur 'gyur pa med cing gnyis su med pa'i ye
analyzed: rgyu 'dis sangs rgyas pa bzhi bo rnams kyi bag chags kyi stobs kyis bcom ldan 'das kyis gang zag tu smra ba rnams la gang zag mi rtag par bsgom pa gsungs so // don du smra ba rnams la sa la sogs pa'i zad par bsgom pa dang rnam par shes par smra ba rnams la rnam par rig pa tsam gyi ting nge 'dzin dang dbu ma pa rnams la rmi lam lta bur 'gyur pa med cing gnyis su med pa'i ye
translated: For this reason, the Bhagavān taught the meditation on the impermanence of the person to those who propound the person, by the power of the predispositions of the four Buddhist schools.

original: shes bsgom pa ste de ltar gang zag la bdag med pa dang chos la bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: shes bsgom pa ste de ltar gang zag la bdag med pa dang chos la bdag med pa'o //
translated: He taught the meditation on the extinction of earth and so on to the proponents of objects. He taught the samādhi of mere representation to the proponents of consciousness. He taught the meditation on the nonexistence of dreams and nondual wisdom to the Mādhyamikas. Thus, there is the selflessness of persons and the selflessness of phenomena.

original: bye brag tu smra ba dang mdo sde pa dang rnal 'byor spyod pa pa rnams kyi lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba dang mdo sde pa dang rnal 'byor spyod pa pa rnams kyi lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: The Nirvana with Remainder of the Vaibhasikas, Sautrantikas, and Yogacarins.

original: dbu ma pa rnams kyi lhag ma dang bral ba rab tu mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ste rgyu dang 'bras bu 'gags pa'i phyir shin tu gnyid log pa dang sad pa'i gnas skabs dang bral ba rmi lam dang bzhi pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dbu ma pa rnams kyi lhag ma dang bral ba rab tu mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ste rgyu dang 'bras bu 'gags pa'i phyir shin tu gnyid log pa dang sad pa'i gnas skabs dang bral ba rmi lam dang bzhi pa lta bu'o //
translated: The Nirvana without Remainder of the Madhyamikas, who are free from the states of deep sleep and waking, like the dream state and the fourth state, because of the cessation of cause and effect.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis so sor rtogs pa'i ye shes kyi bstod pa las tshigs su bcad pa bcu pas gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis so sor rtogs pa'i ye shes kyi bstod pa las tshigs su bcad pa bcu pas gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
translated: The Blessed One has said in the Stotra of the Gnostics:

original: lhag ma kun las rnam grol zhing //
analyzed: lhag ma kun las rnam grol zhing //
translated: “Free from all remainder,

original: nam mkha'i lam la rab gnas pa //
analyzed: nam mkha'i lam la rab gnas pa //
translated: Dwelling in the path of space,

original: yid bzhin nor bu chen po 'chang //
analyzed: yid bzhin nor bu chen po 'chang //
translated: Holding the great wish-fulfilling gem,

original: khyab bdag rin chen kun gyi mchog / ces pa ste de'i phyir phyogs su 'dzin pa dang bral zhing lhag ma lus pa med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi'o //
analyzed: khyab bdag rin chen kun gyi mchog / ces pa ste de'i phyir phyogs su 'dzin pa dang bral zhing lhag ma lus pa med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi'o //
translated: Therefore, the nirvana of the perfect Buddha is free from grasping at extremes and is without remainder.

original: ci ste rmi lam gyi gnas skabs su bems po'i chos med par bems po ma yin pa'i snang ba mthong bar 'gyur te sems kyi bag chags kyi dbang gis so //
analyzed: ci ste rmi lam gyi gnas skabs su bems po'i chos med par bems po ma yin pa'i snang ba mthong bar 'gyur te sems kyi bag chags kyi dbang gis so //
translated: If, in the state of dreaming, non-physical appearances are seen without physical phenomena, it is due to the power of mental imprints.

original: sad pa'i gnas skabs su ni bems po'i chos med par @250b bems bo ma yin pa'i snang ba mthong bar mi 'gyur te me long la gzugs brnyan bzhin no //
analyzed: sad pa'i gnas skabs su ni bems po'i chos med par @250b bems bo ma yin pa'i snang ba mthong bar mi 'gyur te me long la gzugs brnyan bzhin no //
translated: In the state of waking, non-physical appearances are not seen without physical phenomena, like a reflection in a mirror.

original: gnas skabs 'di la rnal 'byor pa'i bsgom pa'i snang ba yang rnam pa gnyis su snang bar 'gyur te chu'i zla ba bzhin du chos can yod na chos rnams so //
analyzed: gnas skabs 'di la rnal 'byor pa'i bsgom pa'i snang ba yang rnam pa gnyis su snang bar 'gyur te chu'i zla ba bzhin du chos can yod na chos rnams so //
translated: In this state, the appearances of the yogi's meditation also appear in two ways, like the moon in water, with phenomena existing as subjects.

original: gnas skabs de la rnal 'byor pas bems po'i chos med par rmi lam dang mtshungs pa bems po'i chos ma yin pa brtags ba ma yin pa skyes ba ma yin pa stong pa ma yin pa sems ma yin pa nam mkha' la mthong bar 'gyur pa 'di nyid
analyzed: gnas skabs de la rnal 'byor pas bems po'i chos med par rmi lam dang mtshungs pa bems po'i chos ma yin pa brtags ba ma yin pa skyes ba ma yin pa stong pa ma yin pa sems ma yin pa nam mkha' la mthong bar 'gyur pa 'di nyid
translated: At that time, the yogi will see in space this very non-existence of matter, which is like a dream, which is not an imputed non-matter, which is not a produced non-matter, which is not an empty non-matter, which is not a non-matter mind.

original: ni rab tu ma grags te gang gi phyir chos can yod na chos rnam par dpyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ni rab tu ma grags te gang gi phyir chos can yod na chos rnam par dpyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is not well known because when there is a phenomenon, the attributes are analyzed.

original: sgyu ma lta bur de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa rnams bems po'i chos med par bems po ma yin pa'i snang ba ting nge 'dzin gyis mthong bar mi 'gyur ro zhes pa 'dir 'ga' zhig gi bsam pa 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bur de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa rnams bems po'i chos med par bems po ma yin pa'i snang ba ting nge 'dzin gyis mthong bar mi 'gyur ro zhes pa 'dir 'ga' zhig gi bsam pa 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Some may think that the Tathagata's statements about things being illusion-like do not mean that the appearance of non-matter, which is not a matter phenomenon, is seen by concentration.

original: de'i phyir brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be explained.

original: 'dir bems po'i sems kyi bag chags la mngon par dga' ba rnams kyis brjod par bya ba gang yin pa sad pa'i gnas skabs su bems po'i chos med par bems po ma yin pa'i snang ba mthong bar mi 'gyur bde ni ma yin te gang gi phyir pra🔽phab pa'i me long la bems po'i chos med par bems po ma yin pa'i snang ba yang dag par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir bems po'i sems kyi bag chags la mngon par dga' ba rnams kyis brjod par bya ba gang yin pa sad pa'i gnas skabs su bems po'i chos med par bems po ma yin pa'i snang ba mthong bar mi 'gyur bde ni ma yin te gang gi phyir pra phab pa'i me long la bems po'i chos med par bems po ma yin pa'i snang ba yang dag par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, it is not the case that what is to be expressed is not seen as a non-material appearance in the waking state, in the absence of material habitual tendencies of the mind.🔽Because a non-material appearance is seen in a mirror that is not a material thing, due to the power of the blessing of the mantra and deity.

original: ji ltar gzhon nu mas pra phab pa'i me long la sngags dang lha'i byin brlabs kyi stobs kyis 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i chos rnams kyi bems po ma yin pa snang bar 'gyur te 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar
analyzed: ji ltar gzhon nu mas pra phab pa'i me long la sngags dang lha'i byin brlabs kyi stobs kyis 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i chos rnams kyi bems po ma yin pa snang bar 'gyur te 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar
translated: Just as in a mirror that is not a material thing, a non-material appearance is seen due to the power of the blessing of the mantra and deity, so too in the mirror of the mind, a non-material appearance is seen due to the power of the blessing of the mantra and deity.

original: byung ba'i bems po'i chos de rnams me long la mngon par phyogs par 'gyur pa yang ma yin la bems po'i chos de rnams med par me long la bems po ma yin pa'i snang ba med pa yang ma yin zhing chos de rnams gzhon nu mas bsams pa
analyzed: byung ba'i bems po'i chos de rnams me long la mngon par phyogs par 'gyur pa yang ma yin la bems po'i chos de rnams med par me long la bems po ma yin pa'i snang ba med pa yang ma yin zhing chos de rnams gzhon nu mas bsams pa
translated: Those material phenomena that arise do not appear in the mirror, and without those material phenomena, the non-material appearance does not appear in the mirror.

original: yang ma yin no //
analyzed: yang ma yin no //
translated: Those phenomena are not imagined by the young woman.

original: de bzhin du rnal 'byor pas rang gi sems kyi byin brlabs kyi stobs kyis nam mkha'i khams la bems po khams gsum pa med par bems po ma yin pa'i snang ba mthong bar 'gyur ro //🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis sgrub thabs kyi le'u las tshigs su bcad pa brgya dgu bcu rtsa brgyad @251a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnal 'byor pas rang gi sems kyi byin brlabs kyi stobs kyis nam mkha'i khams la bems po khams gsum pa med par bems po ma yin pa'i snang ba mthong bar 'gyur ro // bcom ldan 'das kyis sgrub thabs kyi le'u las tshigs su bcad pa brgya dgu bcu rtsa brgyad @251a * //
translated: In the same way, the yogin, by the power of the blessing of his own mind, sees the non-material appearance in the realm of space, without the material three realms.

original: pas gsungs pa /
analyzed: pas gsungs pa /
translated: The Blessed One taught in the Sādhana Chapter with 198 verses:

original: phyag rgya sgyu ma'i rjes su mthun pa yid dang nam mkha' la ni me long dag la gzugs bzhin te //
analyzed: phyag rgya sgyu ma'i rjes su mthun pa yid dang nam mkha' la ni me long dag la gzugs bzhin te //
translated: In accordance with the illusion of the seal, in the mind and space, like forms in a mirror,

original: 'jig rten gsum po snang bar byed cing dri med glog dang mtshungs pa'i 'od zer du ma 'phro bar byed //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum po snang bar byed cing dri med glog dang mtshungs pa'i 'od zer du ma 'phro bar byed //
translated: It radiates many rays of light, which illuminate the three worlds and are like stainless lightning.

original: phyi dang lus la dbyer med yul dang rnam par bral ba snang ba tsam ni mkha' la gnas pa yi //
analyzed: phyi dang lus la dbyer med yul dang rnam par bral ba snang ba tsam ni mkha' la gnas pa yi //
translated: It is indivisible from the external and the internal, is free from objects, is mere appearance, and abides in space.

original: sems la sems kyi rang bzhin 'khyud pa gang zhig 'gro ba du ma'i gzugs can de ni gcig pu'o zhes pa ste /
analyzed: sems la sems kyi rang bzhin 'khyud pa gang zhig 'gro ba du ma'i gzugs can de ni gcig pu'o zhes pa ste /
translated: The mind embraces the nature of the mind, and it is the one that has the form of many beings.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung 'di'i phyir bems po'i chos med par bems po ma yin pa'i chos snang ba rnal 'byor pas mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung 'di'i phyir bems po'i chos med par bems po ma yin pa'i chos snang ba rnal 'byor pas mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of this statement of the Blessed One, the yogin sees the appearance of the non-material dharma without the material dharma.

original: ci ste gzhon nu mas bra phab pa'i me long la snang ba mthong ba gang yin pa de ni slob dpon gyi drin gyis yin te gang gi phyir gzhon nu ma la slob dpon gyis sngags dang lha'i byin gyis brlab pa byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci ste gzhon nu mas bra phab pa'i me long la snang ba mthong ba gang yin pa de ni slob dpon gyi drin gyis yin te gang gi phyir gzhon nu ma la slob dpon gyis sngags dang lha'i byin gyis brlab pa byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is argued that what is seen in a mirror drawn by a young woman is due to the grace of the teacher, because the teacher has performed the mantra and deity consecration for the young woman,

original: 'dir gzhon nu ma la slob dpon gyis sngags dang lha'i byin gyis brlab pa byas so //
analyzed: 'dir gzhon nu ma la slob dpon gyis sngags dang lha'i byin gyis brlab pa byas so //
translated: Here, the master performs the mantra and deity consecration for the young woman.

original: des na byin gyis brlab pa'i dbang gis gzhon nu mas pra phab pa'i me long la snang ba mthong bar 'gyur gyi sngags dang lha'i byin brlabs dang bral bas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des na byin gyis brlab pa'i dbang gis gzhon nu mas pra phab pa'i me long la snang ba mthong bar 'gyur gyi sngags dang lha'i byin brlabs dang bral bas ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, by the power of consecration, the young woman sees the reflection in the mirror that is the object of the augury, but not due to the mantra and deity consecration.

original: de'i phyir bla ma'i bka'i drin gyis rnal 'byor pas khams gsum par snang ba tsam nam mkha'i khams la mthong bar 'gyur ro zhes pa 'dir bka' la chags pa 'ga' zhig gis bsam pa 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bla ma'i bka'i drin gyis rnal 'byor pas khams gsum par snang ba tsam nam mkha'i khams la mthong bar 'gyur ro zhes pa 'dir bka' la chags pa 'ga' zhig gis bsam pa 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, some who are attached to the words of the guru will think that by the kindness of the guru’s words, the yogi sees the mere appearances of the three realms in the element of space.

original: de'i phyir brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, I will explain this.

original: 'dir rmongs pa rnams kyis brjod par bya ba gang yin pa bla ma'i bka' drin gyis gzhon nu ma la sngags dang lha'i byin brlabs su 'gyur pa de ni ma yin te gang gi phyir slob dpon la pra phab pa'i me long la snang ba med pa'i phyir
analyzed: 'dir rmongs pa rnams kyis brjod par bya ba gang yin pa bla ma'i bka' drin gyis gzhon nu ma la sngags dang lha'i byin brlabs su 'gyur pa de ni ma yin te gang gi phyir slob dpon la pra phab pa'i me long la snang ba med pa'i phyir
translated: Here, the explanation of the ignorant is not that by the kindness of the guru’s words, the young woman has the mantra and deity consecration, because the master does not see the reflection in the mirror of the augury.

original: ro // 'dir gal te slob dpon gyi bka' drin gyis gzhon nu ma la sngags dang lha'i byin gyis brlabs par 'gyur na de'i tshe slob dpon la yang byin gyis brlabs pa de nyid ci ste mi 'gyur gang gis na gzhon nu ma la byin gyis brlab pa byas nas
analyzed: ro // 'dir gal te slob dpon gyi bka' drin gyis gzhon nu ma la sngags dang lha'i byin gyis brlabs par 'gyur na de'i tshe slob dpon la yang byin gyis brlabs pa de nyid ci ste mi 'gyur gang gis na gzhon nu ma la byin gyis brlab pa byas nas
translated: If, through the kindness of the master, the girl is empowered by the mantra and the deity, then why wouldn’t the master himself be empowered?

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i lkog tu gyur pa'i shes pa 'dri bar byed /
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i lkog tu gyur pa'i shes pa 'dri bar byed /
translated: Why would he ask the girl about the knowledge of the past, future, and present that is hidden from him?

original: gal te de nyid la byin gyis brlabs pa yod na de nyid kyis pra phab pa'i me long la de'i snang @251b pa mthong nas rang nyid kho nas rjod par byed de de ltar yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te de nyid la byin gyis brlabs pa yod na de nyid kyis pra phab pa'i me long la de'i snang @251b pa mthong nas rang nyid kho nas rjod par byed de de ltar yang ma yin no //
translated: If he himself is empowered, then he himself would see the reflection of the girl who is empowered and who is performing the divination, and he himself would speak. But that is not the case.

original: de'i phyir slob dpon gyi bka' drin gyis gzhon nu ma la snang do brjod par mi nus te de bzhin du rnal 'byor pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir slob dpon gyi bka' drin gyis gzhon nu ma la snang do brjod par mi nus te de bzhin du rnal 'byor pa la yang ngo //
translated: Therefore, the master cannot say that the girl is empowered by the kindness of the master and that she speaks.

original: 'on kyang gzhon nu ma la sngags dang lha'i byin gyis brlabs par 'gyur ba de la rgyu yod de rgyu gang gis gzhon nu ma la dbang po gnyis yang dag par phrad pa las 'pho ba'i bde ba nye bar thob pa med pa'i rgyu des byin gyis brlabs🔽par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang gzhon nu ma la sngags dang lha'i byin gyis brlabs par 'gyur ba de la rgyu yod de rgyu gang gis gzhon nu ma la dbang po gnyis yang dag par phrad pa las 'pho ba'i bde ba nye bar thob pa med pa'i rgyu des byin gyis brlabs par 'gyur ro //
translated: But there is a reason why a young woman is blessed by mantra and deity. By what reason? By the reason that a young woman does not obtain the bliss of emission from the perfect joining of the two organs, by that reason she is blessed.

original: 'jig rten du yang rab tu grags te gzhon nu ma'i bde ba bzhin zhes so //
analyzed: 'jig rten du yang rab tu grags te gzhon nu ma'i bde ba bzhin zhes so //
translated: It is also well known in the world, as in the saying, “Like the bliss of a young woman.”

original: rgyu des na gzhon nu mas sngags dang lha'i byin gyis brlabs pa'i stobs kyis pra phab pa'i me long la snang ba mthong bar 'gyur gyi dbang po gnyis kyi bde ba nye bar thob pa'i na chung gzhan gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu des na gzhon nu mas sngags dang lha'i byin gyis brlabs pa'i stobs kyis pra phab pa'i me long la snang ba mthong bar 'gyur gyi dbang po gnyis kyi bde ba nye bar thob pa'i na chung gzhan gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: By that reason, a young woman sees the reflection in the mirror of a mirror divination through the power of the blessing of mantra and deity, but not another young woman who obtains the bliss of the two organs.

original: gzhon nu lhas byin gyis brlabs pa dang lhas byin gyis brlabs pa'i dar ma dang na chung dar la bab pas kyang mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhon nu lhas byin gyis brlabs pa dang lhas byin gyis brlabs pa'i dar ma dang na chung dar la bab pas kyang mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: A young man, a middle-aged man, and a young woman blessed by Devadatta and blessed by Devadatta will also see it.

original: de bzhin du rnal 'byor pa yang mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i bde ba goms pa'i dbang gis phyi rol gyi 'pho ba'i bde ba spangs pa'i phyir gzhon nu ma'i gnas skabs gzhan du gyur pas rang gi sems kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i stobs kyis 'das pa dang ma
analyzed: de bzhin du rnal 'byor pa yang mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i bde ba goms pa'i dbang gis phyi rol gyi 'pho ba'i bde ba spangs pa'i phyir gzhon nu ma'i gnas skabs gzhan du gyur pas rang gi sems kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i stobs kyis 'das pa dang ma
translated: Likewise, the yogī, by the power of being accustomed to the supreme, unchanging bliss, abandons external, migrating bliss, and by transforming the state of the young maiden, through the power of his mind’s blessing, he sees the past,

original: 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba mthong bar 'gyur gyi bla ma'i bka'i drin gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba mthong bar 'gyur gyi bla ma'i bka'i drin gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: the future, and the present, but not through the kindness of the guru’s words.

original: ci ste mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i bde ba goms pa med cing tshangs par spyod pa med kyang ltas du ma ston par byed pa ma yin nam de'i phyir tshangs par spyod pa med kyang sngags dang lhas byin gyis brlabs par 'gyur te rnam pa gzhan du na
analyzed: ci ste mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i bde ba goms pa med cing tshangs par spyod pa med kyang ltas du ma ston par byed pa ma yin nam de'i phyir tshangs par spyod pa med kyang sngags dang lhas byin gyis brlabs par 'gyur te rnam pa gzhan du na
translated: “ But if one is not accustomed to the supreme, unchanging bliss and is not celibate, then does he not display many omens? Therefore, even without celibacy, he will be blessed by mantra and the deity. Otherwise,

original: de dag ci ltar ltas ston par byed ces pa 'ga' zhig gi bsam pa 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag ci ltar ltas ston par byed ces pa 'ga' zhig gi bsam pa 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: how would they display omens?” Some may think this.

original: de'i phyir brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, I will explain.

original: 'dir byis pa rnams kyis gang brjod pa tshangs par spyod pa med pa rnams la sngags dang lha'i byin gyis brlabs par 'gyur pa de ni ma yin te gang gi phyir skar rtsis goms pa'i dbang gis don yang dag par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir byis pa rnams kyis gang brjod pa tshangs par spyod pa med pa rnams la sngags dang lha'i byin gyis brlabs par 'gyur pa de ni ma yin te gang gi phyir skar rtsis goms pa'i dbang gis don yang dag par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, what the foolish say is not the case, that the blessings of mantra and deity are for those who do not practice pure conduct, because through the power of familiarity with astrology, they see the truth.

original: 'dir ltas shes pa gang yin pa de nyid ni skar rtsis kyi yan lag sems can thams cad kyi thun mong ba ste /
analyzed: 'dir ltas shes pa gang yin pa de nyid ni skar rtsis kyi yan lag sems can thams cad kyi thun mong ba ste /
translated: Here, that which is known as astrology is the common part of all sentient beings.

original: @252a * // man ngag gi dbang dang rtsis kyi dbang gis skye ba dang nyams pa la sogs pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes so //
analyzed: @252a * // man ngag gi dbang dang rtsis kyi dbang gis skye ba dang nyams pa la sogs pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes so //
translated: Through the power of instruction and the power of calculation, one knows exactly what arises and degenerates.

original: gzhan dag gis rna ba'i sha za mo bsgrubs te des rjod par byed do //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis rna ba'i sha za mo bsgrubs te des rjod par byed do //
translated: Others accomplish the ear-flesh-eating ghost and it speaks.

original: gzhan dag gis zhing skyong rnams bsgrubs te de rnams kyis de rnams kyi sems la gang cung zad 'phro ba rjod par byed do //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis zhing skyong rnams bsgrubs te de rnams kyis de rnams kyi sems la gang cung zad 'phro ba rjod par byed do //
translated: Others accomplish the field protectors and they speak whatever thought moves in their minds.

original: gzhan dag gis ma mo rnams bsgrubs shing phab ste gzhan gyi lus la rab tu zhugs nas rjod par byed do //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis ma mo rnams bsgrubs shing phab ste gzhan gyi lus la rab tu zhugs nas rjod par byed do //
translated: Others, having accomplished the mātṛs, cause them to descend and enter the bodies of others, who then speak.

original: gzhan dag gis klu'i rgyal po rnams bsgrubs te de rnams kyis dus kyis zin pa'i lus la rab tu zhugs nas rjod par byed do //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis klu'i rgyal po rnams bsgrubs te de rnams kyis dus kyis zin pa'i lus la rab tu zhugs nas rjod par byed do //
translated: Others accomplish the nāga kings, who enter the bodies of those whose time has come and speak.

original: gzhan dag gis bran pho bsgrubs te de ni sgrub pa po rnams kyi tshig gis sems can gyi lus la zhugs nas sems can rnams la co 'dri bar byed do //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis bran pho bsgrubs te de ni sgrub pa po rnams kyi tshig gis sems can gyi lus la zhugs nas sems can rnams la co 'dri bar byed do //
translated: Others accomplish male servants, who, by the words of the adepts, enter the bodies of sentient beings and make them laugh.

original: gzhan dag gis mkha' 'gro ma dang srin po la sogs pa rnams bsgrubs te de rnams kyis sems can rnams kyi khrag 'thung bar byed do //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis mkha' 'gro ma dang srin po la sogs pa rnams bsgrubs te de rnams kyis sems can rnams kyi khrag 'thung bar byed do //
translated: Others accomplish ḍākinīs, rākṣasas, and so on, who drink the blood of sentient beings.

original: gzhan dag gis 'byung po rnams bsgrubs te de dag sems can rnams kyi lus la zhugs nas 'dar ba dang g-yo ba la sogs pa byas te 'gro'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis 'byung po rnams bsgrubs te de dag sems can rnams kyi lus la zhugs nas 'dar ba dang g-yo ba la sogs pa byas te 'gro'o //
translated: Others accomplish bhūtas, who enter the bodies of sentient beings and make them tremble, move, and so on.

original: gzhan dag gis bgegs dang log 'dren rnams bsgrubs te de rnams kyis sems can rnams la bgegs byed do //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis bgegs dang log 'dren rnams bsgrubs te de rnams kyis sems can rnams la bgegs byed do //
translated: Others, having accomplished the obstructors and misleaders, cause them to obstruct sentient beings.

original: gzhan dag gis zhi ba'i lha rnams bsgrubs te de rnams kyis sems can rnams la srung bar byed do //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis zhi ba'i lha rnams bsgrubs te de rnams kyis sems can rnams la srung bar byed do //
translated: Others, having accomplished the peaceful gods, cause them to protect sentient beings.

original: gzhan dag gis 'dod pa'i lha rnams bsgrubs te de rnams kyis sems can rnams 'dod pas myos pa dang khu ba 'pho bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis 'dod pa'i lha rnams bsgrubs te de rnams kyis sems can rnams 'dod pas myos pa dang khu ba 'pho bar bya'o //
translated: Others, having accomplished the gods of the desire realm, cause them to intoxicate sentient beings with desire and cause them to emit semen.

original: gzhan dag gis gdug pa'i lha gzhan rnams bsgrubs te 'ga' zhig gis rengs par byed do //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis gdug pa'i lha gzhan rnams bsgrubs te 'ga' zhig gis rengs par byed do //
translated: Others, having accomplished other evil gods, cause some to be paralyzed.

original: 'ga' zhig gis rmongs pa dang 'ga' zhig gis bskrad pa dang 'ga' zhig gis dbye ba dang 'ga' zhig gis gsad pa'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gis rmongs pa dang 'ga' zhig gis bskrad pa dang 'ga' zhig gis dbye ba dang 'ga' zhig gis gsad pa'o //
translated: Some cause confusion, some cause expulsion, some cause division, and some cause killing.

original: 'ga' zhig gis shing dang mtshan ma rtsad nas 'byin par byed de de lta bu la sogs pa nye bar 'tshe ba'i las phra mo du ma rnams mi snang ba'i gzugs kyis byed do //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gis shing dang mtshan ma rtsad nas 'byin par byed de de lta bu la sogs pa nye bar 'tshe ba'i las phra mo du ma rnams mi snang ba'i gzugs kyis byed do //
translated: Some cause trees and signs to be uprooted. In this way, many subtle harmful actions are done by invisible forms.

original: gang dag gis gdug pa'i lha bdud kyi ris rnams bsgrubs pa de rnams 'phral du yid ches par byed pa'i yongs su shes pa phra mo 'di rnams kyis rmongs pa rnams kyi bla mar 'gyur zhing chos ston par byed de 'dod pa dang @252b dug dang mig sman
analyzed: gang dag gis gdug pa'i lha bdud kyi ris rnams bsgrubs pa de rnams 'phral du yid ches par byed pa'i yongs su shes pa phra mo 'di rnams kyis rmongs pa rnams kyi bla mar 'gyur zhing chos ston par byed de 'dod pa dang @252b dug dang mig sman
translated: Those who have accomplished the evil gods and demons become gurus for the confused through these subtle understandings that immediately inspire confidence and teach the Dharma.

original: med pa rnams kyi ye shes yid ches pa ni snying po'o //
analyzed: med pa rnams kyi ye shes yid ches pa ni snying po'o //
translated: The essence of the teachings is the knowledge that inspires confidence in those without desire, poison, or eye medicine.

original: gang la 'dod pa'i bka' med pa dang dug dang mig sman med pa'i bka' med pa la mig sman med pa ni phra mo dang bde 'byung dang nus pa can te mngon sum dang lkog tu gyur pa shes pa'i bka' med pa de ni mkhas pa yin yang
analyzed: gang la 'dod pa'i bka' med pa dang dug dang mig sman med pa'i bka' med pa la mig sman med pa ni phra mo dang bde 'byung dang nus pa can te mngon sum dang lkog tu gyur pa shes pa'i bka' med pa de ni mkhas pa yin yang
translated: Those without the teachings of desire, poison, and eye medicine are without eye medicine, subtle, blissful, and powerful. Even the wise do not have the teachings of direct perception and the hidden,

original: phyugs so // sems can thams cad la phan par byed pa la dga' ba bsod snyoms la rgyu zhing gcig pu grogs med par gnas pa ni rang gi don nyams pa ste rang don nyams pa rmongs pa nyid ces 'jig rten du yang rab tu grags so //
analyzed: phyugs so // sems can thams cad la phan par byed pa la dga' ba bsod snyoms la rgyu zhing gcig pu grogs med par gnas pa ni rang gi don nyams pa ste rang don nyams pa rmongs pa nyid ces 'jig rten du yang rab tu grags so //
translated: The cowherd, who is devoted to the welfare of all beings, goes for alms, lives alone, and has no companion. He is one who has lost his own welfare. The loss of one’s own welfare is well known in the world as delusion.

original: de'i phyir mchog gi dbang phyug gi bka' longs spyod dang grol ba'i 'bras bu rab tu ster ba 'di ni brgyud pa'i rim pas 'ongs pa ste bla ma'i drin gyis thob bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir mchog gi dbang phyug gi bka' longs spyod dang grol ba'i 'bras bu rab tu ster ba 'di ni brgyud pa'i rim pas 'ongs pa ste bla ma'i drin gyis thob bo //
translated: Therefore, this teaching of the Supreme Lord, which bestows the fruits of enjoyment and liberation, has come down through a lineage and is obtained through the grace of the guru.

original: mchog gi dbang phyug gam thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa //
analyzed: mchog gi dbang phyug gam thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa //
translated: The Supreme Lord, the Omniscient One, has said:

original: bla ma lta bu'i ma med cing //
analyzed: bla ma lta bu'i ma med cing //
translated: There is no mother like the guru,

original: bla ma lta bu'i pha med de //
analyzed: bla ma lta bu'i pha med de //
translated: and there is no father like the guru.🔽By whom is one liberated from the great fear

original: 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho rgal dka' ba //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho rgal dka' ba //
translated: of the difficult-to-cross ocean of saṃsāra?

original: 'jigs pa che las gang gis bsgral zhes pa dang / bla ma gang gis slob ma la //
analyzed: 'jigs pa che las gang gis bsgral zhes pa dang / bla ma gang gis slob ma la //
translated: And: By what guru

original: dpag tshad brgya nas bslab pa sbyin //
analyzed: dpag tshad brgya nas bslab pa sbyin //
translated: is the disciple taught even from a hundred leagues away?

original: longs spyod grol ster bslab pa gang //
analyzed: longs spyod grol ster bslab pa gang //
translated: What is the training that bestows enjoyment and liberation?

original: de ni thar pa ster byed do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de ni thar pa ster byed do zhes pa'o //
translated: That is what grants liberation.

original: de ltar rnam pa du ma rnams kyis chags pa chen pos zil gyis mnan pa'i rmongs pa de rnams yongs su shes pa phran tshogs kyis sad par byas nas de rnams rjes su 'dzin par byed de bka' de yang ster bar byed do //
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa du ma rnams kyis chags pa chen pos zil gyis mnan pa'i rmongs pa de rnams yongs su shes pa phran tshogs kyis sad par byas nas de rnams rjes su 'dzin par byed de bka' de yang ster bar byed do //
translated: Thus, those fools who are overcome by great attachment, having been awakened by the small amount of knowledge they have, are taken care of by him, and he grants them that teaching.

original: de rnams kyang mgu ba chen por 'gyur te bdag cag rnams bla ma'i drin gyis grol lo //
analyzed: de rnams kyang mgu ba chen por 'gyur te bdag cag rnams bla ma'i drin gyis grol lo //
translated: They become greatly pleased, thinking, “We are liberated by the grace of the guru!”

original: da ni bdag cag gis thams cad byas te mi gtsang ba bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: da ni bdag cag gis thams cad byas te mi gtsang ba bza' bar bya'o //
translated: “Now we have done everything. We will eat impure substances!

original: rigs ma yin pa la mngon par bgrod par bya'o //
analyzed: rigs ma yin pa la mngon par bgrod par bya'o //
translated: We will engage in sex with those of the wrong caste!

original: srog gcod pa dang brdzun du smra ba dang ma byin par len pa dang chang btung ba la sogs pa bya'o //
analyzed: srog gcod pa dang brdzun du smra ba dang ma byin par len pa dang chang btung ba la sogs pa bya'o //
translated: We will kill, lie, steal, drink alcohol, and so on!”

original: de ltar bdud kyi las rnam pa du ma rnams 'dir dngos grub kyi don du byed de mchog gi dbang phyug gi bka' drin gyis de rnams kyi lus 'grub par 'gyur pa yang ma yin zhing 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba rig par
analyzed: de ltar bdud kyi las rnam pa du ma rnams 'dir dngos grub kyi don du byed de mchog gi dbang phyug gi bka' drin gyis de rnams kyi lus 'grub par 'gyur pa yang ma yin zhing 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba rig par
translated: Thus, the many types of demonic activity are performed here for the sake of spiritual powers.🔽

original: 'gyur pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gyur pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the many kinds of Māra’s deeds are done here for the sake of spiritual powers, but they are not accomplished by the kindness of the Lord of Supreme Power, nor are they known in the past, future, or present.

original: mthar 'chi bar 'gyur te lus mes sreg par 'gyur pa'am khyi dang bya la sogs pa rnams kyis za bar @253a * //
analyzed: mthar 'chi bar 'gyur te lus mes sreg par 'gyur pa'am khyi dang bya la sogs pa rnams kyis za bar @253a * //
translated: In the end, one dies, and the body is burned by fire or eaten by dogs, birds, and so on.

original: 'gyur ro // srog ni zhi ba'am rnam par shes pa ni rdo rje can du 'gyur pa med do //
analyzed: 'gyur ro // srog ni zhi ba'am rnam par shes pa ni rdo rje can du 'gyur pa med do //
translated: The life force is not pacified, nor is consciousness transformed into a vajra.

original: de ltar bdud rnams kyis sngags dang lha'i byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa phra mo thams cad mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i ye shes la mngon par dga' ba'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis rnam par dpyad par bya ste sngags kyis byin gyis brlab pa phra mo 'di rnams
analyzed: de ltar bdud rnams kyis sngags dang lha'i byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa phra mo thams cad mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i ye shes la mngon par dga' ba'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis rnam par dpyad par bya ste sngags kyis byin gyis brlab pa phra mo 'di rnams
translated: Thus, all the subtle stages of the blessings of mantra and deity should be analyzed by yogins who delight in the gnosis of the unsurpassed, and these subtle blessings of mantra

original: kyis rdo rje 'bebs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kyis rdo rje 'bebs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Vajra-descent will not occur.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi bstod pa las tshigs su bcad pa bdun pas gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi bstod pa las tshigs su bcad pa bdun pas gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
translated: The Bhagavat has said in the Vajra-descent praise of the mirror-like wisdom of the Litany of the Names of Manjushri, in the seventh verse:

original: rdo rje 'bar ba mig mi bzad //
analyzed: rdo rje 'bar ba mig mi bzad //
translated: Vajra-flame, unbearable eye,

original: skra yang rdo rje 'bar ba ste //
analyzed: skra yang rdo rje 'bar ba ste //
translated: hair also is vajra-flame,

original: rdo rje 'bebs pa 'bebs pa che //
analyzed: rdo rje 'bebs pa 'bebs pa che //
translated: Vajra-descent, great descent,🔽hundred-eyed, vajra-eye.

original: mig brgya pa ste rdo rje'i mig ces pa dang de bzhin du rgyud kyi rgyal po'i dbang gi le'u las kyang tshigs su bcad pa brgyad cu rtsa dgu pas sku'i 'bebs pa la sogs pa gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mig brgya pa ste rdo rje'i mig ces pa dang de bzhin du rgyud kyi rgyal po'i dbang gi le'u las kyang tshigs su bcad pa brgyad cu rtsa dgu pas sku'i 'bebs pa la sogs pa gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
translated: And likewise, in the ninety-eighth verse of the chapter on consecration in the king of tantras, the Vajra-Pinnacle, he has said of the descent of body and so forth:

original: sku phebs pas ni rnam 'byor ldan pa rang bzhin yon tan dbang gis sku yi bya ba byed pa ste //
analyzed: sku phebs pas ni rnam 'byor ldan pa rang bzhin yon tan dbang gis sku yi bya ba byed pa ste //
translated: By the descent of body, the one endowed with yoga, by the power of the qualities of his nature, performs the deeds of the body.

original: gsung phebs pas ni lha dang 'byung po lha min rnams las rnam par rgyal ba'i smra ba po ru 'gyur //
analyzed: gsung phebs pas ni lha dang 'byung po lha min rnams las rnam par rgyal ba'i smra ba po ru 'gyur //
translated: By the descent of speech, he becomes a speaker who is victorious over gods, spirits, and demigods.

original: thugs phebs pas na gzhan gyi snying la gnas pa dag dang byung dang 'byung ba thams cad shes bar 'gyur //🔽ye shes phebs pas sangs rgyas lha dang mi yi bla ma rdzu 'phrul ldan pa'i ston pa gcig pur 'gyur zhes pa ste rdo rje 'bebs pa med pa de'i phyir lha phra mo'i 'bebs pa rnams ni sangs rgyas nyid kyi 'bras bu ster bar byed pa por mi🔽'gyur ro // re zhig sangs rgyas nyid dang 'jig rten gsum gyi bdag po nyid ces bya ba lta zhog gi nyi tshe ba'i 'bebs pa 'di rnams kyis ni ral gri dang bcud dang bcud len la sogs pa rnams kyang 'grub par mi 'gyur te gang gi phyir mchog gi dbang
analyzed: thugs phebs pas na gzhan gyi snying la gnas pa dag dang byung dang 'byung ba thams cad shes bar 'gyur // ye shes phebs pas sangs rgyas lha dang mi yi bla ma rdzu 'phrul ldan pa'i ston pa gcig pur 'gyur zhes pa ste rdo rje 'bebs pa med pa de'i phyir lha phra mo'i 'bebs pa rnams ni sangs rgyas nyid kyi 'bras bu ster bar byed pa por mi 'gyur ro // re zhig sangs rgyas nyid dang 'jig rten gsum gyi bdag po nyid ces bya ba lta zhog gi nyi tshe ba'i 'bebs pa 'di rnams kyis ni ral gri dang bcud dang bcud len la sogs pa rnams kyang 'grub par mi 'gyur te gang gi phyir mchog gi dbang
translated: Since it enters the heart, one knows all that is in the hearts of others, that which has arisen and that which will arise.🔽Since it enters gnosis, one becomes a Buddha, the teacher of gods and men, the one with miraculous powers.🔽Since there is no vajra descent, the descent of the subtle deity does not bestow the fruit of Buddhahood.

original: phyug gi bka' ster bar byed pa po'i bla ma pha rol gyi rdzas 'phrod par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: phyug gi bka' ster bar byed pa po'i bla ma pha rol gyi rdzas 'phrod par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Let alone Buddhahood and lordship over the three worlds, even the temporary descents do not accomplish the sword, elixir, alchemical powers, and so on, because the guru who bestows the boon of supreme lordship is not one who appropriates the wealth of others.

original: 'dir gal te bla ma'i bka' drin gyis rmongs pa chen po rnams kyis skye ba 'di la 'jig rten gsum gyi rgyal srid dang thams cad mkhyen pa'i go 'phang du 'gyur na de'i tshe ci'i phyir bla ma la dbul ba'i sdug bsngal yod cing bcud grub pa'i go🔽@253b 'phang yang yod pa ma yin /
analyzed: 'dir gal te bla ma'i bka' drin gyis rmongs pa chen po rnams kyis skye ba 'di la 'jig rten gsum gyi rgyal srid dang thams cad mkhyen pa'i go 'phang du 'gyur na de'i tshe ci'i phyir bla ma la dbul ba'i sdug bsngal yod cing bcud grub pa'i go @253b 'phang yang yod pa ma yin /
translated: Here, if through the grace of the guru, the very ignorant would become kings of the three worlds and omniscient in this life, then why would there be suffering for the guru and no state of being an alchemist?

original: de ltar rnam pa du ma rnams kyis rnam par dpyad na skye ba gzhan gyi bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs gnyis dang bral ba la ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i go 'phang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa du ma rnams kyis rnam par dpyad na skye ba gzhan gyi bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs gnyis dang bral ba la ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i go 'phang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: When analyzed in this way, the state of omniscience does not exist for those who are devoid of the two accumulations of merit and wisdom in other lives.

original: de'i phyir bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi don du sems can la phan par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi don du sems can la phan par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should benefit sentient beings for the sake of the accumulations of merit and wisdom.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis le'u lnga pa las tshigs su bcad pa drug cu rtsa drug pas gsungs pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis le'u lnga pa las tshigs su bcad pa drug cu rtsa drug pas gsungs pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said in the Five Chapter [Tantra], in sixty-six verses:

original: sems can rnams ni sangs rgyas yin te sangs rgyas chen po gzhan 'dir 'jig rten khams na yod ma yin //
analyzed: sems can rnams ni sangs rgyas yin te sangs rgyas chen po gzhan 'dir 'jig rten khams na yod ma yin //
translated: Sentient beings are Buddhas, for there is no other great Buddha in this world.

original: de rnams mnyes par byas pas dpag med srid pa gcod par byed de rnam par mi rtog pa las so //
analyzed: de rnams mnyes par byas pas dpag med srid pa gcod par byed de rnam par mi rtog pa las so //
translated: By pleasing them, one cuts off the immeasurable stream of existence, through non-discrimination.

original: rnal 'byor pa ni 'khu bar byed na dmyal ba du 'bod la sogs chen po'i mtha' ru 'gro bar 'gyur //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa ni 'khu bar byed na dmyal ba du 'bod la sogs chen po'i mtha' ru 'gro bar 'gyur //
translated: But if the yogin offends them, he goes to the great hell of Wailing and so on.

original: de phyir sems ni dag pa na yang mkhas dang mi mkhas skye bo rnams la 'gal bar mi bya'o zhes pa ste de'i phyir bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi don du sems can la phan par bya'o //
analyzed: de phyir sems ni dag pa na yang mkhas dang mi mkhas skye bo rnams la 'gal bar mi bya'o zhes pa ste de'i phyir bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi don du sems can la phan par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, even when the mind is pure, one should not offend the wise and the ignorant. Thus, for the sake of the accumulation of merit, one should benefit sentient beings.

original: ye shes kyi tshogs kyi don du mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i ye shes bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi tshogs kyi don du mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i ye shes bsgom par bya'o //
translated: For the sake of the accumulation of wisdom, one should cultivate the highest non-dual wisdom.

original: sems can gyi don ma gtogs par bsod nams kyi tshogs dang mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i ye shes sgom pa ma gtogs bar ye shes kyi tshogs su 'gyur pa ma yin no zhes pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs so //
analyzed: sems can gyi don ma gtogs par bsod nams kyi tshogs dang mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i ye shes sgom pa ma gtogs bar ye shes kyi tshogs su 'gyur pa ma yin no zhes pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs so //
translated: Except for the benefit of sentient beings, there is no accumulation of merit, and except for the cultivation of supreme, unchanging wisdom, there is no accumulation of wisdom.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyud kyi rgyal po'i le'u lnga pa las tshigs su bcad pa bdun cu rtsa gnyis pas gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyud kyi rgyal po'i le'u lnga pa las tshigs su bcad pa bdun cu rtsa gnyis pas gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
translated: The Blessed One has stated this in the Five Chapter King Tantra with seventy-two verses, as follows:

original: sems can rnams kyi sdig pa'i sems ni mi yi bdag po bdud kyi tshogs kyis byin gyis brlabs par 'gyur //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi sdig pa'i sems ni mi yi bdag po bdud kyi tshogs kyis byin gyis brlabs par 'gyur //
translated: The sinful minds of sentient beings are empowered by the hosts of Māra, O Lord of Men.

original: bsod nams ye shes rjes chags bde ster dag kyang rtag tu byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis byin brlabs pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams ye shes rjes chags bde ster dag kyang rtag tu byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis byin brlabs pa'o //
translated: But those who delight in merit and wisdom, and who bestow bliss, are always empowered by the bodhisattvas.

original: gang phyir bde ba'i dam tshig dbang gis bdud dang nyon mongs bcom nas mya ngan 'das par 'gro byed pa //
analyzed: gang phyir bde ba'i dam tshig dbang gis bdud dang nyon mongs bcom nas mya ngan 'das par 'gro byed pa //
translated: Because, by the power of the pledge of bliss, having conquered Māra and the afflictions, one proceeds to nirvāṇa.

original: de phyir bdud rnams nyi ma so so'i dus su de dag rnams la du ma yi ni bgegs rnams byed ces pa ste bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung 'di'i phyir rnal 'byor pas thar pa'i don du mchog tu mi 'gyur pa phyag rgya chen po'i rnal 'byor gyis rang
analyzed: de phyir bdud rnams nyi ma so so'i dus su de dag rnams la du ma yi ni bgegs rnams byed ces pa ste bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung 'di'i phyir rnal 'byor pas thar pa'i don du mchog tu mi 'gyur pa phyag rgya chen po'i rnal 'byor gyis rang
translated: Therefore, the demons create many obstacles for them on each and every day.

original: gi sems bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: gi sems bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: For this reason, the yogi should accomplish his mind with the yoga of the supreme non-dual Mahāmudrā for the sake of liberation.

original: @254a * // rnam pa gzhan du bla ma'i bkas thar bar mi 'gyur te gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das lam nye bar ston par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: @254a * // rnam pa gzhan du bla ma'i bkas thar bar mi 'gyur te gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das lam nye bar ston par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, liberation will not occur by the guru’s words, because the Bhagavān is the one who teaches the path.

original: bka' yis kun spyod chos rnams ni //
analyzed: bka' yis kun spyod chos rnams ni //

analyzed: rgyal ba bka' yis thar ster min // gal te bla ma'i bka' drin gyis //
translated: the teacher of the path, liberate by his words?🔽If embodied beings are liberated

original: lus can rnams ni grol 'gyur na //
analyzed: lus can rnams ni grol 'gyur na //
translated: by the kindness of the guru,

original: de tshe thar pa snying rje can //
analyzed: de tshe thar pa snying rje can //
translated: then at that time, the compassionate one

original: ting nge 'dzin gyis ston mi 'gyur //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyis ston mi 'gyur //
translated: would not teach liberation by samādhi.

original: de'i phyir thar pa'i don dang 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub bsgrub pa'i don du rnal 'byor pas phyi rol gyi lha'i sngags bsgrub par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir thar pa'i don dang 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub bsgrub pa'i don du rnal 'byor pas phyi rol gyi lha'i sngags bsgrub par mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the yogi should not practice the mantras of external gods for the sake of liberation or mundane accomplishments.

original: 'dir phyi rol gyi lha nye bar 'tshe ba phra mo byed pa rnams ni bsgrubs kyang sgrub pa po la glags tshol bar byed do //🔽de rnams kyi stobs kyis sgrub pa po la rab tu gtum pa'i lha gzhan rnams nye bar 'tshe ba phra mo byed de de rnams kyis bzung ba na sgrub nga bo la gdug pa'i lha bsgrubs pa de rnams dgra bor 'gyur zhing 'chi ba'i dus su cung zad
analyzed: 'dir phyi rol gyi lha nye bar 'tshe ba phra mo byed pa rnams ni bsgrubs kyang sgrub pa po la glags tshol bar byed do // de rnams kyi stobs kyis sgrub pa po la rab tu gtum pa'i lha gzhan rnams nye bar 'tshe ba phra mo byed de de rnams kyis bzung ba na sgrub nga bo la gdug pa'i lha bsgrubs pa de rnams dgra bor 'gyur zhing 'chi ba'i dus su cung zad
translated: Here, even if one practices the external gods who cause minor harm, they seek to harm the practitioner.

original: kyang rjod par mi byed do //
analyzed: kyang rjod par mi byed do //
translated: By their power, other very fierce gods cause minor harm. When seized by them, the gods who are practiced by the practitioner become enemies. At the time of death, they do not say anything at all.

original: ting nge 'dzin med pas shi ba'i sgrub pa po yang dmyal bar 'gro'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin med pas shi ba'i sgrub pa po yang dmyal bar 'gro'o //
translated: The practitioner who dies without concentration goes to hell.

original: gzhan yang de rnams bsgrubs pas ci zhig ster bar 'gyur te mi dbul po bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang de rnams bsgrubs pas ci zhig ster bar 'gyur te mi dbul po bzhin no //
translated: Moreover, what do they give when practiced? Like a poor man.

original: bsgrubs pa rnams kyis smras pa kye sgrub pa po khyod kyis bsgo ba thams cad bdag gis bya'o //
analyzed: bsgrubs pa rnams kyis smras pa kye sgrub pa po khyod kyis bsgo ba thams cad bdag gis bya'o //
translated: The siddhas say, “O sādhana practitioner, we will do all that you command.”

original: gal te sgrub pa pos khyed rnams kyis rgyal po chings la 'dir khyer la shog cig ces brjod na de'i tshe yongs su zlog par byed de yul 'di la bdag cag rnams nus pa med do zhes so ;🔽/ de ltar lha phra mo bsgrubs bas par gyur pa rnams ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i yul la yongs su zlog par byed de de'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa'i go 'phang mngon par 'dod pa rnams la gdug pa'i lha sgrub pa dang bla ma'i bka' 'khor ba'i chos
analyzed: gal te sgrub pa pos khyed rnams kyis rgyal po chings la 'dir khyer la shog cig ces brjod na de'i tshe yongs su zlog par byed de yul 'di la bdag cag rnams nus pa med do zhes so ; / de ltar lha phra mo bsgrubs bas par gyur pa rnams ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i yul la yongs su zlog par byed de de'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa'i go 'phang mngon par 'dod pa rnams la gdug pa'i lha sgrub pa dang bla ma'i bka' 'khor ba'i chos
translated: If the sādhana practitioner says, “You must bind the king and bring him here,” then they will completely refuse, saying, “We have no power over this country.”

original: kyi rang bzhin can rnams kyis dgos pa ci zhig yod /
analyzed: kyi rang bzhin can rnams kyis dgos pa ci zhig yod /

Therefore, what need is there for those who aspire to the state of omniscience to practice evil deities or to transgress the words of their guru, which is the nature of the Dharma?
