original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sa bcu'i dbang phyug pha rol tu phyin pa bcus nges par byung ba dbang bcu thob pa rnams las kyi rnam par smin pas 'khor bar 'khyam na de'i tshe sems can rnams la thar pa med do //
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sa bcu'i dbang phyug pha rol tu phyin pa bcus nges par byung ba dbang bcu thob pa rnams las kyi rnam par smin pas 'khor bar 'khyam na de'i tshe sems can rnams la thar pa med do //
translated: If the bodhisattvas, lords of the ten stages, who have gone forth by means of the ten perfections and have attained the ten masteries, were to wander in saṃsāra through the evolution of karma, then there would be no liberation for sentient beings.

original: lam mi shes pas lam mi shes pa rnams la lam nye bar bstan par brjod par bya ba ma yin te long bas long ba la bzhin no //
analyzed: lam mi shes pas lam mi shes pa rnams la lam nye bar bstan par brjod par bya ba ma yin te long bas long ba la bzhin no //
translated: It is not proper to say that the path should be taught to those who do not know the path because they do not know it, just as the blind cannot show the way to the blind.

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams skye ba 'dzin pa ni sems can gyi don du'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams skye ba 'dzin pa ni sems can gyi don du'o //
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattvas take birth for the sake of sentient beings.

original: 'jig rten mgon po bdag la sems can gyi don gyi slad du @255b dmyal bar rab tu zhugs pa'i dus su bdud kyi ris rnams kyis brjod pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten mgon po bdag la sems can gyi don gyi slad du @255b dmyal bar rab tu zhugs pa'i dus su bdud kyi ris rnams kyis brjod pa /
translated: The world-protector has said that when he enters the hells for the sake of sentient beings, the hosts of Māra say:

original: gang zhig srid pa'i 'ching ba rnams las grol yang sems can don du srid pa 'dzin //
analyzed: gang zhig srid pa'i 'ching ba rnams las grol yang sems can don du srid pa 'dzin //
translated: He who is liberated from the bonds of existence, but who takes up existence for the sake of sentient beings,

original: de ni stong pa'i don dag ston mdzad dus las las kyi 'bras bu gtong ma lags //
analyzed: de ni stong pa'i don dag ston mdzad dus las las kyi 'bras bu gtong ma lags //
translated: he who teaches the meaning of emptiness, does not abandon the fruit of karma.

original: sems kyi dri ma yang dag ye shes mes bsregs rtag tu yang dag brtse bas brlan //
analyzed: sems kyi dri ma yang dag ye shes mes bsregs rtag tu yang dag brtse bas brlan //
translated: The stains of the mind are burned by the fire of perfect wisdom, and he is always moistened by perfect compassion.

original: mdzad spyod brtag min sems can don la dgyes pa'i sangs rgyas de la bdag cag 'dud ces pa ste /
analyzed: mdzad spyod brtag min sems can don la dgyes pa'i sangs rgyas de la bdag cag 'dud ces pa ste /
translated: We bow to that Buddha, whose conduct is not contrived, who delights in the welfare of sentient beings.

original: de ltar yon tan du ma dang ldan zhing nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa bsregs pa rnams kyi sems can gyi don bya ba'i bdag nyid nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa cha shas tsam ni skye ba 'dzin pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: de ltar yon tan du ma dang ldan zhing nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa bsregs pa rnams kyi sems can gyi don bya ba'i bdag nyid nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa cha shas tsam ni skye ba 'dzin pa'i don du'o //
translated: Thus, those who have burned the afflictive obstructions, who have many good qualities, take up birth for the sake of sentient beings, for the sake of just a portion of the afflictive obstructions.

original: rnam pa gzhan du na sems can rnams la lam ston pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du na sems can rnams la lam ston pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, there would be no one to teach the path to sentient beings.

original: lam med par thog ma med pa'i 'khor ba las sems can rnams nges par 'byung bar mi 'gyur te byang chub sems dpa' dang phrad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lam med par thog ma med pa'i 'khor ba las sems can rnams nges par 'byung bar mi 'gyur te byang chub sems dpa' dang phrad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Without a path, sentient beings would not be able to escape samsara, which is beginningless, because they would not encounter a bodhisattva.

original: 'dir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis sngon du byang chub kyi sems shin tu brtan par byas so //
analyzed: 'dir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis sngon du byang chub kyi sems shin tu brtan par byas so //
translated: Here, bodhisattvas first make the thought of awakening very firm.

original: byang chub kyi sems 'di la bcing ba rnam pa gnyis te shes rab kyi chags pa dang bral ba dang shes rab kyi chags pas so //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems 'di la bcing ba rnam pa gnyis te shes rab kyi chags pa dang bral ba dang shes rab kyi chags pas so //
translated: This thought of awakening has two kinds of bonds: the bond of the attachment to wisdom and the bond of the absence of attachment to wisdom.

original: ji ltar dngul chub cing ba bzhin te gcig ni bdug pa dang dgod pa'i sbyor bas te gnyis pa ni lcags la sogs pa bskol ba dang mes bsreg pa'i sbyor pas so //
analyzed: ji ltar dngul chub cing ba bzhin te gcig ni bdug pa dang dgod pa'i sbyor bas te gnyis pa ni lcags la sogs pa bskol ba dang mes bsreg pa'i sbyor pas so //
translated: It is like mercury. One is bound by the application of smoke and fire; the other is bound by the application of heating iron and so on with fire.

original: de dag las bdug pa dang dgong pa'i sbyor bas bcings pa'i dngul chu gang yin pa de ni me drag pos bzhu bar gyur na cung zad gnas te 'bros par byed do //
analyzed: de dag las bdug pa dang dgong pa'i sbyor bas bcings pa'i dngul chu gang yin pa de ni me drag pos bzhu bar gyur na cung zad gnas te 'bros par byed do //
translated: Of these, the mercury that is bound by the application of smoke and fire, if it is heated by a strong fire, remains for a little while and then escapes.

original: lcags thams cad bskol ba las me drag pos bcings pa gang yin pa de ni me drag pos bzhu bar gyur pa na nam yang mi 'bros so //🔽de nyid ni zas dang bskol ba gzhan gyi dbang gis gnas skabs gzhan du 'gyur pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: lcags thams cad bskol ba las me drag pos bcings pa gang yin pa de ni me drag pos bzhu bar gyur pa na nam yang mi 'bros so // de nyid ni zas dang bskol ba gzhan gyi dbang gis gnas skabs gzhan du 'gyur pa 'di lta ste /
translated: All the iron is melted by the intense heat, and it never escapes from the intense heat.

original: du ba dang ni tseg tseg nyid //
analyzed: du ba dang ni tseg tseg nyid //
translated: It is the same for the food and the other things that are melted, which change into another state.🔽Smoke, bubbling,

original: sbal pa mchong ba nyid dang ni //
analyzed: sbal pa mchong ba nyid dang ni //
translated: froth,

original: 'dar dang mi 'dar ba nyid de //
analyzed: 'dar dang mi 'dar ba nyid de //
translated: trembling and non-trembling,

original: dngul chu yi ni gnas skabs lnga //
analyzed: dngul chu yi ni gnas skabs lnga //
translated: are the five states of mercury.

original: de bzhin du sgom pa goms pa'i dbang gis byang chub sems kyi gnas skabs gzhan du 'gyur te dman pa dang 'bring dang mchog dang ches mchog gi rab tu dbye ba las so //
analyzed: de bzhin du sgom pa goms pa'i dbang gis byang chub sems kyi gnas skabs gzhan du 'gyur te dman pa dang 'bring dang mchog dang ches mchog gi rab tu dbye ba las so //
translated: In the same way, by the force of the practice of meditation, the state of bodhicitta changes, inferior, middling, superior, very superior.

original: bdug pa dang / @256a * //
analyzed: bdug pa dang / @256a * //
translated: Smoke,

original: dgod pa'i sbyor bas bcings pa gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems kyi bcing ba ste de ni gang zag mi rtag pa bsgom pa'i stobs dang sa la sogs pa'i zad par mngon sum du byed pa dang shes rab kyi chags pa dang bral ba yis so
analyzed: dgod pa'i sbyor bas bcings pa gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems kyi bcing ba ste de ni gang zag mi rtag pa bsgom pa'i stobs dang sa la sogs pa'i zad par mngon sum du byed pa dang shes rab kyi chags pa dang bral ba yis so
translated: The fetter of bodhicitta is the fetter of the bodhisattva who is bound by the yoga of laughter. That is removed by the power of meditating on the impermanence of the person, by manifesting the totality of earth and so on, and by being free from attachment to wisdom.

original: // ji ltar dngul chu'i bdug pa dang dgod pa'i sbyor ba la yang dus gzhan gyi dbang gis lcags kyi zas za ba yod de zas zos pa des gnas skabs gzhan du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: // ji ltar dngul chu'i bdug pa dang dgod pa'i sbyor ba la yang dus gzhan gyi dbang gis lcags kyi zas za ba yod de zas zos pa des gnas skabs gzhan du 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as mercury and the yoga of laughter exist in iron by the power of time, and by consuming that food, it becomes a different state.

original: de bzhin du gang zag mi rtag par sgom pa dang sa la sogs pa'i zad par sgom pas bems po'i phung po dang khams dang skye mched zad pa las gnas skabs gzhan du 'gyur te gnas skabs gzhan zhes bya ba ni sa thob pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gang zag mi rtag par sgom pa dang sa la sogs pa'i zad par sgom pas bems po'i phung po dang khams dang skye mched zad pa las gnas skabs gzhan du 'gyur te gnas skabs gzhan zhes bya ba ni sa thob pa'o //
translated: Similarly, by meditating on the impermanence of the person and by meditating on the totality of earth and so on, the person becomes a different state from the exhaustion of the aggregates, elements and sense bases that are matter, and that different state is called attaining the bodhisattva levels.

original: 'dir sa ni rnam pa gnyis te 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa dang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sa'o //
analyzed: 'dir sa ni rnam pa gnyis te 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa dang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sa'o //
translated: Here, the stage is twofold: the stage of freedom from passion and the stage of perfect buddhahood.

original: sa'i dbang gis rdzu 'phrul te rnam pa gcig pa'i rdzu 'phrul dang rnam pa thams cad pa'i rdzu 'phrul lo //
analyzed: sa'i dbang gis rdzu 'phrul te rnam pa gcig pa'i rdzu 'phrul dang rnam pa thams cad pa'i rdzu 'phrul lo //
translated: By the power of the stage, there is the superknowledge of magical power, which is of two kinds: the magical power of one form and the magical power of all forms.

original: de bzhin du mngon par shes pa lnga dang mngon par shes pa drug go //
analyzed: de bzhin du mngon par shes pa lnga dang mngon par shes pa drug go //
translated: Similarly, there are five superknowledges and six superknowledges.

original: de bzhin du don gyi grangs mthong ba dang don thams cad kyi grang mthong ba'o //🔽de bzhin du skad ni sems can gyi grangs kyi bdag nyid can dang sems can thams cad kyi grangs kyi bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: de bzhin du don gyi grangs mthong ba dang don thams cad kyi grang mthong ba'o // de bzhin du skad ni sems can gyi grangs kyi bdag nyid can dang sems can thams cad kyi grangs kyi bdag nyid can no //
translated: Similarly, there is the vision of the number of objects and the vision of all objects.🔽Similarly, there is the language of the number of sentient beings and the language of the number of all sentient beings.

original: de bzhin du chos ston pa ni sems can gyi grangs kyi mtshan nyid dang sems can thams cad kyi grangs kyi skad kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin du chos ston pa ni sems can gyi grangs kyi mtshan nyid dang sems can thams cad kyi grangs kyi skad kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: Similarly, there is the teaching of the Dharma with the characteristics of the number of sentient beings and the teaching of the Dharma with the characteristics of the language of the number of all sentient beings.

original: de bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa ni phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa dang phung po'i lhag ma med pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa ni phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa dang phung po'i lhag ma med pa'o //
translated: Likewise, nirvana is with remainder and without remainder.

original: de bzhin du gang zag la bdag med pa dang chos la bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gang zag la bdag med pa dang chos la bdag med pa'o //
translated: Likewise, there is the selflessness of persons and the selflessness of phenomena.

original: de bzhin du 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi sgom pa dang chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi sgom pa dang chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin no //
translated: Likewise, there is the cultivation of the four noble truths and the meditative absorption of emptiness, the absence of intrinsic nature of all phenomena.

original: de ltar sa'i khyad par gyis sems can gyi don bya ba rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar sa'i khyad par gyis sems can gyi don bya ba rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the benefit for sentient beings is twofold, due to the distinction of the stages.

original: 'dir sa dang po thob pa las 'jig rten gyi khams gcig gi mthar thug par ma mthong ba'i don yang dag par mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'dir sa dang po thob pa las 'jig rten gyi khams gcig gi mthar thug par ma mthong ba'i don yang dag par mthong ngo //
translated: Here, from attaining the first stage, one sees the perfect seeing of the end of one world system.

original: sa gnyis pa thob pa las phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams gnyis kyi mthar thug par ro //
analyzed: sa gnyis pa thob pa las phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams gnyis kyi mthar thug par ro //
translated: From attaining the second stage, one sees the end of two world systems in the ten directions.

original: sa gsum pa thob pa las phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi @256b khams bzhi'i mthar thug par ro //
analyzed: sa gsum pa thob pa las phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi @256b khams bzhi'i mthar thug par ro //
translated: From attaining the third stage, one sees the end of four world systems in the ten directions.

original: sa bzhi pa thob pa las phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams brgyad kyi mthar thug par ro //
analyzed: sa bzhi pa thob pa las phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams brgyad kyi mthar thug par ro //
translated: When they attain the fourth level, they can reach the end of eight world systems in each of the ten directions.

original: sa lnga pa thob pa las phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams bcu drug gi mthar thug par ro //
analyzed: sa lnga pa thob pa las phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams bcu drug gi mthar thug par ro //
translated: When they attain the fifth level, they can reach the end of sixteen world systems in each of the ten directions.

original: sa drug pa thob pa las phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi mthar thug par ro //
analyzed: sa drug pa thob pa las phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi mthar thug par ro //
translated: When they attain the sixth level, they can reach the end of thirty-two world systems in each of the ten directions.

original: sa bdun pa thob pa las phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams drug cu rtsa bzhi'i mthar thug par ro //
analyzed: sa bdun pa thob pa las phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams drug cu rtsa bzhi'i mthar thug par ro //
translated: When they attain the seventh level, they can reach the end of sixty-four world systems in each of the ten directions.

original: sa brgyad pa thob pa las phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams brgya nyi shu rtsa brgyad kyi mthar thug par ro //
analyzed: sa brgyad pa thob pa las phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams brgya nyi shu rtsa brgyad kyi mthar thug par ro //
translated: When they attain the eighth level, they can reach the end of one hundred and twenty-eight world systems in each of the ten directions.

original: sa dgu pa thob pa las phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams nyis brgya lnga bcu rtsa drug gi mthar thug par ro //
analyzed: sa dgu pa thob pa las phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams nyis brgya lnga bcu rtsa drug gi mthar thug par ro //
translated: When they attain the ninth level, they can reach the end of two hundred and fifty-six world systems in each of the ten directions.

original: sa bcu pa thob pa las phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams lnga brgya bcu gnyis kyi mthar thug par ro //
analyzed: sa bcu pa thob pa las phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams lnga brgya bcu gnyis kyi mthar thug par ro //
translated: When they attain the tenth level, they can reach the end of one thousand two hundred and fifty world systems in each of the ten directions.

original: sa bcu gcig pa thob pa las phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams nyi shu rtsa bzhi lhag pa'i stong phrag gcig gi mthar thug par lkog tu gyur pa'i don yang dag par mthong ngo //
analyzed: sa bcu gcig pa thob pa las phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams nyi shu rtsa bzhi lhag pa'i stong phrag gcig gi mthar thug par lkog tu gyur pa'i don yang dag par mthong ngo //
translated: By attaining the eleventh stage, one sees the hidden meaning of the world systems of the ten directions, up to the limit of one thousand times twenty four.

original: de bzhin du stong gnyis dang stong gsum gyi 'jig rten gyi khams rnams kyi grangs kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin du stong gnyis dang stong gsum gyi 'jig rten gyi khams rnams kyi grangs kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: In the same way, the world systems of two and three thousand.

original: stong gcig ces bya ba ni mi mjed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi dbus nas steng dang 'og tu stong phrag re re ste 'og dang steng bzhin du shar dang nub dang byang dang lho dang bden bral dang dbang ldan dang rlung dang mer ro //
analyzed: stong gcig ces bya ba ni mi mjed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi dbus nas steng dang 'og tu stong phrag re re ste 'og dang steng bzhin du shar dang nub dang byang dang lho dang bden bral dang dbang ldan dang rlung dang mer ro //
translated: One thousand means from the center of the world system of Patient Endurance, one thousand above and below, and in the same way, one thousand in each of the directions east, west, north, south, northeast, southeast, southwest, northwest, nadir and zenith.

original: de bzhin du stong phrag gnyis dang gsum mo //
analyzed: de bzhin du stong phrag gnyis dang gsum mo //
translated: In the same way, there are two and three thousand.

original: de nas stong chen po zhes bya ba grangs med pa chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnams te de rnams su ma mthong ba'i don yang dag par mthong bar yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bcu gnyis pa thob pa las 'gyur gyi 'dod chags dang bral
analyzed: de nas stong chen po zhes bya ba grangs med pa chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnams te de rnams su ma mthong ba'i don yang dag par mthong bar yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bcu gnyis pa thob pa las 'gyur gyi 'dod chags dang bral
translated: Then, in the great trichiliocosm, the great countless world systems, the perfect complete Buddha attains the twelfth stage, the stage of seeing the meaning not seen before.

original: ba rnams kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ba rnams kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: This is not the case for those free from attachment.🔽These moments of unchanging great bliss arising from the attachment of wisdom attain these stages of a tathagata.

original: shes rab kyi chags pa las byung ba mi 'gyur pa'i bde ba chen po'i skad cig rnams kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa 'di rnams thob ste mi 'pho ba'i skad cig brgya phrag bcva brgyad thob pas sa dang po thob po //
analyzed: shes rab kyi chags pa las byung ba mi 'gyur pa'i bde ba chen po'i skad cig rnams kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa 'di rnams thob ste mi 'pho ba'i skad cig brgya phrag bcva brgyad thob pas sa dang po thob po //
translated: By attaining one hundred and eight moments of nonemission, one attains the first stage.

original: grangs 'dis sa bcu gnyis kyi mthar thug par ro //
analyzed: grangs 'dis sa bcu gnyis kyi mthar thug par ro //
translated: By this number, one reaches the end of the twelfth stage.

original: mi 'gyur pa'i skad cig nyi khri chig stong drug brgya rnams kyis sa bcu gnyis thob ste yan lag bcu gnyis 'gags pa ji srid par ro //
analyzed: mi 'gyur pa'i skad cig nyi khri chig stong drug brgya rnams kyis sa bcu gnyis thob ste yan lag bcu gnyis 'gags pa ji srid par ro //
translated: By twenty-one thousand six hundred moments of nonemission, one attains the twelfth stage, for as long as the twelve branches are stopped.

original: @257a * // dus sbyor bcu gnyis 'gags pas zla ba bcu gnyis 'gag go //
analyzed: @257a * // dus sbyor bcu gnyis 'gags pas zla ba bcu gnyis 'gag go //
translated: The twelve two-hour periods being blocked, the twelve months are blocked.

original: zla ba bcu gnyis 'gags pas nyin zhag sum brgya drug cu 'gag go //
analyzed: zla ba bcu gnyis 'gags pas nyin zhag sum brgya drug cu 'gag go //
translated: The twelve months being blocked, the three hundred and sixty days are blocked.

original: nyin zhag sum brgya drug cu 'gags pas chu tshod nyi khri chig stong drug brgya rnams 'gags te de ltar phyi rol la ji lta ba de bzhin du lus la chu tshod kyi grangs kyi dbugs rnams 'gag go //
analyzed: nyin zhag sum brgya drug cu 'gags pas chu tshod nyi khri chig stong drug brgya rnams 'gags te de ltar phyi rol la ji lta ba de bzhin du lus la chu tshod kyi grangs kyi dbugs rnams 'gag go //
translated: The three hundred and sixty days being blocked, the twenty-one thousand six hundred breaths are blocked. Thus, as with the external, so with the body, the breaths are blocked by the number of hours.

original: dbugs rnams 'gags pas lus 'gag ste byang chub kyi sems 'gyur pa med pa'i skad cig rnams kyis so //
analyzed: dbugs rnams 'gags pas lus 'gag ste byang chub kyi sems 'gyur pa med pa'i skad cig rnams kyis so //
translated: The breaths being blocked, the body is blocked, by the moments of the unchanging bodhicitta.

original: ji ltar dngul chu bskol ba dang rin po che rnams kyis lcags zos pa ni de rnams kyi tshon chen po bzung nas gnas kyi phal pa'i khams nyid du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar dngul chu bskol ba dang rin po che rnams kyis lcags zos pa ni de rnams kyi tshon chen po bzung nas gnas kyi phal pa'i khams nyid du ni ma yin no //
translated: Just as mercury and precious substances, when heated, take on the color of whatever they are placed in, but do not take on the nature of the ordinary elements of the vessel.

original: tshon chen po des lcags gang la reg par byed pa'i lcags de rnams ni dri ma dang bral bar 'gyur zhing rdo rnams ni rin po cher 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshon chen po des lcags gang la reg par byed pa'i lcags de rnams ni dri ma dang bral bar 'gyur zhing rdo rnams ni rin po cher 'gyur ro //
translated: Whatever iron that great elixir touches, that iron becomes free from impurities and the stones become jewels.

original: de bzhin du byang chub kyi sems bsgoms pa ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched srog dang bcas pa rnams zos shing de rnams kyi tshon chen po bzung nas gnas kyi phal pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub kyi sems bsgoms pa ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched srog dang bcas pa rnams zos shing de rnams kyi tshon chen po bzung nas gnas kyi phal pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, the one who has cultivated the thought of awakening eats the aggregates, elements, and sense bases along with their life force, and having taken up the great elixir of those, he is not an ordinary person.🔽By the power of his merit, whatever beings he blesses with that elixir, they become clairvoyant, but not perfectly awakened.

original: tshon des bsod nams kyi dbang las sems can gang dag la byin gyis brlab pa byed pa de rnams mngon par shes pa can du 'gyur gyi yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyid ni ma yin te gang gi tshe lcags bskol ba rnams dngul chu dang lhan
analyzed: tshon des bsod nams kyi dbang las sems can gang dag la byin gyis brlab pa byed pa de rnams mngon par shes pa can du 'gyur gyi yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyid ni ma yin te gang gi tshe lcags bskol ba rnams dngul chu dang lhan
translated: When the heated iron and mercury are mixed together, the iron becomes gold.

original: cig gcig nyid du 'gyur pa de'i tshe dngul chus phug pa'i lcags rnams dri ma med par 'gyur gyi bems po'i khams nyid med pa ni ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: cig gcig nyid du 'gyur pa de'i tshe dngul chus phug pa'i lcags rnams dri ma med par 'gyur gyi bems po'i khams nyid med pa ni ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: When they become one, the iron pierced by mercury becomes stainless, but it is not that the element of matter is absent.

original: phan tshun yang dag par ldan pa de'i phyir khams rnams ni khams nyid du med cing dngul chu'ang dngul chu nyid du med de sngar gyi rang bzhin yongs su btang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun yang dag par ldan pa de'i phyir khams rnams ni khams nyid du med cing dngul chu'ang dngul chu nyid du med de sngar gyi rang bzhin yongs su btang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are mutually combined, the elements are not elements, and mercury is not mercury, because they have given up their previous nature.

original: de bzhin du sems dang lhan cig gcig tu gyur pa'i lus kyi khams rnams la khams nyid med cing sems la sems nyid med de sngar gyi 'khor ba'i bag chags med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems dang lhan cig gcig tu gyur pa'i lus kyi khams rnams la khams nyid med cing sems la sems nyid med de sngar gyi 'khor ba'i bag chags med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the same way, the elements of the body that have become one with the mind are not elements, and the mind is not mind, because the previous habit-energy of cyclic existence is absent.

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis sems gang yong ba'i sems de ni sems ma yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis sems gang yong ba'i sems de ni sems ma yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the Blessed One said, “The mind that comes is not the mind.”

original: de ltar brjod pa'i rim pa 'dis sa brgyad kyi dbang phyug dang dbang phyug la sogs pa'i lha rnams dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la yang mngon par shes @257b pa lnga rig bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar brjod pa'i rim pa 'dis sa brgyad kyi dbang phyug dang dbang phyug la sogs pa'i lha rnams dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la yang mngon par shes @257b pa lnga rig bar bya'o //
translated: In this way, the five superknowledges should be understood to belong to the lords of the eighth stage, to the gods such as Ishvara, and to the Bodhisattvas.

original: b'a shishtha la sogs pa'i drang srong rnams la ni mngon par shes pa lnga med de gang gi phyir r'a m'a ya na dang bh'a ra ta tshad ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: b'a shishtha la sogs pa'i drang srong rnams la ni mngon par shes pa lnga med de gang gi phyir r'a m'a ya na dang bh'a ra ta tshad ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The sages such as Vashishtha do not have the five superknowledges, because the Ramayana and the Bharata are not valid.

original: 'dir grog mkhar gyi tshig r'a m'a ya na las thos pa b'a shishtha byin pa'i dus sbyor la lha r'a mas lha mo s'i ta'i lag pa bzung ba byas so //
analyzed: 'dir grog mkhar gyi tshig r'a m'a ya na las thos pa b'a shishtha byin pa'i dus sbyor la lha r'a mas lha mo s'i ta'i lag pa bzung ba byas so //
translated: Here, from the words of the anthill in the Ramayana, it is heard that at the time of giving the Bharata, Rama took the hand of the goddess Sita.

original: b'a shishtha sa byin pa'i dus sbyor gyi drin des r'a ma ni rgyal srid las nyams te nags su zhugs shing s'i ta yang rtag tu sdug bsngal dang ldan no //
analyzed: b'a shishtha sa byin pa'i dus sbyor gyi drin des r'a ma ni rgyal srid las nyams te nags su zhugs shing s'i ta yang rtag tu sdug bsngal dang ldan no //
translated: By the favor of the time given by Vashishtha, Rama lost his kingdom and entered the forest, and Sita always suffered.

original: de skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: de skad du gsungs pa /
translated: It is said:

original: sngon gyi las 'bras longs spyod la //
analyzed: sngon gyi las 'bras longs spyod la //
translated: The result of past karma is enjoyed.

original: gza' dang rgyu skar don med de //
analyzed: gza' dang rgyu skar don med de //
translated: The planets and stars are meaningless.

original: b'a shishtha sa byin dus sbyor gyis //
analyzed: b'a shishtha sa byin dus sbyor gyis //
translated: The lunar mansions and the conjunctions of the moon with the lunar mansions are meaningless.

original: skyed byed ma ni sdug bsngal sten zhes so //
analyzed: skyed byed ma ni sdug bsngal sten zhes so //
translated: The mother who gives birth is meaningless.

original: de bzhin du rgyas pa'i tshig bh'a ra ta las thos pa sgra ngan pa dang skya bseng gi bu rnams las gang dag gnam stong la ku ru'i zhing du 'jug par byed pa de rnams rnam par rgyal bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'i tshig 'di thos nas skya bseng🔽gi bu rnams bcu gsum la rab tu zhugs shing sgra ngan pa rnams gnam stong la rab tu zhugs te de rnams las gang dag bcu gsum la rab tu zhugs pa de rnams rnam par rgyal bar gyur cing gang dag gnam stong la rab tu zhugs pa de
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyas pa'i tshig bh'a ra ta las thos pa sgra ngan pa dang skya bseng gi bu rnams las gang dag gnam stong la ku ru'i zhing du 'jug par byed pa de rnams rnam par rgyal bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'i tshig 'di thos nas skya bseng gi bu rnams bcu gsum la rab tu zhugs shing sgra ngan pa rnams gnam stong la rab tu zhugs te de rnams las gang dag bcu gsum la rab tu zhugs pa de rnams rnam par rgyal bar gyur cing gang dag gnam stong la rab tu zhugs pa de
translated: Similarly, the words of the Bharata epic were heard: “Those who enter the Kuru battlefield on the fourteenth day will be victorious.”🔽Hearing this, the sons of Pandu entered on the thirteenth day and the sons of Dhritarashtra entered on the fourteenth day.

original: rnams bsad par gyur to //
analyzed: rnams bsad par gyur to //
translated: Those who entered on the thirteenth day were victorious and those who entered on the fourteenth day were killed.

original: ci ste drang srong gdug pas smras pa 'dir bram ze'i tshig gis bcu gsum ni gnam stong du 'gyur te zla ba dang nyi ma gcig tu sbyor ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste drang srong gdug pas smras pa 'dir bram ze'i tshig gis bcu gsum ni gnam stong du 'gyur te zla ba dang nyi ma gcig tu sbyor ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that the thirteenth day is the new moon because the evil sages say so, and because the sun and moon are joined together,

original: de nyid ni mi 'thad de gang gi phyir zla ba'i cha bcva lnga zad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid ni mi 'thad de gang gi phyir zla ba'i cha bcva lnga zad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then that is not so, because the fifteenth part of the moon is not exhausted.

original: 'dir bcu gsum la cha bcva lnga zad par mi 'gyur te gza' gang dang skar ma gang gi bcu gsum par gyur pa'i gza' de dang skar ma des gang du yang gnam stong du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir bcu gsum la cha bcva lnga zad par mi 'gyur te gza' gang dang skar ma gang gi bcu gsum par gyur pa'i gza' de dang skar ma des gang du yang gnam stong du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, the thirteenth day is not the new moon, because the fifteenth part of the moon is not exhausted. The sun and moon are not joined together on the thirteenth day of any month or on the thirteenth day of any constellation.

original: rgyu de'i phyir de rnams kyis kar rtsis kyi mngon par 'dod pa ste mngon par shes pa lnga po rnams kyis don yang dag par mthong ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu de'i phyir de rnams kyis kar rtsis kyi mngon par 'dod pa ste mngon par shes pa lnga po rnams kyis don yang dag par mthong ba ni ma yin no //
translated: For that reason, the five types of superknowledge that are desired by astrologers do not see reality.

original: de bzhin du sdig pa'i blo can rnams kyis lo rgyus kyi chos brdzun pa smras pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du sdig pa'i blo can rnams kyis lo rgyus kyi chos brdzun pa smras pa 'di lta ste /
translated: In the same way, the following story is a false statement by evil-minded people.

original: rgyal po stobs ldan gyi dus su'o ma'i rgya mtsho bsgrubs pa las rta mthor thos dang glang po che sa srung dang nor bu koo stu bha dang shing yongs 'du dang lha mo aa pas ra dang dpal mo dang zla ba dang / @258a * //
analyzed: rgyal po stobs ldan gyi dus su'o ma'i rgya mtsho bsgrubs pa las rta mthor thos dang glang po che sa srung dang nor bu koo stu bha dang shing yongs 'du dang lha mo aa pas ra dang dpal mo dang zla ba dang / @258a * //
translated: They appeared during the time of King Balha, when the ocean was churned.

original: bdud rtsi dang nag po brtsegs pa rnams byung par gyur to zhes pa lo rgyus kyi chos kyi tshig tu grag go //
analyzed: bdud rtsi dang nag po brtsegs pa rnams byung par gyur to zhes pa lo rgyus kyi chos kyi tshig tu grag go //
translated: This is the story that is well known in the treatises on secular affairs.

original: gal te de ltar yin na aandha ka nyid kyi rgyal srid la tshes dang gza' dang zla ba dang skar ma dang dus rnams med par 'gyur te zla ba dang nyi ma 'char ba dang nub pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te de ltar yin na aandha ka nyid kyi rgyal srid la tshes dang gza' dang zla ba dang skar ma dang dus rnams med par 'gyur te zla ba dang nyi ma 'char ba dang nub pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If that is so, then in the kingdom of Andhaka the days, planets, moon, stars and seasons would not exist because the rising and setting of the moon and sun do not exist there.

original: rgya mtshor gnas pa'i zla ba rgyu skar la longs spyod pa med pa'i phyir tshes gcig la sogs pa'i cha 'dzin pa med par 'gyur zhing nyi ma dang bkra shis la sogs pa'i gza' rnams kyi 'char ba dang nub pa dang gza' bdun yongs su longs spyod pa🔽yang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgya mtshor gnas pa'i zla ba rgyu skar la longs spyod pa med pa'i phyir tshes gcig la sogs pa'i cha 'dzin pa med par 'gyur zhing nyi ma dang bkra shis la sogs pa'i gza' rnams kyi 'char ba dang nub pa dang gza' bdun yongs su longs spyod pa yang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: The moon in the ocean would not enjoy the lunar mansions, and the first day of the month and so on would not be apprehended. The rising and setting of the sun, the planets such as Bṛhaspati, and the enjoyment of the seven planets would not exist.

original: de bzhin du tir n+ya k'a shya pa'i rgyal srid la gza' la sogs pa med par 'gyur te de'i rigs la dus kyi dbang gis stobs ldan skyes shing de nas lha dang lha ma yin rnams kyis rgya mtsho bsgrubs pas so //
analyzed: de bzhin du tir n+ya k'a shya pa'i rgyal srid la gza' la sogs pa med par 'gyur te de'i rigs la dus kyi dbang gis stobs ldan skyes shing de nas lha dang lha ma yin rnams kyis rgya mtsho bsgrubs pas so //
translated: The kingdom of Tīrṇyakāśyapa would not have planets and so on, because the powerful one was born in his family by the power of time and then the gods and asuras churned the ocean.

original: ci ste zla ba 'di ma yin gyi de ni dbang phyug gi spyi bo'i zla ba'o zhe na tshig de nyid mi 'thad de zla pa de nyid mngon par 'dod pas aandha ka bsang par gyur to //
analyzed: ci ste zla ba 'di ma yin gyi de ni dbang phyug gi spyi bo'i zla ba'o zhe na tshig de nyid mi 'thad de zla pa de nyid mngon par 'dod pas aandha ka bsang par gyur to //
translated: If you say that this moon is not the moon, but the moon on the head of Īśvara, that statement is untenable, because the moon is asserted to be that moon, and the moon on the head of Īśvara is not asserted to be that moon.

original: nag po brtsegs pa byung ba de nyid ni bden pa ma yin te rgyal po stobs ldan gyi dus su nag po brtsegs pa'i dug zos pa'i phyir sngar dbang phyug mgrin sngon ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nag po brtsegs pa byung ba de nyid ni bden pa ma yin te rgyal po stobs ldan gyi dus su nag po brtsegs pa'i dug zos pa'i phyir sngar dbang phyug mgrin sngon ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not true that the one who was born as Kālacakṣu was the very same one who was born as Kālacakṣu, because in the time of King Balī, Kālacakṣu ate poison and was previously Nīlakaṇṭha, Śiva.🔽It is not true that the one who was born as Kālacakṣu was the very same one who was born as Kālacakṣu, because in the time of King Balī, Kālacakṣu ate poison and was previously Nīlakaṇṭha, Śiva.🔽It is not true that the one who was born as Kālacakṣu was the very same one who was born as Kālacakṣu, because in the time of King Balī, Kālacakṣu ate poison and was previously Nīlakaṇṭha, Śiva.🔽It is not true that the one who was born as Kālacakṣu was the very same one who was born as Kālacakṣu, because in the time of King Balī, Kālacakṣu ate poison and was previously Nīlakaṇṭha, Śiva.🔽It is not true that the one who was born as Kālacakṣu was the very same one who was born as Kālacakṣu, because in the time of King Balī, Kālacakṣu ate poison and was previously Nīlakaṇṭha, Śiva.🔽It is not true that the one who was born as Kālacakṣu was the very same one who was born as Kālacakṣu, because in the time of King Balī, Kālacakṣu ate poison and was previously Nīlakaṇṭha, Śiva.🔽It is not true that the one who was born as Kālacakṣu was the very same one who was born as Kālacakṣu, because in the time of King Balī, Kālacakṣu ate poison and was previously Nīlakaṇṭha, Śiva.

original: de bzhin dus srung dang mthor thos dang dpal mo dang koo stu bha dang bdud rtsi rnams byung ba de nyid ni bden pa ma yin te gang gis na aandha ka'i g-yul la lha rnams cad rang rang gi mtshan ma dang rang rang gi bzhon pa la gnas🔽zhes pa'o // ci ste drang srong gdug pa rnams kyis smras pa dur b'a sa yis dmod pa btab pas dbang po'i 'byor pa rgya mtshor zhugs so zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin dus srung dang mthor thos dang dpal mo dang koo stu bha dang bdud rtsi rnams byung ba de nyid ni bden pa ma yin te gang gis na aandha ka'i g-yul la lha rnams cad rang rang gi mtshan ma dang rang rang gi bzhon pa la gnas zhes pa'o // ci ste drang srong gdug pa rnams kyis smras pa dur b'a sa yis dmod pa btab pas dbang po'i 'byor pa rgya mtshor zhugs so zhe na /
translated: It is not true that the one who was born as Kālacakṣu was the very same one who was born as Kālacakṣu, because in the time of King Balī, Kālacakṣu ate poison and was previously Nīlakaṇṭha, Śiva.

original: de nyid ni bden pa ma yin te dbang po'i dmod pas lha gzhan rnams kyi 'byor pa nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid ni bden pa ma yin te dbang po'i dmod pas lha gzhan rnams kyi 'byor pa nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not true that the one who was born as Kālacakṣu was the very same one who was born

original: de ltar brjod pa'i rim pas lo rgyus kyi chos thams cad brdzun par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar brjod pa'i rim pas lo rgyus kyi chos thams cad brdzun par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, all the stories of the past would be false.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis le'u lnga pa las tshigs su bcad pa brgya brgyad cu rtsa gnyis pas lo rgyus kyi chos rnams brdzun par gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis le'u lnga pa las tshigs su bcad pa brgya brgyad cu rtsa gnyis pas lo rgyus kyi chos rnams brdzun par gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
translated: The Lord, in the Fifty Verses on the Guru, says that the stories of the past are false:

original: dpal mo mthor thos lha yi ljon pa glang po'i bdag dan lha mo koo stu bha dang zla ba dang / bdud rtsi stobs ldan rgyal srid dus su chug ter bsrubs las lha yul mkha' la gal te @258b byung gyur na //🔽aandha ka nyid rgyal srid la ni zla ba med pas gza' tshes dus kyi tshogs kyang med par 'gyur //
analyzed: dpal mo mthor thos lha yi ljon pa glang po'i bdag dan lha mo koo stu bha dang zla ba dang / bdud rtsi stobs ldan rgyal srid dus su chug ter bsrubs las lha yul mkha' la gal te @258b byung gyur na // aandha ka nyid rgyal srid la ni zla ba med pas gza' tshes dus kyi tshogs kyang med par 'gyur //
translated: If the glorious Udayana, the celestial tree, the lord of elephants, the goddess Kauśikī, the moon, and the powerful nectar were to be churned by the mountain Mandara in the proper time,🔽then the gods would appear in the sky of the heavens.🔽But if the moon were to be killed by the king of the demons, then the collection of planets and stars would not exist in the sky of the heavens.

original: de yang dbang phyug zla phyed la chags bsad par gyur te stobs ldan de ni de yi phyin sa so zhes pa ste rigs pa 'dis rnam par dpyad na 'jig rten gyi lo rgyus rnams ni mi bden no //
analyzed: de yang dbang phyug zla phyed la chags bsad par gyur te stobs ldan de ni de yi phyin sa so zhes pa ste rigs pa 'dis rnam par dpyad na 'jig rten gyi lo rgyus rnams ni mi bden no //
translated: And if the powerful one were to kill the moon, which is attached to the half-month, then the powerful one would be the cause of that.🔽By this reasoning, when analyzed, the stories of the past are not true.

original: ci ste tshangs pa'i drang srong gdug pa rnams kyis smras pa 'dir sngon du rig byed kyi chos ni lhan cig skyes pa ste phyi nas thams cad mkhyen pas bstan pa'i chos ni bcos ma'o //🔽de'i phyir rig byed kyi chos ni phu po'o zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste tshangs pa'i drang srong gdug pa rnams kyis smras pa 'dir sngon du rig byed kyi chos ni lhan cig skyes pa ste phyi nas thams cad mkhyen pas bstan pa'i chos ni bcos ma'o // de'i phyir rig byed kyi chos ni phu po'o zhe na /
translated: But if the wicked Brahmins say, “The Dharma of the Vedas is primary, and the Dharma taught later by the Omniscient One is secondary,”

original: de nyid brjod par bya ste rig byed kyi chos phu po dang phyi na thams cad mkhyen pa'i chos yin du chug mod 'di la 'gal ba ci zhig yod /
analyzed: de nyid brjod par bya ste rig byed kyi chos phu po dang phyi na thams cad mkhyen pa'i chos yin du chug mod 'di la 'gal ba ci zhig yod /
translated: then we reply: Let the Dharma of the Vedas be primary, and the Dharma of the Omniscient One be secondary. What is the contradiction here?

original: sngon du mun pa chen po lhan cig skyes pa lam thams cad gsal bar byed pa ma yin pa dang phyi nas de gzhom pa'i don du 'od stong pa'i snang ba lam thams cad rab tu gsal bar byed par gyur na mun pa chen po dang snang ba
analyzed: sngon du mun pa chen po lhan cig skyes pa lam thams cad gsal bar byed pa ma yin pa dang phyi nas de gzhom pa'i don du 'od stong pa'i snang ba lam thams cad rab tu gsal bar byed par gyur na mun pa chen po dang snang ba
translated: Before, there was the primary darkness that does not illuminate any path, and later, in order to destroy that, there is the light of a thousand suns that illuminates all paths.

original: 'di dag las mun pa lhan cig skyes pa phu bo ni mig dang ldan pa rnams kyi dga' ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag las mun pa lhan cig skyes pa phu bo ni mig dang ldan pa rnams kyi dga' ba ma yin no //
translated: Between these two, the primary darkness is not pleasing to those who have eyes.

original: de bzhin du sngon du rig byed kyi chos lhan cig skyes pa phu bo mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam gsal bar byed pa ma yin pa dang phyi nas de gzhom pa'i don du thams cad mkhyen pa'i cos nu bo mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam gsal bar🔽byed par gyur na /
analyzed: de bzhin du sngon du rig byed kyi chos lhan cig skyes pa phu bo mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam gsal bar byed pa ma yin pa dang phyi nas de gzhom pa'i don du thams cad mkhyen pa'i cos nu bo mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam gsal bar byed par gyur na /
translated: Likewise, the innate Vedic Dharma, the elder brother, does not illuminate the path to nirvana, and later, for the sake of destroying it, the omniscient Dharma, the younger brother, does illuminate the path to nirvana.

original: rig byed kyi chos dang thams cad mkhyen pa'i chos 'di dag las rig byed kyi chos lhan cig skyes pa phu bo ni shes ldan rnams kyi dga' ba ma yin te mig dang ldan pa rnams kyi mun pa chen po bzhin no //
analyzed: rig byed kyi chos dang thams cad mkhyen pa'i chos 'di dag las rig byed kyi chos lhan cig skyes pa phu bo ni shes ldan rnams kyi dga' ba ma yin te mig dang ldan pa rnams kyi mun pa chen po bzhin no //
translated: If that is so, between the Vedic Dharma and the omniscient Dharma, the innate Vedic Dharma, the elder brother, is not pleasing to the wise, like great darkness to those with eyes.

original: de'i phyir phu po dang nu bo dag las nu bo mchog go //
analyzed: de'i phyir phu po dang nu bo dag las nu bo mchog go //
translated: Therefore, between the elder and younger brothers, the younger is supreme.

original: de'i phyir mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i ye shes kyi sgrub pas mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur gyi 'pho ba'i bag chags can rig byed kyi chos rnams kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i ye shes kyi sgrub pas mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur gyi 'pho ba'i bag chags can rig byed kyi chos rnams kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, one attains nirvana through the practice of supreme unchanging wisdom, not through the Vedic Dharma, which is characterized by the latent tendencies of transference.

original: de bzhin du nya la sogs pa'i lo rgyus rigs ldan gyi mthar thug pa rnams kyang rnam par dpyad na don med pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du nya la sogs pa'i lo rgyus rigs ldan gyi mthar thug pa rnams kyang rnam par dpyad na don med pa'o //
translated: Likewise, the stories of the fish and so on, up to the story of the Kṣatriya, are meaningless when analyzed.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'di ni nor lha'i 'jug pa dgu pa ste rigs ldan ni bcu pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'di ni nor lha'i 'jug pa dgu pa ste rigs ldan ni bcu pa'o zhes so //
translated: This Blessed Buddha is the ninth chapter on the god of wealth, and the Kṣatriya is the tenth.

translated: The ten perfections that the bodhisattvas must complete are the perfection of generosity, the perfection of moral discipline, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of meditative stabilization, the perfection of wisdom, the perfection of skillful means, the perfection of aspiration, the perfection of power, and the perfection of pristine awareness.

analyzed: sems can thams cad la phan gdags par bya'o //
translated: One should benefit all sentient beings.🔽One should not engage in the ten unwholesome actions: taking life, taking what has not been given, sexual misconduct, lying, harsh speech, slander, idle speech, covetousness, malice, and wrong views.

translated: These are the categories of mistaken Dharma that the śūdra

analyzed: la sogs pa rnams sad par byas nas skra bregs te dur smrig 'dzin pa'i dge slong rnams su byed par 'gyur ba ni ;
translated: and so on, they will shave their heads and become monks wearing saffron robes.

original: gang dag sngon du lha ma yin gyi phyogs na gnas pa nor lhas g-yul du ma bsnun pa rnams te bram ze rnams la sun 'byin pa byas na dmyal bar 'gro ba gang yin pa des na dmangs rigs la sogs pa sngar lha ma yin gyi phyogs ni
analyzed: gang dag sngon du lha ma yin gyi phyogs na gnas pa nor lhas g-yul du ma bsnun pa rnams te bram ze rnams la sun 'byin pa byas na dmyal bar 'gro ba gang yin pa des na dmangs rigs la sogs pa sngar lha ma yin gyi phyogs ni
translated: Those who previously lived in the asura realm and were not defeated by Vaisravana in battle will become brahmins who criticize the Buddha and go to hell.

original: gnas pa rnams dmyal bar 'gro ba'i don du @259b khyab 'jug gis sangs rgyas kyi sgyu 'di byas te de ltar sangs rgyas kyi 'jug pa zhes dang / rigs ldan ni sham bha la'i yul du nor lha bram ze'i bu grags par gyur nas rdo'i rta la zhon te ku sha'i rang bzhin can gyi mdung rnams kyis kla klo thams cad bsad nas gser mang po'i me dha'i mchod sbyin byas te slar yang sa gzhi bram
analyzed: gnas pa rnams dmyal bar 'gro ba'i don du @259b khyab 'jug gis sangs rgyas kyi sgyu 'di byas te de ltar sangs rgyas kyi 'jug pa zhes dang / rigs ldan ni sham bha la'i yul du nor lha bram ze'i bu grags par gyur nas rdo'i rta la zhon te ku sha'i rang bzhin can gyi mdung rnams kyis kla klo thams cad bsad nas gser mang po'i me dha'i mchod sbyin byas te slar yang sa gzhi bram
translated: For the sake of the destruction of the world, Viṣṇu, in the form of a buddha, will do this.

original: ze'i rang bzhin du byed par 'gyur ro zhe'o //
analyzed: ze'i rang bzhin du byed par 'gyur ro zhe'o //
translated: The kṣatriya will become the son of a brahmin, the god of wealth, in the land of Shambhala. Riding a stone horse, he will kill all the barbarians with spears made of kuśa grass. He will perform a sacrifice of many pieces of gold and will again make the land the nature of brahmins.

original: de ltar mi 'thad pa'i tshig du ma ma rnams ni gdug pa'i bram ze rnams kyi sangs rgyas byung ba'i dus su bkod pa ste sngon gyi rig byed klog pa la med do //
analyzed: de ltar mi 'thad pa'i tshig du ma ma rnams ni gdug pa'i bram ze rnams kyi sangs rgyas byung ba'i dus su bkod pa ste sngon gyi rig byed klog pa la med do //
translated: These and many other untenable statements are the compositions of evil brahmins at the time of the advent of the Buddha; they are not found in the Vedas of old.

original: 'dir dang po'i sangs rgyas ston pa'i dus su 'jig rten khams kyi le'u'i skar rtsis kyi skabs las kla klo'i chos byung bar gyur pa nas la grub pa'i mtha' rnams rnam par nyams par 'gyur zhing nyung du'i byed pa rnams 'byung bar 'gyur te 'jam pa'i dbyangs kyang
analyzed: 'dir dang po'i sangs rgyas ston pa'i dus su 'jig rten khams kyi le'u'i skar rtsis kyi skabs las kla klo'i chos byung bar gyur pa nas la grub pa'i mtha' rnams rnam par nyams par 'gyur zhing nyung du'i byed pa rnams 'byung bar 'gyur te 'jam pa'i dbyangs kyang
translated: Here, at the time when the first Buddha taught, in the chapter on astrology in the world systems, from the time when the religion of the barbarians arose, the philosophical systems will be damaged and the activities of the few will arise.🔽Mañjuśrī,

original: lo drug brgya na sham bha la'i yul du sh'akya'i rigs la lha mo sna tshogs yum gyi mngal nas lha dbang ldan gyi sras rigs ldan grags pa zhes bya bar 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: lo drug brgya na sham bha la'i yul du sh'akya'i rigs la lha mo sna tshogs yum gyi mngal nas lha dbang ldan gyi sras rigs ldan grags pa zhes bya bar 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
translated: in six hundred years, in the land of Shambhala, in the Śākya family, from the womb of the goddess Viśvamātā, the son of Indra, known as the Kṣatriya Yaśas, will appear.🔽Thus it is said by the Tathāgata:

original: lo 'di nas ni drug brgya'i lo yis gsal bar mi bdag grags pa sham bha la zhes bya bar 'byung //
analyzed: lo 'di nas ni drug brgya'i lo yis gsal bar mi bdag grags pa sham bha la zhes bya bar 'byung //
translated: From this year, in six hundred years, the king Yaśas will appear in Shambhala.

original: de nas klu'i lo brgya rnams kyis nges par mkha'i yul du kla klo'i chos dag rab tu 'jug / de'i dus su 'dzin ma la ni nyung du'i byed pa gsal bar mi rnams dag gis rig par bya /
analyzed: de nas klu'i lo brgya rnams kyis nges par mkha'i yul du kla klo'i chos dag rab tu 'jug / de'i dus su 'dzin ma la ni nyung du'i byed pa gsal bar mi rnams dag gis rig par bya /
translated: Then, in the year of the serpent, the religion of the barbarians will certainly spread in the land of the sky.🔽At that time, the people will know that the influence of the Kali age is increasing.🔽When the doctrines of the earth are completely destroyed, the conjunction of the Kali age will have taken place.

original: mtha' dag sa gzhi la ni grub pa'i mtha' rnams rnam par nyams pa dus kyi sbyor ba la 'byung 'gyur zhes pa de bzhin gshegs pas 'jam pa'i dbyangs lung bstan pa ste de yang nyi ma'i shing rta la sogs pa tshangs pa'i drang srong bye ba phrag phyed
analyzed: mtha' dag sa gzhi la ni grub pa'i mtha' rnams rnam par nyams pa dus kyi sbyor ba la 'byung 'gyur zhes pa de bzhin gshegs pas 'jam pa'i dbyangs lung bstan pa ste de yang nyi ma'i shing rta la sogs pa tshangs pa'i drang srong bye ba phrag phyed
translated: This is the prophecy of the Tathagata concerning Manjusri.

original: dang bcas pa'i gsum rnams rdo rje theg pa'i bsam pas rigs gcig tu byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dang bcas pa'i gsum rnams rdo rje theg pa'i bsam pas rigs gcig tu byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: The half-brahmin Rishi, Surya, and the rest, together with five hundred and fifty million other brahmin Rishis, will be united in the Vajrayana.

original: des na 'jam pa'i dbyangs la rigs ldan gyi mtshon 'byung bar 'gyur gyi bram ze'i rigs 'jog par byed pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des na 'jam pa'i dbyangs la rigs ldan gyi mtshon 'byung bar 'gyur gyi bram ze'i rigs 'jog par byed pas ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, Manjusri will be born as a Kshatriya, not as a Brahmin.

original: gal te grags pa bram ze'i bu rigs ldan yin na de'i tshe gang gis na 'dir rigs ldan yin nor med par ni nor ldan ma yin no //🔽rigs zhes bya ba ni rigs dang rigs ma yin pa @260a * //
analyzed: gal te grags pa bram ze'i bu rigs ldan yin na de'i tshe gang gis na 'dir rigs ldan yin nor med par ni nor ldan ma yin no // rigs zhes bya ba ni rigs dang rigs ma yin pa @260a * //
translated: If the brahmin boy Yaśas was a kṣatriya, then how could he be a kṣatriya here without being a kṣatriya there?

original: rnams gcig tu byed pa'o //
analyzed: rnams gcig tu byed pa'o //
translated: The word “kṣatriya” is used to refer to both kṣatriyas and non-kṣatriyas.🔽It is used to refer to those who have the kṣatriya caste.

original: rigs de gang la yod pa de ni rigs ldan te rigs ldan de nyid ni rigs med par ma yin no //
analyzed: rigs de gang la yod pa de ni rigs ldan te rigs ldan de nyid ni rigs med par ma yin no //
translated: That kṣatriya is not without the kṣatriya caste.

original: slar yang dus bzhi'i mthar kla klo rnams kyi shin tu chos ma yin pa gzigs nas ri bo bzhin du 'dar ba med par 'gyur te rta mchog gi ting nge 'dzin gyis rta mchog mtha' yas pa spros nas de rnams kyis kla klo rnams kyi sems zhum par
analyzed: slar yang dus bzhi'i mthar kla klo rnams kyi shin tu chos ma yin pa gzigs nas ri bo bzhin du 'dar ba med par 'gyur te rta mchog gi ting nge 'dzin gyis rta mchog mtha' yas pa spros nas de rnams kyis kla klo rnams kyi sems zhum par
translated: Again, at the end of the four ages, seeing the great unrighteousness of the barbarians, he will become unshakable like a mountain. Through the supreme horse samādhi, he will emanate infinite supreme horses. They will cause the minds of the barbarians to become depressed,

original: byas te rang gi chos la 'god par 'gyur zhing de rnams kyi chos 'joms par 'gyur gyi srog gtong ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: byas te rang gi chos la 'god par 'gyur zhing de rnams kyi chos 'joms par 'gyur gyi srog gtong ba ni ma yin no //
translated: and he will establish them in their own religion. He will destroy their religion, but not their lives.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis nang gi le'u las tshigs su bcad pa bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad pas gsungs pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis nang gi le'u las tshigs su bcad pa bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad pas gsungs pa /
translated: The Bhagavat has said in the chapter on the internal, with forty-eight verses,

original: 'khor lo can ni rang gi lus la rdo rje can te lha mchog bdag rnams yan lag bcu gnyis 'gog / rigs ldan dag ni yang dag ye shes glang po rta dang shing rta mngag ga gzhug 'phags pa'i tshad med rnams //
analyzed: 'khor lo can ni rang gi lus la rdo rje can te lha mchog bdag rnams yan lag bcu gnyis 'gog / rigs ldan dag ni yang dag ye shes glang po rta dang shing rta mngag ga gzhug 'phags pa'i tshad med rnams //
translated: “The Cakravartins, the Vajrins, the supreme gods, ourselves, the twelve members, the noble ones, the immeasurables,

original: drag po rang rgyal ming can du 'gyur ha nu m'a na ni nyan thos dag go gdug pa kla klo'i dbang //
analyzed: drag po rang rgyal ming can du 'gyur ha nu m'a na ni nyan thos dag go gdug pa kla klo'i dbang //
translated: the Pratyekabuddhas, the Hanumans, the Sravakas, the barbarians,

original: srog chags rnams kyi sdig pa dag ste gang zhig byed pa'i blo gros sdug bsngal sbyin byed mi dge'i lam zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: srog chags rnams kyi sdig pa dag ste gang zhig byed pa'i blo gros sdug bsngal sbyin byed mi dge'i lam zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: the sinful beings, the one who gives suffering, the unwholesome paths, and so on.”

original: kla klo'i 'khrug pa de bzhin gshegs pas lung bstan pa le'u dang po las gsungs pa gang yin pa rigs ldan gyis rdo'i rta rnams kyis kla klo rnams 'joms par 'gyur pa de ni gdug pa'i drang srong de rnams kyi sems zhum par byed pa'i don du ste
analyzed: kla klo'i 'khrug pa de bzhin gshegs pas lung bstan pa le'u dang po las gsungs pa gang yin pa rigs ldan gyis rdo'i rta rnams kyis kla klo rnams 'joms par 'gyur pa de ni gdug pa'i drang srong de rnams kyi sems zhum par byed pa'i don du ste
translated: The barbarian war that the Tathāgata predicted in the first chapter of the Sutra of the Prophecy of the Barbarian King will be the destruction of the barbarians by the stone horses of the Kalkī. This is for the purpose of discouraging the minds of those evil ṛṣis.

original: rnam pa gzhan du dang por the tshom gyi sems skyes par gyur na rtogs par bya bar mi nus so //🔽de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' thabs la mkhas par rig par bya'o /

translated: Otherwise, if doubt arises in their minds first, they will be unable to understand.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the Bhagavān said, “The bodhisattva should be known as skilled in means.”

analyzed: de ltar lo rgyus kyi chos rnams ni rnam par dpyang na don med pa'o //
translated: Thus, when the historical dharmas are analyzed, they are meaningless.

analyzed: ci ste drang srong gdug pa rnams kyis smras pa /
translated: If the evil ṛṣis say,

analyzed: lo rgyus dang ni shed bu'i chos //
translated: “The historical and Śākya dharmas,

analyzed: rig byed yan lag bcas dang gso //
translated: the Vedas with their branches, and the Purāṇas,

original: bka' yis grub pa bzhi po ni //
analyzed: bka' yis grub pa bzhi po ni //
translated: these four established by the Vedas,

original: gtan tshigs rnams kyis gzhom mo bya //
analyzed: gtan tshigs rnams kyis gzhom mo bya //

original: shed bu rgyas pa b'a shishtha'i //
analyzed: shed bu rgyas pa b'a shishtha'i //
translated: The son of Prajāpati, the one called Vālmīki,

original: tshig ni rig byed dang bcas pa //
analyzed: tshig ni rig byed dang bcas pa //
translated: the one who speaks with the Vedas,🔽the one who speaks without valid cognition,
