original: gdug pa'i drang @260b srong rnams kyi brdzun gyi tshig 'di nyid ni rang gi rigs rab tu gzhag pa'i don du byis pa rnams kun du rmongs pa skyed par byed pa ste rnam par dpyad pas stong pa'o //🔽gal te sems can rnams kyi 'dod chags kyi 'pho ba'i bag chags thog ma med pa yin zhing de'i mthus 'khor ba yin na 'on de'i tshe ci'i don du bcom ldan 'das kyis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis bstan te nyon mongs pa dang
analyzed: gdug pa'i drang @260b srong rnams kyi brdzun gyi tshig 'di nyid ni rang gi rigs rab tu gzhag pa'i don du byis pa rnams kun du rmongs pa skyed par byed pa ste rnam par dpyad pas stong pa'o // gal te sems can rnams kyi 'dod chags kyi 'pho ba'i bag chags thog ma med pa yin zhing de'i mthus 'khor ba yin na 'on de'i tshe ci'i don du bcom ldan 'das kyis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis bstan te nyon mongs pa dang
translated: This false statement of the wicked ṛṣis is for the purpose of establishing their own class, and it produces delusion in the childish, but it is empty of analysis.🔽If the latent tendencies of the transference of desire of sentient beings are beginningless, and through their power there is saṃsāra, then at that time for what purpose did the Bhagavān teach the twelve links of dependent origination, where the links such as ignorance are respectively included in the three: afflictions,

original: las dang sdug bsngal zhes pa gsum po rnams su rim pa bzhin ma rig pa la sogs pa'i yan lag rnams yang dag par bsdus so //
analyzed: las dang sdug bsngal zhes pa gsum po rnams su rim pa bzhin ma rig pa la sogs pa'i yan lag rnams yang dag par bsdus so //
translated: actions, and suffering?

original: de'i phyir nyon mongs pa las las su 'gyur zhing las las sdug bsngal du 'gyur te sdug bsngal las slar yang nyon mongs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir nyon mongs pa las las su 'gyur zhing las las sdug bsngal du 'gyur te sdug bsngal las slar yang nyon mongs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, from the afflictions, there is karma; from karma, there is suffering; and from suffering, again, there are afflictions.

original: 'di nyid ni srid pa'i 'khor lo ste 'gro ba thams cad rgyu dang 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid ni srid pa'i 'khor lo ste 'gro ba thams cad rgyu dang 'bras bu'o //
translated: This is the wheel of existence, the cause and effect of all transmigrating beings.

original: sems can gzhan ni 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: sems can gzhan ni 'ga' yang med do //
translated: There are no other sentient beings.

original: stong pa rnams las chos rnams su 'gyur zhing chos rnams las kyang stong pa rnams su 'gyur te kha thon la sogs pa'i dpe rnams kyis de rnams shes par bya'o //
analyzed: stong pa rnams las chos rnams su 'gyur zhing chos rnams las kyang stong pa rnams su 'gyur te kha thon la sogs pa'i dpe rnams kyis de rnams shes par bya'o //
translated: From emptinesses, phenomena arise, and from phenomena, again, emptinesses arise. This should be understood through the examples of recitations, etc.🔽Therefore, this latent proclivity of transmigration does not constitute the wheel of existence.

original: de'i phyir 'pho ba'i bag chags 'di ni 'khor ba'i 'khor lor mi 'gyur ro zhes pa 'dir 'gag zhig gi bsam pa 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'pho ba'i bag chags 'di ni 'khor ba'i 'khor lor mi 'gyur ro zhes pa 'dir 'gag zhig gi bsam pa 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: This is the thought that occurs here.

original: de'i phyir brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be stated.

original: 'dir byis pa rnams kyis ma rig pa la sogs pa brten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis ni nyon mongs pa dang las dang sdug bsngal gyi bdag nyid de nyid 'khor ba'i 'khor lor brjod pa gang yin pa de ni ma yin te gang gi
analyzed: 'dir byis pa rnams kyis ma rig pa la sogs pa brten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis ni nyon mongs pa dang las dang sdug bsngal gyi bdag nyid de nyid 'khor ba'i 'khor lor brjod pa gang yin pa de ni ma yin te gang gi
translated: Here, the twelve members of dependent origination, beginning with ignorance, which are of the nature of afflictions, actions, and suffering, are not the wheel of life that is referred to, because

original: phyir bcom ldan 'das mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i rig pa 'dzin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: phyir bcom ldan 'das mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i rig pa 'dzin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: the Lord is a holder of unchanging awareness.

original: 'dir bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i rig pa 'dzin pa 'khor ba'i bag chags las 'das pa ste de'i chos mi mthun pas 'khor ba rnams 'gyur pa'i rig pa 'dzin pa 'khor ba'i bag chags kyis bzung ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i rig pa 'dzin pa 'khor ba'i bag chags las 'das pa ste de'i chos mi mthun pas 'khor ba rnams 'gyur pa'i rig pa 'dzin pa 'khor ba'i bag chags kyis bzung ba'o //
translated: Here, the Lord Vajrasattva is a holder of unchanging awareness, beyond the habitual tendencies of cyclic existence. Because of his dissimilarity to that, those in cyclic existence are holders of changing awareness, bound by the habitual tendencies of cyclic existence.

original: de'i phyir mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i 'dod chags chen po ni rig pa ste ma rig pa ni 'dir sems can rnams kyi thog ma med pa'i 'dod chags kyi bag chags so //
analyzed: de'i phyir mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i 'dod chags chen po ni rig pa ste ma rig pa ni 'dir sems can rnams kyi thog ma med pa'i 'dod chags kyi bag chags so //
translated: Therefore, great unchanging passion is awareness. Ignorance here is the beginningless habitual tendency to passion of sentient beings.

original: des 'dod chags la rab tu 'jug ste 'dod chags kyang 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: des 'dod chags la rab tu 'jug ste 'dod chags kyang 'gyur pa'o //
translated: From that, passion arises, and passion is also a transformation.🔽From a transformation, one becomes free from passion, and being free from passion is aversion.

original: 'gyur pa las chags pa dang bral ba ste chags pa @261a * //🔽dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni zhe sdang ngo //🔽zhe sdang gi bdag nyid ni brgyal ba ste brgyal ba zhes bya ba ni gti mug go //
analyzed: 'gyur pa las chags pa dang bral ba ste chags pa @261a * // dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni zhe sdang ngo // zhe sdang gi bdag nyid ni brgyal ba ste brgyal ba zhes bya ba ni gti mug go //
translated: The nature of aversion is fainting, and fainting is delusion.

original: de ltar 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi bdag nyid ni ma rig pa ste nam mkha'i me tog gi phreng ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi bdag nyid ni ma rig pa ste nam mkha'i me tog gi phreng ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the nature of passion, aversion, and delusion is ignorance, not a garland of sky flowers.

original: ma rig pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'o ;🔽/ ma rig pa las 'du byed de las so //
analyzed: ma rig pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'o ; / ma rig pa las 'du byed de las so //
translated: What is called ignorance is affliction.🔽From ignorance, formations; from that, consciousness; from consciousness, name-and-form; from name-and-form, the six sense bases; from the six sense bases, contact; from contact, feeling; from feeling, craving; from craving, grasping; from grasping, existence; from existence, birth; and from birth, aging, death, sorrow, lamentation, suffering, unhappiness, and distress come to be.🔽This is the origin of the world.🔽From ignorance, formations; from formations, consciousness; from consciousness, name-and-form; from name-and-form, the six sense bases; from the six sense bases, contact; from contact, feeling; from feeling, craving; from craving, grasping; from grasping, existence; from existence, birth; and from birth, aging, death, sorrow, lamentation, suffering, unhappiness, and distress come to be.🔽This is the origin of the world.

original: 'du byed las rnam par shes pa ste sdug bsngal lo zhes pa ni dang po chung ngu'i gnas skabs kyi lus dang ngag dang sems so //🔽de nas rnam par shes pa las ming dang gzugs te nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed las rnam par shes pa ste sdug bsngal lo zhes pa ni dang po chung ngu'i gnas skabs kyi lus dang ngag dang sems so // de nas rnam par shes pa las ming dang gzugs te nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: From ignorance, formations; from formations, consciousness; from consciousness, name-and-form; from name-and-form, the six sense bases; from the six sense bases, contact; from contact, feeling; from feeling, craving; from craving, grasping; from grasping, existence; from existence, birth; from birth, aging, death, sorrow, lamentation, suffering, unhappiness, and distress come to be.🔽This is the origin of the world.

original: ming dang gzugs las skye mched drug ste las so //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs las skye mched drug ste las so //
translated: From ignorance, formations; from formations, consciousness; from consciousness, name-and-form; from name-and-form, the six sense bases; from the six sense bases, contact; from contact, feeling; from feeling, craving; from craving, grasping; from grasping, existence; from existence, birth; from birth, aging, death, sorrow, lamentation, suffering, unhappiness, and distress come to be.🔽This is the origin of the world.🔽From ignorance, formations; from formations, consciousness; from consciousness, name-and-form; from name-and-form, the six sense bases; from the six sense bases, contact; from contact, feeling; from feeling, craving; from

original: skye mched drug las reg pa ste sdug bsngal lo zhes pa ni gnyis pa 'bring po'i gnas skabs kyi lus dang ngag dang sems so //
analyzed: skye mched drug las reg pa ste sdug bsngal lo zhes pa ni gnyis pa 'bring po'i gnas skabs kyi lus dang ngag dang sems so //
translated: From the six sense-spheres, contact, which is suffering. This is the body, speech, and mind of the second stage, the middle.

original: de nas reg pa las tshor ba ste nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: de nas reg pa las tshor ba ste nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: Then, from contact, feeling, which is the afflictions.

original: tshor ba las sred pa ste las so //
analyzed: tshor ba las sred pa ste las so //
translated: From feeling, craving, which is karma.

original: sred pa las len pa ste sdug bsngal lo zhes pa ni gsum pa chen po'i gnas skabs kyi lus dang ngag dang sems so //
analyzed: sred pa las len pa ste sdug bsngal lo zhes pa ni gsum pa chen po'i gnas skabs kyi lus dang ngag dang sems so //
translated: From craving, grasping, which is suffering. This is the body, speech, and mind of the third stage, the great.

original: de nas len pa las srid pa ste nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: de nas len pa las srid pa ste nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: Then, from grasping, becoming, which is the afflictions.

original: srid pa las skye ba ste las so //
analyzed: srid pa las skye ba ste las so //
translated: From becoming, birth, which is karma.

original: skye ba las rga shi ste sdug bsngal lo zhes pa ni bzhi pa chen po'i chen po'i gnas skabs kyi lus dang ngag dang sems so //
analyzed: skye ba las rga shi ste sdug bsngal lo zhes pa ni bzhi pa chen po'i chen po'i gnas skabs kyi lus dang ngag dang sems so //
translated: From birth, aging and death, which is suffering. This is the body, speech, and mind of the fourth stage, the great of the great.

original: de ltar lus dang ngag dang sems dang ye shes kyi bdag nyid bzhi po rnams ni chu srin la sogs pa'i dus sbyor gsum gsum la ste mngal dang sgo dang phyi'i dbye ba rnams la'o //
analyzed: de ltar lus dang ngag dang sems dang ye shes kyi bdag nyid bzhi po rnams ni chu srin la sogs pa'i dus sbyor gsum gsum la ste mngal dang sgo dang phyi'i dbye ba rnams la'o //
translated: Thus, the four bodies, speech, mind, and gnosis are in the three conjunctions of Makara and so on, in the divisions of the womb, door, and outside.

original: de la mi rnams kyi mngal 'dzin pa'i zla ba ni chu srin dang ma rig pa ste mngal lo //
analyzed: de la mi rnams kyi mngal 'dzin pa'i zla ba ni chu srin dang ma rig pa ste mngal lo //
translated: The month of conception for humans is Capricorn and ignorance, which is the womb.

original: zla ba gnyis pa ni bum pa dang 'du byed de sgo'o //
analyzed: zla ba gnyis pa ni bum pa dang 'du byed de sgo'o //
translated: The second month is Aquarius and karmic formation, which is the door.

original: zla ba gsum pa ni nya dang rnam par shes pa ste phyi rol lo zhes pa zla ba gsum gyi bdag nyid ni mngal nas skyes pa rnams kyi chung ngu'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: zla ba gsum pa ni nya dang rnam par shes pa ste phyi rol lo zhes pa zla ba gsum gyi bdag nyid ni mngal nas skyes pa rnams kyi chung ngu'i gnas skabs so //
translated: The third month is Pisces and consciousness, which is outside. These three months are the period of the fetus in the womb.

original: de nas bzhi pa ni lug dang ming dang gzugs te mngal lo //
analyzed: de nas bzhi pa ni lug dang ming dang gzugs te mngal lo //
translated: Then the fourth month is Aries and name and form, which is the womb.

original: lnga pa ni glang dang skye mched drug ste sgo'o //
analyzed: lnga pa ni glang dang skye mched drug ste sgo'o //
translated: The fifth month is Taurus and the six sense bases, which is the door.

original: drug pa ni 'khrig pa dang reg pa ste phyi rol lo zhes pa zla ba gsum gyi bdag nyid ni 'bring po'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: drug pa ni 'khrig pa dang reg pa ste phyi rol lo zhes pa zla ba gsum gyi bdag nyid ni 'bring po'i gnas skabs so //
translated: The sixth month is Gemini and contact, which is outside. These three months are the period of the fetus in the womb.

original: de nas zla ba bdun pa ni karka ta dang tshor ba ste mngal lo //
analyzed: de nas zla ba bdun pa ni karka ta dang tshor ba ste mngal lo //
translated: Then the seventh month is Cancer and feeling, which is the womb.

original: brgyad pa ni seng ge dang sred pa ste sgo'o //
analyzed: brgyad pa ni seng ge dang sred pa ste sgo'o //
translated: The eighth month is Leo and craving, which is the door.

original: dgu pa ni bu mo dang len pa ste phyi rol lo zhes pa zla ba gsum gyi bdag @261b nyid ni gsum pa chen po'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: dgu pa ni bu mo dang len pa ste phyi rol lo zhes pa zla ba gsum gyi bdag @261b nyid ni gsum pa chen po'i gnas skabs so //
translated: The ninth is the girl, the acceptance, the external.

original: de nas zla ba bcu pa ni srang dang srid pa ste mngal lo //
analyzed: de nas zla ba bcu pa ni srang dang srid pa ste mngal lo //
translated: The tenth month is the scales, existence, the womb.

original: bcu gcig pa ni sdig pa dang skye ba ste sgo'o //
analyzed: bcu gcig pa ni sdig pa dang skye ba ste sgo'o //
translated: The eleventh is the scorpion, birth, the door.

original: bcu gnyis pa ni gzhu dang rga shi ste phyi rol lo zhes pa zla ba gsum gyi bdag nyid ni chen po'i chen po'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: bcu gnyis pa ni gzhu dang rga shi ste phyi rol lo zhes pa zla ba gsum gyi bdag nyid ni chen po'i chen po'i gnas skabs so //
translated: The twelfth is the bow, old age and death, the external.

original: de ltar lus dang ngag dang sems dang ye shes kyi dbye ba ste ye shes kyi dang po chung ngu'i gnas skabs dang lus kyi bzhi par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar lus dang ngag dang sems dang ye shes kyi dbye ba ste ye shes kyi dang po chung ngu'i gnas skabs dang lus kyi bzhi par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the body, speech, mind, and gnosis are distinguished. The first gnosis is the stage of small, and the fourth body is to be known.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyud kyi rgyal po'i lnga pa ye shes kyi le'u las tshigs su bcad pa brgya bdun cu pas gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyud kyi rgyal po'i lnga pa ye shes kyi le'u las tshigs su bcad pa brgya bdun cu pas gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
translated: The Blessed One has taught this in the fifth chapter on gnosis in the King of Tantras with five chapters, in one hundred and seventy verses.

original: las ni nyon mongs las te de las sdug bsngal du 'gyur nyon mongs nyid ni rang gi sdug bsngal las //
analyzed: las ni nyon mongs las te de las sdug bsngal du 'gyur nyon mongs nyid ni rang gi sdug bsngal las //
translated: Action is from the afflictions; from that, suffering. The afflictions themselves are from suffering.

original: 'di ni 'khor ba'i 'khor lor 'khyam pa rgyu dang 'bras bu mnyam pa dag ste sems can gzhan pa med //
analyzed: 'di ni 'khor ba'i 'khor lor 'khyam pa rgyu dang 'bras bu mnyam pa dag ste sems can gzhan pa med //
translated: This is the wheel of cyclic existence, with its causes and effects, with no other sentient being.

original: stong pa rnams las phung po'i chos rnams 'dir ni 'chi ba'i mtha' ru de rnams las kyang stong pa rnams //
analyzed: stong pa rnams las phung po'i chos rnams 'dir ni 'chi ba'i mtha' ru de rnams las kyang stong pa rnams //
translated: From the empty, the phenomena of the aggregates arise here. At the end of death, from those, the empty.

original: kha thon mar me chu dang me tog sgra dang me shel skyur ba sa bon rnams kyis shes par bya zhes pa ste kha thon la sogs pa'i dpe 'di rnams kyis phung po rnams kyi skye ba dang 'gag pa rig par bya'o //
analyzed: kha thon mar me chu dang me tog sgra dang me shel skyur ba sa bon rnams kyis shes par bya zhes pa ste kha thon la sogs pa'i dpe 'di rnams kyis phung po rnams kyi skye ba dang 'gag pa rig par bya'o //
translated: From the examples of recitation, lamp, water, flower, sound, fire glass, sour, and seed, it should be understood. The arising and ceasing of the aggregates should be understood from these examples of recitation and so on.

original: ji ltar kha thon la mkhan po'i rig pa zad pa ma yin zhing slob mas thob pa med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar kha thon la mkhan po'i rig pa zad pa ma yin zhing slob mas thob pa med pa ma yin no //
translated: Just as in recitation, the knowledge of the teacher is not exhausted and the student does not obtain anything.

original: de bzhin du mar me las mar me 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du mar me las mar me 'byung ngo //
translated: In the same way, a lamp arises from a lamp.

original: chu la yang zla ba las zla ba dang me tog las gos la dri dang nyi ma las me shel la me dang sgra las sgra brnyan dang skyur ba las lce 'dzag pa dang sa bon las myu gu'o //
analyzed: chu la yang zla ba las zla ba dang me tog las gos la dri dang nyi ma las me shel la me dang sgra las sgra brnyan dang skyur ba las lce 'dzag pa dang sa bon las myu gu'o //
translated: In water, from the moon, the moon; from a flower, the scent; from the sun, the fire crystal; from sound, the echo; from sourness, the salivation; from the seed, the sprout.

original: de bzhin du phung po rnams kyi mtshams sbyor ba ni 'gyur pa'i 'dod chags kyi bag chags kyi dbang gis so //
analyzed: de bzhin du phung po rnams kyi mtshams sbyor ba ni 'gyur pa'i 'dod chags kyi bag chags kyi dbang gis so //
translated: In the same way, the connection of the aggregates is by the power of the instinct of passion for change.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung 'di'i phyir 'khor ba'i 'khor lo ni 'gyur pa'i 'dod chags te ma rig pa'o //🔽'dir gang gi tshe 'gyur pa'i 'dod chags nyams pa de'i tshe mchog tu mi 'gyur bar 'gyur te mchog tu mi 'gyur pa ni 'dod chags chen po'o //🔽'dod chags chen po las chags bral nyams pa ste chags bral zhes bya ba ni zhe sdang ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung 'di'i phyir 'khor ba'i 'khor lo ni 'gyur pa'i 'dod chags te ma rig pa'o // 'dir gang gi tshe 'gyur pa'i 'dod chags nyams pa de'i tshe mchog tu mi 'gyur bar 'gyur te mchog tu mi 'gyur pa ni 'dod chags chen po'o // 'dod chags chen po las chags bral nyams pa ste chags bral zhes bya ba ni zhe sdang ngo //
translated: Because of this statement of the Lord, the wheel of transmigration is the passion for change, which is ignorance.🔽Here, when the passion for change declines, then there is the supreme unchanging, which is the great passion.🔽From the great passion, there is the decline of passionlessness, which is hatred.

original: zhe sdang zad pa las zhe sdang chen por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhe sdang zad pa las zhe sdang chen por 'gyur ro //
translated: From the exhaustion of hatred, there is the great hatred.

original: zhe sdang chen po las brgyal ba zhes bya ba gti mug nyams pa'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang chen po las brgyal ba zhes bya ba gti mug nyams pa'o //
translated: From great passion, “fainting” occurs, which is a loss of delusion.

original: gti mug nyams pa las gti mug chen por 'gyur ro //🔽'dod chags chen po dang zhe @262a * //
analyzed: gti mug nyams pa las gti mug chen por 'gyur ro // 'dod chags chen po dang zhe @262a * //
translated: From a loss of delusion, “great delusion” occurs.

original: sdang chen po dang gti mug chen po las 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi bdag nyid ma rig pa nyams pa'o //
analyzed: sdang chen po dang gti mug chen po las 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi bdag nyid ma rig pa nyams pa'o //
translated: From great passion, great hatred, and great delusion, ignorance arises, which is the nature of passion, hatred, and delusion.

original: ma rig pa zad pa las ma rig pa chen por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa zad pa las ma rig pa chen por 'gyur ro //
translated: From the exhaustion of ignorance, “great ignorance” occurs.

original: de ltar ma rig pa 'gags pas 'dud byed 'gag go //
analyzed: de ltar ma rig pa 'gags pas 'dud byed 'gag go //
translated: In this way, from the cessation of ignorance, the formative predispositions cease.

original: 'du byed 'gags pas rnam par shes pa 'gag go //
analyzed: 'du byed 'gags pas rnam par shes pa 'gag go //
translated: From the cessation of the formative predispositions, consciousness ceases.

original: rnam par shes pa 'gags pas ming dang gzugs 'gag go //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'gags pas ming dang gzugs 'gag go //
translated: From the cessation of consciousness, name and form cease.

original: ming dang gzugs 'gags pas skye mched drug 'gag go //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs 'gags pas skye mched drug 'gag go //
translated: From the cessation of name and form, the six sense fields cease.

original: skye mched drug 'gags pas reg pa 'gag go //
analyzed: skye mched drug 'gags pas reg pa 'gag go //
translated: From the cessation of the six sense fields, contact ceases.

original: reg pa 'gags pas tshor ba 'gag go //
analyzed: reg pa 'gags pas tshor ba 'gag go //
translated: From the cessation of contact, sensation ceases.

original: tshor ba 'gags pas sred pa 'gag go //
analyzed: tshor ba 'gags pas sred pa 'gag go //
translated: From the cessation of sensation, craving ceases.

original: sred pa 'gags pas len pa 'gag go //
analyzed: sred pa 'gags pas len pa 'gag go //
translated: From the cessation of craving, grasping ceases.

original: len pa 'gags pas srid pa 'gag go //
analyzed: len pa 'gags pas srid pa 'gag go //
translated: From the cessation of grasping, becoming ceases.

original: srid pa 'gags pas skye ba 'gag go //
analyzed: srid pa 'gags pas skye ba 'gag go //
translated: Because of the cessation of existence, birth ceases.

original: skye ba 'gags pas rga shi 'gag ste de ltar yan lag bcu gnyis 'gags pa las chos mi mthun pas bcom ldan 'das kyi yan lag rnams ni sgrib pa med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: skye ba 'gags pas rga shi 'gag ste de ltar yan lag bcu gnyis 'gags pa las chos mi mthun pas bcom ldan 'das kyi yan lag rnams ni sgrib pa med par rig par bya'o //
translated: Because of the cessation of birth, aging and death cease. Thus, because of the cessation of the twelve members, the Lord’s members are known to be unobstructed.

original: gal te 'gyur pa'i 'dod chags bcom pas rnal 'byor pa rnams sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur na 'o na de'i tshe 'chi bdag dang phung po dang nyon mongs pa dang lha'i bu ste bzhi po rnams gzhom pa de bzhin gshegs pas ci'i don du mdzad de'i phyir 'gyur
analyzed: gal te 'gyur pa'i 'dod chags bcom pas rnal 'byor pa rnams sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur na 'o na de'i tshe 'chi bdag dang phung po dang nyon mongs pa dang lha'i bu ste bzhi po rnams gzhom pa de bzhin gshegs pas ci'i don du mdzad de'i phyir 'gyur
translated: If the yogis were to become Buddhas by destroying the attachment of change, then at that time, for what purpose did the Tathagata destroy the four: the Lord of Death, the aggregates, the afflictions, and the sons of the gods?

original: pa'i 'dod chags bcom pas sangs rgyas nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes pa 'dir 'ga' zhig gi bsam pa 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: pa'i 'dod chags bcom pas sangs rgyas nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes pa 'dir 'ga' zhig gi bsam pa 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, one might think that Buddhahood is not attained by destroying the attachment of change.

original: de'i phyir brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, this should be explained.

original: 'dir rmongs pa rnams kyis brjod pa gang yin pa phyi rol gyi bdud rnams de bzhin gshegs pas bcom pa de ni ma yin te gang gi phyir snga ma dang phyi ma 'gal ba'i phyir ro //🔽'dir gal te sngon du sangs rgyas nyid dang phyi nas bdud bcom pa yin na de'i tshe sangs rgyas la sgrib pa med pa nyid med de bdud kyis nye bar 'tshe ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir rmongs pa rnams kyis brjod pa gang yin pa phyi rol gyi bdud rnams de bzhin gshegs pas bcom pa de ni ma yin te gang gi phyir snga ma dang phyi ma 'gal ba'i phyir ro // 'dir gal te sngon du sangs rgyas nyid dang phyi nas bdud bcom pa yin na de'i tshe sangs rgyas la sgrib pa med pa nyid med de bdud kyis nye bar 'tshe ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, what the ignorant say is not that the transcendent conquerors conquer external demons, because the former and latter are contradictory.🔽Here, if buddhahood is prior and the demons are conquered later, then at that time the transcendent conquerors would not be free from obscurations, because they would be harmed by demons.

original: ci sde sngon du bdud bcom pa dang phyi nas sangs rgyas nyid yin na de'i tshe 'khor ba pa gzhan rnams kyang sangs rgyas nyid med bar bdud bcom pa ci'i phyir mi byed /
analyzed: ci sde sngon du bdud bcom pa dang phyi nas sangs rgyas nyid yin na de'i tshe 'khor ba pa gzhan rnams kyang sangs rgyas nyid med bar bdud bcom pa ci'i phyir mi byed /
translated: If the demons are conquered prior and buddhahood is later, then at that time, why would other transmigrating beings who do not have buddhahood not conquer the demons?

original: ci ste cig car bdud bcom par 'gyur ro zhe na de bzhin du cig car yang bdud bcom pa ma mdzad de skad cig gang la bdud yod pa'i skad cig de la sangs rgyas nyid du mi 'gyur te @262b sems sgrib pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci ste cig car bdud bcom par 'gyur ro zhe na de bzhin du cig car yang bdud bcom pa ma mdzad de skad cig gang la bdud yod pa'i skad cig de la sangs rgyas nyid du mi 'gyur te @262b sems sgrib pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But if the demons are destroyed all at once, then the Buddha would not have been a Buddha in the moment when the demons existed, because the mind would have been obscured.

original: skad cig gang la sangs rgyas nyid yin pa'i skad cig de la bdud med de sgrib pa thams cad zad pa'i phyir ro //🔽de'i phyir sems can rnams kyi lus dang ngag dang sems dang ma rig pa'i bag chags kyi bdag nyid ni bdud bzhi ste de rnams las lus kyi sgrib pa ni phung po'i bdud dang ngag gi sgrib pa ni nyon mongs pa'i bdud dang sems kyi sgrib pa ni
analyzed: skad cig gang la sangs rgyas nyid yin pa'i skad cig de la bdud med de sgrib pa thams cad zad pa'i phyir ro // de'i phyir sems can rnams kyi lus dang ngag dang sems dang ma rig pa'i bag chags kyi bdag nyid ni bdud bzhi ste de rnams las lus kyi sgrib pa ni phung po'i bdud dang ngag gi sgrib pa ni nyon mongs pa'i bdud dang sems kyi sgrib pa ni
translated: And in the moment when he was a Buddha, the demons would not have existed, because all obscurations would have been exhausted.

original: 'chi bdag gi bdud do //
analyzed: 'chi bdag gi bdud do //
translated: Therefore, the four demons are the body, speech, mind, and ignorance of sentient beings. Among them, the obscuration of the body is the demon of the aggregates, the obscuration of speech is the demon of afflictions, the obscuration of mind is the demon of death, and the obscuration of ignorance is the demon of devaputra.

original: phyir rol gyi ma rig pa'i 'jug pa ni lha'i bu'i bdud de dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi 'bras bu nye bar longs spyod pa yongs su ma brtags pa byis pa'i blo can 'khor ba'i longs spyod mngon par 'dod pa rnams kyi phyi rol gyi ma🔽rig pa'i 'jug pa 'di ni lha'i bu'i bdud kyi tshig gis 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyir rol gyi ma rig pa'i 'jug pa ni lha'i bu'i bdud de dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi 'bras bu nye bar longs spyod pa yongs su ma brtags pa byis pa'i blo can 'khor ba'i longs spyod mngon par 'dod pa rnams kyi phyi rol gyi ma rig pa'i 'jug pa 'di ni lha'i bu'i bdud kyi tshig gis 'gyur ro //
translated: The external engagement of ignorance is the māra of the gods. It is the external engagement of ignorance of those who do not examine the enjoyment of the fruits of virtuous and nonvirtuous actions, who are childish, who desire the enjoyments of cyclic existence, and who are subject to the words of the māra of the gods.

original: 'dir lha'i bu rnams kyi tshig ni zla ba'i stobs kyis sems can rnams kyi sems dge ba dang mi dge bar 'gyur te nyi ma'i stobs dang bkra shis kyi stobs dang gza' lag gi stobs dang phur bu'i stobs dang pa ba sangs kyi stobs dang spen pa'i stobs
analyzed: 'dir lha'i bu rnams kyi tshig ni zla ba'i stobs kyis sems can rnams kyi sems dge ba dang mi dge bar 'gyur te nyi ma'i stobs dang bkra shis kyi stobs dang gza' lag gi stobs dang phur bu'i stobs dang pa ba sangs kyi stobs dang spen pa'i stobs
translated: Here, the words of the gods are as follows: “By the power of the moon, the minds of sentient beings become virtuous. By the power of the sun, the power of Bṛhaspati, the power of Aṅgāraka, the power of Śukra, the power of Śani, the power of Rāhu, and the power of Ketu, the minds of sentient beings become nonvirtuous.”

original: dang sgra gcan gyi stobs dang mjug rings kyi stobs dang / gza'i stobs dang tshes kyi stobs dang skar ma'i stobs dang sbyor ba'i stobs dang byed pa'i stobs dang dus sbyor gyi stobs kyis dge ba dang mi dge bar 'gyur ro //🔽de bzhin du dbyangs 'char ba'i stobs la mngon par dga' ba gzhan rnams kyi tshig ni g-yul du dbyangs 'char ba'i stobs kyis rnam par rgyal bar 'gyur te rnal 'byor ma'i stobs dang skar ma'i stobs dang sgra gcan gyi stobs dang drag po'i stobs la sogs pas g-yul
analyzed: dang sgra gcan gyi stobs dang mjug rings kyi stobs dang / gza'i stobs dang tshes kyi stobs dang skar ma'i stobs dang sbyor ba'i stobs dang byed pa'i stobs dang dus sbyor gyi stobs kyis dge ba dang mi dge bar 'gyur ro // de bzhin du dbyangs 'char ba'i stobs la mngon par dga' ba gzhan rnams kyi tshig ni g-yul du dbyangs 'char ba'i stobs kyis rnam par rgyal bar 'gyur te rnal 'byor ma'i stobs dang skar ma'i stobs dang sgra gcan gyi stobs dang drag po'i stobs la sogs pas g-yul
translated: The power of Rahu, the power of Ketu, the power of the planets, the power of the lunar mansions, the power of the stars, the power of the conjunctions, the power of the actions, the power of the periods of the day, are all good or bad.

original: gyi sar rnam par rgyal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gyi sar rnam par rgyal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, those who are devoted to the rising of the vowels will be victorious in battle by the power of the rising of the vowels. By the power of the yoginīs, the power of the stars, the power of Rahu, the power of Śiva, and so on, they will be victorious in battle.

original: de bzhin du sangs rgyas pa'i nyan thos rnams kyi yang phyi rol gyi ma rig pa'i 'jug pa ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i bsam pas sems can rnams kyi dge ba dang mi dge bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du sangs rgyas pa'i nyan thos rnams kyi yang phyi rol gyi ma rig pa'i 'jug pa ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i bsam pas sems can rnams kyi dge ba dang mi dge bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, the external functioning of ignorance of the Buddhist śrāvakas becomes good or bad for sentient beings by the power of the dependent origination that is contemplated.

original: de bzhin du lha'i bu gzhan rnams kyi tshig ni lha'i drin gyis thams cad dge bar 'gyur ro zhes pa ste sems can rnams kyi de lta bu la sogs pa'i ma rig pa'i 'jug ba ni lha'i bu'i bdud kyi tshig gis so //🔽'dir gal te skye ba gzhan gyi bsod nams dang sdig pa dag ma gtogs par lha'i bu'i bdud kyi tshig rnams kyi sems can rnams kyi dge ba dang mi dge @263a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du lha'i bu gzhan rnams kyi tshig ni lha'i drin gyis thams cad dge bar 'gyur ro zhes pa ste sems can rnams kyi de lta bu la sogs pa'i ma rig pa'i 'jug ba ni lha'i bu'i bdud kyi tshig gis so // 'dir gal te skye ba gzhan gyi bsod nams dang sdig pa dag ma gtogs par lha'i bu'i bdud kyi tshig rnams kyi sems can rnams kyi dge ba dang mi dge @263a * //
translated: Likewise, the words of other sons of gods are: “By the grace of the gods, all will be virtuous.” The engagement of beings in such ignorance, etc. is by the words of the sons of gods, Māra.

original: bar 'gyur na de'i tshe sngar bsags pa'i dge ba dang mi dge ba thams cad don med par 'gyur te gza' la sogs pa'i stobs dang stobs ma yin pa nye bar longs spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bar 'gyur na de'i tshe sngar bsags pa'i dge ba dang mi dge ba thams cad don med par 'gyur te gza' la sogs pa'i stobs dang stobs ma yin pa nye bar longs spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, if the virtue and nonvirtue of beings were due to the words of the sons of gods, Māra, except for the merit and sin of other lives, then at that time all previously accumulated virtue and nonvirtue would be pointless because one would experience the power and nonpower of the planets, etc.

original: de ltar yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yang ma yin no //
translated: But that is not so.

original: de bzhin du 'khrul pa yang mthong ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'khrul pa yang mthong ste /
translated: Likewise, error is also seen.

original: dus sbyor las ni s'i ta bde //
analyzed: dus sbyor las ni s'i ta bde //
translated: In the saṃyukta, it is said: “The earth is happy.

original: ldan min gnam stong drin gyis ni //
analyzed: ldan min gnam stong drin gyis ni //
translated: By the grace of the sky, it is not connected.

original: 'thab dga' rnam par rgyal min te //
analyzed: 'thab dga' rnam par rgyal min te //
translated: The one who delights in battle is not victorious.

original: 'jigs sde yis ni phye mar brlags //
analyzed: 'jigs sde yis ni phye mar brlags //
translated: Arjuna ground him to dust.

original: 'thab mo'i sar ni dpung gnas gang //
analyzed: 'thab mo'i sar ni dpung gnas gang //
translated: Those who stood in the army

original: srid bsgrub la ni bsnun 'dod pa //
analyzed: srid bsgrub la ni bsnun 'dod pa //
translated: and wanted to kill Arjuna,🔽Arjuna killed with his arrows,

original: de rnams srid sgrub mda' yis phug / phyogs rnams kun du brlag par gyur /
analyzed: de rnams srid sgrub mda' yis phug / phyogs rnams kun du brlag par gyur /
translated: and they were destroyed in every direction.

original: de'i phyir sngon gyi dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi 'bras bu sems can rnams kyis longs spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir sngon gyi dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi 'bras bu sems can rnams kyis longs spyad par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the results of former virtuous and nonvirtuous actions are to be experienced by sentient beings.

original: de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /🔽lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las //
analyzed: de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa / lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las //
translated: Similarly, the Bhagavān has said:🔽Whatever virtuous and nonvirtuous actions

original: dge dang mi dge gang byed pa //
analyzed: dge dang mi dge gang byed pa //
translated: are done by body, speech, and mind,

original: de 'bras sems can longs spyod de //
analyzed: de 'bras sems can longs spyod de //
translated: sentient beings experience the results.

original: lha gzhan 'bras bu ster ba min zhes so //
analyzed: lha gzhan 'bras bu ster ba min zhes so //
translated: There is no other god who gives results.

original: ci ste gang zhig lha'i drin du mthong ba yang sems can rnams kyi sngon gyi bsod nams kyi stobs kyis yin gyi sdig pa'i stobs kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ci ste gang zhig lha'i drin du mthong ba yang sems can rnams kyi sngon gyi bsod nams kyi stobs kyis yin gyi sdig pa'i stobs kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: If you see that it is the kindness of the gods, it is the power of the former merit of sentient beings, not the power of their evil.

original: bsod nams kyang sems can la phan btags pa las 'gyur gyi lha dang pha mes kyi bya ba la srog bcad pa las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bsod nams kyang sems can la phan btags pa las 'gyur gyi lha dang pha mes kyi bya ba la srog bcad pa las ni ma yin no //
translated: And merit comes from helping sentient beings, not from killing oneself for the sake of gods or ancestors.🔽The Bhagavān says in the Chapter on the Inner

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi sa nang gi le'u las tshigs su bcad pa brgyad cu rtsa dgu pas las kyi 'bras bu gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi sa nang gi le'u las tshigs su bcad pa brgyad cu rtsa dgu pas las kyi 'bras bu gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
translated: that the result of action is like this, in the ninety-ninth verse:

original: de phyir byed po 'ga' yang srog chags rnams kyi bde dang sdug bsngal dag ni mi sbyin mi 'phrog ste //
analyzed: de phyir byed po 'ga' yang srog chags rnams kyi bde dang sdug bsngal dag ni mi sbyin mi 'phrog ste //
translated: Therefore, no creator gives or takes away the happiness and suffering of living beings.

original: 'khor ba dag tu rnam pa gsum po gang byas sngon gyi las ni 'bras bu rab tu sbyin par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'khor ba dag tu rnam pa gsum po gang byas sngon gyi las ni 'bras bu rab tu sbyin par 'gyur //
translated: Whatever is done in the three realms in the past, that action will give its fruit.

original: skyed dang sdud pa'i byed pa po 'di ster zhing de ni 'phrog pa rmongs pa rnams kyi blo yin te //
analyzed: skyed dang sdud pa'i byed pa po 'di ster zhing de ni 'phrog pa rmongs pa rnams kyi blo yin te //
translated: This is the giver and the taker, and the confused think it is the self.

original: lus la dpag med dge ba 'phrog bar byed pa'i bug pa rang gi dbang po rnams kyis mthong ma yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: lus la dpag med dge ba 'phrog bar byed pa'i bug pa rang gi dbang po rnams kyis mthong ma yin zhes pa'o //
translated: The body is not seen to be the giver or the taker of the immeasurable virtue.

original: de bzhin du lha'i bu'i bdud kyang le'u lnga pa'i tshigs su bcad pa brgyad cu rtsa drug pas gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du lha'i bu'i bdud kyang le'u lnga pa'i tshigs su bcad pa brgyad cu rtsa drug pas gsungs pa /
translated: Likewise, the demon of the sons of the gods is taught in the eighty-sixth verse of the fifth chapter:

original: srid pa gsum gyi bdag pos drag po'i las kyis rang bzhin du ma'i sngags rnams rab tu gsungs pa gang //
analyzed: srid pa gsum gyi bdag pos drag po'i las kyis rang bzhin du ma'i sngags rnams rab tu gsungs pa gang //
translated: Those mantras of various natures, which the lord of the three worlds taught for the sake of violent actions,

original: de rnams thams cad bdud kyi phyogs nyams 'jigs pa skyed byed yin gyi srog chags rnams la nam @263b yang min //
analyzed: de rnams thams cad bdud kyi phyogs nyams 'jigs pa skyed byed yin gyi srog chags rnams la nam @263b yang min //
translated: all of them are for the destruction of the side of Mara, for the production of fear, but never for living beings.

original: gang zhig dran pa rnams dang byed po g-yul gyi yul la dga' zhing gsod byed gzhan yang mu stegs pa //
analyzed: gang zhig dran pa rnams dang byed po g-yul gyi yul la dga' zhing gsod byed gzhan yang mu stegs pa //
translated: Those who delight in the objects of battle, who are the agents of killing, and also the tirthikas,🔽for them the supreme sons of the victors apply those for the sake of protecting living beings.

original: de rnams la ni mchog gi rgyal sras rnams kyis srog chags bsrung ba'i don du de rnams sbyar bar bya zhes pa ste bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung 'di'i phyir bdud kyi tshig rnams kyis ma rig pa'i 'jug pa ni rnal 'byor pas mi bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams la ni mchog gi rgyal sras rnams kyis srog chags bsrung ba'i don du de rnams sbyar bar bya zhes pa ste bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung 'di'i phyir bdud kyi tshig rnams kyis ma rig pa'i 'jug pa ni rnal 'byor pas mi bya'o //
translated: Because of this statement of the Bhagavat, the yogi/ni should not engage in ignorance through the words of Mara.

original: de bzhin du sems can rnams kyi rang gi sems kyi bag chags la so sor snang ba ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' ste 'di ltar sems can rnams kyi so so'i snang ba la bcom ldan 'das nyid bsod nams kyi phung po dang sdig pa'i phung
analyzed: de bzhin du sems can rnams kyi rang gi sems kyi bag chags la so sor snang ba ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' ste 'di ltar sems can rnams kyi so so'i snang ba la bcom ldan 'das nyid bsod nams kyi phung po dang sdig pa'i phung
translated: Likewise, the appearances in the individual mind-streams of sentient beings are the Bhagavān Vajrasattva. Thus, the Bhagavān himself is the mass of merit and the mass of sin in the individual appearances of sentient beings.

original: bor ro // bcom ldan 'das kyis ye shes kyi le'u'i rnam pa lnga'i bstod pa las tshigs su bcad pa bzhi pas gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bor ro // bcom ldan 'das kyis ye shes kyi le'u'i rnam pa lnga'i bstod pa las tshigs su bcad pa bzhi pas gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
translated: The Bhagavān has said in the four verses of the praise with five aspects in the Wisdom Chapter:

original: sems tsam sngags kyi ngo bo lha yis yongs su bskor ba sdug bsngal dang ni bde ba'i rang bzhin te //
analyzed: sems tsam sngags kyi ngo bo lha yis yongs su bskor ba sdug bsngal dang ni bde ba'i rang bzhin te //
translated: The essence of mind-only mantra, surrounded by deities, is the nature of suffering and happiness.

original: dam pa rnams la zhi ba'i gzugs ni rang gis byas pa'i nyams myong mi bzad rnams la mi bzad pa //
analyzed: dam pa rnams la zhi ba'i gzugs ni rang gis byas pa'i nyams myong mi bzad rnams la mi bzad pa //
translated: For the sublime, the peaceful form is created by oneself; for those with unbearable experiences, it is unbearable.

original: gang gis las gang rab byas rang gi sems la cho ga bzhin du de yi 'bras bu de skyed pa //
analyzed: gang gis las gang rab byas rang gi sems la cho ga bzhin du de yi 'bras bu de skyed pa //
translated: Whatever action is performed, the result of that is produced in one's mind according to the ritual.

original: 'jig rten dbang po sna tshogs gzugs can srid gsum skyed mdzad rdo rje sems dpa' la yang phyag 'tshal lo zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten dbang po sna tshogs gzugs can srid gsum skyed mdzad rdo rje sems dpa' la yang phyag 'tshal lo zhes pa'o //
translated: I pay homage to Vajrasattva, the Lord of the World, the creator of the three worlds, the creator of various forms.

original: de'i phyir sems can rnams kyi rang gi sems kyi bag chags kyi snang ba ni rdo rje sems dpa' dang bdud de bcom ldan 'das la bdud med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems can rnams kyi rang gi sems kyi bag chags kyi snang ba ni rdo rje sems dpa' dang bdud de bcom ldan 'das la bdud med do //
translated: Therefore, the appearance of the habitual tendencies of the mind of sentient beings is Vajrasattva and Mara. The Blessed One is free from Mara.

original: lus dang ngag dang sems dang ma rig pa'i bdud sngar brjod pa 'di rnams kyi skyed par byed pa ni 'gyur pa'i skad cig ste 'dod pa'i lhar mngon par brjod do //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang sems dang ma rig pa'i bdud sngar brjod pa 'di rnams kyi skyed par byed pa ni 'gyur pa'i skad cig ste 'dod pa'i lhar mngon par brjod do //
translated: The creator of these Maras of body, speech, mind, and ignorance mentioned earlier is the moment of transformation, expressed as the desire realm.

original: de ni de bzhin gshegs pas mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i skad cig gis rnam par bcom mo //
analyzed: de ni de bzhin gshegs pas mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i skad cig gis rnam par bcom mo //
translated: That is completely destroyed by the Tathagata with the moment of supreme non-transformation.

original: de bcom pa ni bdud kyi dpung bcom pa ste 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug dang khong khro ma rig pa'i rang bzhin can rnams zad pa'o //
analyzed: de bcom pa ni bdud kyi dpung bcom pa ste 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug dang khong khro ma rig pa'i rang bzhin can rnams zad pa'o //
translated: The destruction of that is the destruction of Mara's army, the exhaustion of desire, anger, ignorance, and hatred.

original: 'dir 'gyur pa'i bag chags 'gags pas 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug dang khong khro 'gag go //
analyzed: 'dir 'gyur pa'i bag chags 'gags pas 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug dang khong khro 'gag go //
translated: Here, the latent tendencies of change are stopped, and so attachment, aversion, delusion, and anger are stopped.

original: de rnams 'gags pas ma rig pa 'gag ste de bzhin du rim pas yan lag bcu gnyis rnams 'gag go //
analyzed: de rnams 'gags pas ma rig pa 'gag ste de bzhin du rim pas yan lag bcu gnyis rnams 'gag go //
translated: When those are stopped, ignorance is stopped, and in the same way, the twelve limbs are stopped in sequence.

original: yan lag bcu gnyis 'gags pas srid pa'i @264a * //
analyzed: yan lag bcu gnyis 'gags pas srid pa'i @264a * //
translated: When the twelve limbs are stopped, the wheel of existence

original: 'khor lo 'gag go //
analyzed: 'khor lo 'gag go //
translated: is stopped.

original: srid pa'i 'khor lo 'gags pas sgrib pa med pa'i sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srid pa'i 'khor lo 'gags pas sgrib pa med pa'i sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: When the wheel of existence is stopped, there is the buddhahood of nonobstruction.

original: nyan thos dang pha rol tu phyin pa dang sngags kyi tshul 'di rnams kyi mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i snying po bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'dzin ba ni mtshan yang dag par brjod pa las de bzhin gshegs pas bstan to //
analyzed: nyan thos dang pha rol tu phyin pa dang sngags kyi tshul 'di rnams kyi mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i snying po bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'dzin ba ni mtshan yang dag par brjod pa las de bzhin gshegs pas bstan to //
translated: The Bhagavān Vajradhara, the essence of unchanging supreme bliss, is taught in the Litany of the Names of Mañjuśrī by the Tathāgata in these three ways of the śrāvakas, the perfections, and the mantra vehicle.

original: 'di'i don mi shes pa bla ma dam pa ma yin pa nyams pa mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i ye shes nyams pa rnams ma 'ongs pa'i dus sku 'byung bar 'gyur te rnam par nyams pa de rnams kyis sems can rnams nyams par byed do //
analyzed: 'di'i don mi shes pa bla ma dam pa ma yin pa nyams pa mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i ye shes nyams pa rnams ma 'ongs pa'i dus sku 'byung bar 'gyur te rnam par nyams pa de rnams kyis sems can rnams nyams par byed do //
translated: Those who do not understand this meaning, who are not holy gurus, who are not the best of adepts, who are not adepts in pristine awareness, will be born in the future as bodies of degeneration, and those who are degenerate will degenerate sentient beings.

original: des na rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi ye shes rnam pa lnga'i bstod pa las tshigs su bcad pa lngas rnam pa lnga'i bsgom pa bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: des na rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi ye shes rnam pa lnga'i bstod pa las tshigs su bcad pa lngas rnam pa lnga'i bsgom pa bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
translated: Therefore, in the praise of the five aspects of pristine awareness of the Root Tantra, the Bhagavān taught the meditation on the five aspects in five verses, as follows:

original: stong pa la ni dngos po'i tshogs //
analyzed: stong pa la ni dngos po'i tshogs //
translated: The collection of things is in the empty.

original: brtags pa'i gzugs spangs bems po min //
analyzed: brtags pa'i gzugs spangs bems po min //
translated: The formless is abandoned in the imagined form.
